Ninetales-Alola.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.
Ninetales-Alola.comments:
Speed EV Benchmarks

  • Alolan Ninetales should almost always use a Timid nature, as this is the most efficient way for it to outspeed a wide variety of threats.

  • 60+ Spe EVs: This outspeeds Adamant Urshifu formes.

  • 68+ Spe EVs: This outspeeds Modest Iron Crown.

  • 84+ Spe EVs: This outspeeds Modest Chi-Yu.

  • 116+ Spe EVs: This outspeeds Jolly Landorus-T, Jolly Annihilape, and Jolly Gouging Fire.

  • 156+ Spe EVs: This outspeeds Adamant Ogerpon formes and Modest Latios.

  • 164+ Spe EVs: This outspeeds Jolly Urshifu formes.

  • 172+ Spe EVs: This outspeeds Timid Iron Crown.

  • 188+ Spe EVs: This outspeeds Timid Chi-Yu and Jolly Entei.

  • 204+ Spe EVs: This outspeeds Jolly Garchomp.

  • 220+ Spe EVs: This outspeeds Adamant Roaring Moon.

  • 244+ Spe EVs: This outspeeds Adamant Meowscarada.

Defensive EV Benchmarks

  • 244 HP / 108 SpD EVs: This survives Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Tera Fairy Moonblast.

  • 244 HP / 92 SpD EVs: This has a 93.7% chance of surviving Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Tera Fairy Moonblast.

  • 180 HP / 244 Def EVs: This avoids a 2HKO from Adamant Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes and almost always avoids an OHKO from Scizor's unboosted Bullet Punch.

  • 196 HP / 244 Def EVs: This spread is not OHKOed by Adamant Scizor's Bullet Punch if it lacks an offensive item, and it is also not 2HKOed by Adamant Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes.

  • 148 HP / 180 SpD EVs: This is the most efficient EV spread for surviving Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Tera Fairy Moonblast at the cost of serious physical bulk.

Screens Setter.description:
• With the new Defense-boosting mechanic for Ice-types in snow, Alolan Ninetales is the premier screens setter in the current metagame, as well as being a decent check against fearsome physical attackers like Chien-Pao and Urshifu-R.

  • Encore: Encore can thwart bulkier setup foes that would otherwise take advantage of Alolan Ninetales's mediocre offenses.

  • Blizzard versus Freeze-Dry: Blizzard's high Base Power helps make up for Alolan Ninetales's lack of power. Freeze-Dry is much less powerful but is more consistent at pressuring Water-types like Ogerpon-W and Basculegion-M.

  • Pain Split: Pain Split punishes foes that assume Alolan Ninetales will simply allow revenge kills from slower Pokemon, giving it a new lease on life to check physical threats. This especially works well with Rocky Helmet.

Other Options
  • Misty Terrain: Misty Terrain stops common users of status such as Yawn Ursaluna-B and Thunder Wave Porygon2 from having an impact, though it does weaken grounded Dragon-type teammates like Raging Bolt and Roaring Moon.
Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Thanks to its high Speed and increased physical bulk in snow, Alolan Ninetales does not normally want to Terastallize. It's true it can help with Steel-types moves from Scizor and Choice Scarf Gholdengo, but it is often more advisable to play around this weakness through its teammates.

  • Water: Tera Water is a balanced defensive typing that completely flips Alolan Ninetales's Steel-type weakness, all but guaranteeing it can set Aurora Veil. It also lets it resist Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes—a common counter against screens—though Alolan Ninetales will normally survive it without Terastallizing.

  • Fire: Tera Fire can be used offensively and defensively against Steel-types, with invested Tera Blast usually OHKOing Scizor and 2HKOing Gholdengo. Do note though that this comes at the cost of having a dramatically worse Urshifu-R matchup.

  • Ice: Tera Ice lets Alolan Ninetales keep its Defense boost in snow while increasing its offensive output and making the devastating Steel weakness more manageable.

Items

  • Light Clay: Light Clay extends Aurora Veil's duration and makes it much harder for the opponent to play around it.

  • Rocky Helmet: If using a physically defensive EV spread, Rocky Helmet lets Alolan Ninetales severely punish Urshifu-R that lack Punching Glove.

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash is good insurance against fast super effective hits, but it's overall less useful in the majority of matchups.

EV Spread Examples

  • Alolan Ninetales has a wide variety of possible EV spreads. If the examples below don't suit your needs, consider checking out some useful Speed and Defensive benchmarks later in this analysis to help create a custom EV spread!

  • 244 HP / 92 SpD / 172 Spe with Timid: This spread lets Alolan Ninetales outspeed up to Timid Iron Crown and Jolly Urshifu formes while surviving Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Tera-boosted Moonblast on all but the highest damage roll.

  • 228 HP / 76 Def / 4 SpA / 116 SpD / 84 Spe with Timid: With this investment in bulk, Alolan Ninetales survives Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Tera Fairy Moonblast, as well as avoiding an OHKO from Ogerpon-H's super effective Ivy Cudgel while the weather is still snow. The Speed investment lets Alolan Ninetales outrun Modest Chi-Yu.

  • 180 HP / 140 SpD / 188 Spe with Timid: This spread sacrifices some physical bulk in exchange for outspeeding Timid Chi-Yu and almost always survives Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Tera-boosted Moonblast.

  • 180 HP / 244 Def / 84 Spe with Timid: This physically bulky spread avoids a 2HKO from Adamant Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes while outspeeding up to Modest Chi-Yu. It also avoids an OHKO from Scizor's unboosted Bullet Punch on all but the highest damage roll.

Defensive Utility.description:
• A unique combination of Intimidate, Extreme Speed and multiple support tools make Arcanine a versatile and unpredictable defensive option.

  • Extreme Speed: Even on a defensive set, Extreme Speed's strong base power and priority combined with Arcanine's naturally high Attack make it a potent cleaning tool.

  • Roar: Roar lets Arcanine phaze out troublesome set-up foes that are hard for teammates to switch into, such as Wo-Chien and Garganacl.

  • Bulldoze: Bulldoze's speed control can be used to set up your own offense for a countersweep.

  • EV Spread: After Intimidate, the given EV spread lets Arcanine avoid a 2HKO from Choice Band Chien-Pao's Crunch and Baxcalibur's Earthquake. The HP investment minimizes Stealth Rock damage when not running Heavy-Duty Boots, and the Speed investment outspeeds Adamant Breloom.

Other Options
  • Snarl: This move lets Arcanine pester special attackers that switch into it, potentially letting it stay in longer or ease a switch to a teammate.
Items

  • Heavy-Duty Boots: As a defensive switch-in with a Stealth Rock weakness, Arcanine heavily favors Heavy-Duty Boots to remove said weakness.

  • Rocky Helmet: Against targets like Chien-Pao, Arcanine can rack up passive chip damage.

  • Leftovers: Passive recovery is a valuable asset to have on a defensive Pokemon, but since Arcanine is an Intimidate user that switches a lot, Leftovers doesn't always have enough turns to produce good value.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Terastallization can do a lot to further improve Arcanine's unique set of attributes, but it's not necessarily something that Arcanine needs to function.

  • Normal: Tera Normal gives Arcanine even more cleaning power by boosting Extreme Speed. It's also a nice pinch option for blocking Ghost-type moves, as Flutter Mane and Mimikyu are often forced to use them due to Arcanine's Fairy resistance.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy provides defensive insurance against some of the hardest hitting Choice Band users, such as Tera Dark Chien-Pao and Outrage Dragonite.

Offensive.description:
• The given EV spread minimizes Stealth Rock damage, and the Speed investment lets Arcanine outspeed Adamant Tyranitar by 2 points.

  • This set does not have a full write-up yet. If you'd like to finish this, feel free to reserve it here!

Ghostbuster (Stall).description:
• Alolan Muk is one of the strongest dedicated checks to Calyrex-S for stall teams, boasting incredible Special Defense and a dual typing that isn't weak to Calyrex-S's most common Tera types or Psyshock.

  • Poison Jab: Combining Poison Jab with Poison Touch gives an amazing 51% chance to inflict poison per hit, making Alolan Muk an excellent status spreader just by attacking.

  • Protect: Since Alolan Muk's most reliable source of healing is Black Sludge, using Protect for extra recovery turns is critical, as well as for racking up extra damage on poisoned enemies.

  • Shadow Sneak: Shadow Sneak deals significant damage to Calyrex-S if it hasn't Terastallized and is great for picking off weakened Focus Sash users in general.

  • Toxic: When forcing switches against Calyrex-S, Toxic can be used to catch problematic checks and put them on a strict timer.

  • Black Sludge: Even without Tera Poison, Black Sludge is largely preferred over Leftovers because it punishes Trick attempts from Calyrex-S and Lunala.

  • 15 Speed IV: This is an option for underspeeding the slowest Alomomola, making it much harder for the opponent to safely pivot would-be checks into Alolan Muk.

  • EV Spread: Maximum special bulk means that Calyrex-S's +2 Astral Barrage cannot 2HKO Alolan Muk.

Other Options

  • Minimize: While evasion tactics can be devastating for poisoned targets, it is very inconsistent and risks unnecessary damage that can compromise Alolan Muk's ability to check Calyrex-S long term.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Any Terastallization on Alolan Muk needs to be meticulously timed, as Terastallization sacrifices its long term survivability against Calyrex-S.

  • Poison: Tera Poison's Fighting-type and Fairy-type resistances can buy an extra turn against Tera Blast Calyrex-S and Flutter Mane. It also keeps the healing effects of Black Sludge.

  • Flying: Tera Flying can be used in a pinch to avoid Alolan Muk's sole Ground-type weakness.

Shell Smash Sweeper.description:
• Shell Smash and Skill Link more than make up for Cloyster's weak Attack stat, making it a formidable sweeper that Focus Sash and Mimikyu can't easily stop.

  • Ice Shard: Priority may seem like overkill, but it helps pick off weakened threats without setup. It also gets around priority attacks from Breloom, Dragapult, and Meowscarada after a Shell Smash.

  • Rock Blast: This is Closyer's best shot at dealing with the many Tera Fires that resist Icicle Spear, as well as OHKOing Chien-Pao, Iron Bundle, and Iron Moth.

  • Drill Run: This hits Gholdengo and other Steel-types hard without needing to Terastallize.

  • Adamant versus Jolly: Adamant is the preferred nature to maximize offensive power, as a single Shell Smash lets you outspeed the entire unboosted metagame. However, Cloyster is in the same speed tier as Breloom, so Jolly is a consideration if you want to minimize Speed tie scenarios in that matchup.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: As a Focus Sash user, Cloyster wants to avoid using Tera when possible, but opposing priority attacks and defensive typings can sometimes make it a necessity.

  • Ghost: Since Cloyster will often be at extremely low health after Shell Smash, Tera Ghost helps it avoid getting revenge killed by Breloom's Mach Punch and Dragonite’s Extreme Speed. It also provides coverage against Gholdengo with Tera Blast.

  • Ice: The increased damage from Tera Ice makes it very difficult for Pokemon to wall Cloyster without resisting it, with even Corviknight getting OHKOed by +2 Adamant Icicle Spear after Stealth Rock damage.

  • Ground: Volt Switch users like Rotom-W love to take Cloyster down to its Focus Sash and pivot to a priority attacker; Tera Ground both nullifies the damage and prevents the switch, giving Cloyster significant momentum with a free turn to Shell Smash. It also lets Cloyster challenge defensive Gholdengo, blocking Thunder Wave and giving +2 Adamant Drill Run a strong chance to OHKO.

  • Fire: While Tera Fire Tera Blast actually does less damage to Corviknight than Tera Ice Icicle Spear, Tera Fire otherwise helps Cloyster muscle past Steel-types it traditionally struggles to beat, such as Scizor.

  • Normal: Tera Normal is a niche option that offers no offensive benefits to Cloyster, but it does prevent Mimikyu and Gallade from revenge killing it with Shadow Sneak.

Items

  • Focus Sash: Considering Cloyster's paper-thin Special Defense, Focus Sash gives Cloyster by far the most setup opportunities.

  • King's Rock: King's Rock is a risky option that doesn’t help Cloyster set up, but it does give Icicle Spear and Rock Blast a 41% chance of flinching.

Gengar.overview:
With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Disruptor.description:
• Gengar's useful immunities and great support movepool give it a niche as an incredibly disruptive Pokemon, especially if taking the correct predictive risks.

  • Destiny Bond: Destiny Bond is excellent at making foes second-guess attacking Gengar. When slower foes don't take the bait and use a setup move, Gengar can punish them with Encore.

  • Encore: Gengar's excellent speed makes it an especially disruptive user of Encore, being able to disrupt key threats such as Garchomp and Dragonite.

  • Icy Wind: Icy Wind's Speed control can give Gengar the upper hand against fast Focus Sash leads such as Flutter Mane, and lets Gengar outspeed faster threats that it may want to Destiny Bond, such as Meowscarada.

  • Thunder Wave: Thunder Wave is great at crippling faster sweepers if Gengar's Focus Sash is intact, and punishing fast, common switch-ins such as Roaring Moon.

  • Sludge Bomb: This covers Meowscarada and Fairy-types, in addition to being Gengar's most powerful attack.

  • Dazzling Gleam In addition to OHKOing Hydreigon after Stealth Rock damage, Dazzling Gleam is an appealing secondary STAB move when using Tera Fairy.

  • Focus Blast: Focus Blast is Gengar's best shot at beating Kingambit outside of Destiny Bond.

Other Options

  • Will-O-Wisp Gengar does a great job of burning bulky sweepers that Gengar can be forced to Destiny Bond against, such as Dragonite, Great Tusk, Iron Treads, and Tera Annihilape.

Tera Types

  • Normal: Tera Normal Gengar can turn slower Ghost-types such as Mimikyu, Flutter Mane, and Annihilape into easy Encore targets.

  • Fairy: A Dragon-type immunity gives Gengar new Encore targets and better threatens Dragon-types.

  • Flying: Earthquake is a common attack against Gengar, so Tera Flying can turn the tables effectively. It also takes advantage of common Fissure users such as Dondozo and Garganacl.

  • Dark: A Dark Tera type lets Gengar surprise Espathra, letting it Encore Stored Power and potentially ruin its sweep.

FIREFIGHTER (Defensive).description:
• Will-O-Wisp and Intimidate make Paldean Tauros-F a potent check to physical attackers, notably enabling it reliably check Chien-Pao and Kingambit.

  • Raging Bull: This provides a powerful STAB attack that can also break screens, allowing Paldean Tauros-F’s teammates to clean up more easily.

  • Body Press Body Press is valuable because unlike Close Combat, it doesn’t cause defense drops.

  • Rock Tomb: Rock Tomb allows Paldean Tauros-F to check Volcarona despite its meager Special Defense.

  • Bulk Up: While this set is unlikely to sweep, Bulk Up does give Paldean Tauros-F a good way to punish foes that attempt to sacrifice their Pokemon to it.

  • Tera Dependency - Very Situational: Paldean Tauros-F should generally avoid Terastallizing, as its typing is a big part of what lets it act as such a sturdy check to Kingambit and other massive threats, such as Baxcalibur.

Items

  • Sitrus Berry / Figy Berry: A quick burst of recovery from a berry fits playing this set a bit more recklessly.

  • Heavy-Duty Boots: This allows Paldean Tauros-F to switch around more freely in after entry hazards are set.

  • Rocky Helmet: Paldean Tauros-F tends to force a lot of switches, so Rocky Helmet lets it get some useful chip damage when switching into moves like Chien-Pao's Crunch.

  • Leftovers: Leftovers is a high value item that other Pokemon want, but the gradual recovery is useful.

Offensive Screen Smasher.description:
• Paldean Tauros-F is fast enough to outspeed key threats such as Mimikyu and Modest Chi-Yu, making an offensive set viable.

  • Raging Bull versus Flare Blitz: Raging Bull might not be as powerful as Flare Blitz, but its ability to break Reflect and Light Screen give Paldean Tauros-F a unique niche.

  • Flame Charge versus Trailblaze: Flame Charge gives Paldean Tauros-F an unexpected late-game win condition, letting it outspeed threats such as Chien-Pao and Iron Bundle. Trailblaze is often weaker, but the greater chip dagainst against Water-types such as Azumarill can be beneficial.

  • Rock Tomb: Rock Tomb's speed control is useful when sacrificing Paldean Tauros-F against a threat and prevents Dragonite from getting easy Speed boosts.

  • Will-O-Wisp: Despite this set's offensive nature, Will-O-Wisp is good for punishing Dragonite, Dragapult, and slower foes that may Terrastallize, such as Ting-Lu and Kingambit.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Paldean Tauros-F makes major use of its unique typing defensively, so it only needs to Terastallize for situational win conditions.

  • Grass: A Grass Tera type makes Paldean Tauros-F far less vulnerable to Rotom-W and Rotom-W, in addition to dealing with Focus Sash Breloom.

  • Fairy: When paired with Tera Blast, a Fairy Tera type means Dragonite will no longer wall Paldean Tauros-F without Teratsallizing itself.

Items

  • Eject Pack: With Close Combat, this will give Paldean Tauros-F a powerful, one-time use pivot option.

  • Life Orb: This high value item can be tough to slot in, but the increased power makes sweeping with a Speed boost much easier.

  • Mirror Herb: Mirror Herb punishes setup sweepers even more effectively and pairs especially well with Intimidate.

Assault Vest.description:
• With an Assault Vest, Paldean Tauros-F finds itself a niche checking Choice Band Chien-Pao, Flutter Mane, and Iron Moth.

  • Raging Bull Despite Flare Blitz having more power, Raging Bull is Paldean Tauros-F's preferred STAB move as a result of its ability to break Aurora Veil, Reflect, and Light Screen, as well as the lack of recoil associated with the move.

  • Iron Head vs Stone Edge Iron Head is used because of its ability to hit foes that can Terastallize into Fairy-types, such as Dondozo and some Dragonite; it also provides a midground against Rock-types such as Garganacl and Tyranittar. It also is Paldean Tauros-F's best shot at OHKOing Flutter Mane without Terastallizing. However, Stone Edge can be used in lieu of it, as it is Tauros-F's best chance of defeating Iron Moth.

Tera Types

  • Steel: Terastallizing into a Steel-type allows Paldean Tauros-F to be immune to Acid Spray attempts from Iron Moth, as well as boosting the power of Iron Head. It also allows Paldean Tauros-B to defeat Flutter Mane more easily, as Flutter Mane would otherwise need lots of defensive investment to survive it.

  • Grass: Tera Grass prevents Azumarill's Liquidation from OHKOing Paldean Tauros-F, as well as providing a boost to Trailblaze.

  • Fire: Like Tera Steel, Tera Fire provides useful resistance to Fairy, notably Flutter Mane. It also allows Paldean Tauros-B to OHKO Flutter Mane that don't invest in bulk with Raging Bull.

EV Spreads
  • 244 HP / 12 Atk / 76 Def / 36 SpD / 140 Spe with Adamant: This EV spread allows Paldean Tauros-B to defeat Flutter Mane with Trailblaze into Raging Bull. The Defense EVs allow it to beat Choice Band Chien-Pao after Intimidate one-on-one. The Speed investment allows Paldean Tauros-B to outpace Flutter Mane after Trailblaze.

Choice Band.description: This set is currently in copyediting. It can be found here.

Gyarados.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out the format page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Rocky Helmet.description:
• Gyarados utilizes its unique typing alongside Rocky Helmet to cushion physical sweepers such as Scizor, Great Tusk and Palafin.

  • Taunt: Taunt forces foes such as Corviknight and Dondozo to attack Gyarados, constraining them to take Rocky Helmet chip while often dealing minimal damage themselves.

  • Waterfall versus Iron Head: Waterfall provides Gyarados with a reliable STAB move, but Iron Head works better with Thunder Wave thanks to its higher flinch chance. They can be run together, though usually at the cost of overall coverage.

  • Earthquake: Earthquake checks several common Gyarados switch-ins, such as Iron Hands and Magnezone.

  • Ice Fang: Ice Fang hits bulky Dragon-types such as Dragonite that otherwise can withstand attacks from Gyarados.

  • Thunder Wave: Thunder Wave combined with flinch moves like Waterfall and Iron Head can shut down foes for several turns at a time. It can also catch foes switching into Gyarados, though keep in mind that many prominent Gyarados checks are naturally immune.

  • EV Spread: This spread allows Gyarados to survive two unboosted Moonblasts from Flutter Mane and minimizes Stealth Rock chip. The Speed investment outspeeds 4 Speed Rotom formes and, when using Thunder Wave, outspeeds paralyzed Speed-boosting nature Dragapult.

Other Options
  • Dragon Dance: Rocky Helmet sets can still opt to utilize Dragon Dance for more offensive presence, but this usually involves cutting bulk to invest in Attack and Speed.
Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: While Gyarados has uses for Terastallization, losing its unique defensive typing jeopardizes its Rocky Helmet niche and makes it much harder to check its key targets. Terastallization must be timed properly if Gyarados is to get proper value out of it.

  • Steel: Tera Steel powers up Iron Head to more serviceable levels and makes it easier to OHKO bulky Flutter Mane.

  • Ground: Tera Ground prevents Gyarados from getting dismantled by its 4x Electric-type weakness and provides a sizable power boost to Earthquake.

Revenge Killer.description:
• Ditto is widely hailed as the best revenge killer and finds a small niche with a Choice Scarf.
Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Ditto rarely needs to Terastallize unless it is being threatened by Dragon Dance Dragonite's Extreme Speed at +3.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost gives Ditto immunity to Dragonite's Extreme Speed, preventing it from defeating Ditto after three Dragon Dances.

Items
  • Choice Scarf: The safest option, Choice Scarf guarantees that Ditto will always outspeed the foe unless said foe is holding a Choice Scarf.
  • Focus Sash: A high-risk yet high-reward option, Focus Sash allows Ditto to switch moves at the cost of being nullified by entry hazards. However, it should be noted that Imposter doesn't copy Protosynthesis or Quark Drive boosts, making Focus Sash a lot less niche, as it allows Ditto to beat foes such as Flutter Mane more consistently assuming the field is clear of hazards.
EV Spreads
  • Effort Values: The given EVs maximize Ditto's bulk in the rare case of a mirror matchup.
  • Individual Values: 0 Speed IVs and a minus Speed nature is key to beating opposing Ditto, as the Ditto that moves last on the fourth turn will win the mirror.

Dragonite.overview: This Pokemon has been updated for the return of the Regulation G format and its powerful restricted threats!
Dragonite.comments:
Speed EV Benchmarks

  • After a single Dragon Dance or Scale Shot, Dragonite will always outspeed up to Adamant Urshifu-formes regardless of Dragonite's Speed investment.

  • 12 Spe: At +1, this outspeeds Modest Chi-Yu.

  • 44 Spe: This outspeeds uninvested Archaludon.

  • 76 Spe: At +1, this outspeeds Jolly Urshifu-formes.

  • 92 Spe: This outspeeds uninvested Landorus-T. At +1, this outspeeds Timid Chi-Yu. At +2, this outspeeds Timid Calyrex-S.

  • 100 Spe: This outspeeds the uncommon Jolly Ursaluna.

  • 132 Spe: This outspeeds uninvested Mimikyu.

  • 140 Spe: This outspeeds uninvested Urshifu-formes.

  • 172+ Spe: At +1, this outspeeds Adamant Zacian-C.

  • 204+ Spe: At +1, this outspeeds Pokemon with base Speeds of 135 and a positive Speed nature such as Jolly Chien-Pao and Timid Miraidon.

Choice Band.description:
• Choice Band makes Dragonite both an effective late-game cleaner and revenge killer with Extreme Speed, and a powerful wall-breaker against foes such as Ting-Lu, Ursaluna-B, and Dondozo.

  • Extreme Speed: Boosted by both Choice Band and Tera Normal, Extreme Speed easily 2HKOs up to max HP Miraidon that aren't running Electric Seed.

  • Outrage: Outrage is strong enough to potentially 2HKO Bold Ursaluna-B and Impish Dondozo after Stealth Rock damage, though it leaves Dragonite very vulnerable to getting revenge killed.

  • Earthquake: Earthquake provides the best overall coverage into Steel-types that resist Extreme Speed and Outrage.

  • Low Kick: Low Kick is Dragonite's best move against Ursaluna-B, making it much more difficult for Ursaluna-B to Moonlight stall without defensive Terastallization.

  • Ice Spinner: Ice Spinner is primarily used to punish Landorus-T's that try to switch in, and being super-effective into common Dragon-types makes it a rather effective midground option when trying to predict switches.

Other Options

  • Tera Blast Flying: While not as dominating as in past regulations, Tera Blast Flying is still one of Dragonite's hardest hitting moves that has no type immunities to worry about. If using this option, a Special Attack IV of 17 or lower is needed to prevent Tera Blast from flipping to a Special Attack after being hit by Flutter Mane's Charm.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: This Dragonite will usually want to Terastallize to either increase its revenge killing or wall-breaking capabilities, but Choice Band's power doesn't make this strictly necessary.

  • Normal: Tera Normal massively boosts Dragonite's revenge killing potential with Extreme Speed and cuts off Calyrex-S's Astral Barrage from doing any damage.

  • Flying: With Tera Blast, Tera Flying is a strong wallbreaking option that lets Dragonite potentially 2HKO bulky Pokemon like defensive Ursaluna-B. It also lets Dragonite demolish offensive Urshifu formes without the need for Outrage.

Scale Shot Sweeper.description:
• Dragonite is a great user of Scale Shot, utilizing its bulk and Multiscale to set up easily.

  • Dragon Dance: A single Dragon Dance makes Scale Shot much more consistent at OHKOing Focus Sash Chien-Pao, while also enabling 5-hit Scale Shot to OHKO offensive Urshifu.

  • Iron Head: Iron Head punishes Fairy-types and Tera Fairy users that try to block Scale Shot.

  • Earthquake: Earthquake provides great all-around coverage while reliably hitting common Steel-types.

  • Extreme Speed: Extreme Speed is useful for revenge killing faster foes and helps Dragonite outrun other priority users trying to exploit Scale Shot's Defense drops.

  • Adamant versus Jolly: Jolly allows Dragonite to outspeed Chien-Pao, Flutter Mane, Koraidon, and Miraidon after a single Dragon Dance. However, many of these targets employ means of raising their Speed, so it is usually more worth it to maximize damage with Adamant and try to hit +2 Speed instead.

Other Options

  • Low Kick: Low Kick gives Dragonite the most damage output against Ursaluna-B, which is otherwise strong at stopping Dragonite's momentum.

  • Encore: Encore with Dragon Dance makes it easier to set up on passive foes, but the sacrifice in coverage can make it difficult to fit.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Dragonite's bulk and Multiscale still go a long way in helping it set up, but Terastallization can extend its reach and make it harder to revenge kill.

  • Steel: Tera Steel is a powerful response to Fairy-types like Flutter Mane, resisting Moonblast and boosting Iron Head. The resistance to Normal-type moves is also strong, helping cushion Ursaluna-B and opposing Extreme Speed Dragonite.

  • Normal: Tera Normal remains a strong option for boosting Extreme Speed and shedding Dragonite's Dragon-type weaknesses. It also shuts down Astral Barrage from Calyrex-S.

Extreme Killernite.description:
• With Tera Normal, Dragonite can do its best impression of Arceus, with a powerful Extreme Speed that makes Dragonite a great revenge killer, and even a sweeper if using Dragon Dance!

  • Earthquake: Earthquake offers the best coverage against the widest variety of Normal-type resistances, with Archaludon, Glimmora, and Scizor being big targets.

  • Encore: Encore lets Dragonite disrupt passive Pokemon and gives it incredible switch-in opportunities, making it a worthy move to consider. It can give free setup when paired with Dragon Dance, or it can turn Dragonite into a long-term defensive disruptor when paired with Roost.

  • Tera Dependency - High: This set benefits immensely from the ability to Terastallize to both boost Extreme Speed's power while also removing Dragon type weaknesses. However, care should be taken on the timing of Terastallization depending on the matchup, as Dragonite more effectively checks several prominent threats, such as Urshifu-R and Ogerpon-H, with its base typing.

Other Options

  • Dragon Tail: Dragon Tail is a unique alternative to Encore, allowing Dragonite to phaze out fast setup attackers that are risky to switch into or otherwise catch with Encore, such as Calyrex-S.

Items

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet lets Dragonite play more passively against physical threats, which is especially relevant before it Terastallizes. In particular, Urshifu-R without Punching Gloves takes a lot of damage from using Surging Strikes.

  • Silk Scarf: Silk Scarf gives a small but significant boost to Extreme Speed's cleaning power. When used with Tera Normal, Dragonite can 2HKO offensive Miraidon!

  • Leftovers: The residual recovery of Leftovers makes it easier to maintain Multiscale when using Roost.

  • Heavy-Duty Boots: Stealth Rock is commonly set up specifically to break Dragonite's Multiscale, so Heavy-Duty Boots are a good way to always preserve Dragonite's ability to set up and revenge kill.

Alternate EV Spread

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 Spe with Impish Going fully defensive means Dragonite won't sweep nearly as easily, but Dragonite is still capable of being an effective defensive Pokemon even after Terastallization.

Phazer.description:
• With Multiscale's incredible bulk potential and Dragon Tail bypassing Taunt, Dragonite is a unique and very effective phazer that massively ups the danger of entry hazards!

  • Dragon Tail VS. Roar: Dragon Tail is preferred for it disregarding Taunt and providing some good chip damage. However, Roar can phaze out meddlesome Fairy-types and users of Substitute.

  • Entry Hazard Teammates: For this Dragonite to be at its most effective, you'll need some partners to at least set up Stealth Rock. Ting-Lu and Archaludon are particularly bulky examples that pair well, but other options include Landorus-T, Swampert, and Annihilape.

  • Earthquake VS. Iron Head: Earthquake is the most wide-reaching coverage move, ensuring good damage against Normal resistances like Garganacl and Archaludon. If using Roar, Iron Head prevents Levitate Pokemon from completely walling Dragonite, and its flinch rate synergies well with Thunder Wave.

  • Thunder Wave: Dragonite's bulk makes it an ace at spreading paralysis, making it more of a team supporter.

  • Substitute versus Encore: Substitute is a fantastic option against Pokemon with status moves that threaten Dragonite's phazing cycles, such as Garganacl, Porygon2, and Toxapex. Encore won't do as well against these threats but does punish opposing foes carrying Substitute that can be a problem for Dragon Tail along with slower foes that use status moves in general such as Ting-Lu and Ursaluna-B. Encore can even be used over extra coverage if teammates can deal with Fairy-types.

  • Extreme Speed versus Aqua Jet: Extreme Speed's ability to pick off threats is useful, even on defensive variants of this set. Despite being half as powerful, Aqua Jet is still worth considering for its ability to pick off weakened Flutter Mane, which can be difficult for this set to handle due to its power when Multiscale isn't in play.

Items

  • Leftovers: Leftovers is a high value item, but it's worth using on Dragonite if using Substitute, as it gives Dragonite a serious chance of passively gaining Multiscale's effect back.

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet allows Dragonite to play more passively, punishing Pokemon that rely on contact moves like Choice Item Urshifu-R and Annihilape.

  • Heavy-Duty Boots: Heavy-Duty Boots' Stealth Rock immunity makes Multiscale more flexible, especially if Dragon Tail brings in a threat Dragonite isn't equipped to handle.

Alternate EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 76 Def / 180 Spe with Impish: This spread gives up quite a bit of bulk in exchange for outspeeding Adamant Breloom, while still often mantaining a Substitute against Garganacl's Salt Cure.

  • 252 HP / 124 Atk / 108 Def / 4 SpD / 20 Spe with Adamant: This EV spread is optimized for use with Earthquake and Aqua Jet, allowing Dragonite to 2HKO 4 Defense Flutter Mane with that combination of moves without needing to Terastallize. Only Modest Tera Fairy Flutter Mane will have a chance to OHKO through Multiscale.

  • 252 HP / 252 Atk / 4 Spe with Adamant: This EV spread is a far more offensive approach, mainly for use with Extreme Speed to pick off threats more effectively.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Dragonite's defensive typing can be quite helpful against foes like Urshifu-R and Chi-Yu, but some of the huge exploitable weaknesses to Pokemon like Chien-Pao and Flutter Mane will require Terastallization to cover.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy's Dragon immunity gels well with Dragonite and is a great defensive typing in general against foes like Chien-Pao and Urshifu.

  • Steel: Tera Steel is not only an incredible defensive typing that covers much of Dragonite's former weaknesses, but the power boost it provides to Iron Head lets it OHKO all but the most bulky Flutter Mane.

  • Normal: Tera Normal isn't that incredible defensively, but it can be worth it for boosting Extreme Speed's power, letting offensive EV spreads 2HKO Chien-Pao with it.

Paraflinch.description:
• Paraflinch Dragonite is a defensively oriented Dragonite set that takes full advantage of Terastallization and the element of surprise to cripple and downright defeat numerous Pokemon. Multiscale allows Dragonite to paralyze its foes relatively safely, becoming a massive nuisance for unprepared opponents.

  • Air Slash vs. Iron Head: Air Slash is a more practical move for this set, as it can cover a wider range of Pokemon for at least neutral damage. Air Slash also does not trigger Rocky Helmet and is naturally boosted by Dragonite's STAB. The Iron Head variant of Paraflinch, however, gives Dragonite an easier time against a number of common threats such as Flutter Mane, at the cost of struggling against Gouging Fire before they Terastallize.

  • Encore vs. Substitute: Encore will allow Dragonite to effectively check a wider variety of Pokemon such as Ursaluna-B by locking them into an unfavorable move, giving it a free opportunity to land Thunder Wave on your opponent's switch-in on the following turn. Substitute, on the other hand, will give Dragonite a much easier time dealing with defensive Pokemon that rely on status infliction such as Porygon2 and Dragon Tail Archaludon.

Other Options
  • Waterfall: Waterfall can be a viable option. However, the move is less reliable for the application of this set, as its chance to flinch is 20% as opposed to Air Slash and Iron Head's 30%. It does deal more damage to common Electric-types like Thundurus-T though.
EV and IV Spreads

  • 244 HP / 236 Def / 28 Spe: 52 Speed EVs are the minimum Speed requirement to outspeed paralyzed Iron Bundle that lack Booster Energy.

  • 252 HP / 140 Def / 116 Spe: This is the minimum requirement to outspeed paralyzed Modest Choice Scarf Chi-Yu.

  • 0 Attack IVs: If using Air Slash, 0 Attack IVs are highly recommended for having a high chance of retaining Substitute against STAB Foul Play users such as Porygon2

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: In order for Dragonite to survive multiple turns against the likes of Chien-Pao and Flutter Mane, Terastallizating into a better defensive typing is usually a must.

  • Steel: Steel is a great defensive type that provides resistance to Fairy-type attacks, such as Moon Blast from Flutter Mane. If using the physical set, Tera Steel also provides a significant boost to the damage of Iron Head.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy is Dragonite's best option against opposing Dragon-types, such as Roaring Moon and Gouging Fire.

  • Water: Tera Water provides Dragonite with the much-needed defensive versatility to paralyze and wall common threats, such as Chien-Pao and Azumarill. Water is an excellent defensive type in general with its only weaknesses being Electric and Grass.

Defensive Dragon Dance.description:
• Dragonite's good bulk gives it plenty of chances to set up Dragon Dance, while still providing a solid defensive backbone.

  • Earthquake: Earthquake is a reliable move for covering Steel-types, and Fire-types like Gouging Fire if using Iron Head and Tera Steel.

  • Breaking Swipe: While weak, Breaking Swipe's Attack drop makes it even easier for Dragonite to set up, making it preferred over Dragon Claw.

  • Encore: Encore makes setting up on slower defensive foes such as Corviknight fairly easy, though the lack of coverage makes Terastallizing far more important.

  • Thunder Punch versus Electric Tera Blast: If using Tera Electric, Thunder Punch is a low-power but reliable STAB option. However, while Tera Blast almost certainly requires Dragonite to Terastallize, it does avoid Rocky Helmet chip damage and is a tad more powerful.

Other Options
  • Ice Spinner: Ice Spinner deals massive damage to Landorus-T and other Flying-types, making it a reasonable coverage option to consider if using a Tera type that can deal with Steel-types, like Water or Electric.
Items

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet lets Dragonite play more passively thanks to the chip damage, and can be paired with Encore to severely punish slower physical attackers like Scizor.

  • Clear Amulet: Clear Amulet stops common Attack debuffers such as Charm Flutter Mane and Intimidate Landorus-T from ruining Dragonite's offenses, making it much harder to cycle around. As a bonus, it also stops Rock Tomb Speed drops from common foes like Ogerpon-H.

  • Heavy-Duty Boots: Preserving Multiscale even when Stealth Rock is set up can help Dragonite survive attacks in emergencies.

  • Leftovers: Leftovers's passive healing gives Dragonite a better matchup against passive foes it can Encore.

  • Covert Cloak: With Covert Cloak and Encore, Dragonite becomes a very solid check to Garganacl, as well as no longer fearing Breaking Swipe or flinches.

  • Weakness Policy: Since Multiscale makes Dragonite very difficult to OHKO, Weakness Policy is a viable option to turn the tables on foes targeting Dragonite's weaknesses.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 188 Defense / 76 Spe with Impish: This EV spread outspeeds up to Jolly Urshifu after one Dragon Dance, and Iron Bundle after two Dragon Dances.

  • 252 HP / 52 Def / 204 Spe with Jolly: This is the minimum Speed needed to outspeed Timid Iron Bundle after a boost, and it also outspeeds Flutter Mane and Chien-Pao.

  • 252 HP / 140 Defense / 112 Speed with Impish: This spread outspeeds Adamant Roaring Moon, Jolly Garchomp, and Timid Chi-Yu after Dragon Dance, all of which are threats that can easily revenge kill Dragonite once Multiscale is broken.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High / Almost Required: This Dragonite lacks a powerful STAB attack without Terastallization, making it highly recommended. If using Tera Flying with Tera Blast as the only attack, this set will need Terastallization to function.

  • Steel: Tera Steel covers Dragonite's former weaknesses very well, and can still work somewhat well even if not Terastallized thanks to Iron Head, though note it makes this Dragonite much more vulnerable to Urshifu and Ogerpon-H.

  • Flying: With Tera Blast, Tera Flying gives Dragonite a solid mono-attacking option and defensive typing in one, at the cost of almost always needing to Terastallize to function.

  • Electric: Though this requires extra coverage to be viable, Tera Electric shields Dragonite from paralysis, which can be combined with Clear Amulet to ruin more supportive Flutter Mane sets! Being only weak to Ground-type attacks also makes it a solid defensive Tera Type for Dragonite.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy gives Dragonite an excellent mono-attacking Tera Blast that gives it an advantage over other Dragon-types.

  • Water: Tera Water gifts Dragonite a resistance to Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash without being weak to Sacred Sword, plus it pairs well with Waterfall.

Encore Trapper.description:
• Due to Dragonite's offensive presence and high bulk, many opponents choose to either check it defensively or set up against it to break through Roost + Multiscale. Against either option, Encore can turn Dragonite practically invincible allowing it to reside on the field indefinitely in most cases.

  • Fire Spin: This allows Dragonite to defeat almost any Pokemon universally by simply making full use of its longevity. Trapping an Encore locked Pokemon in the field is also highly valuable. Fire Spin is used instead of Wrap because it affects Ghost-types and doesn't trigger chip damage from Rough Skin and Rocky Helmet.

  • Earthquake versus Iron Head: Earthquake prevents Dragonite from being entirely passive against Archaludon, Gouging Fire, and Flutter Mane. Meanwhile, Iron Head fits using Tera Steel, and does massive damage to Flutter Mane.

  • Draco Meteor: With a Bold Nature, Draco Meteor is a powerful move that can catch opposing Dragon-types off-guard and deal big damage to Ursaluna-B and Urshifu formes.

Items

  • Leftovers versus Heavy-Duty Boots Generally, Leftovers preserves Dragonite’'s longevity best, as it cancels out the damage from Sandstorm and makes timer stall easier. However, the increased usage of entry hazard setters in response to Dragonite makes Heavy-Duty Boots a strong option.

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet makes it easier for Dragonite to defeat Pokemon such as opposing Dragonite, Urshifu-R, and Gouging Fire (while Dragonite is Terastallized), and its residual damage can be used to execute a win condition.

  • Covert Cloak: With Covert Cloak, this Dragonite becomes a very effective check to Garganacl, in addition to no longer being vulnerable to flinches from Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash while Terastallizing.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Dragonite's typing does have some fairly exploitable weaknesses that can harm its defensive capability, but an immunity to Toxic Spikes and useful resistances to common attack types such as Ground, Fire, and Fighting mean that Terastallization is not always the right play.

  • Fairy: Due to Dragonite’'s low Speed compared to other Dragon-types, Tera Fairy is a great response against them. This also retains its advantage against Urshifu formes.

  • Steel: Tera Steel massively improves Dragonite's matchups against Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle, at the cost of being even more vulnerable to Salt Cure and Urshifu formes.

  • Water: Tera Water adds a resistance to Ice without losing Dragonite's innate Fire-type resistance, which is helpful against Chien-Pao and Urshifu-R.

  • Poison: The niche Tera Poison gives Dragonite a way to remove its common weaknesses without being vulnerable to Toxic Spikes, while still resisting Fighting unlike Tera Steel.

Double Priority Lure.description:
• With Flying-type Tera Blast OHKOing physically frail and Flying-weak Pokemon such as Flutter Mane, Ogerpon-H, and Urshifu-R, this set is effective at fooling opponents into thinking that it's Choice Band Dragonite.

  • Aqua Jet: It may seem redundant with Extreme Speed, but Aqua Jet is a key move for picking off weakened Ghost-types, such as Flutter Mane, and surprising Focus Sash Pokemon that might use Tera Ghost to avoid being sniped by Extreme Speed, such as Iron Bundle. This can also work against Chien-Pao, but Icicle Crash's flinch chance makes this rather risky.

  • Earthquake versus Low Kick: Earthquake is the preferred coverage move for dealing big damage against Archaludon and Gholdengo, common responses to a Dragonite locked into Tera Blast. Low Kick trades smacking Gholdengo for revenge killing opposing Tera Normal Dragonite and dealing massive damage to Ting-Lu.

  • Adamant versus Jolly: Adamant is the best nature for needing less chip damage to revenge kill weakened targets with priority attacks, but Jolly can make sense if outspeeding foes like Modest Gholdengo, Adamant Gouging Fire, and the rare Jolly Breloom is appealing.

  • Tera Dependency - Almost Required: This set is highly reliant on using Tera Blast as a luring tool, so Terastallization should be a top priority for Dragonite.

Items

  • Sharp Beak: Sharp Beak gives Dragonite the most offensive presence with the fewest drawbacks, giving Flying-type Tera Blast just enough of a boost to usually 2HKO Ursaluna-B, or 3HKO defensive variants.

  • Assault Vest: Assault Vest vastly improves Dragonite's matchup against Iron Bundle and Flutter Mane, especially if Multiscale's protection has been lost.

  • Heavy-Duty Boots: Heavy-Duty Boots means Stealth Rock will no longer remove this set's ability to trade blows with powerful threats.

Bulky Offensive Dragon Dance.description:
• While giving up Extreme Speed and Scale Shot may seem unusual, it allows Dragonite to use both Multiscale and the unpredictability of Terastallization to become an extremely dangerous bulky sweeper that teams often have the wrong response to!

  • Roost: Despite this set's more offensive approach, Roost is still highly recommended for taking full advantage of Multiscale.

  • Iron Head: Iron Head is a good choice if using Tera Steel, but even outside of that, it offers much more damage against Flutter Mane and common Tera Fairy foes like Raging Bolt and Toxapex than Earthquake.

  • Outrage: Outrage has tremendous power compared to any other attack from Dragonite, but Flutter Mane flipping it into a chance to revenge kill means it's best to lock-in late-game when the sweeping shot is clear.

  • Ice Spinner: Ice Spinner works best with Clear Amulet, making sure Landorus-T and Dragonite are easy to break through before they Terastallize.

  • Adamant versus Jolly: Adamant is usually preferred for the extra damage output, and the given EV spread still outspeeds Adamant Chien-Pao after a Dragon Dance. Jolly is required for outspeeding Timid Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle though.

Other Options

  • Fire Punch: Fire Punch is handy for roasting Scizor and dealing good damage to Corviknight, but it can't replace Earthquake, since hitting Archaludon hard is extremely important.

  • Thunder Punch: If using Tera Electric, Thunder Punch is a less risky alternative to Tera Blast in exchange for getting hit by Rocky Helmet. It's best used with Ice Spinner over Earthquake.

  • Low Kick: Low Kick is an easy way to OHKO Chien-Pao compared to Earthquake, but Flutter Mane laughing at it means Iron Head becomes required coverage, and it does less damage to Archaludon than Earthquake.

Items

  • Clear Amulet: Clear Amulet protects Dragonite from Pokemon that can ruin its sweep with Attack debuffs, such as Landorus-T and Charm Flutter Mane, as well as Breaking Swipe users like Gouging Fire and opposing Dragonite.

  • Lum Berry: Lum Berry is an effective way around common status spreaders like Flutter Mane, Archaludon, and Dragapult.

  • Heavy-Duty Boots: Heavy-Duty Boots ensures that Stealth Rock won't break Multiscale.

  • Rocky Helmet: If using Roost, Rocky Helmet is a good way of punishing Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes if it lacks Punching Glove or if switching into Aqua Jet.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High / Medium: If making use of Tera Blast for Tera types like Flying, Dragonite will usually want to Terastallize as much as possible. Without Tera Blast, it becomes less necessary, but it's still often worth doing due to it making Dragonite a nightmare to OHKO!

  • Flying: Tera Blast Flying offers incredible power with no drawbacks outside of Terastallizing, making it a great choice for sweeping!

  • Steel: Tera Steel is a more defensive approach to this set, covering Dragonite's common weaknesses to Fairy, Dragon, and Rock.

  • Ground: When combined with Clear Amulet, Tera Ground gives Dragonite the tools to defeat common support Flutter Mane moves like Thunder Wave and Charm in addition to a powerful Earthquake.

  • Electric: Tera Electric works great with Ice Spinner covering Landorus-T, giving Dragonite another way to soak up Thunder Wave and even Serperior's Glare!

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy isn't as great defensively for Dragonite as Tera Steel, but the Dragon immunity is great for keeping Multiscale intact, and it makes Dragonite a good check against Urshifu-S.

Azumarill.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out the format page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Offensive.description:
• With a fantastic typing that checks key threats like Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu and a good STAB priority attack, Azumarill is a common choice for a team's bulky Water-type.

  • Superpower: Superpower often forces Azumarill to switch out, but it deals massive damage to the important Iron Bundle.

Other Options
  • Ice Spinner: Ice Spinner lets Azumarill deal serious damage to Water Absorb Clodsire and does more against Dragonite before it Terastallizes.
Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Azumarill has a fantastic typing that it normally wants to keep, but it being rather weak to Iron Bundle is a major issue that can force it to Terastallize.

  • Water: Tera Water not only makes it easier to clean weakened teams with Aqua Jet, but it also lets Choice Band Azumarill OHKO uninvested Flutter Mane with Aqua Jet.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy gives Assault Vest Azumarill a much better matchup against Iron Bundle, no longer being weak to Freeze-Dry and OHKOing it after Stealth Rock damage with Play Rough.

  • Fire: Tera Fire gives Azumarill a vital immunity to Will-O-Wisp, as well as letting it deal massive damage to Corviknight with Tera Blast.

  • Electric: Tera Electric lets Azumarill deal massive damage to Dondozo, Toxapex, and Corviknight, plus it OHKOes Iron Bundle.

  • Grass: Tera Grass lets Azumarill beat Breloom, Brute Bonnet, and Rotom-W.

Items

  • Assault Vest: Assault Vest lets Azumarill act as a decent Chi-Yu check, with only +2 Life Orb Overheat even coming close to OHKOing.

  • Choice Band: The big power boost from Choice Band gives Azumarill an 81.3% chance to OHKO Rotom-H with Aqua Jet, and it lets it pick off major foes such as Flutter Mane, Chien-Pao, and Great Tusk more easily.

Belly Drum.description:
• Azumarill's excellent typing and access to priority Aqua Jet make it one of the best Belly Drum users in the metagame.

  • Liquidation: Liquidation remains a strong Water-type STAB move and makes Azumarill more usable in matchups where Belly Drum can't be used. When boosted by Belly Drum, Liquidation is fully capable of punching through bulky Steel-types—like Corviknight—that Play Rough can't.

  • Encore: Encore can create an opening to use Belly Drum against slower, more passive foes, such as Ting-Lu, though the decreased offensive coverage can hurt in the long run.

  • Belly Drum Usage: While finding a safe opportunity to use Belly Drum can be tough, Azumarill can cushion hits well from and set up on popular sweepers like Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu, given that they don't have a Tera type that counters Azumarill. Azumarill can still hit hard even without Belly Drum, so don't force it if the situation looks too dangerous.

  • EV Spread : 244 HP EVs are used to give Azumarill an even HP number, guaranteeing that Sitrus Berry activates after Belly Drum. The extra EVs are put into Speed to prevent Speed ties with opposing 4 Speed Azumarill.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Belly Drum is inherently risky; smart Tera usage can cushion an attack during setup or provide a stronger coverage option when Belly Drum simply isn't viable to use.

  • Water: Tera Water combined with Belly Drum gives Aqua Jet nightmarish power. After Stealth Rock chip, it can even OHKO Iron Bundle!

  • Fire: Tera Fire blocks Will-O-Wisp, and the Tera Blast coverage can hit Steel-types like Scizor and Corviknight hard even without Belly Drum.

  • Grass: Tera Grass turns both Grass- and Electric-type weaknesses into resistances, and when combined with Tera Blast, it makes dealing with Unaware Dondozo and Rotom-W much easier. It can also be used to block Spore and set up Belly Drum for free, but this must be done with discretion, as Spore users like Loaded Dice Breloom may just attack and leave Azumarill heavily wounded after Belly Drum.

  • Electric: Tera Electric with Tera Blast is Azumarill's best option to beat Toxapex, and it still deals big damage to Unaware Dondozo and Corviknight.

Substitute + Encore.description: • This set does not have a full write-up yet. If you'd like to finish this, feel free to reserve it here!

Wish Tank.description:
• Umbreon's high bulk allows it tank a slew of offensive Pokemon. Alongside excellent utility moves, Umbreon can generate tempo while surviving even surprise Tera-boosted attacks.

  • Foul Play: In such a physically leaning format, Foul Play is a strong reliable move to chip the opponent's Pokemon. In particular, it punishes Dragon Dance from Lum Berry Dragonite.

  • Wish and Protect: Wish + Protect provides excellent recovery opportunies for both Umbreon and its teammates. With Leftovers's animation as well, its great at stalling out the timer. Protect also scouts for U-turn and Tera.

  • Yawn: Yawn's ability to force switches generates extra Leftovers recovery and generates momentum for its teammates.

  • Thunder Wave: Thunder Wave has excellent synergy with Wish. If the opponent's Pokemon is unable to attack on the turn Umbreon uses Wish, Umbreon can easily pass the Wish to a teammate.

  • Taunt: Umbreon can Taunt opposing walls and deny their recovery, with foes such as Hippowdon and Corviknight being especially vulnerable.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Despite its incredible bulk, Umbreon's Fighting- and Fairy-type weaknesses are exploitable by several top threats and often needs to be removed.

  • Fairy: In a heavily Dragon-centric metagame, Tera Fairy on defensive Pokemon is highly valuable. Removing Umbreon's Fighting- and Fairy-type weakness also helps deal with Sacred Sword Chien-Pao and Mimikyu.

  • Poison: Tera Poison resists Fighting, Bug, and Fairy and provides an immunity to Toxic, but makes it more vulnerable to Earthquake from the likes of Dragonite and Baxcalibur.

Items

  • Leftovers: Combined with Protect, Leftovers keeps Umbreon healthy and a little less reliant on Wish.

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet's chip damage is serviceable, but many top physical threats have suitable non-contact moves they can use on Umbreon, especially after Umbreon Terastallizes.

Abilities

  • Inner Focus: Inner Focus avoids flinches from Chien-Pao and Kingambit, making Umbreon a more reliable check.

  • Synchronize: Synchronize punishes attempts to burn Umbreon.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 SpD with Bold: With Terastallization, this spread allows Umbreon to tank a majority of the physical metagame.

  • 172 HP / 252 Def / 60 SpD / 20 Spe with Bold: If running Taunt, 20 Speed EVs outpace Skeledirge and Corviknight while retaining all-around bulk.

AV Tank.description:
• Thanks to its great Special Defense, unique typing, and Regenerator, Galarian Slowking functions well as an Assault Vest user.

  • Assault Vest: While Galarian Slowking has access to Slack Off, Regenerator can provide some recovery if needed, and an Assault Vest increases its Special Defense to titanic levels.

  • Future Sight: Future Sight is Galarian Slowking's strongest move and provides phenomenal field pressure due to hitting two turns after it's used, allowing for combinations with another teammate's move.

  • Eerie Spell versus Psychic: Psychic offers more PP, while Eerie Spell depletes the PP of the last move used by the opponent by 3, which can be useful when fighting against opponents with low PP moves, such as recovery moves.

  • Acid Spray: Acid Spray makes Galarian Slowking much less passive and prone to setup against opponents that aren't immune, and the Special Defense drops can be deadly when combined with Future Sight, alongside making Galarian Slowking harder to check defensively.

  • Earthquake: Earthquake is Galarian Slowking's best option against Heatran and Hisuian Goodra, even when using a Calm nature.

  • Ice Beam: Ice Beam allows Galarian Slowking to hit Ground-types such as Ting-Lu, Landorus-T, and Ursaluna for more damage than its Psychic STAB moves.

  • Flamethrower: Flamethrower hits other Steel-types such as Gholdengo and Corviknight.

  • Calm versus Sassy: If using Earthquake, a Sassy Nature lets Galarian Slowking have a shot at 3HKOing max HP Hisuian Goodra, though at the risk of getting outsped by Amoonguss. A Calm Nature has better odds at Speed tying or outspeeding Amoonguss.

Other Options
  • Psyshock: Despite having little synergy with Acid Spray, Psyshock hits Flutter Mane and Clodsire the hardest before factoring Special Defense drops.
EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Calm / Sassy: This EV spread focuses on Galarian Slowking's ability to take special attacks to the point where powerful super effective hits such as Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball only has a chance of 2HKOing it 75.4% of the time.

  • 252 HP / 28 Def / 84 SpA / 140 SpD / 4 Spe with Modest / Quiet: This spread survives Jolly Choice Band Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes while OHKOing it with Eerie Spell.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Galarian Slowking is perfectly able to function without Terastallization, but it can boost its defensive profile.

  • Normal: A well-timed Tera Normal can severely hamper opponents hoping to take down Galarian Slowking with Ghost-type moves.

  • Poison: Tera Poison removes Galarian Slowking's weaknesses to Ghost-, and Dark-type attacks, and it boosts Sludge Bomb and Acid Spray's power.

  • Grass: Tera Grass turns Galarian Slowking's Ground weakness into a resistance, can help it take Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes better, and provides a handy immunity to Spore.

Scizor.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Pivot.description:
• Thanks to its high Attack, great defensive typing and solid bulk, Scizor is an effective bulky pivot that can also punish faster foes with Technician-boosted Bullet Punch, such as Flutter Mane, Chien-Pao, and Latios.

  • Knock Off versus Thief: Beyond being a fantastic support move, Knock Off is a great option against Gholdengo. Thief does offer more consistent damage than Knock Off though, thanks to Technician.

  • Dual Wingbeat: Dual Wingbeat is Scizor's best option against Ogerpon-H as well Fighting-types like Annihilape and Urshifu formes.

  • Close Combat: Close Combat is Scizor's best option to hit opposing Ursaluna-B and Chi-Yu as well as Steel types, even when using defensive EV spreads.

Other Options
  • Choice Scarf: Choice Scarf is a shocking twist against Ogerpon-H and Urshifu formes to launch off a strong Dual Wingbeat, but this does mean Scizor's bulk is heavily compromised against the threats it usually checks, like Flutter Mane.
Items

  • Assault Vest: While much less immediately threatening than Choice Band, Assault Vest lets Scizor more comfortably switch into stray special attacks like Gholdengo's and Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball or Rotom-W's Volt Switch, improving its longevity.

  • Choice Band: Choice Band lets Scizor function as a scary late-game cleaner, especially with Tera Steel-boosted Bullet Punch. The high damage output also helps Scizor to break down walls for its teammates.

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet is perfect for more defensive Scizor, letting it continually switch into weaker physical attacks and wear down the team with U-turn and residual damage.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 92 Atk / 164 SpD with Adamant: This spread is meant to be used with Assault Vest, letting Scizor almost always avoid a 2HKO from Modest Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball. It also maintains enough Attack investment to always OHKO uninvested Chien-Pao after Stealth Rock chip.

  • 236 HP / 68 Atk / 204 Def with Adamant: This spread avoids an OHKO from Tera Dark Life Orb Chien-Pao, is not 2HKOed by Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast, and reduces the amount of residual damage Scizor receives thanks to the HP stat being 1 lower than divisible by 16.

  • 236 HP / 68 Atk / 204 Def with Adamant: This bulky spread lets Scizor survive +2 Life Orb Adamant Tera Ghost Mimikyu's Shadow Claw.

  • 252 HP / 4 Atk / 252 Def with Impish: Defensive Scizor might seem strange, but when paired with Rocky Helmet, it becomes an effective pivot that can survive extreme attacks: it avoids the OHKO from Choice Band Tera Dark Chien-Pao's Crunch as well as the 2HKO from Adamant Landorus-T's Earthquake. Just note that this will make Scizor focus more on pivoting than revenge killing with Bullet Punch.

  • Brave or Relaxed with a Speed IV of 8 or 9: This Speed IV can be used to use U-turn after some Hippowdon use Yawn, but still outspeed Ting-Lu. Note that being slower than Ursaluna-B can be troublesome.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: While Terastallization can be quite helpful in either cleaning teams or preparing against Scizor's classic Fire-type issues, the power of its priority and pivoting don't make it needed for it to function consistently.

  • Water: Tera Water turns its Fire weakness into a resistance, giving Scizor a fighting chance against dangerous Fire-types such as Chi-Yu, Gouging Fire, and Ogerpon-H.

  • Steel: Tera Steel is ideal for more offensive Scizor variants, making Bullet Punch an even better cleaning tool. Tera Steel also softens Scizor's weakness to Fire, letting it avoid the OHKO from attacks like Flutter Mane's Mystical Fire.

  • Fire: Tera Fire is a great response most Ogerpon-H sets, and shields Scizor from burns that foes like Entei like to deal out.

  • Flying: Increasing Dual Wingbeat's power with Terastallization nets Scizor some useful new OHKOs against offensive Urshifu formes and Annihilape.

  • Dragon: While not an incredible defensive typing, Tera Dragon is fantastic against most Fire and Water Pokemon that give Scizor trouble, with Ogerpon formes being a particularly prominent example. As a downside though, it harms Scizor's ability to check Flutter Mane and Chien-Pao.

Swords Dance.description:
• Scizor's incredible power and good typing make it one of the premier priority sweepers, being able to sweep through huge threats such as Flutter Mane and Chien-Pao!

  • Close Combat: Close Combat lets Scizor smash through Ursaluna-B, Archaludon, and Ting-Lu after a boost.

  • Knock Off: Knock Off is Scizor's best bet against Gholdengo, in addition to being a great support move in general.

  • Dual Wingbeat: After a boost, Dual Wingbeat smashes through bulky Fighting-types like Urshifu-R and Annihilape.

  • U-turn: While pivoting doesn't gel well with sweeping, it makes this kind of Scizor very adaptable, and is especially effective at getting away from Pokemon that threaten with residual damage like Garganacl.

Items

  • Sitrus Berry and 244 HP EVs: Sitrus Berry trades late-game sweeping power for new setup opportunities, such as avoiding a 2HKO from Modest Gholdengo that lack Choice Specs. Make sure to run 244 HP EVs to gain an even HP number, letting Sitrus activate after getting hit by Ruination once.

  • Life Orb: While Life Orb does compromise Scizor's bulk, it's worth it for being able to OHKO Iron Bundle with a boosted Bullet Punch. Boosted Close Combat will also OHKO even physically defensive Ursaluna-B, and it has good shot of OHKOing physically defensive Ting-Lu.

  • Rocky Helmet: Best used with U-turn, Rocky Helmet transforms this Scizor into a good bulky pivot that has the surprising option to sweep late-game.

EV Spreads

  • 236 HP / 228 Atk / 20 Def / 20 SpD / 4 Spe with Adamant: This spread gives Scizor enough bulk to survive Tera Dark Life Orb Chien-Pao's Crunch, and less residual damage if using U-turn. It also avoids a 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast. With Sitrus Berry, Modest Gholdengo's Shadow Ball is also no longer a 2HKO.

  • 228 HP / 124 Atk / 156 SpD with Adamant: This Sitrus Berry optimized spread avoids a 2HKO from Jolly Chien-Pao's Crunch, Iron Bundle's Hydro Pump, and Modest Choice Specs Tera Fairy Flutter Mane's Moonblast.

  • 252 HP / 28 Atk / 204 Def / 20 SpD / 4 Spe with Adamant: This bulky spread avoids the OHKO from Adamant Tera Ghost Life Orb Mimikyu's +2 Shadow Claw. When used with Sitrus Berry and 244 HP EVs, it also avoids the 2HKO from Modest Gholdengo's Shadow Ball.

  • 252 HP / 4 Atk / 252 Def with Impish: This defensive spread is best used with U-turn and Rocky Helmet, making Scizor function more like a bulky pivot that can sweep late-game.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium / Low: Terastallization works very well at shutting down common methods of revenge killing or walling Scizor, but its typing is good enough to function without Terastallization. If using U-turn, Scizor can focus on pivoting in some matches, making Terastallization even less needed.

  • Water: Tera Water lets Scizor ambush Chi-Yu, Iron Bundle, and Incineroar with a resistance and is especially handy against Fire-types when using Tera Blast.

  • Steel: Boosting Bullet Punch is Scizor's best ticket for revenge killing and late-game sweeping, and it gains a Flying-type resistance into powerful Tera Flying Choice Band users like Dragonite and Landorus-T.

  • Fire: Tera Fire ensures that Siczor's hard work won't get ruined by Will-O-Wisp or Sacred Fire, in addition to stopping revenge kills from common Fire-types like Ogerpon-H, Gouging Fire, and Incineroar.

  • Dark: Tera Dark can cushion Shadow Ball from Gholdengo and Flutter Mane, giving it an extra turn to set up or hit back with Tera-boosted Knock Off.

  • Electric: Tera Electric is Scizor's best shot of breaking past Toxapex and Urshifu-R with Tera Blast, and it does good chip damage to Dondozo.

Porygon2.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon is a new addition from the Indigo Disk that happens to be relevant!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Immortal Duck.description:
• With its wide movepool and impressive bulk courtesy of Eviolite, Porygon2 is a great defensive option.

  • Tri Attack vs Tera Blast: Tri Attack offers Porygon2 consistent damage and the chance of inflicting status, while Tera Blast allows Porygon2 to make use of Tera to damage foes it might miss out on with Tri Attack such as Flutter Mane.

  • Foul Play: Foul Play prevents Porygon2 from being used as setup fodder by the likes of Dragonite and Ogerpon, punishing their attempts to boost with increasing damage.

  • Ice Beam: Ice Beam allows Porygon2 to more immediately threaten important targets like Dragonite and Landorus-T without relying on Tera.

  • Discharge: Discharge gives Porygon2 coverage against the likes of Primarina and enables it to attempt to spread paralysis even through Taunt.

EV Spreads
  • 244 HP / 192 Def / 60 SpD / 12 Spe with Calm: This spread gives Porygon2 good mixed bulk and allows it to outspeed paralyzed Urshifu.
Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Porygon2 is a great defensive presence even without Tera; however, the right Tera type is still crucial in allowing it to lock down important targets.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy gives Porygon2 resistances to Dark- and Fighting-type attacks, allowing it to better stand up to foes such as Urshifu. The immunity to Dragon is also useful in denying Scale Shot attempts from the likes of Dragonite.

  • Poison: Tera Poison grants a resistance to Fighting as well as an immunity to Toxic and Toxic Spikes, enabling Porygon2 to function better against bulkier teams.

Blissey.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Calm Mind Support.description:
• The old reliable special wall is still viable, but it now takes a more active role through the use of Calm Mind.

  • Flamethrower: Flamethrower is great at hitting Tera Steel users like Latios that are commonly employed against stall teams.

  • Alluring Voice: Alluring Voice catches targets trying to set up alongside Blissey, confusing them if they boosted their stats in the same turn.

  • Fling with Poison Barb: Fling with Poison Barb gives Blissey a one-time opportunity to poison foes, and is preferred over Toxic Orb since it doesn't poison Blissey itself prior to being thrown. Fling also gets rid of Choice items from Trick users.

  • Stealth Rock: Stealth Rock remains a trusty support move for Blissey, punishing teams that are forced to switch around Blissey and its teammates.

Other Options

  • Shadow Ball: Shadow Ball can deal good damage to special Ghost-type sweepers like Flutter Mane and Gholdengo. However, Blissey will no longer be able to reliably hit Ursaluna-B, which is a matchup Blissey is normally expected to handle.

  • Fling with Flame Orb or Toxic Orb: This is as close as it gets to Blissey regaining Toxic, though getting burned or badly poisoned is devestating if Blissey is the last Pokemon around, making it a risky option.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Blissey is known for shrugging off big special hits with ease. However, its presence at team preview often attracts hard counters, and Tera is one way of dealing with that.

  • Steel: Steel Tera resists the STAB attacks of Latios and Archuladon while also granting a Fairy resistance for the Flutter Mane matchup. It also prevents poison, which can otherwise force Blissey to switch out.

  • Dark: Dark Tera completely ruins Latios's attempts to break through Blissey with Stored Power or Psychic Noise, at least forcing a Calm Mind war. However, Blissey becomes much more vulnerable to Choice Specs Flutter Mane.

  • Ghost: The Fighting-type immunity comes in handy for Blissey and prevents it from being trapped, though it does become more vulnerable to Gholdengo.

  • Water: Tera Water puts the brakes on Choice Specs Tera Fire Chi-Yu’s wallbreaking parade, ruining its ability to reliably 2HKO Blissey.

Items

  • Poison Barb: Poison Barb complements Fling, letting Blissey use poison to outlast targets that can't heal.

  • Covert Cloak: Covert Cloak grants a huge immunity to the healing block of Psychic Noise. Beyond that, it is also fantastic for blocking the passive damage from Garganacl's Salt Cure, flinches from Chi-Yu's Dark Pulse, and Special Defense drops from Latios's Luster Purge.

  • Leftovers: As is the case with most walls, Leftovers’ passive recovery is a great supplement to Softboiled and helps Blissey be less passive itself.

EV Spreads

  • 4 HP / 252 Def / 252 SpD with Calm or Bold: Beyond making Tera Blissey that much harder to break by foes like Ursaluna-B and Chi-Yu, going all-in on Special Defense means less frequent Softboiled uses against special attackers, especially with Leftovers.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 Spd with Bold: Maximizing both HP and Defense gives Blissey a little extra boost in physical bulk.

Bulky Offense.description: • This set does not have a full write-up yet. If you'd like to finish this, feel free to reserve it here!

Bulky Attacker.description:
• Access to strong priority and an ability that prevents Intimidate cycling give Entei a strong niche over other bulky Fire-types like Incineroar and Gouging Fire!

  • Sacred Fire: Sacred Fire's stupendous burn rate makes switching physical attackers into Entei a terrifyingly risky prospect!

  • Stone Edge: Despite its notorious reliability issues, Stone Edge is useful for being Entei's strongest attack against Dragonite and Terastallized Ogerpon-H.

  • Tera Blast Grass VS. Trailblaze: Tera Blast Grass has a chance of OHKOing offensive Primarina, OHKOes Swampert, and deals massive damage to Urshifu-R. Trailblaze misses out on these KOes, but the Speed boost can lead to easier sweeping late-game.

  • Bulldoze VS. Stomping Tantrum: Bulldoze is both a way to deal decent damage to opposing Fire-types and a useful support move with its Speed drop. Stomping Tantrum offers a bit more power and can match Sacred Fire in power if Entei misses an attack.

  • Crunch: Crunch is Entei's best coverage option for Latios and Latias.

Other Options
  • Iron Head: Iron Head does a bit of extra damage against Flutter Mane but has limited use otherwise.
EV Spreads

  • 148 HP / 244 Atk / 84 Def / 12 SpD / 20 Spe with Adamant: This EV spread avoids an OHKO from Adamant Chien-Pao's Tera-boosted Crunch after Stealth Rock damage and a 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball without Stealth Rock.

  • 132 HP / 228 Atk / 4 Def / 4 SpD / 140 Spe with Adamant: This spread spread lets Entei outspeed Iron Bundle after using Trailblaze or Bulldoze while only having a 2% chance of being 2HKOed by Choice Specs Timid Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball.

  • 196 HP / 132 Atk / 156 Def / 4 SpD / 20 Spe with Adamant: This physically defensive spread survives Tera Dark Choice Band Adamant Chien-Pao's Crunch while still dodging a 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball without Stealth Rock.

  • 116 HP / 116 Atk / 4 Def / 252 SpD / 20 Spe with Adamant: This specially defensive spread dodges a 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane even when with Stealth Rock!

  • 4 HP / 236 Atk / 4 Def / 76 SpD / 188 Spe with with Jolly: This speedy and frailer spread outspeeds all Landorus-T that lack Choice Scarf while still having enough special bulk to almost always avoid a 2HKO Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Entei's Fairy resistance is a big selling point as an Assault Vest Pokemon, but Terastallization can help with some of its poor matchups.

  • Grass: Tera Grass helps Entei with Water-types like Primarina and offensive Urshifu-R. Just note that Suicune and Bulk Up Urshifu-R avoid a 2HKO from Tera Blast.

  • Normal: While this Entei doesn't have enough firepower to sweep until late-game, boosting Extreme Speed is still helpful in this regard. It can also save Entei from Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy isn't as helpful against bulky Water-types, but it makes Urshifu-S and Choice Band Chien-Pao much more manageable and surprises Gouging Fire that may attempt to set up with Breaking Swipe and Dragon Dance.

Choice Band.description:
• Being immune to Intimidate cycling and a better Speed stat make Entei a reasonable alternative to Choice Band Dragonite for priority cleaning.

  • Sacred Fire: Sacred Fire's horrifying coin-flip burn chances are a powerful deterrent to problematic foes like Urshifu-R, so it's preferred over Flare Blitz.

  • Stone Edge: As unreliable as Stone Edge can be, it's needed to do maximum damage to Dragonite.

  • Bulldoze: Bulldoze's Speed drop is useful for team support and 2HKOes most Focus Sash Flutter Mane, potentially saving Entei from a KO!

  • Crunch: Crunch deals massive damage to Latias, which can otherwise stall out Stone Edge with Recover.

EV Spreads

  • 116 HP / 252 Atk / 140 Spe with Adamant: This spread lets Entei outspeed up to Iron Bundle after using Bulldoze.

  • 148 HP / 252 Atk / 84 Def / 4 SpD / 20 Spe with Adamant: This bulkier spread lets Entei survive Adamant Chien-Pao's Tera-boosted Crunch.

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe with Jolly: Entei can make use of its often overlooked Speed stat to outspeed Adamant Urshifu formes and Adamant Ogerpon formes, and it can even Speed tie with Chi-Yu.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Entei is a perfectly fine priority cleaner, but Terastallization makes that task much easier.

  • Normal: Tera Normal lets Entei do its best Dragonite impression, giving Extreme Speed such a boost that Chien-Pao can be OHKOed by it after Stealth Rock!

  • Grass: Tera Grass trades easier Extreme Speed sweeping for shredding through opposing bulky Water-types with Tera Blast, like Urshifu-R and Suicune.

Offensive.description:
• Entei is fast enough to be a surprisingly effective offensive Pokemon thanks to its immunity to Intimidate cycling and decent Speed.

  • Sacred Fire: Even though Flare Blitz is more powerful and doesn't contend with a irritating 5% chance to miss, the insane burn rate Sacred Fire provides is generally preferred.

  • Stone Edge: Stone Edge is Entei's best chance at breaking through Dragonite and Gouging Fire before without Terastallization.

  • Trailblaze VS. Grass Tera Blast: Trailblaze does decent damage to offensive Water-types and lets Entei outspeed the troublesome Choice Scarf Urshifu-R, but Tera Blast is needed to break through bulky Water-types like Suicune.

  • Swagger and Mirror Herb: This is the closest Entei gets to setting up, giving Entei the chance to pull off a shocking sweep and even be a nuisance with confusion! Outside of Swagger, Mirror Herb can be used for some risky switch-ins to punish setup moves with a boosted Extreme Speed.

  • Jolly VS. Adamant: Jolly Entei will outpace the prominent Urshifu-R, but Adamant is worth considering if using Tera Normal for easier priority sweeping.

Alternate EV Spreads
  • 148 HP / 252 Atk / 84 Def / 4 SpD / 20 Spe with Adamant: If using Swagger, Mirror Herb, and Tera Normal, this bulkier EV spread can fit to avoid an OHKO from Adamant Chien-Pao's Tera-boosted Crunch after Stealth Rock.
Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Entei can function without Terastallization, but there are some matchups that will need it for.

  • Grass: Tera Grass is Entei's trump card against bulky Water-types like Suicune and Primarina and can save it from getting revenge killed by Choice Scarf Urshifu-R.
