  • Normal: Tera Normal gives Entei a more late-game focus with Extreme Speed sweeping, especially if using Swagger.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy with Tera Blast is a less nerve-wracking way to deal with Dragon-types, with Roaring Moon particularly vulnerable to it.

Defensive.description:
• This set's write-up has not started yet, but here's some basic info to get you started!

  • 252 HP / 36 Def / 220 SpD with Bold: This spread avoids a 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast after Leftovers recovery.

  • Tera Types: Fairy stops Choice Band Chien-Pao from breaking through Suicune with Crunch, while Poison makes Toxic Spikes a non-factor for it and helps against Ogerpon formes.

Rest.description:
• This set's write-up has not started yet, but here's some basic info to get you started!

  • Chesto Berry: This transforms Suicune into more of a late-game bulky sweeper, making Rest safe only once but giving it extra coverage against Dragonite and Roaring Moon.

  • Tera Type: Fairy is the best choice for avoiding getting torn apart by Choice Band Chien-Pao's Crunch and Swords Dance Urshifu-R's Wicked Blow.

Support Pivot.description:
• Thanks to its bulk and unique dual typing, Swampert is a good Stealth Rock lead that matches up well against most Archaludon sets.

  • Flip Turn: Unlike Ting-Lu and Hippowdon, Swampert can use Flip Turn to safely bring in its teammates.

  • Yawn versus Roar: Yawn synergizes best with Stealth Rock, forcing switches that gradually rack up hazard damage. On the other hand, Roar lets you phaze out troublesome setup users and isn't blocked by Substitute.

  • Earthquake: Earthquake is the preferred attacking move for pressuring Archaludon and Gholdengo.

  • Knock Off: Knock Off is a great support option that can remove items from the likes of Porygon2, even if the lack of power makes Swampert even more passive.

  • Avalanche: Avalanche can be used over Earthquake to surprise Dragonite and Landorus-T.

Other Options

  • Mirror Coat: Mirror Coat can OHKO Ursaluna-B, provided you have invested in enough Special Defense.

  • Protect and Leftovers: This combination can give Swampert more longevity, and Protect also helps Swampert scout for Trick and surprise Grass-type coverage.

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash doesn't always make sense with Swampert's bulk, but it is the best insurance against Grass-type moves. It also has good synergy with Mirror Coat and the less common Counter.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Swampert has excellent bulk and only a single weakness, but opponents will often try to exploit that weakness, often making Terastallization necessary.

  • Fire: Tera Fire grants a superb defensive typing. Not only does it flip the script on powerful Grass-types like Ogerpon-H and Rillaboom, but its Fairy resistance makes dealing with Flutter Mane much easier.

  • Poison: Tera Poison covers up Swampert's massive Grass weakness while allowing it to neutralize Toxic and Toxic Spikes throughout the match.

  • Steel: Tera Steel's Dragon resistance can be pivotal for standing in the way of sweepers like Scale Shot Dragonite, giving Swampert an opening to use Yawn or Roar against them.

  • Water: Tera Water makes it so that not even Tera Water Choice Band Urshifu-R can 2HKO Sitrus Berry Swampert. It also gives Flip Turn some extra damage potential.

EV Spreads

  • 0 Speed IV with Relaxed or Sassy: Having the slowest Flip Turn possible is great for pivoting, but it does make Swampert more vulnerable to bulky attackers like Ursaluna-B.

  • 252 HP / 220 Def / 36 SpD with Relaxed or Impish: This EV spread prioritizes physical bulk, but enough Special Defense EVs are allocated to avoid a 2HKO from Timid Flutter Mane's Moonblast.

  • 252 HP / 156 Def / 100 SpD with Relaxed or Impish: Some physical bulk is cut for special bulk, but now Swampert can survive a Draco Meteor from Modest Choice Specs Archaludon.

  • 252 HP / 60 Def / 196 SpD with Sassy or Careful: The focus on Special Defense investment with Sitrus Berry makes it so Timid Choice Specs Latios will fail to 2HKO Swampert with consecutive Draco Meteors, as well as making it so maximum Special Attack Modest Choice Specs Flutter Mane will fail to 2HKO with Moonblast 95% of the time. Ursaluna-B's Tera Normal Blood Moon into Earth Power will also fail to 2HKO with Sitrus Berry factored in. The Defense investment gives just enough physical bulk to always avoid the 2HKO from Jolly Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes after Sitrus Berry recovery.

Pelipper.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Bulky Drizzle.description:
• Pelipper is the best rain summoner around, letting dangerous teammates like Urshifu-R, Swift Swim Basculegion, or Electro Shot Archaludon run wild!

  • Ice Beam: This lets Pelipper do huge damage to Dragonite, who otherwise takes most of this set on fine.

  • Tailwind: Tailwind gives Pelipper even more team support props, making it an especially scary option with Urshifu-R sets.

  • Roost; Roost takes advantage of its decent physical bulk, increasing its staying power. This is particularly useful in weather wars against Torkoal and Hippowdon.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Pelipper is all about rain support, so only Terastallize if if its needed to win certain match-ups.

  • Steel: Tera Steel prevents total annihilation from Freeze-Dry users like Iron Bundle and Alolan Ninetales.

Ground: Tera Ground gives Pelipper an immunity to Volt Switch, which is often used against it early-game. This wastes a turn for the opponent and gives Pelipper the chance to safely U-turn or deal massive damage with a rain-boosted Hydro Pump.

Grass: Tera Grass is a viable way to gain an Electric resistances without being revenge killed by Urshifu-R.

Alternate EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpA with Quiet: With 0 Speed IVs, this is used to underspeed uninvested Hippowdon, giving Pelipper the initial advantage in weather wars.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 SpA with Bold or Relaxed: This spread gives Pelipper a better matchup against dominant, powerful physical attackers like Urshifu-R and Dragonite.

Fast Drizzle.description:
• This set's write-up has not started yet, but here's some basic info to get you started!

  • Quick Attack: Quick Attack may seem silly, but it allows Pelipper to snipe opposing Focus Sash foes like Iron Bundle and Urshifu-R.

Drizzle Bird.description:
• Hydro Pump versus Surf: Hydro Pump significantly weakens opponents when rain-boosted, often picking up surprise KOs. Surf is the far more reliable option.

  • Hurricane versus Roost; The choice between Hurricane and Roost is a matter of coverage versus longevity. Hurricane gives Pelipper a powerful secondary STAB move, while Roost takes advantage of its decent physical bulk, increasing its staying power. This is particularly useful in weather wars against Torkoal

Tera Types

Ground: Tera Ground gives Pelipper an immunity to Volt Switch, which is often used against it early-game. This wastes a turn for the opponent and gives Pelipper the chance to safely U-turn or deal massive damage with a rain-boosted Hydro Pump.

Grass: Tera Grass is a viable option for Rotom-W, which primarily uses Hydro Pump on lead while providing a Volt Switch resistance.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpA with Quiet: With 0 Speed IVs, this is used to underspeed uninvested Hippowdon, giving Pelipper the initial advantage in weather wars.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 SpA with Relaxed: This spread gives Pelipper a better matchup against dominant, powerful physical attackers like Choice Band Dragpault and Extreme Speed Dragonite.

  • 4 Def / 252 SpA / 252 Spe with Modest: This offensive spread can be used to outspeed uninvested Corviknight and others in that Speed tier.

Items

  • Eject Button: This extra method of pivoting makes it much easier to switch Pelipper in just for getting rain up.

  • Choice Specs: Choice Specs can be used to take advantage of Pelipper's powerful STAB moves.

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry provides longevity on defensive sets.

Bulky Offense.description:
• Between using Trace to cancel Ruin abilities and burning foes with Will-O-Wisp, Gardevoir can overwhelm some of the meta's strongest physical sweepers.

  • Will-O-Wisp: Beyond crippling physical attackers for the remainder of the match, the passive burn damage breaks Focus Sash on Chien-Pao and Multiscale on Dragonite.

  • Psyshock versus Psychic: The choice of Psychic-type STAB comes down to what you need to hit hardest. Psyshock is the best option into Flutter Mane, Iron Moth, and Clodsire, while Psychic puts more pressure on Toxapex and many variants of Bulk Up Annihilape.

Other Options
  • Sitrus Berry versus Pinch Berry: Sitrus Berry is normally the preferred recovery item for bulky Gardevoir sets, but it is a highly sought-after item. If needed elsewhere, Gardevoir's bulk profile is strong enough that running a pinch Berry can work.
Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Using Tera usually improves common matchups like Flutter Mane and is certainly an option if a target is deemed high enough priority. Otherwise, Gardevor's impressive suite of defensive attributes combined with excellent STAB coverage are great as is.

  • Fire: Tera Fire’s resistances to Ice, Steel, and Fairy are all excellent, greatly improving the matchups against Flutter Mane, Scizor, and Kingambit. Tera boosted Mystical Fire will also 2HKO maximum HP Kingambit without Assault Vest.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy can patch up this set's lacking power by boosting Moonblast, and the removal of Gardevoir's Psychic typing makes dealing with opposing Ghost-types like Flutter Mane and Mimikyu more manageable.

  • Normal: Tera Normal's defensive attributes are lacking overall, but nullifying a key Ghost-type attack from the likes of Flutter Mane and Mimikyu can give an opening to deal extra damage or inflict a crucial burn.

EV Spreads

  • The spreads listed below all have an even HP stat to guarantee that Sitrus Berry activates after getting hit by Ruination. All spreads are also capable of surviving one unboosted Shadow Ball from Flutter Mane.

  • 244 HP / 244 Def / 20 Spe: Near maximum HP and Defense gives Gardevoir fantastic defensive calcs; after Sitrus Berry recovery and inflicting a turn 1 burn, Gardevoir has a strong chance of avoiding the 3HKO from Focus Sash Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash and Assault Vest Ting-Lu's Heavy Slam. The Speed investment outspeeds maximum Speed Adamant Kingambit.

  • 244 HP / 204 Def / 60 Spe: A little extra Speed investment lets Gardevoir outspeed defensive Gholdengo with 20 Speed EVs, but Gardevoir is much less likely to avoid the 3HKOs mentioned in the main spread.

Offensive.description: • EV Spread: This spread allows Assault Vest Gardevoir to survive Modest Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball from full health, while outspeeding Adamant Breloom.

Breloom.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out this page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Offensive.description:
• Since it can sleep foes without restriction, Breloom is a monstrous foe that applies serious pressure at Team Preview!

  • Bulldoze: This is Breloom's best option against Gholdengo and provides valuable speed control.

  • Spore: As good as Spore is, it's well prepared for enough by threats such as Gholdengo, Garganacl, and Lum Berry that going without it can make sense.

  • Rock Tomb: Rock Tomb provides a form of speed control that can't be walled by Flying-types like Dragonite.

  • Close Combat: Close Combat lets Breloom muscle past bulkier threats more easily, such as Wo-Chien.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low / Medium: While Breloom can certainly take advantage of Terastallization, Focus Sash variants are used fairly early in the game and often don't need it. Loaded Dice Breloom, however, does like Terastallization covering up its iffy defensive typing.

  • Fire: With Tera Blast, Tera Fire provides an alternative way to get past Gholdengo, avoids getting burned by other foes, and gives bulkier Breloom a chance against Flutter Mane and Focus Sash Chien-Pao.

  • Fighting: Tera Fighting is a good choice for picking off foes more easily with Mach Punch.

  • Grass: Bullet Seed's boost from Tera Grass means it will OHKO Chien-Pao through its Focus Sash if Breloom rolls at least three hits.

  • Rock: Besides boosting Rock Tomb's damage output, Tera Rock prevents Sandstorm from breaking Breloom's Focus Sash.

  • Ground: Tera Ground-boosted Bulldoze has a 93.8% chance to OHKO 4 HP Gholdengo, making Breloom a situational lure. It also severely punishes Rotom-W that attempt to Volt Switch out, and Hippowdon that don't Terastallize.

Items

  • Focus Sash: Since Breloom's bulk isn't very good, Focus Sash is the most reliable way to fire off Spore.

  • Loaded Dice: Guaranteeing 4 hits from Bullet Seed can be quite useful for bulkier Breloom sets, clinching an OHKO on Flutter Mane, Chien-Pao, and Iron Bundle regardless of them running Substitute or Focus Sash.

EV Spreads

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe: If using Focus Sash, maximizing Speed is important to deal with slower foes that might invest in Speed, such as Corviknight and Skeledirge.

  • 252 HP / 180 Atk / 76 SpD: This bulkier spread makes sense if using Loaded Dice and Swords Dance, letting Breloom survive one hit from Iron Bundle, Chien-Pao, or Choice Specs Flutter Mane with the correct Tera type.

SubSeed.description:
• With Poison Heal, Breloom can act as a pivot versus defensive Pokemon such as Dondozo and Umbreon as it is unaffected by Yawn.

  • This set can catch opponents expecting the more popular Focus Sash set off guard. However, do note that this set is very susceptible to Taunt and Encore, which can make it difficult to even select Breloom in the team preview phase.

  • Protect: Protect gives Breloom an opportunity to scout out its opponents and further stall them out once Leech Seed has been set up.

  • Timer Stalling: If you obtain a numerical advantage early in the match, you can utilize Breloom to win on timer. This is particularly effective since the Leech Seed damage happens after recovery from Leftovers and Poison Heal.

  • Bulldoze: Bulldoze allows Breloom to further support its teammates and threaten Gholdengo, which likes to absorb status moves. Do be wary that many Gholdengo are Tera Flying, which can render Breloom ineffective versus it.

Other Options
  • Toxic: Toxic can be difficult to fit into the set, but it allows Breloom to punish Tera Grass foes that attempt to circumvent Breloom's Spore and Leech Seed.
Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: While Breloom's typing does have some useful resistances, its low bulk means more favorable resistances granted by Terastallization can be key to setting up.

  • Water: This defensive Tera type allows Breloom to resist Baxcalibur's Icicle Spear and Skeledirge's Torch Song, both of which are threats to Substitute. It also helps against Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu, though note that Choice Specs Chi-Yu can still OHKO with Tera Fire Overheat.

  • Fire: This Tera type allows Breloom to resist Ice- and Fire-type attacks while also providing Breloom with a Fairy-type resistance. With Toxic, Breloom is able to fight back against common Grass-type switch-ins. However, this type has more weaknesses when compared to Water.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 Spe with Impish: This spread allows for maximum physical bulk.

  • 156 HP / 100 Def / 252 Spe with Jolly: This spread allows for maximum Speed and can survive a Choice Band Extreme Speed from Tera Normal Dragonite after Stealth Rock.

  • 204 HP / 164 Def / 140 Spe with Impish: This spread hits a Speed stat of 108 which ties 4 Spe Adamant Baxcalibur. Furthermore, the defensive investment means that after Terastallization, Breloom's Substitute has a high chance of surviving three hits from Baxcalibur's Icicle Spear.

Assault Vest.description:
• With threats such as Chi-Yu, Iron Moth, Volcarona, and Chien-Pao around, Hariyama carves a niche for itself as an Assault Vest user capable of taking them on. Along with its decent bulk, Thick Fat gives it key resistances to Fire- and Ice-type attacks.

  • Bullet Punch: Bullet Punch provides Hariyama with a non-situational priority move that can grab KOs on weakened targets, and, when boosted by Tera Steel, turn the tides against Fairy-type opponents such as Flutter Mane and Mimikyu.

  • Fake Out versus Knock Off: Fake Out gives Hariyama another source of priority, and it can even be used to scout for Covert Cloak users if the opponent doesn't get flinched by it. Knock Off cripples switch-ins by removing their items; however, it can't remove a Booster Energy from an opponent with the Protosynthesis or Quark Drive in Sun or Electric Terrain, respectively, as it's consumed before Hariyama gets to move.

  • Close Combat versus Drain Punch: Close Combat is the stronger move but at the cost of cutting into Hariyama's bulk with each use. Drain Punch can fail to get a 2HKO on specially defensive Ting-Lu more than 90% of the time, but it provides Hariyama with some recovery, bolstering its bulk.

  • Headlong Rush: Headlong Rush drops Hariyama's defenses with each use, but it 2HKOes defensive Toxapex and Gholdengo.

Other Options

  • Ice Punch: Ice Punch gives Hariyama a strong option to hit Dragonite with and can catch it by surprise, considering it isn't pressured to Terastallize against Hariyama's other moves.

  • Heavy Slam: Heavy Slam, coupled with Tera Steel, provides Hariyama with a strong move against lightweight foes such as Flutter Mane, Iron Bundle, Chien-Pao, Mimikyu, and Terastallized Iron Moth and Volcarona that doesn't drop its defenses.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: While Hariyama can work without Terastallization, it can provide an extra kick to its coverage or improve its defensive presence against certain threats.

  • Steel: Steel Tera gives Hariyama STAB on Bullet Punch, a resistance to Fairy, Psychic, and Steel, and an immunity to Poison, greatly improving its matchup against Flutter Mane, Mimikyu, Psychic Chi-Yu, Gholdengo, and Tera Fairy Iron Moth and Volcarona. Thanks to Thick Fat, it can take on non-Choice Specs variants of Chi-Yu even after Terastallizing if it's kept healthy.

  • Fire: Besides the burn immunity, Tera Fire capitalizes on Hariyama's Thick Fat, discouraging threats like Tera Fire Chi-Yu and Choice Band Chien-Pao from using their most powerful moves.

  • Fighting: While Tera Fighting doesn't provide anything defensively for Hariyama, it makes Close Combat a force to be reckoned with.

Guts Attacker.description:
• Thanks to Guts, Hariyama can work as a status absorber and boost its high Attack at the same time, making it a threat to Toxic Spikes-stacking teams.

  • Bullet Punch: Bullet Punch gives Hariyama a consistent priority move and an option to hit Fairy-type foes.

  • Fake Out versus Knock Off: Fake Out is an option to safely activate Flame Orb and Guts, while Knock Off provides utility in removing items from the opponent.

  • Close Combat versus Drain Punch: Guts-boosted Close Combat is a force to be reckoned with, being one of the few moves capable of OHKOing physically defensive Wo-Chien. Drain Punch is weaker, but the recovery can help offset the burn damage.

  • Earthquake versus Headlong Rush: Earthquake complements Hariyama's coverage nicely, hitting Poison-types that resist Close Combat. Headlong Rush is stronger, but comes with the drawbacks of lowering defenses and being a contact move, triggering Rocky Helmet.

Other Options
  • Ice Punch: Ice Punch is Hariyama's best hope of hitting Dragonite, as it doesn't fear much from Hariyama's other moves.
Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Terastallization gives a much appreciated boost to Bullet Punch, but it isn't necessary on every match.

  • Steel: Terastallizing into the Steel-type turns Hariyama's Fairy and Psychic weaknesses into resistances along with giving STAB to Bullet Punch.

Torkoal.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Sun Support.description:
• Torkoal's Drought and disruption support helps set up heavy-hitting Protosynthesis users like Flutter Mane, Roaring Moon, and Gouging Fire.

  • Overheat versus Lava Plume: Overheat with Eject Pack lets Torkoal act as a one-use pivot to safely let good sun teammates in. If running Heat Rock as Torkoal's item instead, Lava Plume is used for the consistent damage and decent burn chance.

  • Solar Beam: Solar Beam takes advantage of Drought to let Torkoal pressure offensive Water-types like Urshifu-R.

  • Gyro Ball: Torkoal makes excellent use of a slow Gyro Ball and can surprise semi-bulky Flutter Mane that try to use Taunt against it with a potential OHKO.

Other Options

  • Clear Smog: Clear Smog allows Torkoal to disrupt opposing setup while still attacking. However, its weak Base Power usually means it does not fix Yawn's problem of being weak against Substitute.

  • Fissure: Torkoal's great defensive profile complements Fissure well, sometimes allowing it to bail itself and its team out of a bad matchup.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Torkoal's high bulk and support focus means that it normally saves Terastallization for its teammates.

  • Grass: Tera Grass flips Torkoal's Water and Ground weaknesses into resistances and is Torkoal's best option for cushioning Hydro Steam from Walking Wake.

  • Fire: Tera Fire can be used in a pinch to give Torkoal more offensive presence with Overheat or Lava Plume.

  • Flying: Tera Flying's Ground immunity is an alternative to Tera Grass that doesn't make it weak to opposing Flying-type moves, making it situationally better against Tera Flying sweepers like Dragonite and Landorus-T.

Items

  • Eject Pack: Eject Pack with Overheat is the preferred choice for pivoting in teammates safely.

  • Heat Rock: Heat Rock gives some extra flexibility with managing sun turns, which can be particularly useful if running multiple sun teammates.

EV Spreads

  • Negative Speed nature and 0 Speed IV: This is the standard for the slowest Eject Pack pivot possible, as well as maximizing Gyro Ball's power.

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpD with Sassy: This avoids an OHKO from Choice Specs Latios from all but the highest damage roll. It also gives Torkoal a decent chance of surviving Modest Ursaluna-B's Earth Power as well as Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Tera Stellar Power Gem.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 SpD with Relaxed: Maximizing physical bulk doesn't help in nearly as much places as special bulk, but one place it does is avoiding a 2HKO from Adamant Dragonite's Earthquake.

Salamence.overview:
With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Specsmence Returns.description:
• Salamence finds a niche for itself among other special attacking Dragon-types due to an incredible ability in Intimidate and a useful typing that provides a handy Fissure immunity.

  • Hurricane versus Air Slash: Hurricane's accuracy may not be very reliable, but the sheer damage output makes it worth it. Air Slash is much weaker than Hurricane, but the more reliable accuracy and flinch chance make it a reasonable alternative. It becomes especially attractive if using Tera Flying.

  • Hydro Pump: If not using Tera Fairy, Hydro Pump is a reasonable choice that deals massive damage to Hippowdon and Fire-types without risking Draco Meteor.

Tera Types

  • Fairy: Not only does Tera Fairy give Salamence an edge against many Dragon-types, but it also pairs extremely well with Intimidate, transforming Salamence into an effective hit-and-run threat.

  • Steel: Tera Steel comes in handy against Dragon- and Fairy-types alike, though the added weaknesses to Ground and Fighting make it less effective at taking physical hits with Intimidate.

  • Flying: Air Slash becomes much easier to justify with Tera Flying, and if you're willing to risk it, Hurricane can be used to become almost impossible to wall with Choice Specs.

  • Fire: Tera Fire doesn't offer as much defensive utility, but the powerful STAB attacks come in handy against Steel-types like Corviknight.

  • Dragon: Tera Dragon trades defensive advantages for an extremely powerful Draco Meteor that catches defensive foes like Dondozo by surprise.

Items

  • Choice Specs: With Salamence already standing at a decent Speed tier, it can get away with Choice Specs, making it extremely difficult to wall outside of using Blissey.

  • Choice Scarf: Choice Scarf trades wallbreaking power for the ability to get the jump on major offensive threats, such as Dragapult, Meowscarada, and Garchomp.

Physically Offensive.description:
• Salamence is somewhat overshadowed by other physical Dragon-types like Roaring Moon and Dragapult, but it has a trick up its claws: Dual Wingbeat, which OHKOes Breloom and Meowscarada through their Focus Sash.

  • Earthquake versus Fire Blast: Earthquake is the best option for hitting Steel-types such as Gholdengo hard, but Fire Blast is Salamence's best shot at 2HKOing Corviknight.

  • Dragon Dance: After a boost, Dual Wingbeat's Focus Sash slaying powers go into overdrive, being able to bust through Flutter Mane, Iron Bundle, and Great Tusk.

Tera Types

  • Flying: With a Flying Tera type, a boosted Dual Wingbeat has a 75% chance to OHKO offensive Mimikyu through its disguise! It also means Salamence no longer needs a boost to OHKO Great Tusk and Flutter Mane.

  • Electric: Tera Electric lets Tera Blast Salamence OHKO Azumarill and Iron Bundle, and potentially 2HKO Dondozo after Stealth Rock damage.

Abilities

  • Intimidate: While Salamence isn't particularly bulky, Intimidate makes setting up far easier when paired with a Flying Tera type that removes Salamence's common weaknesses.

  • Moxie: With Moxie, Salamence has the potential to seriously punish Breloom leads or snowball through teams even without Dragon Dance.

Mixed Attacker.description:
• Salamence's great mixed offenses, Intimidate, and decent Speed give it a niche as a powerful wall breaker.

  • Dual Wingbeat: Dual Wingbeat lets Salamence OHKO Breloom regardless of its Focus Sash, something very few Pokemon can do.

  • Draco Meteor: Draco Meteor deals massive damage to Dondozo, usually doing more than 50% to physically defensive ones.

  • Substitute: Substitute makes the Dondozo match-up even better, making Yawn a non-issue. It's also a good way to scout Terastallization against slower threats.

Tera Types

  • Steel: A Steel Tera type covers a lot of Salamence's weaknesses and makes dealing with Mimikyu, Iron Bundle, and Flutter Mane much easier.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy gives Salamence a great match-up against most Dragon-types, and pairs especially well with Intimidate to turn Salamence into a good hit-and-run attacker.

  • Fire: With a Fire Tera type, Salamence gains a resistance to Fairy-type attacks and deals massive damage to Assault Vest Magnezone.

  • Electric: Tera Electric gives Salamence a great tool against Dondozo with Tera Blast.

  • Dragon: While this Tera type fails to help Salamence much defensively, it makes Draco Meteor 2HKO physically defensive Dondozo.

Bulky Offense.description:
• Good bulk, priority, and Clear Body stopping common Attack debuffers like Flutter Mane and Dragonite from easily setting up gives Metagross a niche over Scizor, despite the irritating weakness to Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball.

  • Psychic Fangs: Despite the iffy coverage, Psychic Fangs is a great STAB attack for having a high chance of OHKOing offensive Urshifu-R and nullifying Aurora Veil from the troublesome Alolan Ninetales.

  • Earthquake: Earthquake provides fantastic coverage against most Steel-types like Gholdengo and Archaludon, although it misses out on Corviknight and Tera Steel Latias.

  • Ice Punch: Ice Punch chills Landorus-T, Dragonite, and Garchomp to the bone, all of which are common Metagross checks otherwise.

  • Knock Off: Knock Off gives Metagross some useful utility, particularly against Porygon2's Eviolite and Assault Vest holders that may switch in like Ursaluna-B. It's also good coverage against Gholdengo.

  • EV Spread: This spread survives Adamant Landorus-T's Earthquake and Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball.

Other Options

  • Alternate Steel-type STAB Moves: Hard Press can be used to OHKO Flutter Mane, but the poor coverage can make it difficult to justify. Meteor Mash doesn't even have to worry about the target being at full HP, and the Attack boost can be dangerous, but the accuracy is an issue.

  • Grass Knot: Grass Knot smacks Ursaluna-B and Dondozo for far more damage than Metagross's physical attacks do, although it's a difficult move to fit in.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Despite Metagross's typing being decent in a vacuum, the Ghost and Dark weaknesses are a big enough problem to often justify Terastallization.

  • Water: Tera Water stops Tera Water Urshifu-R from breaking through Metagross, and it even helps against Choice Specs Chi-Yu if it's locked into a Fire-type attack. It also cushions Metagross from Ogerpon-H's Ivy Cudgel, although Horn Leech will now easily 2HKO.

  • Ground: Tera Ground gets rid of Metagross's troublesome Dark, Ghost, and Ground weaknesses and powers up Earthquake enough to put offensive Archaludon into the KO range of Bullet Punch. Thanks to Metagross's original typing, it can also shock Raging Bolt's attempts to revenge kill.

  • Steel: Buffing up Bullet Punch is helpful for cleaning up weakened teams, with most offensive Flutter Mane in particular now being OHKOed by it. While it doesn't OHKO Chien-Pao, removing the Dark weakness means any that lack an offensive item will fail to 2HKO Tera Steel Metagross with Sucker Punch.

  • Dark: Tera Dark works nicely with Knock Off, OHKOing offensive Gholdengo and giving Metagross important resistances to Ghost and Dark.

Items

  • Assault Vest: Assault Vest is Metagross's best tool for tanking hits, ensuring foes like Flutter Mane and Raging Bolt won't easily cleave through it.

  • Weakness Policy: Weakness Policy is a high-risk, high-reward approach to Metagross, taking advantage of its great physical bulk to turn the tables on common physical attackers and sweep late-game with Bullet Punch, like against Chien-Pao's Sucker Punch and Landorus-T's Earthquake.

Calm Mind.description:
• This set's write-up has not started yet, but here's some basic info to get you started!

  • 252 HP / 236 Def / 20 Spe with Timid: This outspeeds up to Jolly Dragonite, so Encore and Scale Shot won't be as problematic.

  • 252 HP / 244 Def / 4 SpA / 4 SpD / 4 Spe with Bold: This physically bulky spread survives Adamant Focus Sash Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash without Terastallization.

Offensive.description:
• Latios's useful array of resistances, fantastic use of Terastallization, and good offenses make it a strong choice for either a wallbreaker with Choice Specs or revenge killer with Choice Scarf!

  • Luster Purge: Despite its low PP and poor offensive coverage, Luster Purge's high chance of dropping Special Defense still makes it a great wallbreaking tool.

  • Flip Turn: While Flip Turn is weak, Latios forces enough switches to make it a reasonable offensive pivot.

  • Trick: Trick gives Choice Scarf Latios an option to nearly shut down defensive Pokemon like Porygon2 and Ting-Lu and situationally lock offensive foes like Dragonite and Chien-Pao into more manageable moves. Choice Specs Latios isn't quite as effective with this, but its it's still worth considering for crippling defensive foes.

  • Shadow Ball VS. Aura Sphere: Shadow Ball is Latios's best move against Gholdengo and will 2HKO most Flutter Mane sets as well. Aura Sphere leaves Latios reliant on Special Defense drops to deal with Gholdengo, but it is a more direct option against common Tera Steel foes like Dragonite and opposing Latios.

Other Options

  • Calm Mind: While not a defensive set, Calm Mind is a reasonable option for boosting Draco Meteor and Luster Purge to dangerous power levels.

  • Ice Beam: Ice Beam is handy for letting Choice Specs Latios OHKO Assault Vest Landorus-T and deal massive damage to Ting-Lu, though Draco Meteor has more general utility in many cases.

  • Grass Knot: If using Choice Specs, Grass Knot pulls a 2HKO even on Sitrus Berry Ting-Lu, though it being resisted by so many popular Pokemon like Dragonite makes it a risky move to be locked into.

  • Surf: If using Tera Water, Surf is a reasonable coverage option against Steel-types.

  • Thunderbolt: Thunderbolt offers good coverage against most Steel-types, but it is a very risky move to be locked into due to Ground-types like Landorus-T and Excadrill.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Latios's typing isn't amazing defensively, but the very useful resistances to Urshifu-R's and Ogerpon-H's STAB moves mean Terastallization isn't always an upgrade. Still, thanks to Levitate, Latios has some effective defensive options to consider.

  • Steel: Tera Steel has superb synergy with Levitate, making Latios an effective offensive check against common foes like Landorus-T and Dragonite while giving Latios great counterplay against Fairy-types like Flutter Mane defensively and offensively with Tera Blast. This also lets Latios tank a Blood Moon from Ursaluna-B, though the Vacuum Wave weakness can be bothersome afterwards.

  • Fire: Tera Fire also gives Latios a vital resistance to Fairy-types while maintaining the resistances against Ogerpon-H's STAB moves and providing a powerful Tera Blast against most Steel-types.

  • Water: Tera Water covers Latios's issue with Ice-type attacks, which can save it in a pinch against Chien-Pao and Iron Bundle, while still retaining an important resistance to Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes.

  • Electric: Tera Electric removes all of Latios's weaknesses except from Mold Breaker users with Earthquake like Excadrill and provides a useful paralysis immunity against common status spreaders like Porygon2, Flutter Mane, and Serperior.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy is a decent alternative to Tera Steel, giving Latios a good option against Dragon-types while still retaining a Fighting-type resistance.

Items

  • Choice Specs VS. Choice Scarf: Choice Specs is preferred on Latios for the excellent wallbreaking potential. Choice Scarf Latios is a reasonable revenge killer, but it still doesn't deal well with Chien-Pao due to the Sucker Punch weakness, making it more reliant on unique qualities like Trick and Levitate to separate itself from other Choice Scarf revenge killers.

  • Soul Dew: While not as effective at breaking walls as Choice Specs, Soul Dew is a reasonable alternative to still take advantage of Luster Purge's Special Defense drops, and it is a great way of getting around Item Clause issues if Latios still needs a power boost.

  • Focus Sash: Latios isn't frail, but Focus Sash lets it threaten offensive threats it normally has no bussiness with, such as Chien-Pao and Iron Bundle.

Minor Optimizations
  • Neutral Nature: It's best to use a neutral nature with a Timid Mint to ensure that Latios can eat any berry without getting confused after using Trick.

Bulky Stall Breaker.description:
• This set's write-up has not started yet, but here's some basic info to get you started!

  • 204 HP / 124 Def / 180 Spe: This outspeeds Timid Chi-Yu while avoiding a 2HKO from Adamant Choice Scarf Urshifu-R's Tera Water Surging Strikes

  • 252 HP / 84 Def / 4 SpA / 4 SpD / 164 Spe: This slightly slower spread outspeeds Timid Iron Crown, avoids a 2HKO from Adamant Choice Scarf Tera Water Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R, and survives Timid Flutter Mane's Choice Specs Moonblast after Latios has used Calm Mind.

Kyogre.comments:
Rain Teammates

Rain isn't nearly as dominant of a weather as sun, but enough teammates benefit from it that Kyogre doesn't have to use it selfishly

  • Koraidon: Using Koraidon with Kyogre may seem like a total paradox, but together, their partnership ensures that both can comfortably reset their weather cycles.

  • Urshifu-R: Urshifu-R's souped-up Surging Strikes are terrifying, transforming Choice Scarf Urshifu-R into a powerful revenge killer that almost always OHKOes Calyrex-S! Its wallbreaking powers are impressive too, with Choice Band Surging Strikes in the rain 2HKOing even maximum HP Miraidon.

  • Ogerpon-W: Ogerpon-W doesn't share any of Kyogre's weaknesses beyond Freeze-Dry, making it a good bulkier rain beneficiary that still has plenty of power. Ogerpon-W also has Play Rough, ensuring that Koraidon switch-ins are not entirely safe.

  • Archaludon: Electro Shot's lack of a charge turn in the rain makes Archaludon a fearsome bulky sweeper, especially since Stamina and Body Press combine to help against Blissey and Ting-Lu before Archaludon Terastallizes.

Choice Item.description:
• While top Restricted Pokemon like Miraidon and Koraidon are big issues for Kyogre, the sheer damage output under Drizzle still makes it a force to be reckoned with, especially when Water Spout is at full power!

  • Surf versus Origin Pulse: Surf is the most reliable STAB move Kyogre has to offer, but Origin Pulse's higher Base Power lets Kyogre OHKO Calyrex-S after Stealth Rock damage.

  • Ice Beam: Ice Beam is essential for punishing Koraidon switching in, as it otherwise shuts down Kyogre.

  • Thunder: Thunder is Kyogre's best coverage against Water-types, ensuring it isn't walled by foes like Ogerpon-W and opposing Kyogre.

  • Choice Scarf with Timid versus Choice Specs with Modest: Choice Scarf transforms Kyogre into a strong revenge killer and ferocious cleaner in one package, with a Timid nature ensuring that it outspeeds even Calyrex-S. Choice Specs with a Modest nature trades cleaning for being extremely difficult to wall, with even Blissey risking a 2HKO from Water Spout! Ice Beam will also now OHKO offensive Koraidon.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Kyogre already has a fantastic offensive and defensive typing, so Terastallization is more of a bonus than a necessity.

  • Water: Tera Water brings Kyogre's wallbreaking potential to the next level, with even Choice Scarf Kyogre now being able to 2HKO Blissey with Water Spout and Choice Specs Kyogre being able to 2HKO even the bulkiest of Assault Vest Alomomola with Water Spout.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy puts Koraidon in a tough spot, with the rain weakening all of its offensive tools. This is usually best left for bulkier Kyogre sets to take advantage of, though.

Assault Vest.description:
• Kyogre's fantastic special bulk makes it a good choice for an Assault Vest tank.

  • Surf versus Origin Pulse: The reliability of Surf makes it the best choice, but Origin Pulse OHKOing Calyrex-S after Stealth Rock damage does make it a reasonable but riskier alternative.

  • Ice Beam: Ice Beam provides essential coverage against Kyogre's archnemesis, Koraidon! It's also key for taking on other Dragon-types such as Dragonite and Miraidon.

  • Thunder: Thunder lets Kyogre zap opposing Water-types such as Tera Water Calyrex-I and opposing Kyogre. Plus, this set's good bulk gives Kyogre many chances to benefit from the 30% paralysis chance.

  • Tera Blast Fairy versus Water Spout: If Kyogre is using Tera Fairy, Tera Blast lets it ruin Koraidon, which alone is worth a moveslot! However, if it's using Tera Water or alternate gameplans against Koraidon, Water Spout deals absurd damage to anything slower than Kyogre.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Water is a fantastic typing that Kyogre often doesn't want to lose, but Terastallization can be key for dealing with Koraidon and Miraidon.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy is the best defensive option for Kyogre, letting it resist all of Koraidon's common attacks thanks to rain support and ruining Miraidon's attempts at checking it.

  • Electric: Tera Electric lets Kyogre tank Miradon's Electro Drift, in addition to ensuring paralysis support from the likes of Flutter Mane and Archaludon fails. Just note that most Ho-Oh run Earthquake, which means Tera Electric isn't a perfect response to its Brave Bird.

  • Water: This Kyogre is usually best off with defensive Tera types, but Tera Water's absurd damage output lets Water Spout 2HKO even Blissey, making it a better option against stall teams.

Stealth Rock Support.description:
• Empoleon's fantastic typing and good movepool make it a great choice for a specially defensive Stealth Rock setter.

  • Yawn versus Roar: Yawn has fantastic synergy with Stealth Rock, forcing foes to either take damage or be put to Sleep. Roar is more reliant on Stealth Rock being set up first, but it isn't as vulnerable to common Substitute foes like Iron Bundle.

  • Flash Cannon versus Ice Beam: Flash Cannon is the preferred STAB move for dealing good damage to Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle. Ice Beam is still worth considering for dealing far more damage to Landorus-T, Garchomp, and Gliscor though.

  • Flip Turn versus Surf: Flip Turn makes Empoleon a good pivot despite its low damage output, though Surf is still a reasonable alternative for doing good damage against Ground-types.

  • Roost: Despite Empoleon's good defensive profile, Roost can be hard to fit in since it means either giving up support or coverage. Still, it does make Empoleon a better check with Flutter Mane when paired with Flash Cannon.

  • Calm versus Sassy: In addition to making Flip Turn stronger, Sassy's lower Speed can help Empoleon pivot out last. However, Sassy forces a Speed tie with 4 Speed EV Ursaluna-B unless 20 Speed EVs are used. If the power drop isn't an issue, a Calm nature with a Speed IV of 17 can be used to reach the same Speed.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Empoleon's superb typing means Terastallization should only be used to flip certain troublesome match-ups.

  • Flying: Tera Flying floats above common Ground-types such as Landorus-T, Garchomp, and Ursaluna-B, and it additionally grants an important Fighting-type resistance.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy is a good response against Fighting-types like Urshifu while making Electric-types such as Zapdos and Vikavolt less problematic.

  • Grass: In addition to a Ground-type resistance (though this can be risky against Landorus-T), Tera Grass saves Empoleon from Breloom's Spore.

  • Bug: Bug isn't normally a great defensive type, but the resistances to Fighting and Ground, combined with not being weak to Electric, makes it a viable choice on Empoleon.

Items

  • Leftovers: Leftovers is the most reliable healing item, especially when getting free turns with Yawn.

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry's quick burst of recovery is a decent alternative to Leftovers. Make sure to use 244 HP EVs with it so it activates after getting hit by Ting-Lu's Ruination.

  • Air Balloon: Empoleon is an especially effective user of Air Balloon with its offensive advantages against Ground-types, doing especially well against Gliscor thanks to Empoleon's Toxic immunity.

Assault Vest.description:
• Empoleon's vital advantages against Fairy-types and good Special Attack make it a fantastic Assault Vest tank.

  • Surf: Surf is a reliable secondary STAB move that's particularly good against Ursaluna-B.

  • Ice Beam versus Grass Knot: Ice Beam has a multitude of high value targets, such as Dragonite, Garchomp, Landorus-T, and Gliscor. Grass Knot's coverage is less impressive, but it prevents Empoleon from being totally walled by bulky Water-types like Dondozo and Milotic.

  • Flip Turn: Flip Turn will require giving up coverage or priority, but Empoleon is a bulky enough pivot to justify it.

  • Vacuum Wave: While not being a strong priority move, Vacuum Wave is great for picking off weakened threats, especially Chien-Pao.

  • Competitive versus Torrent: Competitive is the most reliable option for checking Flutter Mane, punishing Charm variants and ensuring that Special Attack drops from Moonblast turn into an advantage. Torrent can make some sense with Tera Water though, making Surf very difficult to switch into.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Empoleon relies on its excellent typing to be a great Assault Vest tank, but its lack of recovery means Terastallazation can still be important for flipping certain match-ups.

  • Water: Tera Water vastly improves Empoleon's match-up against common Ground-types like Ursaluna-B and Landorus-T, removing the Earthquake / Earth Power weakness and having a powerful Surf.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy is a great response against Fighting-types like Urshifu and also lets Empoleon tank Electric-types like Zapdos and Vikavolt more reliably.

  • Flying: Tera Flying's Ground-type immunity is perfect for saving it from sweepers like Garchomp and Landorus-T, and it additionally removes grievances with Dondozo's Fissure.

  • Grass: Tera Grass protects Empoleon from Breloom's Spore and makes Grass Knot more desirable.

Floatzel.overview:
With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Swift Weasel.description:
• Wave Crash: This is your main offensive option. When further boosted by rain, Tera Water, and Choice Band, it becomes one of the most powerful physical moves in the game, 2HKOing the likes of Bold Amoonguss and OHKOing maximum Defense Corviknight. Mystic Water is an option for flexibility but sacrifices the listed KOs.

  • Liquidation versus Waterfall: Liquidation is a secondary option, and it's preferred when facing frailer offensive teams due to the significant recoil drawback of Wave Crash. However, Waterfall is worth considering for its possible flinch chance.

  • Aqua Jet: Aqua Jet allows Floatzel to maintain offensive presence outside of rain, as well as being a great response to opposing priority moves, such as Kingambit's Sucker Punch.

  • Rain Setter: Pelipper's rain is mandatory for both Swift Swim and maximum damage output.

Tera Types

  • Water: Tera Water massively bolters Floatzel's damage output, and the weasel simply doesn't have the bulk needed for more defensive options.

EV Spreads

  • 60 HP / 252 Atk / 196 Spe:196 Speed EVs are used to outspeed the entire tier in rain, including Choice Scarf Dragpault.

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe: Maximum Speed investment outspeeds Hydreigon and Mimikyu outside of rain, in addition to tying with Salamence, at the cost of having less buffer HP for Wave Crash recoil.

Garchomp.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Sweeper.description:
• Thanks to its good bulk, unique Speed tier, and excellent use of Terastallization, Garchomp is a solid offensive threat.

  • Scale Shot: While the Defense drop is troublesome against priority users like Chien-Pao, the Speed boost makes Garchomp far more difficult to revenge kill overall.

  • Iron Head: While Iron Head only deals 10 extra base power of damage against Fairy-types, it works great with Tera Steel and lets Garchomp get past Tera Fairy Levitate Pokemon like Latias.

  • Substitute: Both of Garchomp's STAB attacks are vulnerable to common Tera types; Substitute not only gives it a way to scout for these, but makes setting up on Garganacl and bulky status users much easier.

Other Options

  • Stealth Rock: Despite the offensive nature of this set, Garchomp is still a great setter of Stealth Rock, especially when using Focus Sash.

  • Fire Fang: If your team is extremely weak against Tera Steel Latias or the rare Corviknight or Skarmory, Fire Fang is the only way past them without Terastallization.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium / Low: While Garchomp isn't slow, it's typing leaves it very vulnerable to major speedy threats like Flutter Mane, Chien-Pao, and Iron Bundle, which is an issue Terastallization can flip on its head. If using Focus Sash, Terastallization becomes far less needed.

  • Steel: A Steel Tera type has excellent synergy with Garchomp's typing, letting it more effectively tackle faster Dragon-types, Flutter Mane, Iron Bundle, Mimikyu, and Normal-type priority from Dragonite, Entei, and Ogerpon-H.

  • Fire: While the Stealth Rock weakness is unfortunate against bulkier teams, a Fire Tera type still gives out a vital Fairy and Ice resistance, and gives a powerful Tera Blast against levitating Tera Steel Pokemon like Latias.

  • Fairy: Fairy is an even stronger option against Dragon-types, and gives Garchomp a better matchup against Urshifu-S.

  • Water: Tera Water not only gives that sweet Ice resistance to Garchomp, but it makes Choice Scarf Urshifu-R regret ever using Surging Strikes thanks to Rough Skin!

Items

  • Loaded Dice: Loaded Dice keeps Scale Shot at its most reliable damage output, making it the ideal tool for sweeping.

  • Focus Sash: Surviving shocking attacks with Focus Sash gives Garchomp new sweeping and revenge killing potential, and makes it a reliable setter of Stealth Rock if needed.

  • Life Orb: If used with Tera Steel and Iron Head, Life Orb's damage boost can potentially push Garchomp past the dreaded Charm Flutter Mane with a 2HKO even after the Attack drop!

  • Lum Berry: Lum Berry lets Garchomp deal with major Yawn users more easily, such as Swampert and Hippowdon.

Entry Hazard Setter.description:
• While Garchomp is known for its offensive prowess, its access to incredible tools like Rough Skin, Dragon Tail, and a good Speed stat make it a viable alternative to Archaludon and Ting-Lu for setting entry hazards and phazing.

  • Dragon Tail: Dragon Tail has marvelous synergy with setting up hazards, making it the prime choice for a Dragon-type STAB despite the lowered priority.

  • Rock Tomb: Garchomp's solid speed tier means it can fully take advantage of the Speed drops Rock Tomb provides itself, not just as support for teammates.

  • Substitute: Substitute severely punishes foes that rely on Yawn like Hippowdon and Swampert.

  • Iron Head: Beyond pairing well with Tera Steel, Iron Head prevents Garchomp from being walled by Tera Fairy Latios and Latias.

  • Spikes: thanks to its Speed and Dragon Tail, Garchomp is arguably one of the few viable Spikes setters in the metagame! Just make sure using it is worth the cost of losing coverage for the team.

Other Options
  • Bulldoze: Bulldoze is a good alternative speed control option over Rock Tomb for its higher reliability and STAB, but it can make Garchomp rather passive.
Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: This Garchomp's bulk means it can set up hazards against a wide variety of foes, but Terastallization will be needed to take on some major physical threats, such as Chien-Pao, Urshifu formes, and

  • Water: Tera Water gives Garchomp a vital Ice and Steel resistance without making it weak to Fighting, making it a fantastic option against Chien-Pao and Urshifu-R.

  • Fairy: Fairy Tera type provides Garchomp with an immunity to Dragon-type attacks, making Dragonite less of an awkward guessing game and a solid check to Urshifu-S.

  • Steel: Terastallizing into a Steel-type makes Garchomp resist Dragon-, Ice- and Fairy-type attacks, making it a safer lead against opposing Dragon-type leads and Iron Bundle, at the cost of being vulnerable to Ursaluna-B and Urshifu formes.

EV spreads

  • 252 HP / 244 Def / 12 Spe with Impish: This simple looking EV spread avoids a 2HKO from Life Orb Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash when Garchomp has Terastallized, while outspeeding Adamant Breloom and the rare Timid Magnezone.

  • 252 HP / 116 Def / 140 Spe with Jolly: While this spread doesn't take physical hits as well, it lets Garchomp outspeed Modest Chi-Yu and Adamant Urshifu formes.

Items

  • Rocky Helmet: Combined with Rough Skin, Rocky Helmet severely punishes contact moves, with Choice Scarf Urshifu-R in particular being a big target.

  • Sitrus Berry: This prevents Tera Water Choice Scarf Urshifu-R from 2HKOing Impish Garchomp.

  • Red Card: With Red Card, Garchomp will be able to phaze foes Terastallizing into a Fairy type once, like Archaludon.

All-Out Attacker.description:
• Garchomp's fantastic Speed tier and power means it doesn't have to set up to be dangerous.

  • Scale Shot: Choice Band appreciates the Speed boost, giving Garchomp another option for late-game cleaning. Even on Choice Scarf sets, Scale Shot is a less risky Dragon-type attack over Outrage, and outspeeding extremely fast threats like Booster Energy Iron Bundle is welcome.

  • Iron Head: With Tera Steel, Iron Head lets Choice Band Garchomp 2HKO Charm Flutter Mane, who can otherwise edge out a victory with Pain Split and repeated Attack drops.

  • Stone Edge versus Rock Tomb: Rock Tomb is fairly weak, but the speed control can be very useful on Choice Scarf variants if sacrificing Garchomp. Stone Edge deals massive damage to common Tera Flying Pokemon such as Gholdengo, and it prevents it from being walled by Tera Fairy Levitate Pokemon like Latias.

Other Options
  • Fire Fang While weak, this is Garchomp's best option against Corviknight and Tera Steel Latiias when not Tera Fire.
Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium / Low: When using the slower Choice Band variants, Terastallization becomes important for avoiding revenge kills. If using Choice Scarf Garchomp, it's fully capable of revenge killing threats without needing Terastallization, only worrying about Ice Shard from Chien-Pao and Baxcalibur.

  • Steel: Tera Steel is a fantastic defensive Tera Type for Garchomp with key resistances to Ice and Fairy, and it makes Iron Head a much more powerful option.

  • Fire: When combined with Tera Blast, Tera Fire lets even Choice Scarf Garchomp 2HKO Tera Steel Latias. The Fairy and Ice resistance is also very helpful.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy goes all in on the Dragon immunity, no longer being worried about common Fire and Ground coverage from other Dragon-types like Dragonite.

  • Ground: The incredible power boost Earthquake gets from Tera Ground is worth considering, with Choice Band possibly 2HKOing physically defensive Porygon2 and Dondozo with it.

Items

  • Choice Band: Choice Band trades revenge killing for wallbreaking, letting Garchomp deal massive damage to Porygon2 and Ursaluna-B with Outrage.

  • Choice Scarf: With Choice Scarf, Garchomp is able to revenge kill several other major Choice Scarf users, such as Gholdengo, Landorus-T, and Chi-Yu.

Hippowdon.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Stealth Rock Support.description:
• Hippowdon remains a solid Stealth Rock setter, distinguishing itself from Ting-Lu with access to Yawn and consistent recovery.

  • Sand Stream: The passive damage caused from Sandstorm is excellent for breaking Focus Sashes and Multiscale on Dragonite, but be careful as the same applies to your own team if Hippowdon leaves the field prematurely.

  • Whirlwind: This is a more direct phazing option than Yawn, and it is helpful against dangerous setup sweepers that may run Lum Berry, such as Dragonite and Garchomp.

  • Slack Off: Slack Off greatly increases Hippowdon’s longevity and is useful if you need it to repeatedly switch into physical attackers like Dragonite, but Hippowdon is often more focused on support than walling, so it isn’t always worth sacrificing a moveslot.

Other Options

  • Rock Tomb: Rock Tomb not only provides helpful speed control, but also pops Air Balloon on foes Hippowdon would otherwise struggle with, such as Gholdengo.

  • Fissure: Hippowdon isn't quite as good at using Fissure as Dondozo and Garganacl, and it can be difficult to fit in, but it does severely punish passive play.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Hippowdon’s typing and immense bulk already make it very difficult to dislodge, but Tera is an option if needing to cushion off some of the most powerful sweepers the meta has on offer.

  • Steel: Tera Steel gives excellent defensive typing against Flutter Mane, Archaludon, and Latios, as well as allowing specially defensive Hippowdon to avoid a 2HKO from Iron Bundle that lack Choice Specs. It’s also notable for letting Hippowdon retain immunity to its own Sandstorm chip.

  • Water: Tera Water improves the lead matchup with Chien-Pao and Urshifu-R, and overall is a strong defensive type that still takes good advantage of Hippowdon’s imposing bulk.

Items

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry’s burst recovery is what allows properly invested Hippowdon to avoid 2HKO’s from some of the meta’s strongest attackers.

  • Leftovers: If Hippowdon is able to execute an extended Yawn loop, Leftovers passive recovery is a great boon. Such loops can often force the opponent to sacrifice something to sleep to prevent Hippowdon from healing up to full.

  • Rocky Helmet: While Hippowdon’s support focus makes this a less common item choice, Slack Off combined with smart usage of Terastallization can make this item work to surprising effect.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpD with Careful: Patching up Hippowdon's weaker Special Defense is extremely useful against special attackers. With this maximized spread, Hippowdon has a 6.3% chance of surviving Timid Gholdengo's +2 Make It Rain, always survives Modest Chi-Yu’s unboosted Overheat, and avoids the 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane’s Moonblast if using Sitrus Berry.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 SpD with Impish: A physically defensive spread means not even Choice Band Dragonite’s Outrage will be able to 2HKO Sitrus Berry Hippowdon.

Magnezone.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out this page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Pivot.description:
• Magnezone stands out as one of the best pivots in the metagame, having the tools to deal with dangerous threats such as Iron Bundle, Flutter Mane, Dondozo, and Corviknight.

  • Mirror Coat: If using Sturdy, Mirror Coat can get a shocking KO on powerful Special Attackers that Magnezone struggles to KO, such as Chi-Yu and Iron Moth.

  • Steel Beam: Steel Beam is insanely powerful if sacrificing Magnezone's life is worth it.

Tera Types

  • Water: Offensively, Water Tera Blast nails Ground-types such as Ting-Lu and Hippowdon. It also gives Magnezone a much-appreciated Fire resistance for Pokemon like Chi-Yu, Iron Moth, Skeledirge, and Volcarona, and lets Magnezone take on Iron Bundle's Hydro Pump.

  • Flying: Flying has wonderful defensive synergy with Magnezone, reversing its Ground and Fighting weaknesses, and lets Tera Blast hit Grass-types harder.

  • Fairy: A Fairy-type Tera Blast is very useful against common Dragon-types, most notably Garchomp and Roaring Moon, and hitting bulky Dark-types such as Ting-Lu, Wo-Chien, and Umbreon hard.

  • Fighting: Gaining a resistance to Dark allows Magnezone to surprise and defeat Kingambit, Roaring Moon, and Hydreigon, in addition to dealing plenty of damage to Ting-Lu.

  • Grass: Grass has excellent defensive and offense synergy with Magnezone, especially through its utility against Ground-type attackers and Spore immunity. Most notably, Tera Blast Grass can OHKO max SpD Hippowdon with Choice Specs.

  • Steel: The boost from Tera Steel makes Steel Beam absurdly powerful, with Analytic letting Choice Specs Magnezone OHKO even offensive Multiscale Dragonite!

  • Ground: Tera Ground helps against opposing Magnezone, OHKOs Iron Moth, and deals good damage against Gholdengo and Kingambit.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 SpA / 4 Spe with Modest: Magnezone's excellent typing means investing in bulk is a great idea. However, note that some important targets such as Corviknight and Skeledirge are a tad faster than it.

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Calm: With maximum Special Defense investment and Assault Vest, Magnezone becomes a good soft check against Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle, and one of the best pivots in the metagame.

  • 252 HP / 76 SpA / 180 Spe with Modest: While this spread sacrifices a large amount of power, in exchange it outspeeds Adamant maximum Speed Kingambit, who can threaten to deal massive damage otherwise.

  • 252 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Modest: If using Sturdy, Magnezone can run maximum Speed to outspeed unexpected foes, such as Specially Defensive Annihilape.

Items

  • Assault Vest: The increase in special bulk helps Magnezone against the myriad of Choice item special attacking Dragon-types, like Hydreigon and Dragapult. If using Calm, Magnezone can even take on Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle!

  • Choice Specs: Choice Specs gives Magnezone a devastating amount of power, with even Clodsire having trouble handling it.

  • Air Balloon: The temporary Ground-type immunity helps Magnezone against foes like Garchomp and Dragonite without Terastallizing.

Abilities

  • Analytic: A Magnezone boosted by both Choice Specs and Analytic is incredibly hard to switch into, making it easier for Magnezone to generate momentum.

  • Sturdy: With Sturdy's guaranteed survivability and Magnezone's high damage output, Magnezone will very likely take down at least one Pokemon per game. Sturdy also helps Magnezone play around Dondozo, as it can safely come in on Fissure and use Volt Switch against it, which renders Yawn moot. However, if Magnezone switches into a Yawn and not Fissure, it should be noted that Dondozo often runs Protect to block Volt Switch and ensure Magnezone falls asleep.

Gliscor.overview: This Pokemon has been updated for the return of the Regulation G format and its powerful restricted threats!
Gliscor.comments:
Common Teammates

  • Dondozo: Tera Fairy Gliscor and Dondozo make an incredible defensive core against two of the metagame's strongest Choice Band attackers: Koraidon and Urshifu-R.

  • Koraidon: Gliscor has a much easier time playing next to Koraidon's sunny weather, as the weather effect is a huge deterrent to one of Gliscor's biggest checks in Urshifu-R.

  • Eternatus: Eternatus is a great defensive switch for Gliscor's Urshifu-R problem. On the other hand, Earthquake Gliscor can pressure Steel-types to Terastallize into something that Eternatus can more easily deal with. Finally, Tera Fairy Eternatus can pair with Gliscor to make a good defensive core against Miraidon.

Speed EV Benchmarks

  • 124 or 36+ Spe: This outspeeds uninvested Ogerpon formes.

  • 140 or 44+ Spe: This outspeeds Adamant Dragonite.

  • 188 or 92+ Spe: This outspeeds Modest Glimmora.

  • 172+ Spe: This outspeeds Adamant Urshifu formes.

  • 188+ Spe: This outspeeds Timid Glimmora.

  • 196+ Spe: This outspeeds Modest Chi-Yu.

  • 228+ Spe: This outspeeds Jolly Landorus-T.

Glis.description:
• With its great typing and incredible longevity thanks to Poison Heal, Gliscor is a frustratingly potent defensive threat that may be the single largest cause of matches being determined by the match timer running out!

  • Toxic: Gliscor is one of few Pokemon to be given Toxic via TM, allowing it to put opposing walls on a timer while it stays healthy itself.

  • Protect + Substitute: Stalling turns with Protect + Substitute allows Gliscor to keep itself healthy despite not having access to a manual healing move. This also pairs well with Toxic to keep Gliscor safe as the opponent succumbs to poison.

  • Earthquake: Earthquake allows Gliscor to threaten Steel- and Poison-types that are otherwise immune to its Toxic-stalling antics.

Other Options

  • Knock Off: Knock Off’s item removal can allow Gliscor to be more of a team player, removing items such as Leftovers and Rocky Helmet to assist a teammate’s sweep.

  • Baton Pass: Gliscor’s immense longevity makes it particularly well suited to passing Substitutes, bolstering its team’s defense while giving them turns to set up.

EV Spreads

  • 228 HP / 36 Def / 244 SpD with Impish: The physical bulk on this set allows Gliscor to live Jolly Choice Band Koraidon's Outrage on all but the highest damage roll. The special bulk gives Gliscor roughtly a 19% chance to place a Substitute after getting hit with Timid Calyrex-S's Astral Barrage.

  • 228 HP / 4 Atk / 28 Def / 20 SpD / 228 Spe With with Jolly: The Speed investment allows Gliscor to outspeed major foes like Jolly Landorus-T and Adamant Urshifu-R, making it more of a nuisance against faster-paced teams at the cost of some survivability. Enough special bulk is maintained to avoid the OHKO from Timid Calyrex-S's Astral Barrage. The leftover EVs are mostly used for some extra physical bulk, but can be reallocated to maximize Speed if desired.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Gliscor's natural immunities to troublesome attacks like Electro Drift, Volt Switch, and Fissure are huge benefits, but its vulnerability to popular multi-hit and sound-based attacks means Terastallization has strong defensive utility.

  • Steel: Tera Steel allows Gliscor to resist Ice-, Fairy-, and Dragon-type moves, giving it increased survivability against a wider array of threats, with the resistance against the Substitute-ignoring Hyper Voice from Ursaluna-B being a big boon. However, Steel leaves it more vulnerable to Fighting-types like Urshifu-S and Fire-types like Ogerpon-H. When using Tera Steel, make sure not to Terastallize on the first turn, or else Toxic Orb will fail!

  • Water: Tera Water gives Gliscor crucial Ice- and Water-type resistances, allowing it to get emergency Toxics off against threats like Urshifu-R and Primarina, both of whom can ruin Substitute with Surging Strikes and Sparkling Aria respectively. It's also a great response against Chien-Pao, especially since Substitute and Protect scout against Electric Tera Blast.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy completely negates Dragon-type attacks, making it impossible for Scale Shot and Outrage to overwhelm Gliscor. Tera Fairy also retains Gliscor's Fighting-type resistance, which can be important for bulky cores trying to defend against Choice Band users like Koraidon and Urshifu-R.

  • Dark: Tera Dark's Ghost-type resistance and Psychic-type immunity can make handling Calyrex-S more feasible. Neutralizing Psychic Noise is particularly notable for keeping Poison Heal working.

Gallade.overview:
This Pokemon has been updated to reflect Regulation H, that lasts until January 5h, 2025. After this, Regulation G will return.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

All-out Attacker.description:
• With its wide range of moveset options and its offense-boosting ability Sharpness, Gallade is excellent at dueling a wide variety of threats. Especially notable is Scared Sword, letting Gallade ignore Stamina Archaludon's accumulated boosts.

  • Night Slash versus Knock Off: Night Slash's consistent power is best for pure offense, potentially 2HKOing targets like Bold Gholdengo, assuming they can't stall with Recover and Rocky Helmet. If more utility is desired, Knock Off can be used for removing opposing items.

  • Shadow Sneak: Shadow Sneak Gallade's most consistent as a priority move, dealing good damage to targets like Gholdengo and Mimikyu.

  • Leaf Blade: Leaf Blade OHKOes Primarina and is Gallade's best hope of muscling past Dondozo.

  • Triple Axel: Though it suffers from some reliability issues, Triple Axel makes Dragonite rue the day it didn't Terastallize against Gallade!

Other Options

  • Aqua Cutter: Aqua Cutter benefits from Sharpness, but it doesn't add a lot of extra coverage.

  • Feint: Feint lets Gallade pick off weakened Dragonite before they can launch Extreme Speed, but otherwise hitting Gholdengo with Shadow Sneak is usually more useful.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Gallade uses Focus Sash or Assault Vest as its main tool for cushioning a big hit and has great natural coverage. Therefore, Tera is reserved mostly for emergency situations.

  • Fire: Beyond offering a useful Fairy-type resistance, Tera Fire blocks Volcarona from burning Gallade.

  • Dark: Tera Dark not only boosts Night Slash and Knock Off, but provides a key Ghost-type resistance against Gholdengo.

  • Steel: Tera Steel flips Gallade's weakness to Fairy-type attacks to a resistance. The Ice resistance can also be used in a pinch to keep Baxcalibur's Icicle Spear from OHKOing Gallade through Focus Sash.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost's immunity to Normal- and Fighting-type moves can thwart revenge kill attempts from Mach Punch users and Extreme Speed Dragonite, giving Gallade an opportunity to break Multiscale on the latter.

Items

  • Assault Vest: Gallade has enough Special Defense to make good use of Assault Vest, which lets it survive Tera Normal Ursaluna-B. Compared to Focus Sash, Assault Vest isn't rendered useless by Stealth Rock chip, making Gallade a safer mid- or late-game option.

  • Focus Sash: With Focus Sash, Gallade duels opposing Focus Sash users with its hard-hitting STAB attacks and priority moves, letting it focus on Speed investment.

  • Scope Lens: While Scope Lens is risky due to Gallade's average bulk and Speed, it pairs well with the increased critical hit ratio many of Gallade's attacks have.

EV Spreads

  • 140 HP / 244 Atk / 4 Def / 4 SpD / 116 Spe with Adamant: This spread is to be used with Assault Vest, surviving Silk Scarf Tera Normal Ursaluna-B's Blood Moon and Vacuum Wave together, while outspeeding even Timid Ursaluna-B and Jolly Ursaluna.

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe with Adamant or Jolly: A maximum offense spread is standard for Focus Sash and Speed ties with offensive Adamant Dragonite. Jolly can be used to get the jump on Modest Archaludon, especially if using Shadow Sneak to stop Sturdy variants from activating Custap Berry in time.

  • 236 HP / 244 Atk / 28 SpD with Adamant: Sacrificing Speed for bulk lets Assault Vest Gallade survive Life Orb Tera Normal Ursaluna-B's Blood Moon followed by Vacuum Wave.

Choice Scarf.description:
• With Choice Scarf, Gallade is a decent anti-lead against several early-game setups and an unexpected revenge killer.

  • Knock Off versus Night Slash: Knock Off remains a strong disruption move with or without Trick, provided you exercise caution if you've already used Trick. Night Slash has more offensive presence than Knock Off and is a good choice if you really need to hit Gholdengo with consistent damage.

  • Triple Axel versus Leaf Blade: Triple Axel makes Gallade a surprising revenge killer against Garchomp and severely punishes Dragonite that don't Terastallize. Leaf Blade helps against more defensive foes, being a great coverage option for slashing through Primarina and being your best move against Dondozo.

  • Trick: Trick with Choice Scarf lets Gallade permanently cripple setup Pokemon like Annihilape and Garganacl.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Choice Scarf Gallade normally isn't a strong user of Tera. It is best used in situations where Gallade already has momentum and needs to preserve it.

  • Fire: Tera Fire makes facing down Volcarona far less risky thanks to the burn immunity, as well as providing a useful Fairy-type resistance.

  • Steel: Tera Steel provides a welcome resistance to Fairy-type attacks and Dragonite's Extreme Speed.

  • Dark: Tera Dark stops Choice Scarf Gholdengo from revenge killing with Shadow Ball, while boosting Night Slash and Knock Off

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost grants immunity to Extreme Speed and Mach Punch, letting Gallade keep its speed advantage against Dragonite and Breloom even when its low on health.

  • Grass: Tera Grass can surprise Spore users like Breloom, letting Gallade score an easy KO or cripple them with Trick. Leaf Blade also becomes a 2HKO against Dondozo.

Rotom-Heat.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out this page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Choice Attacker.description:
• Rotom-H sets itself apart from other Fire-types, with its Ground immunity and Volt Switch pivoting. When compared to Rotom-W, it is also much more effective at pressuring Flutter Mane, Gholdengo and Wo-Chien.

  • Trick: Trick gives Rotom-H an excellent tool against defensive foes, such as Dondozo and Skeledirge.

  • Using a neutral nature with a Timid mint: Make sure to get a Rotom-H with a neutral nature and then use a Timid Mint on it. This way, it can't be confused by any Berries given with Trick.

Other Options
  • Discharge: While weaker than Thunderbolt, the 30% paralysis chance can be devastating for some of Rotom-H's more troublesome matchups, such as Chi-Yu. Do note though that Choice Scarf Rotom-H will have a much harder time 2HKOing Assault Vest Azumarill and certain variants of Dondozo.
Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low / Medium: If not running Tera Blast, Rotom-H normally wants to keep its unique typing for defensive purposes, allowing it to switch into several key threats. The most common exception to this is sets that run Tera Fairy for Dragon-type matchups.

  • Electric: Electric is an easy Tera type to recommend, as it increases damage output and removes all of Rotom-H's weaknesses.

  • Fairy: A Fairy Tera typing with Tera Blast makes Rotom-H much better equipped to handle normally problematic Dragon-types, such as Garchomp, Roaring Moon, and Dragapult.

  • Fire: When paired with Tera Blast, Rotom-H now has a much more reliable Fire-type STAB move than Overheat, but at the cost of retaining all of its normal weaknesses.

Items

  • Choice Scarf: Choice Scarf lets Rotom-H outspeed normally problematic threats such as Iron Bundle.

  • Choice Specs: The extra power makes Rotom-H far more difficult to wall, with defensive Skeledirge getting 2HKOed by Thunderbolt.

Defensive Pivot.description:
• Rotom-W's defensive set might be the more known one, but Rotom-H's key resistances to Fairy-type attacks and U-turn, plus its ability to put serious pressure on Gholdengo, make it a good alternative as a bulky pivot.

  • Foul Play: Foul Play is a must-have, as otherwise, Rotom-H is extremely passive against Baxcalibur, which is likely to switch in for an Attack boost from Overheat.

  • Will-O-Wisp versus Thunder Wave: Will-O-Wisp is the preferred status move, potentially shutting down major physical threats such as Dragonite, Mimikyu, and Iron Hands. Thunder Wave is still a reasonable choice, though, stopping special attackers such as Flutter Mane and Iron Moth in their tracks.

  • Trick and Flame Orb: This one-use method of burning may seem silly, but taking away important items can be devastating against certain Pokemon such as Ting-Lu, and Rotom-H can use this to get rid of troublesome Choice items if it's taken a Trick as well. Note that Rotom-H will burn itself if it Terastallizes while holding Flame Orb, which is generally not good outside of blocking sleep or Toxic poison.

  • Using a Neutral Nature with a Bold Mint: If using Trick, it's best to run a neutral nature such as Serious and change the stat boosts with a Bold Mint. This way, Rotom-H won't get confused by any Berry it receives.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Rotom-H's defensive typing is very valuable, so Tera is normally reserved for very specific situations.

  • Steel: Tera Steel with Levitate is a sublime defensive typing, letting Rotom-H better handle huge threats like Dragonite, Garchomp, and Baxcalibur.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy is an alternative option to soak up Dragon-type attacks, and it also gives Rotom-H a better matchup against Great Tusk and Iron Hands.

  • Ghost: While this unfortunately makes Gholdengo a much bigger issue, Tera Ghost is still worth considering for making Rotom-H immune to Dragonite's Extreme Speed and Iron Valiant's Close Combat. It also lets Rotom-H switch out of trapping moves without using Volt Switch.

Items

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry is Rotom-H's ticket to staying around the longest, usually avoiding 2HKOs from powerful unboosted attacks such as Dragonite's Outrage and Iron Valiant's Close Combat.

  • Rocky Helmet: Rotom-H's typing makes it a good user of Rocky Helmet, passively punishing physical Fairy-types such as Mimikyu and Iron Valiant and making it a good response to expected uses of U-turn.

Rotom-Wash.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out this page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Offensive.description:
• Rotom-W's Speed access to Volt Switch and great typing make it an excellent pivot and revenge killer.

  • Trick and Neutral Natures: If using a Choice item, Trick is seriously worth considering for its ability to cripple defensive Pokemon such as Garganacl and Dondozo. Make sure Rotom-W is a neutral nature that has had a Timid Mint used on it. This way, Rotom-W can eat any Berry without getting confused.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Rotom-W's excellent typing means its fully functional without Terastallizing, but thanks to Levitate, it's still a powerful user of it.

  • Fairy: When combined with Tera Blast, a Fairy Tera type lets Rotom-W take on Chien-Pao Dragon-types such as Dragapult and Roaring Moon far more effectively.

  • Electric: Not only does the damage boost from Tera Electric come in handy, but it also removes any weaknesses Rotom-W has.

  • Ghost: Terastallizing back to its Ghost-type roots gives Rotom-W a vast array of immunities, helping against Dragonite and Great Tusk in particular. It also makes Shadow Ball viable for picking off Ghost-types with Choice Scarf.

Items

  • Choice Specs: Choice Specs tends to be safer to Trick than Choice Scarf, and it gives a big power boost.

  • Choice Scarf: Choice Scarf lets Rotom-W outspeed major threats such as Iron Bundle, Chi-Yu, and Chien-Pao.

  • Assault Vest: Increasing Rotom-W's special bulk gives it a far better matchup against foes like Flutter Mane, Chi-Yu, Iron Bundle, and Gholdengo.

EV Spreads
