  • 252 HP / 252 SpA / 4 SpD with Modest: This spread sacrifices Rotom-W's revenge killing potential, but, in exchange, it makes it a better pivot, and the better bulk makes Rotom-W more suited to finding the right time to cripple a wall with Trick.

  • 4 HP / 252 SpA / 252 Spe with Timid: Maximizing Rotom-W's Special Attack is part of what makes it an effective revenge killer if using a Choice Scarf.

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 108 SpA / 140 SpD / 4 Spe with Calm: This spread is meant for Assault Vest, letting Rotom-W avoid a 3HKO from Modest Iron Bundle's Freeze-Dry.

Defensive Pivot.description:
• Levitate and excellent status moves make Rotom-W a clean choice for a bulky pivot!

  • Foul Play: Foul Play is essential for hitting Baxcalibur hard, since it's immunity to burns would otherwise let it set up on Rotom-W.

  • Will-O-Wisp versus Thunder Wave: Will-O-Wisp's ability to cripple top-tier physically offensive threats such as Dragonite, Chien-Pao, and Scizor as well as punish the otherwise problematic Iron Hands makes it the best support option. However, Thunder Wave does provide additional insurance against Baxcalibur and punishes special attackers such as Flutter Mane.

  • Hydro Pump: Hydro Pump gives Rotom-W offensive presence against foes that don't care about the rest of the moveset, like Garganacl, Chi-Yu, Volcarona, and Skeledirge.

Other Options

  • Discharge: Giving Rotom-W an Electric STAB attack to better deal with Flying-types like Corviknight and Tera Flying Roaring Moon is useful, but it can be tricky to fit into the set.

  • Hex: If using Tera Ghost, Hex gives Rotom-W a much fiercer offensive kick than usual after inflicting status.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Defensive Rotom-W works fine without Terastallizing, but some Tera types do make it harder to break through.

  • Steel: Tera Steel gives Rotom-W an incredible defensive typing, vastly improving its matchups against Pokemon that rely on Ground-type coverage such as Dragonite, Baxcalibur, and Garchomp. It also provides a useful Freeze-Dry resistance against Iron Bundle.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy guards against fearsome powerful Dark-, Dragon-, and Fighting-type attacks that Rotom-W can have trouble handling and lets it use Tera Blast to hit Dragonite and Chien-Pao hard.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost offers Rotom-W a vast array of immunities with Levitate, enabling it to defeat certain Dragonite sets and do much better against Iron Hands and Iron Valiant when Rotom-W lacks Will-O-Wisp. Being a Ghost-type also prevents Rotom-W from getting trapped, letting it escape faster trappers without Volt Switch.

Items

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry will turn many powerful, unboosted attacks such as Jolly Life Orb Chien-Pao's Crunch, Dragonite's Outrage and Baxcalibur's Glaive Rush into 3HKOs. Just make sure to run an even HP stat so that Sitrus Berry activates with one use of Ruination.

  • Leftovers: If Sitrus Berry is already in use, Leftovers is a reasonable alternative.

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet's extra chip damage can make Rotom-W a less passive pivot.

Nasty Plot.description:
• With a great typing, ability, and good bulk, Rotom-W makes for an effective user of Nasty Plot.

  • Fairy Tera Blast: This move is essential for getting past Dragon-types like Dragapult and Roaring Moon. Even when not Terastallized, it's a decent coverage move.

  • Hydro Pump versus Substitute: Hydro Pump is by far Rotom-W's strongest STAB, but it can be worth sacrificing for Substitute, which lets Rotom-W effectively defeat most Garganacl and defensive Dondozo.

Tera Types
  • Tera Dependency - Medium: While this Rotom-W can sweep on its own, Terastallization can prevent revenge kills from the likes of Iron Bundle.
  • Fairy: With a Fairy Tera type, Rotom-W can turn the tables on its Dragon-type adversaries, as well as catch Crunch Chien-Pao off guard.
Items

  • Lum Berry: Lum Berry lets Rotom-W easily set up on Hippowdon, and avoid getting put to sleep by Dondozo.

  • Sitrus Berry: If Sleep isn't a big issue, Rotom-W appreciates the burst recovery Sitrus Berry provides. Make sure to run an even HP stat so it activates after Rotom-W gets hit by Ruination once.

  • Covert Cloak: If using Hydro Pump, this is Rotom-W's best way around Garganacl.

EV Spreads

  • 4 HP / 252 SpA / 252 Spe: Maximizing Speed with a Timid nature gives Rotom-W the jump on Gholdengo. If Gholdengo isn't an issue, a Modest nature will still outspeed Jolly Breloom.

  • 252 HP / 252 SpA / 4 SpD with Modest: Rotom-W's good bulk can be maximized instead of outspeeding Breloom; this spread avoids the 2HKO from Timid Gholdengo's Shadow Ball.

  • 244 HP / 180 Def / 84 SpA with Bold: This Sitrus Berry optimized spread avoids a 2HKO from Jolly Life Orb Chien-Pao and Timid Flutter Mane.

Serene Queen (Calm Mind).description:
• With its great bulk and the advent of Terastallization, Cresselia is a formidable defensive presence with the ability to take over late in the game.

  • Calm Mind: Calm Mind allows Cresselia to bolster its defensive profile while also increasing its damage output.

  • Moonblast: While lacking STAB, Moonblast has no immunities, which makes it Cresselia’s most reliable offensive move.

  • Stored Power: While blanked by Dark-types, Stored Power allows Cresselia to threaten walls like Unaware Dondozo and more reliably win Calm Mind wars against foes like Flutter Mane. It also allows Cresselia to potentially beat Heatran with sheer power should it accrue enough boosts.

  • Ice Beam: Ice Beam allows Cresselia to immediately threaten the many Ice weak Pokémon in the metagame, such as Dragonite, Landorus-T, and Ting-Lu.

  • Thunderbolt - Thunderbolt allows Cresselia to immediately threaten Urshifu-R and is a great general attacking move if used with an Electric Tera.

Other Options

  • Substitute: While difficult to fit, Substitute can protect Cresselia from debilitating status from the likes of Toxapex and Dondozo, giving it a wider reach against slower paced teams without relying on Covert Cloak as much.

  • Lunar Dance: While seemingly odd on a defensive set, Lunar Dance allows Cresselia to bring back a battered teammate in the event it itself cannot finish the game, giving formidable partners such as Chien-Pao and Ursaluna a second chance to break down the opponent.

Items

  • Covert Cloak: Covert Cloak guards Cresselia from adverse effects such as flinches and Defense drops that would otherwise impede its ability to take over the endgame. It also negates the passive damage from Garganacl’s Salt Cure, allowing Cresselia to heavily punish it.

  • Leftovers: Leftovers’s passive recovery allows Cresselia to better conserve its limited Moonlight PP, more safely set up against powerful attackers like Flutter Mane, and be a more active presence on the field by not mandating it use a turn to heal off every hit it takes manually.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Cresselia makes excellent use of Terastallization thanks to its bulk and Levitate, especially since its presence at team preview attracts hard counters.

  • Electric: Thanks to Levitate, Tera Electric grants Cresselia a complete lack of weaknesses, giving it an extremely diverse defensive profile courtesy of its immense bulk. It also guards against paralysis, minimizing the chance of an ill-timed lost turn ruining a sweep.

  • Poison: Tera Poison protects Cresselia against Toxic, allowing it to more safely set up against Pokémon like Toxapex. It also grants security against even Tera Fairy Choice Specs Flutter Mane by allowing Cresselia to resist Fairy.

  • Steel: Tera Steel combined with Levitate puts the brakes on Tera Normal Ursaluna-B while also giving a great defensive matchup into Tera Flying Dragonite and Tera Fairy Choice Specs Flutter Mane.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy grants Cresselia a crucial resistance to Dark, allowing it to better take on foes like Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu.

Trick Room Support.description:
• WIth the combination of Trick Room and Lunar Dance, Cresselia can give bulky attackers like Ursaluna-B another chance for dangerous comeback sweeps!

  • Moonblast: Due to the support nature of this set, Moonblast is preferred over a STAB move; otherwise, Cresselia is walled by common Dark-type threats like Chien-Pao and Urshifu-S.

  • Moonlight: Moonlight makes Cresselia less of a one-and-done support Pokemon, increasing its longevity and potentially letting it stall out weaker attackers.

  • Ice Beam: Ice Beam is more effective at pressuring Dragonite than Moonblast, which can be useful if wanting to force an early Terastallization.

  • Bold versus Relaxed : Thanks to a decent base Speed stat, a Bold nature with regular Speed is an option if wanting to make Cresselia more flexible outside of Trick Room.

Other Options
  • Skill Swap: Skill Swap can be used to take away Multiscale from Dragonite, which otherwise can use Roost on the turn that Cresselia uses Lunar Dance. Since Dragonite can still switch out to reset its ability, this option works best with Stealth Rock support.
Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: This set's support focus and bulk usually do not require Terastallization, making Cresselia an excellent partner for the sweepers it supports.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy lets it resist Dark-type attacks from the likes of Chi-Yu while also nullifying Scale Shot setups from attackers like Dragonite and Roaring Moon.

  • Electric: Tera Electric remains a solid option thanks to Levitate, giving Cresselia essentially no weaknesses and providing an important paralysis immunity.

  • Steel: Tera Steel makes it much harder for Latios to muscle through Cresselia while still maintaining a very favorable matchup against Dragonite thanks to the synergy with Levitate.

Items

  • Mental Herb: Cresselia is frequently targeted by Taunt users like Flutter Mane, making Mental Herb a great option to guarantee Trick Room is set.

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry is a strong general option for further augmenting Cresselia's longevity.

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet is useful for breaking Focus Sash from targets like both formes of Urshifu, making it more difficult for them to stall out an incoming Trick Room sweep.

Serperior.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon is a new addition from the Indigo Disk that happens to be relevant!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Regal Attacker.description:
• With STAB Leaf Storm paired with its incredible ability in Contrary, Serperior is a formidable wallbreaker and potential sweeper.

  • Leaf Storm: Thanks to Contrary, Leaf Storm will boost Serperior’s Special Attack by two stages, rather than lowering it, allowing Serperior to become more of a threat simply by attacking.

  • Glare: Glare allows Serperior to spread paralysis with 100% consistency, even to Ground-types, giving it a unique niche as a paralysis spreader unperturbed by the likes of Landorus-T.

  • Taunt: Taunt is fantastic for shutting down support Pokemon like Ting-Lu and Porygon2.

  • Tera Blast: Tera Blast provides Serperior with coverage for its poor matchups, depending on its Tera Type.

  • Substitute: When paired with Glare, Substitute allows Serperior to take advantage of the potential free turns afforded by paralysis to become even more of a threat and dodge debilitating status from the likes of Porygon2 and Dondozo.

Other Options
  • Dragon Pulse: Dragon Pulse is difficult to fit in, but it allows Serperior to threaten foes like Dragonite without relying on Terastallization.
Items

  • Leftovers: Leftovers grants Serperior passive recovery, allowing it to spam Glare more often and make successful Substitute attempts even more punishing.

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash enables Serperior to get successful Glares off against faster foes, such as Choice Scarf Chi-Yu.

  • Sitrus Berry: If Leftovers is being used by another team member, Sitrus Berry is a decent alternative.

EV Spreads
  • 76 HP / 180 SpA / 252 Spe with Timid: This spread optimizes Serperior’s HP value for use of Leftovers, while maintaining maximum Speed to spam Glare.
Tera Types

  • Fire: Tera Fire allows Serperior to resist opposing Fire-type attacks, as well as Scizor’s Bullet Punch, and grants it coverage against other Grass-types.

  • Rock: Tera Rock enables Serperior to more consistently threaten Fire-types and Flying-types and resist their attacks.

  • Stellar: Stellar Tera grants Serperior perfect neutral coverage, as well as another way to boost its Special Attack with Stellar Tera Blast. This is a purely offensive Tera type and provides Serperior with no defensive utility; however, it is arguably the best choice for maximizing overall damage output.

Defensive.description:
• This set's write-up has not started yet, but here's some basic info to get you started!

  • EV Spread: This spread lets Serperior outspeed Jolly Urshifu formes.

Dual Screens.description: • This set's write-up has not started yet.

Amoonguss.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out this page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Pivot.description:
• Amoonguss has a great defensive profile compared to most other Toxic Spikes absorbers, and this set can help it even further with a slow switch to another teammate once per game.

  • Pivoting with Leaf Storm: After using Leaf Storm, Eject Pack activates and Amoonguss is switched out; however, it can also be activated by other stat drops, such as Intimidate and Special Defense drops from Shadow Ball.

  • Sludge Bomb versus Clear Smog: Sludge Bomb is preferred for breaking Tera Fairy Wo-Chien's Substitutes and dealing good chip damage against Chi-Yu, but Clear Smog does a great job of clearing boosts from bulky sweepers such as Palafin-H.

  • Bold versus Relaxed: Using Relaxed with a Speed IV of 0 gives Amoonguss the slowest possible pivoting, mostly against mirror matches. However, if both are Terastallized, this means the slower Amoonguss could get hit by Spore, and Amoonguss is already slower than the vast majority of the metagame with Bold.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: While Amoonguss has a good defensive typing, it'll need Terastallization to deal with some top tier threats like Chien-Pao and Iron Bundle.

  • Water: Tera Water gives Amoonguss a key resistance to Ice- and Fire-type attacks, making the matchup against Chien-Pao, Baxcalibur, and Chi-Yu much more reasonable.

  • Steel: Tera Steel makes the Iron Bundle match up tilt in Amoonguss's favor, with even Focus Sash Iron Bundle being unable to catch Amoonguss if Eject Pack is intact.

  • Dark: A Dark Tera type grants a Psychic-type immunity, along with a STAB Foul Play.

  • Poison: A Poison Tera type removes Amoonguss's Ice-, Fire-, and Flying-type weaknesses; and makes Clear Smog stronger due to its Base Power being increased to 60 along with the bonus STAB; however this increases its vulnerability to Ground-type attacks. Tera Poison also still retains Amoonguss's Toxic Spikes absorbing utility.

  • Fire: Fire isn't the best defensive typing, but it's a way to retain a Fairy resistance if dealing with Ice- and Fire-type attacks is needed.

Defensive.description:
• With good bulk, a solid defensive typing, the ability to absorb Toxic Spikes, and access to Spore and Regenerator, Amoonguss is a fantastic support and disruptor option.

  • Sludge Bomb versus Clear Smog: Sludge Bomb gives Amoonguss a decent STAB to use against Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu, and breaks Wo-Chien's Substitute when its weak to it. On the other hand, Clear Smog prevents Amoonguss from getting set up on unless the opponent is Steel-type or has a Substitute up.

  • Giga Drain: Unlike Sludge Bomb, Giga Drain OHKOs Iron Bundle after Stealth Rock damage, and doesn't have to worry about Tera Water.

Other Options

  • Toxic: Toxic's conflicts with Spore make it a lesser option, but it's a devastating option against some bulky Spore absorbers such as Wo-Chien and Annihilape.

  • Hex: Hex both punishes foes put to sleep by Spore and hits Air Balloon Gholdengo and Flutter Mane.

  • Stomping Tantrum: Stomping Tantrum deals decent damage to Gholdengo and Magnezone.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Despite Amoonguss's solid defensive typing, several major threats such as Chien-Pao and Baxcalibur will require Terastallization to deal with.

  • Water: Tera Water is Amoonguss's ticket for dealing with Chien-Pao and Baxcalibur.

  • Dark: Tera Dark removes its weakness to Psychic-type attacks and makes Foul Play stronger.

  • Poison: Tera Poison retains Amoonguss's ability to use Black Sludge and absorb Toxic Spikes, at the cost of being weak to the common Earthquake.

  • Steel: While it makes Amoonguss weak to Ground- and Fighting-type attacks, it also grants Amoonguss a better matchup against Iron Bundle, especially if using Giga Drain.

Items

  • Leftovers: The extra recovery from Leftovers pairs well with the free turns Spore often grants Amoonguss.

  • Black Sludge: Black Sludge is a great way to get around Item Clause if Leftovers is already in use. Note, if Amoonguss Terastallizes into a type that isn't Poison, it will take damage instead.

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet punishes contact moves with residual damage, potentially breaking Focus Sash from foes like Breloom and Great Tusk in the process.

Wish Pass.description:
• With Wish and a slow Flip Turn, Alomomola has a strong combination for providing team healing.

  • Protect: Alomomola can use Wish and Protect to give itself reliable self-recovery, and this combination makes Alomomola great at stalling out turns against weather, Terrains, and Trick Room.

  • Aqua Jet: Aqua Jet is weak on Alomomola but still excellent at picking off severely weakened threats such as Focus Sash Chien-Pao.

  • Play Rough: Play Rough deals sizable damage to Koraidon without Terastallization but is otherwise fairly situational.

Other Options

  • Scald: Scald's burn chance can punish physical attackers like Dragonite and Chien-Pao for trying to set up on it, but it's rather inconsistent.

  • Skill Swap: Skill Swap is a unique way to prevent Gliscor that lack Taunt from setting up on Alomomola and its team. It can also be used on Ogerpon-W's Water Absorb to make Flip Turn possible against it.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low / Medium: Physically bulky Alomomola already has good typing against the threats it wants to wall, but there are times when Terastallization is needed to augment its role.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy's Fighting-type resistance can be used to buy more time against Koraidon and Urshifu-R as well as just outright walling powerful Dragon-type moves like Outrage and Scale Shot.

  • Poison: Tera Poison improves the Flutter Mane matchup and provides important support for removing Toxic Spikes.

Items

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet is fantastic for chipping the likes of Koraidon and Dragonite just by switching into their contact moves. Paired with Alomomola's recovery support, it has great potential to stack this damage up over time.

  • Leftovers: Leftovers synergizes well with Protect, and the extra passive recovery can give Alomomola greater freedom to pass Wish to its teammates.

EV Spreads

  • 116 HP / 252 Def / 140 SpD with Relaxed: The physical bulk on this EV spread is tuned for Scale Shot from Jolly Koraidon, guaranteeing Alomomola can survive up to nine individual hits before recovery. With Leftovers and Protect, it almost always guarantees that Alomomola can live two unboosted Moonblasts from Timid Flutter Mane.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 SpD with Relaxed: A simple spread that tops out physical bulk, but the main benefit is that maximizing Alomomola's HP bumps the recovery teammates will receive from Wish.

  • 4 HP / 252 Def / 252 SpD with Relaxed: While it sacrifices some physical bulk, the higher special bulk investment helps Alomomola to almost always avoid the 2HKO from Timid Flutter Mane's Moonblast, all without needing Leftovers.

Assault Vest Pivot.description:
• Flip Turn and Regenerator combine to make Alomomola one of the hardest pivots to efficiently take out.

  • Mirror Coat: Alomomola makes excellent use of Mirror Coat with its high base HP, retaliating comfortably against top special attackers like Ursaluna-B and Raging Bolt.

  • Scald: Scald's moderate burn chance makes Alomomola even more threatening to physical attackers like Chien-Pao and Urshifu-R.

  • Aqua Jet: Uninvested Aqua Jet may not do much, but it's still useful for picking off common Focus Sash users and Sturdy Archaludon.

  • Play Rough: Play Rough lets Alomomola deal more direct damage to the likes of Chien-Pao and Urshifu-R, especially when paired with Tera Fairy.

  • Icy Wind: Icy Wind's speed control can be useful for wallbreakers like Choice Band Chien-Pao and Choice Specs Chi-Yu. Furthermore, targets like defensive Dragonite are still faster than Alomomola after a single Speed drop, allowing it to maintain its safe pivoting support.

Other Options

  • Liquidiation: Liquidation helps Alomomola deal decent overall damage if forced into a situation where it has to play offensively such as against Calm Mind Flutter Mane.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low / Medium: Alomomola is extremely difficult to OHKO, and with Terastallization, it can thwart its counters and live even longer! Do note though that losing its original typing can make it much more vulnerable to wallbreakers like Tera Water Urshifu-R.

  • Poison: Tera Poison grants pivotal Fairy and Grass resistances against Flutter Mane, Rillaboom, and the Ogerpon formes. The immunity to Toxic and Toxic Spikes is also a big help.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy helps against Dark- and Fighting-type attacks from Chien-Pao and the Urshifu formes and can be used alongside Play Rough to give Alomomola more kick against these targets.

EV Spreads

  • 52 HP / 212 Def / 244 SpD with Relaxed: This EV spread gives Alomomola a balanced defensive profile. The Special Defense investment avoids the OHKO from Modest Choice Specs Chi-Yu's Overheat even if Alomomola is Terastallized.

  • 188 HP / 76 Def / 244 SpD with Relaxed: This spread contributes extra to surviving special attacks; in particular it has an approxiately 90% chance to avoid the 2HKO from Modest Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast as well as having about a 75% chance to avoid the 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Chi-Yu's Dark Pulse. Enough Defense investment is maintained so that Jolly Chien-Pao's Tera Blast Electric only OHKOes Alomomola on the highest damage roll.

Haxorus.overview:
Welcome to the next generation of Battle Stadium Singles! In this new and exciting metagame, new ideas are constantly developing, so this analysis will constantly be updated to reflect metagame trends.

If you feel this analysis is not up to date, feel free to check out the thread for this Pokemon and post suggestions. For more resources on Series 1 in general, check out this thread.

Mold Breaker Funny Moments Compilation.description:
• With its workable Speed, sky-high Attack stat, and the ever-valuable Mold Breaker, Haxorus is notable as one of the few setup sweepers not bothered by Mimikyu or Unaware.

  • With one Dragon Dance, it can outspeed most unboosted foes, but Choice Scarf users still cause issues, notably Hydreigon and Play Rough Meowscarada.

  • Dragon Claw may be worth using in place of Outrage to avoid locking Haxorus in.

  • Earthquake is extremely valuable on Haxorus due to Mold Breaker nullifying Levitate and Earth Eater, allowing Haxorus to hit foes like Rotom-W and Hydreigon hard without the need to lock into Outrage, and giving it a way to hit Orthworm hard at all

Items

  • Life Orb: Life Orb lets Haxorus deal damage much more effectively at the cost of recoil

  • Lum Berry: Lum Berry lets Haxorus safely set up against a foe that may use crippling status moves such as Will-O-Wisp and Spore.

Tera Types

  • Steel: Steel grants good security against opposing Ice-, Fairy-, and Dragon-types.

  • Fairy: Fairy maximizes Haxorus's security against opposing Dragon-types, specifically.

  • Electric: Electric provides a surefire way of dealing with Dondozo thanks to Tera Blast.

Hydreigon.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out the format page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

HARBINGER (Choice Item).description:
• With access to the incredible Levitate, Hydreigon sets itself apart from Roaring Moon as a dangerous offensive force that effectively utilizes Terastallization.

  • Flash Cannon: This is Hydreigon's best option to hit Fairy-types such as Mimikyu and Flutter Mane.

  • Flamethrower versus Fire Blast: Flamethrower is usually good enough for hitting Steel-types such as Scizor and otherwise decent Dark Pulse switch-ins like Meowscarada. On the other hand, Choice Specs Fire Blast is capable of OHKOing bulky Gholdengo and Corviknight.

Items

  • Choice Specs: Choice Specs Hydreigon is a nuclear wallbreaker that can pummel unsuspecting teams.

  • Choice Scarf: Choice Scarf patches up Hydreigon's somewhat lackluster Speed, allowing it to threaten a wider portion of the metagame with its high-powered attacks.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Hydreigon has a lot of competition from other Dragon-types, as well as having to face down strong Dark-resists like Chien-Pao. Terastallization is it's best way to flip these matchups when absolutely necessary.

  • Steel: Tera Steel can be used to get around the many Dragon and Fairy-types that try to revenge kill Hydreigon, though it is still vulnerable to Mach Punch from Breloom.

  • Poison: Tera Poison has great synergy with Hydreigon's former typing, making it do especially well against Great Tusk.

  • Fire: Tera Fire will grant Hydreigon a resistance to Fairy-types while removing its weakness to Fighting-types and powering up Flamethrower or Fire Blast. However, unlike Tera Steel it does not grant a resistance to Dragon, and it also gives Hydreigon a few new weaknesses.

  • Dark: Tera Dark boosts Dark Pulse into an absurdly powerful weapon, and when coupled with its flinch rate, Tera Dark Hydreigon can potentially muscle its way out of otherwise hopeless situations.

Versatile Attacker.description:
• Hydreigon's useful support movepool can add quite a bit of unpredictability to its offensive potential.

  • Note that this Hydreigon is fully capable of running three attacking moves with one support move.

  • Nasty Plot: Nasty Plot makes Hydreigon a surprisingly dangerous sweeper against slower teams and pairs particularly well with Substitute.

  • Substitute: Substitute is excellent for scouting Terastallization and punishes common status users such as Yawn Dondozo as well as Leech Seed Wo-Chien.

  • Taunt: Taunt can stop setup from defensive foes such as Hippowdon, Wo-Chien and Clodsire, and is especially dangerous if they lack coverage to hit back effectively.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Hydreigon sets of this kind normally prey on bulkier targets, using its support tools to overwhelm them. However, Hydreigon will likely still have to deal with its Dragon-type brethren, so Terastallization is sometimes necessary.

  • Steel: A Steel Tera type has fantastic synergy with Levitate, helping Hydreigon against Dragon- and Fairy-types without the dreaded Ground weakness.

  • Poison: With a Poison Tera type, Hydreigon can do well against Fairy-types without fear of powerful Fighting-type attacks. Thanks to Levitate, it also matches up well into Great Tusk.

  • Fire: When using Flamethrower, a Fire Tera type is handy for both the Fairy resistance and a better matchup against Kingambit.

Items

  • Leftovers: If using Substitute, Leftovers's extra bit of recovery helps reduce its risk.

  • Life Orb: A simple power boost still comes in handy, even if only using two attacks.

  • Black Glasses: If a teammate is already using Life Orb, Black Glasses is a good compromise.

Stealth Rock Support.description:
• Hydreigon's new access to Stealth Rock makes it a surprisingly effective offensive support Pokemon.

  • Taunt: Taunt effectively shuts down common support leads like Ting-Lu, Hippowdon, and Clodsire.

  • Thunder Wave: This is a powerful deterrent against offensive foes and can even stop sweepers in emergency situations when used with Focus Sash.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low / Medium: If running Focus Sash, Terastallization is generally not needed. For other items, Terastallization is sometimes more necessary.

  • Steel: Thanks to Levitate, a Steel Tera type is an incredible defensive typing for Hydreigon, giving it an advantage over Fairy- and Dragon-types.

  • Poison: Tera Poison is a good alternative to Steel, with fewer resistances but an important Fighting-type resistance for targets like Great Tusk and Iron Hands.

  • Fire: Fire-type Hydreigon is better against Kingambit and Fairy-types.

Items

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash makes setting up Stealth Rock a much easier task against offensive teams. Be warned that it doesn't stop Dragapult's Dragon Darts.

  • Leftovers: If using Taunt, Leftovers is the best choice for giving Hydreigon longevity against defensive foes such as Corviknight.

  • Life Orb: Life Orb lets Hydreigon be played more offensively if setting Stealth Rock isn't needed.

  • Dark Glasses: Dark Glasses work if a teammate is using Life Orb.

Volcarona.overview:
This Pokemon has been updated to reflect Regulation H, that lasts until January 5h, 2025. After this, Regulation G will return.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Bulkarona.description:
• With recovery and massive investments in bulk, Volcarona is capable of setting up multiple Quiver Dances, making it a potent sweeper.

  • Tera Blast: Even before Terastallization, Tera Blast can come in handy for dealing decent damage to Dragonite and Garchomp.

  • Giga Drain: Giga Drain is Volcarona's best shot at beating Water-types such as Primarina and Basculegion; note that Dondozo is not 2HKOed.

  • Will-O-Wisp: Burning foes is great for letting Volcarona set up against powerful foes like Garchomp, and punishing the common Dragonite switch-in.

Other Options

  • Substitute: Though it can be difficult to fit-in, Substitute allows Volcarona to punish users of status moves, such as sleep moves from Breloom and Gholdengo's Thunder Wave.

  • Bug Buzz: This is Volcarona's best tool against foes behind a Substitute like Hydreigon and Tera Water Gliscor, but the coverage isn't that great otherwise.

  • Psychic: Psychic 2HKOs Toxapex, who can otherwise be problematic with Haze, but offers little other coverage.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: While the massive Rock-type weakness often pressures Volcarona to Terastallize, Volcarona's useful resistances to Fighting and Fairy mean this isn't always the right play.

  • Fairy: A Fairy Tera type lets Volcarona take on powerful Dragon-types that try to boost their Speed with Scale Shot, such as Baxcalibur, Dragonite, and Garchomp, and gives it powerful coverage against them with Tera Blast. Just note that Tera Fairy compromises Volcarona's ability to check Gholdengo effectively.

  • Grass: With a Grass Tera type, Volcarona can now 2HKO most Dondozo with Giga Drain and is better insulated against revenge kills from Water-types like Primarina and Basculegion, at the cost of being vulnerable against opposing Volcarona.

  • Water: Besides removing all of Volcarona's old weaknesses, a Water Tera type also massively improves the match up against Primarina and Basculeigon, and gives a powerful Tera Blast to use against Skeledirge.

Items

  • Heavy-Duty Boots: Stealth Rock is common enough that this is the safest item for Volcarona to hold.

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry gives Volcarona more durability against teams that lack hazards, and with an even HP stat, it'll eat Sitrus Berry right away after switching into Sealth Rock.

  • Lum Berry: This allows Volcarona to recover from status once against threats like Spore Breloom, Yawn Dondozo, and Thunder Wave Dragonite.

  • Covert Cloak: If using Tera Water against Garganacl, Covert Cloak stops it from beating Volcarona with Salt Cure.

  • Kee Berry: Kee Berry's activated Defense boost makes Volcarona even more difficult to revenge kill, though it can only be used once per match.

EV Spreads

  • Odd HP versus Even HP: Volcarona will usually prefer an odd HP stat to take less residual damage, with Stealth Rock no longer 2HKOing being the most important if Volcarona loses Heavy-Duty Boots from Knock Off. However, if using Sitrus Berry, move 8 Defense EV's to HP so that one switch into Stealth Rock activates it.

  • 244 HP / 188 Def / 76 Spe with Timid: This EV spread outspeeds Dragapult after one Quiver Dance.

  • 244 HP / 188 Def / 4 SpA / 4 SpD / 68 Spe with Bold: This EV spread outspeeds Meowscarada after one Quiver Dance.

Offensive Quiver Dance.description:
• This far speedier approach to sweeping with Volcarona is more risky, but can catch more passive teams by surprise with its greater coverage.

  • Giga Drain: Giga Drain is the best coverage option for Volcarona, as it helps it deal with Water-type Pokémon like Basculegion, as well as recover a good amount of HP.

  • Bug Buzz: Bug Buzz's coverage isn't that great, but its ability to ignore Substitute and hit Hydreigon and Tyranitar hard makes it a reasonable coverage move if using Tera Grass.

  • Timid versus Modest: Timid is preferred for outpseeding Jolly Annihilape, Timid Hydreigon, and Jolly Baxcalibur, but Modest is fully acceptable if these aren't issues for your team.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: This Volcarona is heavily pressured to start sweeping after it sets up, so Terastallization can widen the opportunities to do so.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy is a big help against powerful Dragon-type attacks such as Choice Band Dragonite's Outrage and Baxcalibur's Scale Shot, and it gives Volcarona good coverage against them too with Tera Blast.

  • Water: Terastallizing into the Water typing nullifies Volcarona's most common weakness in Rock-type, and Water-type Tera Blast is also the best option Volcarona has to hit Skeledirge and opposing Volcarona.

  • Rock: Tera Rock lets Volcarona cover Dragonite, Skeledirge, and opposing Volcarona with Tera Blast, and provides a very useful Extreme Speed resistance. When used with Sand Stream from Hippowdon or Tyranitar, it also makes Volcarona quite specially bulky.

  • Grass: The Grass typing strengthens Giga Drain and nullifies Volcarona's weakness to Water-types, most notably helping against Dondozo, Primarina, and Basculegion. Note that this does leave Volcarona walled by Dragonite and opposing Volcarona.

Items

  • Heavy-Duty Boots: It is the best option on Volcarona, as it circumvents its crippling Stealth Rock weakness.

  • Lum Berry: This Volcarona's more offensive nature makes it especially vulnerable to status moves from the likes of Dragonite and Focus Sash Breloom, so Lum Berry is a reasonable way around this.

  • Sitrus Berry: If used with an even HP stat, Sitrus Berry will restore Volcarona's health the moment it switches into Stealth Rock.

SOLAR FLARE (Choiced Attacker).description:
• With its high Speed and immediate power, Volcarona is a good candidate for a choice item that can surprise its usual switch-ins.

  • Fiery Dance: Fiery Dance is a potent cleaning tool thanks to its high chance of boosting Volcarona’s Special Attack.

  • Overheat: Overheat deals good immediate damage, which can allow Volcarona to wear down otherwise annoying walls without much prediction, such as defensive Primarina and Dondozo.

  • Bug Buzz: Bug Buzz is a good secondary STAB move that allows Volcarona to hit foes hiding behind a substitute, with Hydreigon and Tera Water Gliscor being particularly juicy targets.

  • Giga Drain: Giga Drain is Volcarona’s best option to hit troublesome Water-types like Primarina, Dondozo, and Basculegion.

  • Choice Specs versus Choice Scarf: With the extra power offered by Choice Specs, Volcarona becomes even more difficult to wall, with even resistances like Garchomp and Dragapult taking over 50% from it! Choice Scarf on the other hand, allow sVolcarona to outspeed the entire unboosted metagame, allowing it to revenge kill surprising targets such as Meowscarada.

  • Timid versus Modest: Modest's extra damage output is appealing, but it does lead to a speed tie against Jolly Baxcalibur, and being outsped by Jolly Annihilape.

Other Options

  • U-turn: Volcarona can make for a decent pivot with U-turn, but this move becomes far more risky to use against teams with Stealth Rock support.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: This Volcarona takes a more hit-and-run approach compared to other sets, making it especially vulnerable to Stealth Rock damage. Terastallization can solve this issue without needing extra support!

  • Fire: Tera Fire transforms Choice Specs Volcarona into a horrifically powerful wallbreaker, with even physically defensive Dondozo and Primarina that lack Assault Vest taking over 50% from Overheat!

  • Fairy: When paired with Tera Blast, a Fairy Tera type allows Volcarona to better handle the many Dragon-types in the metagame, with the major targets including Dragonite, Garchomp, and Hydreigon.

  • Rock: Tera Rock covers Dragonite, Skeledirge, and opposing Volcarona with Tera Blast, and provides a wonderful resistance to Dragonite's Extreme Speed, at the cost of potentially being revenge killed by Scizor.

  • Grass: A Grass Tera type allows Volcarona to resist the many Water-type attacks aimed at it and gives it a better chance at breaking past Dondozo.

Pivot.description:
• Thanks to Volt Absorb, Thundurus-T is an excellent offensive pivot that makes masterful use of Terastallization!

  • Grass Knot: Grass Knot is highly recommended for dealing massive damage to Ground-types, such as Ting-Lu and Ursaluna, without Terastallizing in addition to being a secondary attack to hit Urshifu-R while Choice locked into an attack.

  • Focus Blast: Focus Blast has reliability issues, but it's Thundurus-T's best shot of dealing big damage to Hisuian Goodra and Wo-Chien.

  • Sludge Bomb: Sludge Bomb is a more niche option, giving Thundurus-T a more reliable way to deal damage to Wo-Chien and Meowscarada at the cost of doing nothing to Hisuian Goodra.

  • Timid versus Modest: Timid is the best nature, allowing Thundurus-T to outspeed key threats, such as Urshifu-R, and at least Speed tie with opposing Thundurus-T. Modest is usable with Choice Specs, allowing Thundurus-T to outspeed up to Jolly Baxcalibur and Great Tusk, and the extra power can be handy in some situations, such as usually 2HKOing specially defensive Clodsire with Tera Blast Flying.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: While Thundurus-T is perfectly fine with its base typing, it makes such good use of Terastallization that it'll often Terastallize.

  • Flying: Tera Flying makes Tera Blast a powerful STAB option with very few resistances while gaining no extra weaknesses thanks to Volt Absorb.

  • Ice: Not only does Tera Ice give Thundurus-T powerful coverage against Ground- and Grass-types like Landorus-T and Wo-Chien, it also gives an important resistance to Iron Bundle's and Chien-Pao's Ice-type attacks.

  • Water: Tera Water is a fantastic defensive option, turning Thundurus-T into an excellent check against Regieleki and Zapdos while still giving it a good coverage option against Landorus-T. However, it still retains Thundurus-T's weakness to Freeze-Dry.

Items

  • Choice Specs versus Choice Scarf: Choice Specs makes Thundurus-T difficult to wall without an extremely sturdy special wall, with even Pokemon like Clodsire and Cresselia at risk of a 2HKO. Choice Scarf, on the other hand, allows Thundurus-T to double as a good revenge killer, outspeeding major threats like Iron Bundle and Chien-Pao.

  • Assault Vest: While Thundurus-T isn't known for its bulk, Volt Absorb means Assault Vest makes Thundurus-T more effective at checking other Electric-types, especially when using bulkier EV spreads.

Bulkier EV Spreads

  • 20 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpA / 4 SpD / 228 Spe with Timid: This Assault Vest spread outspeeds both Urshifu formes and takes 70% maximum from Timid Iron Bundle's Freeze-Dry without sacrificing power.

  • 188 SpA / 68 SpD / 252 Spe with Timid or Modest**: This spread is optimized for Assault Vest, letting Thundurus-T survive Timid Choice Specs Iron Bundle's Freeze-Dry without Terastallizing.

Minor Optimizations
  • 0-3 Attack IV: Foes that commonly run Foul Play such as Amoonguss and Rotom-W have more powerful moves to use against Thundurus-T, but there's no drawback to minimizing Foul Play's damage.

Nasty Plot.description:
• Thundurus-T's massive Special Attack stat and array of immunities make it a good user of Nasty Plot.

  • Grass Knot: Grass Knot is integral for potentially OHKOing physically defensive Ting-Lu after a boost and usually OHKOing offensive Ursaluna.

  • Life Orb versus Sitrus Berry: Life Orb is great for wallbreaking, allowing Thundurus-T to potentially OHKO Ting-Lu with a boosted Grass Knot. Sitrus Berry is still a good option, though allowing Thundurus-T to instantly restore some health after being hit by Ruination, as long as its maximum HP is an even number.

Other Options

  • Substitute: When paired with Tera Water, Substitute lets Thundurus-T set up on Garganacl.

  • Focus Blast: Focus Blast's unreliability makes it hard to recommend for most teams, but it's the only way Thundurus-T will break through Hisuian Goodra without Terastallization.

  • Taunt: Giving up coverage is risky, but Taunt shuts down a lot of defensive counterplay against Thundurus-T such as Whirlwind Ting-Lu and Toxic Clodsire.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Thundurus-T's typing is totally functional for sweeping and wallbreaking, but Terastallization makes it far harder to revenge kill thanks to Volt Absorb.

  • Flying: Tera Flying gives Thundurus-T a powerful STAB option, letting it cleave through specially bulky foes, like Water Absorb Clodsire, particularly easily.

  • Water: While Tera Water does leave Thundurus-T vulnerable to certain Pokemon, such as Water Absorb Clodsire and Hisuian Goodra, it's a fantastic defensive Tera type that lets it deal with other common Electric-types that Terastallize like Regieleki and Zapdos.

  • Ice: Tera Ice is a great offensive option, letting Thundurus-T cleave through most Ground-types that aren't weak to Grass such as Landorus-T and Clodsire. Thundurus-T even makes good defensive use of it, resisting Iron Bundle's Freeze-Dry.

Bulkier EV Spreads
  • 108 HP / 4 Def / 140 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Timid: This EV spread lets Thundurus-T survive Timid Iron Bundle's Freeze-Dry, if it doesn't have an offensive item, making it a good choice for more defensive items Thundurus-T may use such as Sitrus Berry.
Minor Optimizations
  • 0-3 Attack IV: Thundurus-T isn't getting hit by Foul Play that often, but a lower Attack IV is marginally useful regardless.

Choice Attacker.description:
• Landorus-T is a fantastic Choice item sweeper and pivot, making great use of Terastallization and Tera Blast to make up for the lack of a reliable Flying-type attack!

  • Rock Slide versus Stone Edge: Rock Slide having more consistent accuracy over Stone Edge makes it the preferred option on this set, but Stone Edge is still an option on Choice Band sets if trying to maximize power.

Items

  • Choice Scarf: Choice Scarf lets Landorus-T catch faster threats like Jolly Urshifu and Chien-Pao, making it a potent revenge killer and late-game cleaner.

  • Choice Band: Choice Band turns Landorus-T into a powerful wallbreaker against slower teams.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium / High: Tera Blast is a key part of this set's sweeping strategy. However, Earthquake's reliable power and U-turn's pivoting can let Landorus-T adapt to different roles based on the situation.

  • Flying: Tera Flying is essentially mandatory, giving Landorus-T a consistent Flying-type attack with Tera Blast.

Offensive Support.description:
• With maximum investment in special bulk and an immunity to Thunder Wave, Landorus-T becomes a premier Flutter Mane check.

  • Rock Tomb: Rock Tomb's speed control pairs well with this set's bulk, usually allowing Landorus-T to slow down targets like Dragonite and Flutter Mane several times.

  • Taunt: Landorus-T's Taunt is fast enough to shut down many support users and can be devastating to Ting-Lu and Hippowdon, which rely on Earthquake as their main damaging move.

  • Tera Blast with Tera Steel: This combination lets Landorus-T check Flutter Mane offensively, but it usually requires some Attack investment to consistently OHKO.

Other Options

  • Grass Knot: Grass Knot can be used to surprise bulky targets like Ursaluna-B, Swampert, and Dondozo, which otherwise take Landorus-T's unboosted attacks well.

Items

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry is the preferred item for extending Landorus-T's longevity.

  • Assault Vest: If running Tera Blast over Stealth Rock, Assault Vest is a viable option if another teammate needs Sitrus Berry.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpD with Careful: With this spread and Sitrus Berry, Landorus-T can almost always survive up to 3 Moonblasts from unboosted Timid Flutter Mane.

  • 252 HP / 36 Atk / 220 SpD with Adamant: If running Tera Blast, this spread lets Landorus-T almost always OHKO any Flutter Mane except for the maximum Defense with Bold nature sets.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 SpD with Impish: Full physical bulk with Intimidate can severely hinder big threats like Dragonite and Ogerpon-H, but keep in mind that several physical attackers like Chien-Pao and Urshifu are still very problematic without Terastallization.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Landorus-T's natural typing is what makes it strong into Thunder Wave Flutter Mane, but Terastallization can shift Landorus-T towards countering other big threats when needed.

  • Water: Tera Water is the main way to deal with Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes. The Ice-, Steel-, and Fire-type resistance also assist it against common wallbreakers such as Chien-Pao, Gholdengo, and Chi-Yu.

  • Steel: Tera Steel is best used as a single turn surprise, such as for cushioning strong attacks from Choice Specs Flutter Mane and Ursaluna-B.

  • Fire: Tera Fire makes Landorus-T much more reliable into Ogerpon-H while still providing a Fairy-type resistance.

Bulk Up.description:
• Bulk Up and Substitute give Landorus-T new setup opportunities while still taking advantage of its naturally strong base stats and typing.

  • Rock Tomb: Rock Tomb's speed control is a powerful asset for Landorus-T and its teammates, and its lower power can be patched up thanks to Bulk Up.

  • Substitute: Substitute and Intimidate can be quite strong against many physical attackers, but Substitute's main strength lies in blocking the effects of Yawn and Salt Cure.

Other Options

  • Smack Down: While less versatile than Rock Tomb, Smack Down makes it much harder for Corviknight, Latias, and other Ground-immune foes to stall Landorus-T out.

EV Spreads

  • 228 HP / 52 Atk / 164 Def / 4 SpD / 60 Spe with Adamant: With this spread, Landorus-T outruns Jolly Ogerpon after a Rock Tomb, and the Attack EVs almost always guarantee that maximum HP Ogerpon-H is knocked out by Rock Tomb into Earthquake. The Attack EVs also let Earthquake 2HKO offensive variants of both Urshifu formes and Garchomp.

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpD with Careful: Investing fully in special bulk makes Landorus-T much more consistent into special attackers like Flutter Mane.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: While many matchups favor Landorus-T's natural typing, other threats such as Chien-Pao and Urshifu-R will require Terastallization if attempting to set up in front of them.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy's Dragon-type immunity is critical for stopping Scale Shot setup from Dragonite and making Substitute much harder to break. It provides a well-rounded defensive profile as well, removing all of Landorus-T's natural weaknesses.

  • Water: Tera Water is your best shot at stopping Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes, which otherwise is strong into Bulk Up and Substitute. The Fire- and Ice-type resistances are also good for cushioning attacks from Chi-Yu and Chien-Pao, respectively.

  • Fire: Tera Fire is consistently strong into Ogerpon-H’s STAB attacks and still provides insurance against Ice-type attacks from the likes of Chien-Pao.

Sylveon.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out the format page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Offensive.description:
• With its good natural bulk, Sylveon can serve as a potent special attacker and decent revenge killer.

  • Tera Blast: Tera Blast serves as a good alternate STAB attack once Sylveon has Terastallized, providing highly valuable coverage against the Steel-types that could otherwise exploit it, like Scizor. It also gets around potential users of Throat Chop before Terastallization, such as Chien-Pao and Roaring Moon.

  • Psyshock: This is Sylveon's best shot of dealing with Iron Moth.

  • Shadow Ball: Shadow Ball hits foes such as Mimikyu, Flutter Mane, and Gholdengo super effectively, and it means Sylveon does not have to Terastallize to hit Gholdengo for good damage.

  • Quick Attack: Though it is weak, Quick Attack gives valuable priority for picking off weakened threats, and thanks to Pixilate, surprise users of Tera Ghost aren't able to absorb it. A Quiet nature can be used to increase its power, though this risks Sylveon getting outsped by Kingambit.

Other Options

  • Psychic: Psychic deals more damage to physically defensive Toxapex and Amoonguss, but its lower damage output against Iron Moth makes it disappointing if not using Tera Ground.

  • Hyper Beam: Despite the serious risks from the recharge turn, Hyper Beam's extreme power makes it a good filler move.

Items

  • Assault Vest: Assault Vest lets even offensive Sylveon be specially resilient.

  • Choice Specs: With the boost from Choice Specs, Sylveon is a surprisingly potent wallbreaker, making the most out of its many opportunities to switch in.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpA: This spread capitalizes on Sylveon's good natural bulk while maximizing its power.

  • 4 Def / 252 SpA / 252 Spe: While no bulk investment makes Sylveon more difficult to safely get in, Speed investment allows it to outrun and threaten a wider range of foes, such as Scizor and Corviknight.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: Sylveon suffers coverage issues on its own, so its heavily reliant on either Tera Blast or the sheer power of Tera Fairy Hyper Voice to break past them.

  • Fire: Tera Fire allows Sylveon to break past troublesome Steel-types, like Gholdengo and Kingambit, and gives it a key resistance to Ice- and Fire-type attacks from Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu respectively.

  • Water: Tera Water gives good coverage against Fire-types like Iron Moth and Skeledirge, in addition to surprising Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu by resisting their strongest STAB attacks.

  • Ground: Tera Ground doesn't match up quite as well against Steel-types as Tera Fire, but it lets Sylveon turn the tables on Iron Moth, and deal massive damage to Toxapex and Skeledirge.

  • Fairy: Getting an extra boost on Hyper Voice and Hyper Beam makes Choice Specs Sylveon far more difficult to wall, with even resists such as Gholdengo and physically defensive Skeledirge getting 2HKOed by Hyper Voice!

Items

  • Assault Vest: Giving Sylveon extra special bulk lets it take on powerful threats like Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle more reliably.

  • Choice Specs: Choice Specs turns Sylveon into a surprising wallbreaker, especially if using Tera Fairy.

  • Throat Spray: With Hyper Voice activating Throat Spray, Sylveon could potentially break apart slower foes in the late-game, though it only gets one shot at this Special Attack boost. This is best used with Tera Blast to give Sylveon an alternative STAB attack that doesn't activate Throat Spray.

CUTESY CRUSADER (Defensive).description:
• With its good bulk and Special Attack and a reasonable healing move in Wish, Sylveon is a good choice for a bulky Fairy-type.

  • Hyper Voice: Hyper Voice gives Sylveon a reliable STAB even when Terastallized, and hits through common Substitute users like Iron Bundle and Wo-Chien. While It's possible to drop this attack for Tera Blast in an attempt to run more coverage, this seriously worsens Sylveon's matchup against Chien-Pao and Ting-Lu.

  • Tera Blast: Beyond just Terastallization, Tera Blast is still impacted by Pixilate, making it a good move to use against foes that sometimes carry Throat Chop, like Chien-Pao and Roaring Moon.

  • Protect: Protect pairs excellently with Leftovers, and makes Wish a more reliable recovery move.

  • Yawn: Sylveon's good bulk makes it a great choice for phazing with Yawn.

  • Psyshock: Psyshock is Sylveon's best hope for Iron Moth switch-ins.

  • Shadow Ball: Shadow Ball offers important coverage on Gholdengo without demanding that Sylveon Terastallize.

  • Leftovers versus Sitrus Berry: Leftovers is the preferred recovery item for its synergy with Protect and Wish, but Sitrus Berry is a reasonable alternative if Protect isn't wanted, or if another teammate needs Leftovers more.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Sylveon's coverage issues are much easier to deal with when using Terastallization, but this set can still be used well defensively without it.

  • Fire: A Fire Tera type grants Sylveon resistances to Steel and Fairy, allowing it to take on foes it would otherwise have to run from, such as Gholdengo, and a good STAB to hit Chien-Pao hard with if not using Hyper Voice. It also works against Scizor, but note that Tera Water is common on that foe. Tera Fire also makes Sylveon far more vulnerable to Ting-Lu.

  • Water: Tera Water is a great mono-attacking option, making it ideal if only running Tera Blast to do decently well against Steel-types. It also gives Sylveon a better matchup against Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu, and is a safer option against Ting-Lu and Tera Water Scizor.

  • Fairy: If not using Tera Blast, Fairy becomes a reasonable option for boosting Hyper Voice's damage output. Note that Tera Blast is not needed to justify a different Tera Type.

  • Ground: Tera Ground worsens Sylveon's matchup with Chien-Pao, but it does let it deal big damage to Iron Moth, Gholdengo, and Toxapex.

Goodra-Hisui.overview:
This Pokemon is a new addition to the Regulation D format! If you have any questions or feel it needs more updates, feel free to post here.

For more information on Battle Stadium Singles, vist the format page!

Assault Vest.description:
• Hisuian Goodra's incredible special bulk, typing, and useful immunity to Spore via Sap Sipper make it one of the prime choices for Assault Vest!

  • Flash Cannon versus Heavy Slam: Flash Cannon has great synergy with Acid Spray and is a reliable STAB move in general. While Heavy Slam isn't very useful against heavy targets, it's worth using for OHKOing offensive Flutter Mane, one of the biggest threats in the metagame.

  • Draco Meteor versus Ice Beam: Draco Meteor's power makes switching offensive threats like Urshifu-R into Hisuian Goodra tricky, and it is notable for 2HKOing Dondozo. Ice Beam lets Hisuian Goodra punish important Ground-types.

  • Acid Spray: Acid Spray is a useful wallbreaking tool, capable of making even specially bulky foes like Clodsire risk taking massive damage after the Special Defense drop.

  • Thunderbolt: Thunderbolt is another way to 2HKO physically defensive Dondozo and OHKO offensive Urshifu-R and pairs very well with Ice Beam in terms of coverage.

  • Earthquake: While not particularly strong, Earthquake is highly recommended for 2HKOing Heatran and 3HKOing opposing Assault Vest Hisuian Goodra, as both of these will wall this set otherwise.

  • Flamethrower: For other Steel-types like Gholdengo and Scizor, Flamethrower will deal much more damage than Earthquake.

  • Modest versus Quiet: The importance of mirror matches makes Modest an appealing option for Hisuian Goodra, but Quiet will ensure that all but the bulkiest Flutter Mane will need to Terastallize to avoid an OHKO from Heavy Slam.

Other Options
  • Surf: Surf is a decent option to hit Ground-types and Heatran with one attack, but Surf will, at best, usually only 3HKO Heatran.
Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Despite Hisuian Goodra's superb typing, its common weaknesses to Ground and Fighting make Terastallization a valuable route for it.

  • Flying: Tera Flying covers Hisuian Goodra's former weaknesses fantastically, even giving it an out against Fissure Dondozo. This comes at the cost of doing much worse against Iron Bundle, Thundurus-T, Zapdos, and Rotom-W though.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy still gives Hisuian Goodra a vital Fighting resistance, as well as being a good defensive typing in general.

  • Water: Tera Water has good synergy with Sap Sipper, giving Hisuian Goodra a sole weakness to Electric, in addition to gaining a useful Ice resistance against Chien-Pao, at the cost of doing worse against Iron Bundle.

Minor Optimizations
  • Female Gender: If using Heavy Slam, there is a a chance that Hisuian Goodra can become infatuated by the very rare Cute Charm Enamorus, making a female gender very slightly superior.

Armor Press.description:
• Hisuian Goodra's bulk lends itself naturally to boosting its Defense for Body Press, especially with a useful immunity to critical hits that gives it a great matchup against Urshifu formes after Terastallization.

  • Heavy Slam: As Flutter Mane is the most dangerous Special Attacker in the format, Heavy Slam is the best Steel-type STAB move, OHKOing all but the most defensive Flutter Mane if they don't Terastallize.

  • Protect: Protect has good synergy with Leftovers for extra healing, though Urshifu formes can ignore it.

  • Draco Meteor versus Ice Beam: If using a Sassy or Relaxed nature, Draco Meteor can threaten to 2HKO physically defensive Dondozo. Ice Beam, on the other hand, is a safer and stronger option against Landorus-T and Garchomp.

Other Options

  • Rest and Chesto Berry: Rest and Chesto Berry combine to give Hisuian Goodra a great way to restore health, though the combination is only reliable once.

  • Life Dew: Life Dew doesn't restore much health even with Leftovers, but it can help Hisuian Goodra last longer against some physical threats after setting up.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Hisuian Goodra's fantastic typing doesn't make Terastallization a requirement, but it does make setting up against major physical threats like Urshifu-R and Landorus-T much more feasible.

  • Flying: Tera Flying not only covers all of Hisuian Goodra's former weaknesses, but it also means Fissure is no longer an option to break through its boosts from the likes of Dondozo or Ting-Lu. The new weaknesses to Electric and Ice can harm it though, since Electric- and Ice-type coverage moves are commonly special.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy gives Hisuian Goodra shielding from both Urshifu formes without giving it the harmful Electric and Ice weaknesses that Flying does, though it can harm mirror matches against Assault Vest Hisuian Goodra.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Careful or Sassy: This specially defensive spread is Hisuian Goodra's best shot at avoiding a 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Tera Fairy Moonblast, assuming extra Leftovers recovery from Protect.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 Spe with Impish or Relaxed: Maximum physical bulk means Hisuian Goodra won't check Flutter Mane nearly as well, but it let will let Body Press become a better sweeping tool.

Minor Optimizations

  • Acid Armor: Acid Armor is the best option for boosting Defense due to its higher PP, but it requires Hisuian Sligoo to evolve while knowing the move in either Scarlet or Violet, as it's not able to be relearned by Hisuian Goodra. Shelter is still a viable, albeit strictly inferior, option.

  • Female Gender: While very rare, Heavy Slam being a contact move means Hisuian Goodra does risk of activating Enamorus's Cute Charm, making a female gender a marginally better choice.

Avalugg.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Sturdy Support.description:
• With incredible Defense and the ability Sturdy, Avalugg finds a niche on stall-based teams as a physical wall that prevents fishing for OHKOs.

  • Icicle Crash versus Avalanche: While Avalanche has bigger damage potential when Avalugg is attacked head on, its defensive profile normally forces switches. This makes Icicle Crash the more consistent option for overall damage.

  • Toxic Support Partners: Even though Avalugg stops foes such as Dondozo from using Fissure, it lacks the power to cleanly beat these targets on its own. Common stall teammates such as Toxapex and Clodsire can bring Toxic or Toxic Spikes to spread status, allowing Avalugg to simply stall while poison wears down the opposition.

  • EV Spread: Full investment into HP and Defense give Avalugg insane physical bulk. Even Choice Band Chien-Pao’s Sacred Sword isn’t a reliable 2HKO!

Other Options
  • Mirror Coat: Combined with Sturdy, Mirror Coat is a tempting last resort against the special attackers that Avalugg can’t wall. However, this almost assuredly destroys Avalugg’s survivability afterwards, which can compromise the defensive cycle of its team.
Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Situational: Most commonly a member of stall-based teams, Avalugg’s bad matchups are supposed to be covered by the team’s defensive cycle. Tera is normally only used if it is necessary to prevent the collapse of said defensive cycle.

  • Fighting: Tera Fighting balances offense and defense, making Tera Dark targets like Urshifu-S and Choice Band Chien-Pao much easier to deal with while giving a sizable boost to Avalugg’s best attack in Body Press.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy provides both a Fighting- and Dark-type resistance, making it the best defensive type into Urshifu-S. Furthermore, it doesn't have the Flying-type weakness of Tera Fighting, so Tera Flying Dragonite and Landorus-T are still manageable.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost lets Avalugg escape from precarious situations against trapping moves and Gothitelle. It also outright walls Close Combat from the likes of Iron Hands and Iron Valiant, although the new Dark-type weakness significantly worsens its matchup with Chien-Pao.

Items

  • Heavy-Duty Boots: Since Avalugg can expect to do a lot of switching, removing its vulnerability to Stealth Rock damage is extremely important for its longevity and preservation of Sturdy.

  • Rocky Helmet: Avalugg can punish many physical attackers it switches into with Rocky Helmet chip, slowly wearing them down without having to be offensively involved.

Assault Vest.description:
• Assault Vest Incineroar functions as a bulky specially defensive pivot, switching into a variety of common threats—most notably Calyrex-S, as Incineroar resists its STAB combination—while using Intimidate to weaken physical attackers, particularly Chien-Pao.

  • Knock Off: Knock Off is crucial to this set's strength; the move is able to OHKO Calyrex-S, furthering Incineroar's ability to successfully check it, and provide immense value with item removal.

  • Flare Blitz: Flare Blitz's raw power and STAB make it a powerful option against Chien-Pao, Calyrex-I, and Zacian-C.

  • U-turn: U-turn is Incineroar's best move, allowing it to chip foes for decent damage while switching out to reset Intimidate and get a powerful partner in.

  • Bulldoze: Bulldoze can provide decent value in its speed control, enabling Incineroar to slow down foes before pivoting to a powerful and now faster attacker with U-turn.

  • Teammates: Incineroar fits on a variety of teams but pairs best with Calyrex-S and Flutter Mane, as it can check the Ghost-types that can threaten them, while in return, they can pivot into and threaten the Fighting-types that are particularly problematic for Incineroar, most notably Koraidon.

Other Options

  • Fake Out: Fake Out does small chip damage to foes for free, notably breaking Focus Sash and Sturdy on the likes of Chien-Pao and Ogerpon-C.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Very Situational: Incineroar only requires Terastallization in a pinch for difficult type matchups, as its regular typing is crucial to its defensive abilities, particularly handling Calyrex-S, and it can pivot out of bad type matchups with U-turn.

  • Water: Tera Water allows Incineroar to resist Water-type attacks, notably Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R, while giving it a generally strong defensive typing.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy provides a resistance to Fighting-type attacks like Close Combat from Koraidon, as well as an immunity to Draco Meteor from Miraidon.

  • Fire: Tera Fire bolsters Incineroar's damage output, allowing it to potentially OHKO Calyrex-S and Calyrex-I, while dropping its Fighting-type weakness.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD / 4 Def with Careful or Sassy: This spread maximizes Incineroar's special bulk to allow it to answer opposing threats much better, particularly letting it survive Electro Drift from Modest Tera Electric Choice Specs Miraidon the majority of the time. A Careful nature allows Incineroar to outspeed important threats in Speed-invested Ursaluna-B and Calyrex-I, while a Sassy nature allows it to pivot more slowly in mirror matches.

  • 252 HP / 212 Atk / 44 SpD with Adamant: This more offensive spread allows Incineroar to have a much greater offensive presence, notably OHKOing Flutter Mane and 2HKOing Calyrex-I with Flare Blitz, while still enabling it to take a Tera Blast Fighting from Choice Specs Calyrex-S.

Pivot.description:
• This set's write-up has not started yet, but here's some basic info to get you started!

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 SpD with Impish or Relaxed: Maximizing Defense gives Incineroar around a 90% chance of avoiding a 2HKO from Choice Band Chien-Pao's Sacred Sword. A lower Speed IV can be used to underspeed more threats, but this can be risky against Ursaluna-B.

  • 252 HP / 44 Def / 212 SpD with Careful or Sassy: When used with Sitrus Berry, this spread avoids a 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast.

Little Mermaid.description:
• With its great bulk, power, and typing, Primarina is a fantastic offensive and defensive presence in the BSS metagame.

  • Sparkling Aria: Sparkling Aria allows Primarina to get around Substitute attempts from foes like Garganacl that might try to stall out Moonblast.

  • Psychic Noise: Psychic Noise can allow Primarina to potentially muscle through walls such as Toxapex by preventing them from healing off its attacks. Additionally, it allows Primarina to better stand up to Ogerpon formes running Horn Leech as their Grass-type STAB move.

  • Energy Ball: Energy Ball provides Primarina with coverage to hit other Water-types, being particularly useful against Ogerpon-W and other Primarina.

  • Aqua Jet: Aqua Jet can allow Primarina to finish off weakened foes that might otherwise outspeed it, notably allowing Assault Vest variants to more consistently win the Flutter Mane matchup.

  • Flip Turn: Flip Turn allows Primarina to scout switches and provide safe entry for its teammates.

Other Options

  • Perish Song: If utilizing Choice Specs, Perish Song can allow Primarina to pressure foes that might otherwise wall it and disrupt attempts at Baton Pass use.

  • Tera Blast: If using Tera Fire, Tera Blast grants Primarina coverage to hit opposing Grass-types such as Serperior.

Items

  • Assault Vest: Assault Vest accentuates Primarina’s excellent special bulk, allowing it to more effectively trade hits with threats such as Flutter Mane.

  • Choice Specs: Choice Specs allows Primarina to more effectively leverage its fantastic STAB combination, turning it into a shockingly powerful wallbreaker.

EV Spreads

  • 180 HP / 252 SpA / 76 Spe with Modest: This spread maximizes power and bulk while allowing Primarina to keep pace with uninvested base 70 Pokemon like Wo-Chien.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependancy - Low: Primarina’s incredible base typing allows it to go head to head with many prominent metagame threats without needing to Terastallize.

  • Fire: Tera Fire grants Primarina important Grass, Fairy, and Steel resistances while maintaining its all important Ice resistance.

  • Poison: Tera Poison allows Primarina to deny Toxic attempts from the likes of Toxapex and Gliscor while still granting it a Fairy resistance.

  • Water: Tera Water grants an extra boost to Sparkling Aria while remaining a good defensive typing.

Calm Mind.description:
• This set's write-up has not started yet, but here's some basic info to get you started!

  • Psychic Noise and Liquid Voice: Liquid Voice turns Psychic Noise into a Water-type attack, giving up Sparkling Aria's power under Torrent in exchange for better match-ups against defensive Pokemon like Toxapex.

Focus Sash.description:
• Using a Focus Sash on Primarina may seem like a waste, but Primarina's high Special Attack, Sparkling Aria ignoring Substitute, and Torrent make it very tricky for offensive teams to check.

  • Aqua Jet: Despite it being weak, Aqua Jet's ability to pick off faster Focus Sash foes like Iron Bundle makes it essential.

  • Encore: Thanks to the Speed investment, this Primarina is especially good at catching normally faster, bulky Pokemon like Calm Mind Raging Bolt and Stamina Archaludon off guard.

  • Psychic Noise: Psychic Noise is Primarina's best option for shutting down Toxapex, Porygon2, and defensive Dragonite's walling capabilities, and it even punishes Horn Leech Ogerpon-H.

  • Energy Ball: Energy Ball improves Primarina's odds of winning mirror matches, and it deals more damage than anything else to Alomomola and Swampert.

  • Calm Mind: Calm Mind's boost lets Primarina potentially OHKO bulkier Assault Vest Ursaluna-B variants.

  • Speed EVs: Maximizing Primarina's Speed lets variants with a Modest nature outspeed up to Landorus-T with no Speed investment. While the power drop from Timid loses a guaranteed OHKO on offensive Ursaluna-B, it does let Primarina outspeed the rare but very dangerous Adamant Breloom.

Other Options

  • Icy Wind: Icy Wind's speed control comes in handy against defensive Dragon Dance Dragonite, but Primarina's low Speed makes it a lesser option.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Primarina will usually only Terastallize to improve its power or gain certain immunities, since Focus Sash makes this Pokemon rather disposable. Otherwise, it's best to leave Terastallization for other teammates.

  • Water: Tera Water's boost to Sparkling Aria makes it the easiest choice to recommend.

  • Stellar: Since Primarina rarely terastallizes anyways, Tera Stellar's flexibility can make sense for late-game sweeping scenarios.

  • Ground: Tera Ground saves Primarina from Electric-type attacks, with Raging Bolt and Tera Electric Chien-Pao being particularly good foes to flip.

  • Ghost: Despite Primarina's low Speed, most Extreme Speed Dragonite sets are slower than this set, letting Tera Ghost potentially ruin a revenge kill attempt.

Toxapex.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Return Of The Pex.description:
• Toxapex stands out as a masterful spreader of poison to support its teammates, and an effective bulky pivot against common foes like Urshifu-R as well.

  • Toxic: Toxic is the most reliable way to spread the deadliest version of poison and is especially effective against Taunt users like Annihilape and Serperior if using Mental Herb.

  • Toxic Spikes: Toxic Spikes makes the team less reliant on Toxapex to spread status directly, and acts as excellent support for stalling teammates like Ting-Lu, Dragonite and Gliscor.

  • Haze: Even with Toxapex's great bulk, powerful setup sweepers like Dragonite and Urshifu-S quickly get out of control for it, so Haze is the best solution to prevent Toxapex from being setup bait.

  • Liquidation versus Poison Jab: Liquidation isn't particularly strong but it allows Toxapex to 2HKO Chi-Yu and is a great option for breaking Substitute against targets like Flutter Mane. Poison Jab leaves Toxapex completely walled by Steel-types, but it does preform better against Water-types like Primarina and Ogerpon-W.

  • Baneful Bunker: If using Black Sludge or Leftovers, Baneful Bunker is a fantastic way to spread poison against physical attackers and get some extra recovery with one moveslot, but keep in mind that this won't work against Urshifu-R. It's also key for scouting dangerous uses of Trick from the likes of Gholdengo and Latios.

  • Physically Defensive versus Specially Defensive: Physically defensive Toxapex does well against some hard-to-check threats, such as Urshifu-R and Chien-Pao. Maximizing Special Defense on the other hand, almost always lets Toxapex survive Tera Normal Life Orb Ursaluna-B's Blood Moon.

Other Options

  • Infestation: Infestation is Toxapex's best chance of doing chip damage to Toxic-immune threats, such as Corviknignt and Gholdengo, and the trapping works fairly well against foes that do have problems with Toxic. It also prevents double switching from being an issue for Toxapex.

  • Chilling Water: Chilling Water gives Toxapex another tool against physical sweepers, but makes it much more vulnerable to Substitute in general.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: While Terastallization can help Toxapex beat a new set of threats, its bulk and good defensive typing usually makes it a rare occurrence compared to its teammates.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy removes all of Toxapex's weaknesses and can save it from taking massive damage from Chi-Yu's Dark Pulse. It also does well against powerful Dragon-type attacks such as Choice Band Dragonite's Outrage and Choice Specs Archaludon's Draco Meteor.

  • Grass: Tera Grass gives Toxapex an important Ground resistance while still preforming well against Urshifu-R, with the bonus of stopping Breloom's Spore.

  • Poison: Besides making Toxapex far less vulnerable to Electric, which Chien-Pao often Terastallizes into, Tera Poison retains the ability to restore health with Black Sludge.

  • Normal: While Normal isn't an impressive defensive type, Tera Normal can punish Choice locked Ghost-types, such as Flutter Mane and Gholdengo.

  • Bug: While the Stealth Rock weakness can be an issue, Tera Bug is a niche way to resist Ground-type attacks while being neutral to both Ice- and Electric-type moves, unlike other methods.

  • Flying: Tera Flying not only protects Toxapex from its irritating Ground-type weakness but also means Fissure Dondozo will no longer pressure Toxapex. However, this typing makes Toxapex much worse into general offense.

Items

  • Mental Herb: With Mental Herb providing one-time protection from Taunt, Toxapex can surprise foes like Annihilape and Serperior with Toxic, which is especially helpful if not running an attack. It also provides some cushioning against common Encore users like Dragonite and Primarina.

  • Black Sludge versus Leftovers: Having passive healing is wonderful, especially with Baneful Bunker. Black Sludge is a clever way to get around Item Clause, but Leftovers gives Toxapex less drawback when using Tera types that aren't Poison.

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet makes Toxapex a superb response to Choice Scarf Urshifu-R, and generally lets it punish common users of contact moves like Chien-Pao and Urshifu-S.

Mimikyu.overview: This Pokemon has been updated for the return of the Regulation G format and its powerful restricted threats!

Trick Scarf.description:
• Mimikyu might seem like an odd user of Choice Scarf with its low offenses, but with Trick and Disguise, it becomes a very disruptive Pokemon.

  • Play Rough: Play Rough is the best single attack option, as it has no defensive immunities and can hit frail attackers like Chien-Pao hard.

  • Curse: Curse let's Mimikyu further disrupt Pokemon after using Trick, or can be used as an emergency way to stop a sweeper while still holding Choice Scarf.

  • Destiny Bond: Mimikyu's good Speed makes it a good option for making trades with Destiny Bond, especially against Restricted Pokemon. Mimikyu can even surprise normally faster targets by using it with Choice Scarf.

  • Using a neutral Nature with a mint: Mimikyu should have a neutral nature with the appropriate Mint used on it. This way, Mimikyu can't be confused by eating any Berry after using Trick.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: This Mimikyu's supportive nature means it'll only Terastallize under specific conditions.

  • Normal: Tera Normal is particularly useful for catching Calyrex-S off guard, potentially preventing the start of a Grim Neigh sweep.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy gives enough of a boost to Play Rough to OHKO Chien-Pao while also resisting Sucker Punch.

  • Stellar: Tera Stellar works best for keeping the right Curse typing as well as giving a one time boost to Play Rough.

Swords Dance.description:
• While not as strong versus restricted Pokemon, Mimikyu is still a decent revenge killer and sweeper in Battle Stadium Singles, being particularly apt at revenge killing Calyrex-S and Flutter Mane with Shadow Sneak if Terastallization is not available.

  • Shadow Claw: While not a particularly powerful STAB, Shadow Claw is Mimikyu's most reliable attack against targets such as Ogerpon-H.

  • Curse: Curse gives Mimikyu an out against particularly bulky foes like Dondozo, albeit at the expense of its own survivability.

  • Adamant versus Jolly: Adamant is usually preferred over Jolly for maximum power, as many targets close to Mimikyu's Speed bracket often don't run full Speed.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Terastallization can clinch in some key win conditions in certain situations, but Mimikyu functions perfectly fine without it.

  • Stellar: Tera Stellar can grant the extra edge Mimikyu needs to close out fights.

  • Normal: Tera Normal can even the playing field against the dreaded Calyrex-S.

  • Ghost: The extra damage on Shadow Sneak gives Mimikyu better overall cleaning potential.

Curse Stall.description:
• The combination of Curse, Substitute, and Pain Split can be devastating against key defensive Pokemon such as Dondozo.
