  • Play Rough: Play Rough is the most consistent single attack option due to having no immunities, and does well against the large amount of Dark-type and Dragon-type Pokemon like Koraidon, Miraidon, Chien-Pao, and Ting-Lu.

  • Thunder Wave: The chance of full paralysis can be devastating for opposing teams, potentially making Mimikyu even harder to break.

  • EV Spread: This bulkier EV spread gives Mimikyu an odd HP number that it can take advantage of if it uses Curse without its Disguise being broken, letting it use Curse again without KOing itself the next turn or using Substitute twice after using Curse. The rest is placed in Defense to wall top physical sweepers as best as possible.

Items

  • Bright Powder: While not particularly reliable, even one miss against Mimikyu can be devastating!

  • Figy Berry: Figy Berry and its other counterparts give Mimikyu another method of healing after using Substitute enough times.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: This Mimikyu rarely Terastallizes, as it needs to keep the damaging effect of Curse at almost all times.

  • Normal: Tera Normal can help prevent Calyrex-S from going unchecked, buying a turn to gain extra Curse damage or to land Thunder Wave.

  • Fairy: Terastallizing this Mimikyu for extra damage output is fairly situational, but getting a bit of extra power can help late game.

Do Not Touch! (Rocky Helmet + Curse).description:
• By combining Disguise with Rocky Helmet and Curse, Mimikyu can quickly overwhelm physical attackers like Koraidon and Zacian-C with enormous passive damage.

  • Endure versus Protect: Endure not only stalls turns for additional Curse damage but also allows physical attackers to make contact and take additional Rocky Helmet damage. It also has an advantage over Protect in that it isn't bypassed by the Urshifu formes, making it particularly dangerous to Urshifu-R that lack Punching Glove. On the other hand, Protect can block pivoting moves that would otherwise reset Curse, and it's generally better at stalling out effects such as Terrains and Trick Room.

  • Thunder Wave: Thunder Wave is a good fallback that can permanently cripple targets, especially those that don't fear Rocky Helmet.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Mimikyu already has the tools it needs to perform its role without Terastallization. On the rare occasion that Terastallization is used, keep in mind that any Tera type that sheds Mimikyu's Ghost typing will remove Curse's damaging effect.

  • Stellar: Tera Stellar provides a good one-time boost on the rare occasions it's needed while maintaining Mimikyu's original typing.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost keeps Mimikyu's most important typing for Curse while powering up Shadow Sneak.

  • Ground: Tera Ground, particularly when it's used late-game, can cause big issues for Choice item Miraidon.

  • Normal: Tera Normal's Ghost-type immunity is great for gaining extra turns against Calyrex-S's Astral Barrage.

  • Water: Tera Water allows Mimikyu to survive Tera Water Surging Strikes from Choice Band Urshifu-R, potentially forcing it to take even more Rocky Helmet chip damage. It is also strong against Koraidon's Flare Blitz.

  • Steel: Tera Steel is a more niche option that makes it easier to cushion Zacian-C and rack up additional damage.

EV Spreads

  • Odd HP Number: Though the situation rarely comes up, an odd HP number is desirable so that Mimikyu can use Curse twice from full health.

  • 12 Speed EVs: Because Mimikyu is only 1 base Speed point lower than Urshifu, it is not uncommon to redistribute some EVs from Attack into Speed to outspeed bulky Urshifu. 12 Speed EVs is the minimum needed, though further investment is recommended, since even bulky Urshifu formes will bump their Speed by a few points.

  • 228 HP / 252 Atk / 20 Def / 4 SpD / 4 Spe with Adamant: This EV spread survives Adamant Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash after Disguise has been broken. The HP investment is also optimized to reduce residual damage from the likes of Stealth Rock.

  • 148 HP / 196 Atk / 164 Def with Adamant: The extra physical bulk now allows Mimikyu to survive Adamant Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash after both Stealth Rock damage and a Disguise break. If Disguise is still active, it almost always survives against Adamant Punching Glove Urshifu-R's Tera Water Surging Strikes.

  • 228 HP / 28 Atk / 252 Def with Impish: Full physical bulk can help Mimikyu live a little longer against threats like Assault Vest Koraidon that lack Flare Blitz. The HP investment is optimized to reduce residual damage from sources like Stealth Rock. The leftover EVs are put into Attack.

Trick Room Support.description:
• Thanks to Disguise, Mimikyu is a very consistent Trick Room setter.

  • Curse: Curse is used as a way to sacrifice Mimikyu and safely bring in a Trick Room sweeper.

  • Will-O-Wisp: Will-O-Wisp can cripple attackers that have already set up prior to deploying Trick Room. Disguise helps cover the fact that Mimikyu is using a slower Will-O-Wisp, but be wary of Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R.

Items

  • Rocky Helmet: While dealing damage isn't this set's focus, Rocky Helmet is still useful for wearing down bulky physical attackers like Koraidon and Urshifu-R that might otherwise pose problems for common Trick Room sweepers.

  • Mental Herb: Mental Herb foils Taunt usage meant to stop Mimikyu from setting Trick Room.

  • Life Orb: Life Orb allows Mimikyu to function better as a secondary attacker, especially when the opponent is trying to stall out Trick Room.

  • Covert Cloak: Covert Cloak is for targets that rely on flinching to stop Mimikyu, such as Icicle Crash Chien-Pao.

  • Ability Shield: Ability Shield can stop Moongeist Beam Lunala and Mold Breaker Ogerpon-H from knocking out Mimikyu through Disguise.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Mimikyu usually wants to keep its original typing, both for maintaining Curse's Ghost-type effect and for the Scale Shot immunity versus Koraidon and Dragonite.

  • Stellar: Tera Stellar keeps all the benefits of Mimikyu's superior typing while giving a little extra offensive power.

  • Normal: Tera Normal's Ghost-type immunity helps Mimikyu control momentum against Calyrex-S.

  • Water: Tera Water combined with Rocky Helmet can cause fits for the likes of Flare Blitz Koraidon and Surging Strikes Urshifu-R.

EV Spreads

  • 0 Speed IV with a Relaxed or Brave Nature: Mimikyu generally wants the slowest Speed possible for moving first in Trick Room. The main disadvantage to this Speed outside of Trick Room is not being able to outrun uninvested Dragonite. If Mimikyu is running standard uninvested Speed, use an Impish or Adamant nature instead.

  • 228 HP EVs: All spreads below optimize HP to take as little damage as possible from sources like Stealth Rock and Disguise breaks.

  • 228 HP / 28 Atk / 252 Def with Relaxed: Focusing on physical bulk makes it so that even Tera Water Choice Band Urshifu-R will struggle to OHKO Mimikyu. It also survives Adamant Scizor's Bullet Punch even after accounting for Stealth Rock damage and a Disguise break.

  • 228 HP / 252 Atk / 28 Def with Brave: This spread gives Mimikyu a much better offensive presence for when it's needed. Enough physical bulk is maintained to survive Adamant Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash after Disguise is broken.

Trick Room.description:
• With a better defensive typing that in particular allows for a more favorable matchup against Zacian-C and the ability to bypass Unaware, Necrozma-DM is a viable alternative to Calyrex-I as a Trick Room sweeper.

  • Photon Geyser: Photon Geyser is Necrozma-DM's most indispensable STAB move that offers the widest neutral coverage. Thanks to its Mold Breaker property, a boosted Necrozma-DM can cleave through Pokemon with Unaware like Dondozo and Skeledirge as well as ignore abilities like Mimikyu's Disguise and Dragonite's Multiscale.

  • Sunsteel Strike: Sunsteel Strike is another powerful ability-ignoring STAB move that does huge damage to Tera Fairy Pokemon especially. However, running both STAB moves has the downside of being resisted by Steel-types.

  • Earthquake: Earthquake is good complementary coverage that can be used to hit Steel-type foes like Scizor and Archaludon that can take Necrozma-DM's STAB attacks.

  • Swords Dance: Swords Dance raises Necrozma-DM's already high Attack to extraordinary heights and allows it to rip through teams.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: With its naturally good bulk fortified even more by its ability Prism Armor, Necrozma-DM can survive many super effective hits, but there are times when Terastallization will be needed to survive especially powerful attacks.

  • Water: Tera Water is the clear premium Tera type, as it is a generally solid defensive typing that critically affords Necrozma-DM a resistance to powerful Fire-type moves from threats like Koraidon.

  • Ground: Tera Ground should be used with Earthquake to give Necrozma-DM a STAB boost and also has the benefit of nullifying Miraidon's devastating Electric-type attacks. Blocking paralysis from Thunder Wave is an additional benefit that potentially provides a free turn of setup.

  • Dragon: Tera Dragon is an alternative defensive Tera type to Water that grants Necrozma-DM a resistance to both Koraidon's Fire-type moves and Miraidon's Electric-type moves as well as both of Ogerpon-H's STAB moves. However, it may leave Necrozma-DM vulnerable to Chien-Pao's Ice Shard.

Items

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry is a good choice that provides Necrozma-DM with pinch healing, keeping it healthy enough to set up or continue a sweep.

  • Lum Berry: Lum Berry helps protect Necrozma-DM against status conditions from moves like Yawn and Will-o-Wisp that foes may use to try to slow it down.

  • Weakness Policy: With its good defensive stats, Prism Armor, and common weaknesses, Necrozma-DM is one of the best users of Weakness Policy. If it is activated on the turn Necrozma-DM sets up Trick Room, then it can start sweeping immediately!

EV Spreads

  • 0 Speed IV with a Brave nature: This makes Necrozma-DM as slow as possible to function most optimally under Trick Room. However, even with minimum Speed, it will never be able to underspeed Ursaluna-B or anything slower than that.

  • 31 Speed IV with an Adamant nature: In light of the awkward Speed tier mentioned above, Necrozma-DM can opt to forgo minimum Speed. With this adjustment, Necrozma-DM can outspeed defensive foes in the base 60-70 Speed range, such as Skeledirge, Scizor, and Corvinight, outside of Trick Room. If Necrozma-DM is not using minimum Speed, it is important to be mindful of the timing of Trick Room when facing foes in that Speed range!

  • 244 HP / 228 Atk / 36 Def with Brave or Adamant: This spread maximizes Necrozma-DM's bulk and Attack while ensuring it is guaranteed to survive one unboosted Astral Barrage from Timid Calyrex-S as well as giving it a very high chance of surviving Adamant Tera Water Choice Band Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes, without requiring a defensive Tera type in either case.

Rillaboom.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Offensive.description:
• Rillaboom’s physical stats, Grassy Surge, and decently powerful priority give it a unique niche over Ogerpon-H.

  • U-turn: Rillaboom is a fairly good pivot, especially when paired with teammates that love Grassy Terrain support like Raging Bolt and Grassy Seed Sneasler.

  • Drum Beating versus Wood Hammer: A secondary Grass-type attack can be considered for extra power. Drum Beating's speed control can help incoming teammates, while Wood Hammer's high Base Power combined with the Terrain Boost can OHKO threats such as Chien-Pao, Flutter Mane, and Ursaluna-B.

  • High Horsepower: While Knock Off will deal more initial damage against Gholdengo, High Horsepower deals more damage afterwards against particularly bulky Gholdengo, and is Rillaboom's best attack against bulky Fire-types like Gouging Fire and Incineroar.

  • Tera Blast: Tera Blast can be a big commitment, but the ability to flip several important matchups can be worth it, especially if it supports incoming teammates.

  • Assault Vest versus Choice Band: Assault Vest is best for making Rillaboom a bulky offensive support Pokemon, letting it take on powerful special attackers like Flutter Mane and Ursaluna-B more effectively. Choice Band is more independent and relies much more on pivoting, but it makes Rillaboom an awesome revenge killer that strikes fear into the heart of all but very bulky Flutter Mane!

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Rillaboom generally wants to save Tera for a teammate, but many poor matchups can be turned around with Terastallization when needed.

  • Fire: Tera Fire grants a Fairy resistance alongside Fire and Ice resistances for Ogerpon-H and Chien-Pao, as well as protection from burn spreaders like Entei. However, this comes at the expense of no longer being able to defensively check Urshifu-R.

  • Rock: Tera Rock can flip the script on Extreme Speed Dragonite, Ogerpon-H, and Gouging Fire by resisting their best attack and retaliating with big damage from Tera Blast.

  • Grass: Tera Grass makes Grassy Glide even more effective at sniping foes, with Assault Vest Rillaboom now being able to OHKO offensive Urshifu-R.

  • Ice: Tera Ice is a poor defensive type outside of the Iron Bundle matchup, but with Tera Blast, it's Rillaboom’s most powerful option for hitting Dragonite and Landorus-T.

  • Water: Tera Water provides a balanced defensive profile, giving Rillaboom Ice and Fire resistances while maintaining its matchup into Urshifu-R.

Alternate EV Spreads

  • 140 HP / 148 Atk / 4 Def / 156 SpD / 60 Spe with Adamant: With Assault Vest and Grassy Surge recovery, this spread avoids the 2HKO from Iron Bundle's Freeze-Dry without having to Terastallize. The Speed investment lets Rillaboom outrun Jolly Garchomp after a single Drum Beating.

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe with Adamant or Jolly: Severely compromising Rillaboom's bulk is risky, but outspeeding Modest or Timid Gholdengo depending on the nature used can be a big surprise when using Choice Band Rillaboom.

Grassy Dance.description:
• Grassy Seed turns Rillaboom into a bulky late-game sweeper, particularly one that can stand up to the dreaded Basculegion!

  • Acrobatics: Acrobatics pairs excellently with Grassy Seed's instant usage and is Rillaboom's strongest option against Dragonite if not using Tera Blast.

  • Tera Blast: While it mandates using Tera on Rillaboom, Tera Blast is a great option for expanding Rillaboom's shallow offensive coverage.

EV Spreads

  • 12 HP EVs and Grassy Seed: Thanks to the Defense boost from Grassy Seed, it only takes 12 HP EVs to guarantee that non-Terastallized Rillaboom will survive Adamant Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash!

  • 140 HP / 252 Atk / 12 Def / 92 SpD / 12 Spe: This EV spread avoids the OHKO from Modest Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast as well as the 2HKO (or OHKO if Tera Rock) from both Urshifu formes' Close Combat. The HP EVs help Rillaboom get the most efficient recovery out of Grassy Terrain. Finally, thek given Speed EVs let Rillaboom outrun up to paralyzed Dragapult.

  • 12 HP / 244 Atk / 252 Spe: An offensive spread still works well with Grassy Seed, and the investment in Speed lets Rillaboom outrun Modest Gholdengo, Adamant Dragonite, and Jolly Breloom.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium / High: Terastallization is often needed to help Rillaboom get going, either by taking attacks from would-be counters or blowing through key matchups with Tera Blast.

  • Fire: Tera Fire lets Rillaboom defend against Chien-Pao's and Ogerpon-H's best attacks simultaneously. It also works great alongside Grassy Surge, reducing Earthquake's damage back to neutral levels.

  • Rock: Tera Rock with Tera Blast gives Rillaboom a well-rounded matchup into Dragonite, allowing it to deal super effective damage while also resisting Extreme Speed. Earthquake is less of a problem too thanks to Grassy Terrain!

  • Ice: Tera Ice is used offensively with Tera Blast to blindside targets like Dragonite and Landorus-T. While it is lacking defensively, it does still give Rillaboom a useful Ice resistance versus Chien-Pao.

  • Grass: Tera Grass is a bit more unorthodox, but the boost to Grassy Glide gives Rillaboom more immediate revenge killing power.

Corviknight.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Pivot Knight.description:
• Corviknight's fantastic typing makes it a great physically defensive pivot, easily getting dangerous teammates in such as Chien-Pao, Flutter Mane, and Ogerpon-H in.

  • Body Press versus Iron Head: Body Press has decent damage output and helps massively against common Dark-types like Chien-Pao and Urshifu-S. Meanwhile, Iron Head ensures that Corviknight will not be walled by Flutter Mane.

  • Taunt: Corviknight might not be fast, but it's fast enough to shut down most other defensive Pokemon with Taunt, such as Ting-Lu and Toxapex.

  • Brave Bird: Brave Bird's recoil is unwelcome, but it's a fantastic response against Ogerpon-H, who otherwise will scare Corviknight off.

  • Neutral Speed Natures versus Negative Speed Natures with a Speed IV of 4 or 5: Negative Speed natures are handy for giving very slow U-turns when used in conjunction with lower Speed IVs, as well as not risking getting hit by Ursaluna-B's Earth Power while using Roost. Just note that going any lower than 4 Speed IVs will underspeed Ting-Lu before it can be shut down by Taunt, and powerful Special attackers like Primarina outspeeding Corviknight can be a problem for some teams.

Other Options
  • Tailwind: Tailwind is an incredible support move for making powerful sweepers like Urshifu-R even more difficult to revenge kill, though its short time span can make it tricky to fully take advantage of.
Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Corviknight's defensive typing is fantastic, so don't Terastallize too hastily, or else it'll lose to threats it normally checks.

  • Dragon: Dragon and Fairy weaknesses are devastating, but in the late-game, resisting Electric and Fire can give Corviknight new win conditions against foes such as Ogerpon-H that lack Play Rough and Tera Water Urshifu-R. Just note that Modest Tera Fire Choice Specs Chi-Yu can still OHKO with Overheat.

  • Fire: Tera Fire may not seem like a good fit for a pivot due to the Stealth Rock weakness, but it vastly improves Corviknight's chances of defeating Ogerpon-H and Tera Electric Chien-Pao, making it a worthy defensive choice. Do note that this won't help much against Choice Specs Chi-Yu.

  • Flying: While this set doesn't always use Brave Bird, Tera Flying lets Corviknight keep its typing while using Roost, meaning Earthquake and Fissure can no longer hit Corviknight while its restoring health. It also improves Corviknight's chances against Ogerpon-H.

  • Water: With Tera Water, Corviknight consistently survives all but Modest Tera Fire Choice Specs Chi-Yu's Overheat, letting it deal serious damage with Body Press. It also gains a key resistance to Ice for Chien-Pao and Water for Tera Water Urshifu-R.

  • Fighting: Getting STAB on Body Press can give Corviknight a surprisingly decent chance at cleaning weakened teams, though this makes it especially vulnerable to Flutter Mane.

  • Electric: While turning Corviknight's incredible Ground-type immunity into a weakness is unfortunate, Tera Electric otherwise improves a wide variety of match-ups, with Tera Electric Chien-Pao and Raging Bolt being particularly major ones.

Items

  • Rocky Helmet: This lets Corviknight wear down physical threats more quickly while pivoting.

  • Leftovers: Leftovers's consistent recovery can be quite helpful for taking repeated hits from Ruination when attempting to stall it out with Pressure.

Abilities

  • Mirror Armor: Mirror Armor's ability to punish Flutter Mane for using Mystical Fire makes it a great ability choice on Corviknight.

  • Pressure: Corviknight's excellent bulk and Taunt makes Pressure a good alternative for stalling out foes such as Gliscor and Ting-Lu.

Alternate EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 76 Def / 180 SpD with Impish or Relaxed This spread has enough bulk to avoid a 2HKO from Timid Iron Bundle's Hydro Pump as long as they lack an offensive item, which can be especially useful if using Pressure. Just beware of Iron Bundle's Encore.

  • 252 HP / 20 Def / 236 SpD with Careful or Sassy: This specially defensive spread won't check major physical threats like Dragonite nearly as well, but it does avoid a 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball.

IronPress.description:
• Corviknight stands out as one of the best choices around for sweeping with Iron Defense and Body Press, thanks to its excellent typing and Roost.

  • Iron Head versus Brave Bird: Iron Head ensures Flutter Mane isn't a reliable check to Corviknight, in addition to making it an even better Swords Dance Mimikyu check. Brave Bird is less reliable at beating Flutter Mane, but severely punishes Ogerpon-H switch-ins.

  • U-turn versus Taunt: While U-turn with this set may seem strange, Corviknight is still a decent pivot even if it must give up Taunt. Just note that this keaves Corviknight completely walled by Ghost-types like Flutter Mane. Taunt on the other hand, lets Corviknight effectively shut down slower defensive Pokemon, such as Ting-Lu and Dondozo. Note that both options leave Corviknight hopelessly walled by Flutter Mane.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Corviknight has a fantastic defensive typing, so only Terastallize if you need to win certain matchups, especially since it becomes vulnerable to Toxic.

  • Fighting: With a Fighting Tera type, Body Press is easier to sweep with, with many Ting-Lu variants now being 2HKOed by boosted Body Press. It also gets rid of enough of Corviknight's common weaknesses that foes like Ogerpon-H and Raging Bolt will check Corviknight far less reliably.

  • Water: Tera Water gives Corviknight a way to resist both Chien-Pao's and Chi-Yu's most powerful STAB attacks, though Modest Tera Fire Choice Specs Chi-Yu can still OHKO with Overheat. It also stops Tera Water Urshifu-R from cleaving through Corviknight's Iron Defense with Surging Strikes.

  • Dragon: A Dragon Tera type lets Corviknight resist common attacks aimed at it, such as Electric- and Fire-type attacks from foes like Raging Bolt and Ogerpon-H respectively. However, the new weaknesses to Fairy and Dragon make this an especially reactive Terastallization.

  • Fire: While Tera Fire leaves Corviknight extremely vulnerable to Urshifu-R, in exchange it retains the important Fairy-type resistance and does well against Ogerpon-H.

  • Flying: A Flying Tera type lets Corviknight retain its Flying typing even when using Roost, making it a more reliable check to Fissure users such as Dondozo and Garganacl.

Items

  • Rocky Helmet: The passive damage from Rocky Helmet against foes like Dragonite give Corviknight a much easier time using U-turn over Iron Head.

  • Sitrus Berry versus Leftovers: Since this Corviknight attempts to sweep, Sitrus Berry's burst of quick recovery can make it less pressured to spend a turn using Roost. Leftovers on the other hand, will still keep healing Corviknight even after being hit by Ruination, so it can make sense with Pressure.

  • Maranga Berry: A Special Defense boost granted from Maranga Berry makes it far more difficult for foes like Flutter Mane to revenge kill Corviknight, and it can even be paired with Terastallization to defeat Raging Bolt!

  • Covert Cloak: When paired with Taunt, Covert Cloak makes Corviknight an effective Garganacl check provided that it isn't Tera Ghost, though note Corviknight will no longer drop Flutter Mane's Special Attack with Mirror Armor.

Abilities

  • Mirror Armor: Mirror Armor means Flutter Mane can't use Mystical Fire without getting its Special Attack dropped, unless Corviknight is holding Covert Cloak.

  • Pressure: Corviknight's ability to take powerful, low PP moves such as Close Combat after Iron Defense makes Pressure a viable alternative, in addition to giving Corviknight a better chance of dealing with Ruination from Ting-Lu effectively.

Alternate EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 76 Def / 180 SpD with Impish The Special Defense investment stops Iron Bundle from 2HKOing Corviknight with Hydro Pump, especially useful if revenge killing one with Body Press. Just remember that Encore means Corviknight is still vulnerable to Iron Bundle ruining set up attempts.

  • 252 HP / 20 Def / 236 SpD with Careful: While Body Press will be significantly weaker on this specially defensive spread, it does avoid a 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball, making this spread especially effective with Iron Head and Mirror Armor.

Bulk Up.description:
• With Bulk Up giving an Attack boost, Corviknight is free from having to use Body Press for good damage output, making it easier to run Taunt against defensive foes without fear of being walled by Ghost-types like Flutter Mane.

  • Iron Head versus Brave Bird: Iron Head reliably 2HKOs Chien-Pao without a boost and is a fantastic tool against Flutter Mane, while Brave Bird is a great response against Ogerpon-H and the only hope of 2HKOing Chi-Yu.

  • Physically Defensive versus Specially Defensive: Physically Defensive Corviknight takes on common Pokemon like Dragon Dance Dragonite and Urshifu-R more comfortably, while focusing on Special Defense stops Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane from 2HKOing Corviknight with Shadow Ball.

Other Options
  • Power Trip: Power Trip takes several boosts to get powerful, but it's Corviknight's best shot at dealing decent damage to Gholdengo. It also makes Corviknight a viable option on Baton Pass Blaziken teams, especially since it relies less on Terastallization to defeat Dark-types than Latias.
Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Remember that most of Corviknight's good Tera types leave it vulnerable to Toxic, so Terastallize carefully and only win a win condition is clear.

  • Water: Tera Water is an effective tool against Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu, though note that Choice Specs Chi-Yu can OHKO with Tera Fire boosted Overheat. It also prevents Urshifu-R from revenge killing Corviknight with Tera-boosted Surging Strikes.

  • Flying: This Tera type lets Corviknight retain its Flying typing while using Roost, meaning Fissure users such as Dondozo are much easier to handle, and giving Brave Bird a healthy boost in power.

  • Dragon: Once Fairy-, Ice-, and Dragon-types are out of the way, the Dragon Tera type allows Corviknight to turn the tables on most Ogerpon-H.

  • Fire: There are few better Tera-types to use against Ogerpon-H than Tera Fire, which unlike Tera Dragon, will retain an important Fairy resistance. It does make Urshifu-R a huge problem as a drawback.

  • Dark: If using Power Trip, Tera Dark is highly recommended to boost its damage output.

Abilities

  • Mirror Armor: In addition to punishing Flutter Mane for using Mystical Fire when not using Covert Cloak, Mirror Armor stops pivoting Intimidate foes like Landorus-T and Incineroar from softening Corviknight's damage output.

  • Pressure: Pressure is a reasonable alternative for whittling down PP, which can be especially helpful against Ting-Lu's troublesome Ruination.

Items

  • Covert Cloak: When paired with Taunt, Corviknight can effectively take down Garganacl.

  • Sitrus Berry versus Leftovers: Sitrus Berry is preferred due to the quicker burst of recovery better fitting a sweeper, but Leftovers can work very well with Pressure in an attempt to out-stall Ruination.

  • Maranga Berry: Maranga Berry's Special Defense boost can stop Special Attacking foes like Flutter Mane from 2HKOing physically defensive Corviknight.

Grimmsnarl.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Defensive Pivot.description:
• This set's write-up has not started yet, but here's some basic info to get you started!

  • 244 HP / 252 Def / 12 SpD with Impish: This spread avoids a OHKO from Timid Choice Specs Iron Bundle.

  • 236 HP / 4 Atk / 252 Def / 12 SpD / 4 Spe with Adamant: This spread sacrifices some physical bulk in exchange for KOing Chien-Pao with Fake Out + Spirit Break. It also survives Timid Choice Specs Iron Bundle from full health.

Dual Screens.description:
• With Prankster and the movepool to use it, Grimmsnarl is a good alternative to Alolan Ninetales for setting up dual screens, useful for setting up dangerous sweepers such as Dragonite or Urshifu-R.

  • Parting Shot: Parting Shot is not only useful for dropping stats, but the pivoting action can let Grimmsnarl come in later to set up screens if it's in a bad matchup.

  • Thunder Wave: This is a reasonable alternative for crippling fast foes that may be problematic for sweeps.

  • Taunt: Taunt shuts down phazers and opposing Taunts that could stop the dual screens from being set up.

  • Spirit Break versus Foul Play: Hitting foes like Chien-Pao and Urshifu-S makes Spirit Break a good offensive move. Alternatively, Foul Play is notable for breaking Gholdengo's Substitute and punishing physical setup sweepers like Dragonite.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Very Low: This Grimmsnarl should almost never Terastallize, since it's trying to support sweepers rather than deal serious damage on its own.

  • Steel: Tera Steel protects Grimmsnarl against Fairy-type attacks in the extremely rare event that it needs to Terastallize against Flutter Mane in the late-game.

  • Fire: Tera Fire provides both a resistance to Flutter Mane's Moonblast and Ogerpon-H's Ivy Cudgel in the rare event Terastallization is needed.

Indeedee.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Terrain Setter.description:
• Indeedee-M's Psychic Surge sets up powerful allies like Psychic Seed Sneasler and Expanding Force Iron Crown.

  • Dazzling Gleam: While generally weak, Dazzling Gleam is the best way to pressure Dark-types like Chien-Pao and Roaring Moon that are immune to Expanding Force.

  • Encore: Encore helps prevent Indeedee-M from getting set up on while also creating openings for its teammates.

  • Shadow Ball: Shadow Ball is almost exclusively for hitting Gholdengo, which can otherwise be troublesome for common Indeedee-M cores.

  • Healing Wish: Healing Wish is used less for its healing and more for its ability to pivot teammates in safely though at the cost of Indeedee-M itself.

  • Terrain Preservation: Targets such as Ice Spinner Urshifu-R and Grassy Surge Rillaboom can remove Indeedee-M's terrain. For this reason, it is sometimes better to lead with a teammate that can scout for these threats.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Common partners like Sneasler tend to be far more Terastallization hungry than Indeedee-M, so it should be preserved outside of fringe cases.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy turns Indeedee-M's Dark- and Bug-type weaknesses into resistances while giving Dazzling Gleam a nice boost.

  • Psychic: Tera Psychic is a simple offensive option, pushing Expanding Force's power even farther.

  • Stellar: Tera Stellar lets Indeedee-M diversify its offensive profile, such as making it easier to 2HKO semi-bulky Gholdengo with Shadow Ball.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 76 Def / 180 Spe with Timid: This bulky EV spread survives Ursaluna-B's Blood Moon and almost always survives Adamant Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash and Adamant Landorus-T's Earthquake. The Speed EVs outspeed Adamant Urshifu formes and Modest Iron Crown.

  • 12 HP / 44 Def / 196 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Timid: This offensive EV spread avoids the OHKO from defensive Landorus-T's Earthquake. It goes less bulky, however, because it wants to be OHKOed by Jolly Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash; this helps secure the most turns of Psychic Terrain possible for teammates.

Choice Scarf Support.description:
• This set's write-up has not started yet, but here's some basic info to get you started!

  • Support Moves: Encore is generally best used if also using Trick. It's even possible to use all 3 support moves at the cost of a decent matchup against Urshifu-S.

Dragapult.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out the format page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Physical Attacker.description:
• Dragapult's blistering Speed makes it a very effective hit-and-run attacker.

  • Phantom Force: This is risky due to the two turns making Dragapult vulnerable to Normal-types and surprise Terastallization, but it still makes an effective late-game cleaning move.

  • Sucker Punch: Despite Dragapult's dynamite Speed stat, Sucker Punch still makes sense to pick off common Choice Scarf holders like Gholdengo, and play around priority from other foes.

  • Shadow Ball: With a Naive nature, Shadow Ball is an easy way to 2HKO Gholdengo, Flutter Mane, and incoming Skeledirge.

Other Options
  • Dragon Dance: Dragon Dance is fairly difficult to set up without Focus Sash, and it can lead to coverage issues. That being said, outspeeding Pokemon that commonly have their Speed boosted via an item, such as Flutter Mane, Gholdengo, and Iron Bundle, can lead to surprising win conditions.
Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Dragapult's cleaning capabilities are improved quite a bit by Terastallization, though it doesn't need to rely on it to be functional.

  • Dragon: Boosting the power of Dragon Darts makes Dragapult very effective at shredding through Focus Sash Pokemon such as Chien-Pao, in addition to removing the annoying Sucker Punch weakness.

  • Steel: Steel has a fantastic synergy with Dragapult's former typing, giving it a far better match-up against foes such as Flutter Mane, Iron Bundle, and Mimikyu.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost is notable for letting Dragapult use a less risky STAB move in Tera Blast.

  • Fire: Tera Fire gives a valuable Fairy-type resistance and is a more powerful tool against Steel-types at the cost of a Stealth Rock weakness.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy's Dragon-type immunity can help win Tera wars against foes like Garchomp, Great Tusk, and Roaring Moon.

  • Fighting: Tera Fighting vastly improves Dragapult's match-up against Kingambit, Chi-Yu, Chien-Pao, and Choice Scarf Meowscarada.

Items

  • Choice Band: Choice Band guarantees that Breloom is OHKOed through its Focus Sash with Dragon Darts, and gives a 75% shot to the same happening to Chien-Pao.

  • Life Orb: Life Orb makes Sucker Punch a less risky option.

  • Focus Sash: Dragaoult's bulk isn't terrible, but Focus Sash will save it from the huge amount of top tier Pokemon that are capable of OHKOing it, such as Chien-Pao, Chi-Yu, and Gholdengo.

  • Choice Scarf: This may seem like overkill, but Choice Scarf gives Dragapult the edge over Booster Energy users such as Iron Bundle, Roaring Moon, and Flutter Mane, and other Choice Scarf foes such Gholdengo.

Special Attacker.description:
• Despite the lower offensive stat, the higher base power of Dragapult's special attacks makes it a serious threat.

  • Thunderbolt: Thunderbolt is the recommended coverage move for hitting Corviknight and Dondozo hard.

  • U-turn: Even though it's weak, U-turn is a reasonable consideration for pivoting and breaking Mimikyu's Disguise.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: While Dragapult can use Terastallization to surprise its checks, the high power of Draco Meteor and good coverage Shadow Ball provides mean it isn't reliant on it to function.

  • Dragon: Tera Dragon makes Draco Meteor nearly impossible to wall without a resistance, with even specially defensive Ting-Lu taking nearly 50% from it!

  • Fire: The Fairy-type resistance and powerful Flamethrower can make the Stealth Rock weakness worth it.

  • Steel: Tera Steel covers much of Dragapult's common weaknesses, and gives it a good Tera Blast to use against Fairy-types.

  • Ghost: Powering up Shadow Ball is perfect for cleaning up late-game, with only Normal-types and bulky resistances such as Ting-Lu, Wo-Chien, and Garganacl taking it well.

  • Fighting: The resistance to Sucker Punch Tera Fighting provides can be key in stopping Chien-Pao and Kingambit.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy improves Dragapult's match-up against other Dragon-types, Great Tusk, and resists Chien-Pao's Sucker Punch.

Bulky Status.description:
• With usable bulk bolstered by Will-O-Wisp, this Dragapult can severely punish its weaker offensive checks, and surprise common users of Sucker Punch such as Kingambit and Chien-Pao.

  • Disable and Substitute: Disable makes Dragapult rely on Will-O-Wisp for Normal-types, but when combined with Substitute, it defeats Choice-locked foes and those that rely on one specific move to beat Dragapult.

  • Draco Meteor: Draco Meteor improves Dragapult against other Dragon-types, such as Dragonite and Garchomp.

  • Flamethrower: This lets Dragapult deal decent unconditional damage to Steel-types, with Kingambit being the biggest target.

  • Dragon Darts: With a Naive nature, Dragon Darts gives Dragapult a consequence-free Dragon-type attack and decent mixed attacking potential.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Dragapult's typing gives it a lot of weaknesses, so Terastallization can help it stick around much longer, though the lack of good recovery means this isn't always the correct choice.

  • Fairy: With a Fairy Tera type, Dragapult preforms better against Dark-types it may still struggle with after Will-O-Wisp, such as Chien-Pao and Ting-Lu.

  • Steel: Steel Tera type is great for general defense and Fairy-types such as Azumarill and Mimikyu.

Dual Screens.description:
• Dragapult's high Speed combined with Reflect and Light Screen make it an effective dual screens lead.

  • Curse: Curse reduces Dragapult's HP to get it off the field quickly once it has set up screens. It also forces opponents to use recovery moves or switch out, allowing Dragapult's teammates to get in and set up safely. Curse is Dragapult’s best option to bypass Substitute, Protect, and Mimikyu.

  • Shadow Ball: This breaks Focus Sash, hits Ghosts like Gholdengo and Flutter Mane that normally threaten it, and breaks Mimikyu's Disguise. Notably Gholdengo stops Curse with Good as Gold, making Dragapult totally helpless against it if it does not carry Shadow Ball.

  • Dragon Darts: Dragon Darts can be used for more power to make Dragapult more self-sufficient when it has to stay on the field, and breaks Focus Sash as well. Its dual-hit nature makes it bypass most Substitutes.

  • Will-O-Wisp: Will-O-Wisp can be used to cripple physical attackers. In tandem with Reflect, this can be a potent strategy to allow the next Pokemon to set up nearly risk-free.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Very Situational: As a dual screens lead, Terastallizing can compromise its teammates sweeping abilities, so it should only be done in emergencies.

  • Ghost / Dragon: If you are in a bad spot, Ghost and Dragon power up its STAB move of choice.

  • Steel: A defensive typing like Steel can allow Dragapult to survive certain moves like Iron Bundle's Ice Beam, boosted Cloyster's Icicle Spear, and boosted Baxcalibur's Glaive Rush and retaliate.

  • Fairy: A Fairy Tera type is useful for enemy Infiltrator Dragapult's Dragon Darts.

Items
  • Focus Sash: While Light Clay is standard, Focus Sash nearly guarantees setting at least one screen without having to Terastallize, in the event Dragapult leads off against Choice Scarf users like Gholdengo, Hydreigon, and Meowscarada.

Offensive.description: This set is currently undergoing copy-editing, located here.

Speed Booster.description: This set is currently undergoing copy-editing, located here.

Cosmic Power.description:
• This set's write-up has not started yet, but here's some basic info to get you started!

  • EV Spread" The given EV spread outspeeds Jolly Urshifu formes and Timid Chi-Yu.

Dancing Bear.description:
• After boosting its power through Swords Dance, Urshifu-S can leverage its complementary set of STAB moves to smash through the opposing team.

  • Close Combat versus Drain Punch: Close Combat offers Urshifu-S the maximum sweeping power. However, if using Focus Sash or a defensive Tera type, Drain Punch is handy for restoring enough health after a boost to prevent priority attacks from easily knocking Urshifu-S out.

Items

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash can help Urshifu-S more reliably get off a Swords Dance boost. It can survive hits from Fairy-types like Flutter Mane as well as powerful special attackers like Iron Bundle. With an Adamant nature, Urshifu-S can reliably beat offensive Tera Fairy Flutter Mane with Wicked Blow + Sucker Punch, provided Focus Sash is still intact.

  • Black Glasses versus Punching Glove: Both items boost the power of Urshifu-S's signature move, Wicked Blow. Black Glasses gives a slightly stronger boost, while Punching Glove helps to protect Urshifu-S from contact effects like Rocky Helmet and Zapdos's Static. Urshifu-S is much less vulnerable to these effects compared to Urshifu-R due to lack of a multi-hit move. Finally, despite the name, Punching Glove does not boost the power of Sucker Punch, while Black Glasses does.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Typically, Urshifu-S will utilize Terastallization offensively to bolster the power of its Dark-type moves, but this set can benefit more from a defensive Tera type in order to stay on the field longer and make use of its ability to switch moves, which the Choice-locked attacker set cannot.

  • Dark: Tera Dark strengthens Wicked Blow and allows Urshifu-S to power its way through opposing walls. After a Swords Dance boost, Tera Dark-boosted Wicked Blow is a guaranteed OHKO on physically defensive Zapdos, while Close Combat has a high chance to OHKO Ting-Lu.

  • Poison: This Tera type allows Urshifu-S to survive common Fairy-type and Fighting-type attacks that would otherwise threaten to KO Urshifu-S.

  • Ghost: For Focus Sash sets, Tera Ghost blocks Normal-type priority from the likes of Dragonite, Ogerpon formes, or Entei from picking Urshifu-S off.

One Punch!.description:
• Urshifu-S can punch holes in the opposing team with its strong combination of STAB moves. Additionally, Urshifu-S can benefit from team preview against opponents who mistakenly assume it to be Urshifu-R.

  • U-turn: This move allows Urshifu-S to pivot out of bad matchups and scout out potential Tera types.

  • Iron Head: Iron Head can cover opposing Fairy-types such as Flutter Mane and Mimikyu, which threaten Urshifu-S.

  • Poison Jab: Poison Jab is Urshifu-S's strongest option against Primarina and the rare Azumarill.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Generally, Urshifu-S will utilize Terastallization offensively in order to extend the reach of its signature move Wicked Blow.

  • Dark: Tera Dark allows Urshifu-S to supercharge its Wicked Blow and muscle its way past various physically defensive foes. Notably, it gives Choice Band Urshifu-S a high chance to 2HKO Dondozo through Leftovers recovery, giving Urshifu-S an advantage against many stall teams.

  • Poison: This is a defensive Tera type that removes Fairy-type and Fighting-type weaknesses, and also absorbs Toxic Spikes.

  • Steel: This Tera type allows Urshifu-S to resist Fairy-type attacks and additionally boosts the power of Iron Head.

Urshifu-Rapid-Strike.overview: This Pokemon has been updated for the return of the Regulation G format and its powerful restricted threats!

Offensive.description:
• With its excellent typing and Surging Strikes breaking through Focus Sash, Urshifu-R is among the premier physical attackers of the metagame!

  • Close Combat versus Drain Punch: Close Combat's power makes it worth the defensive drops most of the time, especially with the protection of Focus Sash. Drain Punch is usually preferred for bulkier Punching Glove sets to improve Urshifu-R's survivability.

  • Aqua Jet: Aqua Jet is perfect for picking off weakened foes that are faster than Urshifu-R, such as Chien-Pao and Flutter Mane.

  • Swords Dance: With Swords Dance, Urshifu-R becomes far more difficult to wall by its defensive checks, though Dondozo is a notable exception.

  • Ice Spinner versus Ice Punch: Ice Spinner is more powerful when not using Punching Glove, and it also ruins terrain set up from the likes of Miraidon and Rillaboom. Ice Punch should always be used with Punching Glove, as it prevents Rocky Helmets users like Dragonite from passively wearing Urshifu-R down.

  • Substitute: Substitute with Punching Glove let's Urshifu-R take advantage of Alomomola that try to wear down Urshifu-R with Rocky Helmet, and is also effective at foiling slower status users.

  • Adamant versus Jolly: Adamant is the preferred nature for giving Urshifu-R as much breaking power as possible. Maximizing Speed with Jolly is often not needed for most matchups, but it does surpass some key targets in Jolly Mimikyu, Jolly Gliscor, and Modest Chi-Yu.

Other Options

  • Bulk Up: Bulk Up takes advantage of Urshifu-R's underrated physical bulk, but it's far less consistent against powerful special attackers like Miraidon and Calyrex-S.

Items

  • Punching Glove: Punching Gloves protects Urshifu-R from taking devastating damage by hitting Rocky Helmet or Rough Skin with Surging Strikes, in addition to boosting other punching moves. Just note that these moves will now be blocked by Protect and other variants.

  • Focus Sash: While it might seem strange with Urshifu-R's good physical bulk, Focus Sash lets it survive extremely powerful physical moves such as Chien-Pao's Electric Tera Blast without investing in bulk, as well as letting it survive powerful special attackers from Flutter Mane, Miraidon, and Calyrex-S.

  • Protective Pads: Protective Pads are a niche alternative to Punching Glove, not boosting any attacks but letting Surging Strikes bypass Protective moves from foes like Garganacl.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Urshifu-R is able to function perfectly fine without Terastallization, though it has both offensive and defensive uses for it.

  • Water: The Tera Water boost to Surging Strikes makes Urshifu-R even more difficult to wall, with even Ting-Lu that lack Sitrus Berry being OHKOed by +2 Surging Strikes. It also makes Aqua Jet a more effective cleaning move.

  • Normal: Tera Normal is often paired with Punching Glove to block Astral Barrage from Calyrex-S, potentially letting it get off a devastating Surging Strikes against it.

  • Stellar: Tera Stellar with Adamant is notable not only for taking advantage of Urshifu-R's great offensive coverage, but also because Tera Stellar Close Combat into Tera Stellar Aqua Jet will OHKO offensive Miraidon variants.

Alternate EV Spreads

  • 108 HP / 252 Atk / 148 Def with Adamant: Not only does this EV spread maintain maximum power, but the physical bulk let's Urshifu-R survive Adamant Chien-Pao's super-effective Tera Blast 87.5% of the time.

Choice Item Attacker.description:
• With its high-powered STAB attacks and access to U-turn, Urshifu-R is a strong option for a Choice item pivot.

  • Aqua Jet: Aqua Jet is a good way for Choice Band Urshifu-R to clean up weakened teams. That being said, with high Speed and priority attacks being so prevalent in the current climate, Aqua Jet can still find a place on Choice Scarf sets.

  • Ice Spinner: Urshifu-R greatly appreciates having a move that prevents it from being walled by Dragonite, and it can also foil terrain-based strategies from Miraidon.

  • Choice Scarf versus Choice Band: Choice Scarf transforms Urshifu-R into an effective revenge killer, outspeeding important threats such as Chien-Pao, unboosted Miraidon, and Flutter Mane that lack Booster Energy. Choice Band, on the other hand, makes Urshifu-R a far more effective wallbreaker, letting it deal massive damage to foes like Ting-Lu, Scizor, Ho-oh, and Calyrex-I.

  • Adamant versus Jolly: Adamant is far and away the preferred option for getting the most damage out of each attack. However, Choice Band does have a use for Jolly when it comes to outrunning and breaking Jolly Gliscor, and using it with Choice Scarf guarantees that Urshifu-R outruns Modest Choice Scarf Chi-Yu.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low / Medium: Urshifu-R has both offensive and defensive uses for Terastallization that can greatly influence the outcome of a match, but it isn't always vital for it to function.

  • Water: Tera Water removes Urshifu-R's troublesome Fairy-type weakness and gives Surging Strikes a healthy boost in power. With Choice Scarf, Urshifu-R can OHKO Focus Sash Chien-Pao before it has a chance to attack. With Choice Band, Surging Strikes becomes practically unwallable by anything that doesn't resist it.

  • Normal: Tera Normal with Choice Band can blindside offensive Calyrex-S that attack with Astral Barrage, letting Urshifu-R handily dispatch it with Surging Strikes.

Alternate EV Spreads

  • 108 HP / 252 Atk / 148 Def with Adamant: When using Choice Band Urshifu, this spread's physical bulk can be worth it against Tera Blast Electric from Chien-Pao, surviving 87.5% of the time.

Leech Seed Stall.description:
• Armed with Terastallization and incredible bulk, Calyrex-I is an imposing defensive force once it's entrenched!

  • Glacial Lance: Despite having low PP, Glacial Lance is the preferred attack. It deals significant damage even when uninvested and slams Grass-types that are immune to Leech Seed.

  • Protect and Substitute: This combination helps get the most out of Leftovers and Leech Seed recovery while burning as many turns as possible.

  • Toxic Spikes Support: This set benefits immensely from Toxic Spikes, which allows Calyrex-I to stall for damage when Leech Seed isn't active. Clodsire is the most common partner utilized for this, as its high special bulk is a great compliment to Calyrex-I's physical bulk.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: In order to take full advantage of its bulk against threats like Koraidon, Calyrex-I will need Terastallization.

  • Water: Tera Water's Fire-type resistance makes shouldering Koraidon's Flare Blitz a breeze, and the Water-type resistance to Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes makes Substitute a lot more effective.

  • Fire Tera Fire is another good way to weaken Koraidon's Flare Blitz while simultaneously making it much harder for Ogerpon-H to check Calyrex-I.

EV Spreads

  • 15 or lower Speed IV or 20 Speed EVs: While optional, a low enough Speed IV makes it so that slow Alomomola's Flip Turn will always go first, letting Calyrex-I hit the incoming target with Leech Seed instead. Do note that this will also make Calyrex-I slower than Ting-Lu. On the other hand, Calyrex-I can outrun uninvested Ursaluna-B with only 20 Speed EVs, though more may be necessary because Ursaluna-B commonly bumps up its Speed.

  • 252 HP / 212 Def / 44 SpD with Impish: With just a small amount of Special Defense investment, Astral Barrage from Timid Calyrex-S only has around a 50% chance to 2HKO if Calyrex-I is Terastallized. This spread also avoids an OHKO from Timid Choice Specs Miraidon's Electro Drift on all but the highest damage roll.

  • 252 HP / 124 Def / 132 SpD with Impish: While it sacrifices some physical bulk, a higher Special Defense investment combined with Terastallization makes it so that Astral Barrage from Timid Calyrex-S almost never 2HKOes.

Offensive Trick Room.description:
• Calyrex-I can facilitate its own sweeps with Trick Room, leaning into its incredible bulk and power to bully opposing teams.

  • Tera Blast Electric versus High Horsepower: Tera Blast Electric combined with Glacial Lance makes Calyrex-I extremely hard to wall. High Horsepower also has decent type synergy with Glacial Lance and doesn't immediately require Terastallization, but Unaware Dondozo becomes almost impossible to break.

  • Swords Dance: Swords Dance can be used to supercharge a Trick Room sweep, making Calyrex-I much harder to stall out.

Other Options

  • Encore: While Encore is difficult to fit, the unique pairing of Encore with Trick Room allows Calyrex-I punish a wide range of status users that it couldn't before.

  • Icicle Spear and Bullet Seed with Loaded Dice: Calyrex-I does have the option to run a Loaded Dice offensive set that is less reliant on Terastallization. While good against Focus Sash and Substitute users, it tends to constrict Calyrex-I's overall power.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: Since Trick Room restricts the range of coverage Calyrex-I can run, Terastallization is key in extending Calyrex-I's offense while also removing its common weaknesses.

  • Electric: Tera Electric is the go-to option for good defensive typing and Tera Blast coverage, giving Calyrex-I the coveted BoltBeam attack type combination.

  • Ground: Tera Ground can be used with High Horsepower to give it a sizable boost in strength as well as buying extra turns against Miraidon's Electric-type attacks.

EV Spreads

  • 0 Speed IV with a Brave nature: Calyrex-I usually wants the lowest Speed possible for sweeping in Trick Room. This will make it slower than Ting-Lu and Dondozo though, so adjustments can be made if outrunning these targets out of Trick Room is deemed necessary.

  • 252 HP / 212 Atk / 44 SpD with Brave or Adamant: The Special Defense investment allows Calyrex-I to almost always survive Timid Choice Specs Miraidon's Electro Drift. If Terastallized, it also has roughly a 50% chance to avoid the 2HKO from Timid Calyrex-S's Astral Barrage.

  • 252 HP / 124 Atk / 132 SpD with Brave or Adamant: By leaning into Special Defense and using Terastallization, Timid Calyrex-S's Astral Barrage won't 2HKO Calyrex-I except on the highest damage rolls.

Shadow Sweeper.description:
• With absurd offensive stats and an ability that takes that further, Calyrex-S is the king of sweeping in Battle Stadium Singles!

  • Draining Kiss: Despite the low Base Power, Draining Kiss deals plenty of damage to Dark-types like Chien-Pao, especially if using Tera Fairy.

  • Psyshock versus Psychic: Psyshock is preferred for the massive damage potential against Blissey, but Psychic will OHKO Koraidon.

  • Encore: Calyrex-S is able to outspeed any relevant foe without a Choice Scarf, making Encore an especially dangerous option even if it comes at the cost of a Psychic-type STAB move or setup option.

  • Nasty Plot versus Calm Mind: Nasty Plot Calyrex-S is nearly impossible to wall, making it an especially deadly option with Focus Sash. While not as immediately dangerous for sweeping, Calm Mind lets Calyrex-S set up more easily without a Focus Sash with some minor EV tweaking.

Other Options

  • Expanding Force: If using Calyrex-S on a Psychic Terrain team with Indeedee-M, Expanding Force is much more powerful than other Psychic-type options. However, this does come with the risk of Miraidon or Rillaboom weakening Expanding Force with their own Terrain.

Items

  • Focus Sash: Despite Calyrex-S's reasonable bulk, Focus Sash is an excellent item for reducing the pressure for it to Terastallize, in addition to potentially revenge killing powerful adversaries like Choice Scarf Koraidon and Booster Energy Flutter Mane.

  • Life Orb: Life Orb makes Calyrex-S less reliant on boosts to clean teams, at the cost of being more vulnerable to priority from the likes of Urshifu-R.

  • Leftovers: If using Calm Mind, Leftovers is a reasonable option for increased longevity, especially if it is getting free turns with Encore.

  • Lum Berry: Lum Berry severely punishes bulky users of Yawn such as Ursaluna-B and Hippowdon, as well as stopping Booster Energy Flutter Mane from hitting Tera Fairy Calyrex-S with Thunder Wave.

  • Spell Tag: While mostly outclassed by Life Orb, Spell Tag makes sense if another teammate needs Life Orb more.

Alternate EV Spreads

  • 20 HP / 4 Def / 220 SpA / 12 SpD / 252 Spe with Timid: This EV spread is to be used with Calm Mind, allowing Calyrex-S to withstand Timid Choice Specs Miraidon's Electro Drift after a boost.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency: Medium / Low: Calyrex-S's typing makes it extremely vulnerable to Sucker Punch from the likes of Chien-Pao and faster Ghost-type attacks from foes like Booster Energy Flutter Mane, making Terastallization a gateway into opening up sweeps. However, if using Focus Sash, this becomes less important.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy Calyrex-S's crown jewel for Tera types, giving it a key resistance to Dark, as well as turning Draining Kiss into a reasonable secondary armament.

  • Fighting: Tera Fighting is a good alternative to Tera Fairy because it offers similar advantages against Dark-types with the bonus of dealing massive damage to Ursaluna-B and Chi-Yu with Tera Blast, as well as not being weak to Scizor's Bullet Punch.

  • Normal: While a more niche Tera type due to its lack of offensive benefits, Tera Normal can be paired with Encore to ambush Ghost-type revenge killers like Flutter Mane and opposing Calyrex-S.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost makes Astral Barrage into a terrifying sweeping move, but the lack of any defensive benefits makes it a niche option, especially when not using Focus Sash.

Choice Item.description:
• As One combines with a Choice item to either turn Calyrex-S into a revenge killer or potent cleaner.

  • Psyshock versus Psychic: Psyshock is usually the best option for a secondary STAB move, since it allows even Choice Scarf Calyrex-S to usually 2HKO Blissey, a problem for Calyrex-S on stall teams otherwise. Psychic is much stronger against Koraidon though, with Choice Scarf sets being able to OHKO offensive Koraidon that aren't Terastallized with it.

  • Draining Kiss versus Tera Blast: Despite its low Base Power, Draining Kiss is still enough to cleave through Chien-Pao and restores a good amount of HP when using Tera Fairy. However, Tera Blast's higher Base Power makes it a reasonable alternative for this set, with Tera Blast Fairy letting Choice Scarf Calyrex-S 2HKO Chi-Yu in particular.

  • Trick: Trick is an effective way of punishing Calyrex-S's more defensive checks, with Ting-Lu in particular loathing it. Just note that most Blissey can get around Trick by using Fling, so this is not entirely reliable against stall teams.

  • Choice Scarf versus Choice Specs: Calyrex-S's insane Speed might make Choice Scarf seem like overkill, but gaining the ability to outspeed Choice Scarf Koraidon and Miraidon, as well as Speed-boosted Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle, is an extremely rare and valuable quality for a Choice Scarf revenge killer. Choice Specs is still worth considering for its impressive wallbreaking power though, especially since Psyshock cleanly 2HKOes Blissey.

Other Options

  • Future Sight: Future Sight is an interesting tool against defensive teams, as if you force out special walls with strong physical Pokemon, Calyrex-S's Future Sight is likely to deal a huge amount of damage to their response later!

  • Expanding Force: If using Calyrex-S on a Psychic Surge team with Indeedee-M, Expanding Force outdamages even Astral Barrage! Just note that Miraidon and Rillaboom are common enough that maintaining the boosted Expanding Force can be tricky.

  • Nasty Plot or Calm Mind: If using Trick, it's feasible to carry a setup move over a Psychic-type STAB move, especially if certain defensive foes like Ting-Lu have been saddled with it. However, setting up still should not be the main purpose of this set, as Encore does a better job of facilitating that.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency: High: With no Encore or Focus Sash to get around this, Calyrex-S's Dark and Ghost weaknesses are highly exploitable, meaning Terastallization is often key to stopping a revenge kill.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy is the best crown to be wearing against Dark-types like Chien-Pao, making Draining Kiss viable as a bonus.

  • Fighting: Tera Fighting is an alternative to Fairy, making Calyrex-S more vulnerable to Flutter Mane in exchange for OHKOing Chi-Yu with Tera Blast. Just note that being locked into Tera Blast Fighting is a problem against other Ghost-types.

  • Normal: Tera Normal is a niche option, since it provides no offensive benefit, but it can be useful for Choice Specs Calyrex-S to dodge an OHKO from Choice Scarf Calyrex-S and Flutter Mane with a Speed boost.

Substitute.description:
• Calyrex-S is a a devastating user of Encore thanks to its regal Speed stat, which when combined with Substitute, lets it turn the tables on common Sucker Punch users like Chien-Pao and Urshifu-S!

  • Draining Kiss: While Tera Blast Fairy is certainly feasible, Draining Kiss's healing factor, when combined with Leftovers, makes it worth the power drop.

  • Leftovers: While Calyrex-S doesn't tend to focus on bulk, Encore and Substitute work together to make it last long enough on the field for Leftovers to have an impact.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency: Medium: Calyrex-S can effectively use Encore and Substitute to avoid the worst of its common Dark and Ghost weaknesses, but Terastallization provides an extra layer of flexibility that still makes it a strong option.

  • Fairy: While other Tera types like Normal are feasible, Draining Kiss is important enough on this set that Tera Fairy is by far the best option, especially for the important resistance to Dark.

The King Strikes Back! (Double Dance).description:
• With access to both Calm Mind and Agility, Calyrex-S can become a terrifying sweeper capable of outspeeding even opposing Choice Scarf Pokemon while maintaining exceptional power and good bulk.

  • Draining Kiss versus Giga Drain: Draining Kiss and Giga Drain both provide coverage and a form of recovery. Draining Kiss allows Calyrex-S to threaten the Dark-types that would switch into Astral Barrage, while Giga Drain threatens the likes of Ursaluna-B more immediately.

  • Calm Mind versus Nasty Plot: Calm Mind trades out Nasty Plot's more immediate boost to give Calyrex-S more survivability.

  • Agility: Agility lets Calyrex-S punish switches to faster threats like Choice Scarf Koraidon, Miraidon, and Booster Energy Flutter Mane by suddenly outspeeding them and threatening a sweep.

Items

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry allows Calyrex-S to set up more safely in the face of threats like Ursaluna-B, giving it a better shot at a successful sweep.

  • Lum Berry: Lum Berry lets Calyrex-S set up in the face of status users like Eternatus, Dondozo, and Gliscor, allowing it more opportunities to mount a sweep against bulkier teams.

Tera Types

Tera Dependecy - High: Although its base typing has advantages like an immunity to Extreme Speed, Calyrex-S will often need to Terastallize to maintain its longevity and mitigate its weakness against common threats.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy grants Calyrex-S a valuable resistance to Dark-type attacks such as Chien-Pao's Sucker Punch and boosts the power of Draining Kiss, allowing it to more easily threaten foes like Ting-Lu.

  • Grass: Tera Grass strengthens Giga Drain's power, dealing solid damage to Ting-Lu and Ursaluna-B. It also grants Calyrex-S the benefit of resisting Miraidon’s Electro Drift and Ground-type attacks. However, it becomes more vulnerable to Ice-type moves like Calyrex-I's Glacial Lance and Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash and Ice Shard.

  • Water: Tera Water grants a resistance to Koraidon's Flare Blitz and Scizor's Bullet Punch and can be used with Tera Blast to deal massive damage to threats like Ursaluna-B and Chi-Yu.

EV Spreads

  • 172 HP / 252 Def / 60 SpA / 4 SpD / 20 Spe with Modest: With Sitrus Berry, this spread can allow Calyrex-S withstand Chien Pao’s Icicle Crash and Ice Shard. After a Calm Mind boost, it can withstand Choice Specs Miraidon’s Electro Drift, Choice Specs Tera Fairy Flutter Mane’s Moonblast, and Silk Scarf Tera Normal Ursaluna-B's Blood Moon after Stealth Rock damage. 20 Speed EVs allow it to outspeed Jolly Landorus-T before an Aglity boost.

  • 124 HP / 100 Def / 252 SpA / 12 SpD / 20 Spe with Modest: Maximizing Special Attack lets Tera Grass Giga Drain 2HKO Sitrus Berry Ting-Lu after a Nasty Plot boost and OHKO maximum HP Dondozo fifty percent of the time.

Kleavor.overview: This Pokemon is a new addition to the Regulation D format! If you have any questions or feel it needs more updates, feel free to post here.

Timber!.description:
• While Stone Axe's accuracy can be off-putting if reliable Stealth Rock setting is a must, Kleavor's unique form of role compression makes it an effective alternative to more defensive setters.

  • Night Slash: Night Slash is Kleavor's best way of dealing big damage to Gholdengo and is a reliable option against weakened Flutter Mane.

  • Feint: Feint's increased priority over other priority attacks make it a great way to pick off Focus Sash foes like Chien-Pao and Iron Bundle. Kleavor being faster means it'll even outpace Dragonite's Extreme Speed!

  • Trailblaze: While Kleavor isn't known for easily sweeping, it's fast enough to outspeed Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle after Trailblaze, and Trailblaze is especially useful when using Tera Grass against Urshifu-R.

  • X-Scissor versus Close Combat: While X-Scissor's coverage on paper isn't impressive, the boost from Sharpness lets it 2HKO Cresselia and Ting-Lu that lack Sitrus Berry.

  • Adamant versus Jolly: If using Feint, Adamant is the best nature choice for maximizing the amount of targets it can pick off after using Stone Axe. For Trailblaze variants, Jolly is preferred to outspeed Flutter Mane, Iron Bundle, and even Dragapult. Jolly also ensures it outspeeds all Gholdengo that lack Choice Scarf.

Other Options
  • Tailwind: Tailwind is an unusual move for Battle Stadium Singles, but Kleavor's disposable nature with Focus Sash can make it justified as a move to use before fainting.
Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Kleavor's entry hazard setting nature may not make Terastallization seem important, but its archnemesis, Urshifu-R, makes it worth considering, since it can threaten to OHKO Kleavor through its Focus Sash.

  • Grass: Tera Grass is a good response against Urshifu-R, not only resisting its deadly Surging Strikes, but also boosting Trailblaze.

  • Water: Tera Water isn't as offensively useful, but it's still a good way to resist both Surging Strikes and powerful Steel-type attacks like Heatran's Flash Cannon.

  • Bug: Tera Bug isn't great defensively, but it allows Kleavor to 2HKO even Impish Sitrus Berry Ting-Lu with X-Scissor.

  • Ghost: Despite Kleavor's resistance to Extreme Speed, Dragonite often picks off Focus Sash variants, so Tera Ghost is a huge shock for it, though a rather risky Terastallization choice. It also blocks Rapid Spin from Great Tusk, even if it's not particularly common.

Items

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash makes Kleavor a good lead against a wide variety of foes such as Iron Bundle and lets it easily justify the maximum Speed investment needed to outspeed Gholdengo.

  • Assault Vest: Kleavor's special bulk is mediocre at best, but Stone Axe's entry hazard setting powers can justify using Assault Vest to survive certain attacks that are otherwise impossible without Focus Sash.

Assault Vest EV Spreads

  • 28 HP / 204 Atk / 4 Def / 204 SpD / 68 Spe with Adamant: This more specially bulky spread usually survives Iron Bundle's Hydro Pump, Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Tera Fairy Moonblast, and Jolly Life Orb Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash while outspeeding Garchomp after one use of Trailblaze.

  • 28 HP / 108 Atk / 4 Def / 204 SpD / 164 Spe with Jolly: This spread has enough Speed to outspeed Iron Bundle after using Trailblaze once while usually surviving Timid Tera Fairy Choice Specs Moonblast from Flutter Mane, Non-Choice Specs Iron Bundle's Hydro Pump, and Jolly Life Orb Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash.

  • 140 HP / 52 Atk / 4 Def / 244 SpD / 68 Spe with Adamant: This more extreme spread usually lets Kleavor survive even Timid Gholdengo's Make It Rain, almost always avoids a 2HKO from Modest Chi-Yu's Dark Pulse, and avoids an OHKO from Adamant Life Orb Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash while still outspeeding Garchomp after one use of Trailblaze.

Minor Optimizations
  • Female Gender: While very rare, Cute Charm Enamorus can potentially impact Kleavor, meaning there are no drawbacks to using a female gender.

Choice Scarf.description:
• Choice Scarf Kleavor has a very unique niche of being a decent revenge killing pivot that can set up Stealth Rock at the same time!

  • Night Slash: Night Slash is Kleavor's best move against Gholdengo, making it highly recommended, since Kleavor outspeeds it.

  • X-Scissor versus Close Combat: Despite offering less coverage, X-Scissor's sheer power with Sharpness makes it a great option, dealing heavy damage to Cresselia and Ting-Lu and being a strong cleaning option. Close Combat isn't as reliable, but it can let Kleavor more reliably revenge kill threats such as Tera Normal Dragonite and Ursaluna. It's also Kleavor's easiest option to use for revenge killing Urshifu-R.

Other Options
  • Aerial Ace: Aerial Ace isn't particularly strong despite the boost from Sharpness, but it does deal massive damage to Urshifu-R, especially if using the easily accessible Tera Flying.
Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: While Choice Scarf Urshifu-R is still a major concern, this set's other purpose means that setting up Stealth Rock is required for success, making Terastallization less important.

  • Bug: If using X-Scissor, Tera Bug lets Kleavor 2HKO even Sitrus Berry Ting-Lu, making for an effective late-game cleaner.

  • Grass: If Choice Scarf Urshifu-R is a major concern, Tera Grass is a decent way around it in addition to getting an advantage against Breloom leads.

  • Flying: Tera Flying should only be used with Aerial Ace, which gives Kleavor a 75% chance of OHKOing Urshifu-R after taking Stealth Rock damage.

Minor Optimizations
  • Female Gender: Cute Charm Enamorus is very rare and not important, but it does mean that a female gender is slightly preferred on Kleavor.

Ursaluna.overview: This Pokemon is a new addition to the Regulation D format! If you have any questions or feel it needs more updates, feel free to post here.

Guts Attacker.description:
• With Flame Orb, Guts, and an incredible Attack stat, Ursaluna is an extremely brutal wallbreaker!

  • Earthquake versus Headlong Rush: Earthquake is an easier move to recommend, avoiding contact with Rocky Helmet and preserving Ursaluna's hefty bulk. However, Headlong Rush's extra power can better fit the playstyles of Ursaluna that may aim for a sweep rather than just wallbreaking, such as Trick Room and Jolly variants.

  • Drain Punch versus Close Combat: Drain Punch doesn't offer much extra coverage, but it's Ursaluna's only decent way of restoring health. Close Combat's sheer power does make it decent coverage though and can particularly punish Heatran for Terastallizing into a Grass-type.

  • Ice Punch versus Play Rough: Once Ursaluna is burned, Ice Punch will deal so much damage to Dragonite that even the bulkiest sets can not restore all their health with Roost. Play Rough isn't nearly as effective against Dragonite, but when used with Tera Fairy, Ursaluna can now OHKO Urshifu-R before Flame Orb kicks in.

  • Protect: While Ursaluna is powerful, it needs the Flame Orb activation to truly wallbreak, so Protect can help when switching it in isn't easy.

  • Bulk Up versus Swords Dance: Bulk Up is the prefered setup move for making Ursaluna difficult to revenge kill with physical attacks, but Swords Dance does offer some truly absurd wallbreaking potential, allowing Ursaluna to OHKO even physically defensive Ting-Lu with Facade! Swords Dance can also be a better fit on Trick Room teams due to the limited amount of turns Ursaluna has to sweep.

  • Trailblaze: If using Jolly Ursaluna, Trailblaze lets it outspeed key threats such as Zapdos, both Urshifu formes, Mimikyu, and even Speed tie with Timid Thundurus-T!

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Ursaluna benefits from Terastallization, but it's not integral to its wallbreaking prowess.

  • Normal: Beyond getting rid of Ground's annoying weaknesses, Tera Normal turns Ursaluna into an even more fearsome wallbreaker,

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy does a great job of protecting Ursaluna from powerful Fighting-type attacks and Dragonite's Outrage.

  • Ghost: While Tera Ghost does make the matchup against Flutter Mane and Gholdengo worse, the Fighting immunity can turn a match around in the blink of an eye.

  • Water: Tera Water is the prime Tera type to use when in need of an Ice and Water resistance, which is helpful against Urshifu-R and Chien-Pao.

  • Fighting: If using Drain Punch, Tera Fighting is a reasonable option for restoring even more health, at the cost of being rather weak against Flutter Mane.

  • Grass: Tera Gass is a niche option that lets Ursaluna deal extra damage with Trailblaze while resisting Water-type attacks and taking Spore before Flame Orb activates.

Alternate EV Spreads

  • Brave and a 0 Speed IV versus Adamant: On a Trick Room team, this lets Ursaluna underspeed some major Pokemon such as Ting-Lu and Dondozo. However, some Trick Room teams may still prefer Adamant to outspeed such slow Pokemon if they also function outside Trick Room.

  • 140 HP / 252 Atk / 116 SpD with Adamant or Brave: This more specially defensive EV spread survives some powerful attacks even after burn damage, including Timid Choice Specs Tera Fairy Flutter Mane's Moonblast, Thundurus-T's Grass Knot, Timid Greninja's Hydro Pump, and Modest Chi-Yu's Overheat.

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe with Jolly: Maximizing Speed may seem strange on such a slow Pokemon, but Ursaluna makes fantastic use of it, making Trailblaze viable due to outspeeding even offensive variants of Zapdos after a boost and letting it wallbreak common Pokemon that often don't invest in enough Speed such as Dragonite and Heatran.

Minor Optimizations
  • Female Gender: Since Ursaluna uses contact moves, a female gender will prevent it from being attracted to the rare Cute Charm Enamorus.

Bulky Bear.description:
• Ursaluna's great overall bulk makes it a good choice for either spreading Yawn or setting up Bulk Up.

  • Play Rough: Play Rough is Ursaluna's best Attack against both Urshifu formes, which are common switch-ins to bulkier Ursaluna sets.

  • Ice Punch versus Avalanche: Ice Punch is the most reliable option for dealing big damage to Dragonite, but Avalanche deals so much damage if Ursaluna is attacked that even Defensive Mulsticale Dragonite is unable to Roost back to full health.

  • Protect: Protect has great synergy with Yawn and Leftovers, letting Ursaluna put foes to sleep with less risk to itself.

  • Drain Punch: In addition to being a decent option for Ursaluna to restore its health with, it can be especially effective with Bulk Up, making Ursaluna difficult to take down.

Other Options

  • Taunt: Taunt's a great support move for shutting down common support Pokemon like Ting-Lu, but it's rather difficult to fit in.

  • Flame Orb and Facade: Using Guts on a bulkier set may be very counter-intuitive, but with Yawn, this can make Ursaluna very difficult to check.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Ursaluna is fully capable of functioning without Terastallization, but with it, it has far fewer weaknesses.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy is a fantastic response against the Fighting-type attacks that threaten Ursaluna and means Choice Band Dragonite can no longer 2HKO with Outrage.

  • Water: Tera Water is Ursaluna's best shot against Chien-Pao thanks to the Icicle Crash resistance, and it helps against Urshifu-R as well.

  • Fighting: If using Bulk Up and Drain Punch, Tera Fighting gives Ursaluna a prime opportunity to keep restoring its health, though at the cost of doing far worse against Flutter Mane and Mimikyu.

Abilities

  • Guts: Guts is a fantastic option for punishing Will-O-Wisp from foes like Rotom-W and works well for punishing Toxic Spikes.

  • Bulletproof: This more niche option gives Ursaluna immunity to several major moves, such as Focus Blast, Bullet Seed, Sludge Bomb, and Shadow Ball when Terastallized, particularly helping against Gholdengo if using Tera Water or Fighting.

Alternate EV Spreads

  • *140 HP / 252 Atk / 116 SpD with Adamant This more specially bulky spread allows Ursaluna to take on major special threats, avoiding KOs from the likes of Timid Choice Specs Tera Fairy Flutter Mane, Choice Specs Gholdengo's Make It Rain, and Timid Greninja's Hydro Pump.

  • 252 HP / 20 Def / 236 SpD with Careful: This spread allows Ursaluna to avoid a 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast after Leftovers recovery.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 Spe with Impish: Maximizing Ursaluna's physical defense means Tera Water will usually avoid a 2HKO from Choice Band Urshifu's Close Combat after Leftovers recovery.

Minor Optimizations
  • Female Gender: A female gender is slightly optimal for avoiding infatuation from the rare Cute Charm Enamorus.

Assault Vest.description:
• Ursaluna's excellent power and bulk make it a good, if unexpected, user of Assault Vest.

  • Drain Punch: Drain Punch's bit of extra healing is useful even without being a STAB move.

  • Play Rough: Play Rough is Ursaluna's best option for punishing Urshifu-R switching in.

  • Ice Punch versus Avalanche: Ice Punch is preferred due to its reliable base power, but Avalanche can threaten to damage Multiscale Dragonite past the ability to recover HP back with Roost.

  • Facade: While Facade is rather weak without the reliability of Flame Orb, it's a devestating way to punish status moves and Toxic Spikes.

  • EV Spread: The bulk investment allows Ursaluna to avoid a 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast after Stealth Rock damage. Some other Special Attacks it takes on include avoiding a 2HKO from defensive Rotom-W's Hydro Pump, avoiding a 2HKO from two consecutive Make It Rains from Choice Specs Gholdengo, and avoiding an OHKO from Tera Water Iron Bundle.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Terastallization isn't needed for Ursaluna to make good use of Assault Vest, but it can help against some common physical threats.

  • Water: Tera Water covers Ursaluna's big Water and Ice weaknesses, helping a great deal against Urshifu-R and Chien-Pao.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy is Ursaluna's best choice for a Fighting resistance, in addition to helping against powerful users of Outrage such as Choice Band Dragonite and Garchomp.

  • Ghost: If using Bulletproof, Tera Ghost is a good way to flip the tables on Fighting-types without compromising Ursaluna against Flutter Mane and Gholdengo.

Abilities

  • Guts: Even if Guts isn't guaranteed to be activated, switching Ursaluna into status moves like Will-O-Wisp can turn it into a wallbreaker in a pinch.
