  • Bulletproof: Bulletproof gives Ursaluna a very useful immunity to some attacks that hit it hard, such as Bullet Seed and Focus Blast. The Sludge Bomb and Shadow Ball immunity is also fantastic when Terastallized.

Minor Optimizations
  • Female Gender: While Cute Charm Enamorus is very rare, there's no drawback in using a female gender to become immune to this ability.

Ursaluna-Bloodmoon.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Freddy (Offensive).description:
• With its great bulk, power, and coverage thanks to high-powered Normal-type STAB moves and amazing ability in Mind’s Eye, Ursaluna-B is a formidable special attacker.

  • Blood Moon: Blood Moon gives Ursaluna-B incredibly high neutral damage. It's a great way to cover a switch or predicted Terastallization, but it requires some forethought to maximize efficiency because it cannot be used on consecutive turns.

  • Vacuum Wave: Vacuum Wave is highly valuable for revenge killing foes, notably hitting Chien-Pao. It can hit Gholdengo due to Mind's Eye.

  • Earth Power: Earth Power gives great coverage against the Steel-types that resist Blood Moon, making Ursaluna-B nearly unwallable except by non-grounded Steel-types like Corviknight.

  • Hyper Voice: Hyper Voice is a more spammable Normal-type STAB move that can bypass Substitute, allowing Ursaluna-B to thwart attempts to Substitute stall out Blood Moon, like Tera Garganacl.

Items

  • Assault Vest: Assault Vest remedies Ursaluna-B's middling Special Defense, allowing this slow but hard-hitting Pokemon to survive longer.

  • Silk Scarf: Silk Scarf can be used instead of Assault Vest to boost the power of Ursaluna-B’s Normal-type STAB attacks, making it more difficult to switch into, though this makes match-ups against Special Attackers like Flutter Mane shakier.

  • Life Orb: If using Ursaluna-B on a Trick Room team, Life Orb can be worth the recoil for the highest possible chance of sweeping.

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash may sound absurd with Ursaluna-B's bulk, but it can allow more offensive variants to turn the tables on extremely powerful Special Attackers like Choice Specs Chi-Yu, and more easily justify faster EV spreads.

Assault Vest EV Spreads

  • 36 HP / 228 SpA / 244 SpD with Modest: This spread survives an opposing Life Orb Ursaluna-B's Tera Normal Blood Moon.

  • 100 HP / 164 SpA / 244 SpD with Modest: This spread survives Timid Tera Water Iron Bundle's Hydro Pump, even if Ursaluna-B doesn't Terastallize!

  • 244 HP / 52 Def / 196 SpA / 12 SpD / 4 Spe with Modest: This spread will never be OHKOed by Adamant Choice Scarf Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes unless it Terastallizes.

Other Item EV Spreads

  • 148 HP / 4 Def / 132 SpA / 220 SpD / 4 Spe with Modest: This EV spread gives Ursaluna-B enough bulk to survive Tera boosted Choice Specs Timid Flutter Mane's Moonblast on all but the highest damage roll, as well as the same odds for surviving Jolly Urshifu-R's Close Combat. If used with paralysis support, 32 EVs can be moved from Special Attack to Speed to outspeed paralyzed Modest Chi-Yu.

  • 20 HP / 4 Def / 172 SpA / 60 SpD / 252 Spe with Timid This outspeeds up to -1 Speed Garchomp, and also often outspeeds Pokemon that focus on bulk such as Dragonite, Scizor, and Primarina. The defensive EVs survive Choice Specs Timid Flutter Mane's Moonblast and Life Orb Adamant Chien-Pao's Sacred Sword if Ursaluna-B sticks with Tera Normal.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Ursaluna-B often uses Terastallization to compensate for its lackluster defensive typing; however, it is often capable of functioning without Tera. Because many different Tera types are viable on it, it can play guessing games with opponents.

  • Normal: Tera Normal removes all weaknesses associated with Ursaluna-B’s Ground typing and boosts Blood Moon to phenomenal levels of power, making it ideal on Trick Room teams.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy allows Ursaluna-B to handle the Urshifu formes and Choice Band Dragon-types like Dragonite and Gouging Fire better while generally being a very solid defensive Tera type.

  • Poison: Tera Poison improves Ursaluna-B’s matchup against Flutter Mane, all Ogerpon formes' Horn Leech, and all Urshifu formes, while preventing Toxic from wearing Ursaluna-B down.

  • Water: Tera Water allows Ursaluna-B to fare better against the likes of Urshifu-R, Chien-Pao, and Chi-Yu.

Hibernation (Yawn).description:
• Yawn doesn't transform Ursaluna-B into just a mere support Pokemon. When used in conjunction with Blood Moon, the bloodmoon beast becomes a master of putting offensive teams between a rock and a hard place: either the opponent's check falls asleep, or they switch out and something far less suited against Ursaluna-B gets shredded by Blood Moon!

  • Moonlight: Moonlight will require sacrificing either coverage or priority, but it makes Ursaluna-B far longer lasting and less vulnerable to lures like Grass Knot Landorus-T. It's a particularly strong choice on teams with strong hit-and-run Pokemon like Choice Specs Flutter Mane.

  • Vacuum Wave: While not amazingly powerful, Vacuum Wave is lovely for picking off Chien-Pao and cleaning up late-game in general. This is to the point where giving up reliable recovery can make sense for some more offensive teams that often can't afford to switch Ursaluna-B out often.

  • Leftovers versus Sitrus Berry: Leftovers is best paired with Moonlight, giving Ursaluna-B maximum longevity. If using Vacuum Wave, Sitrus Berry's quicker burst of recovery suits Ursaluna-B better and provides a better matchup against Urshifu-R. Sitrus Berry is also a reasonable alternative to Leftovers if another teammate needs it.

  • EV Spread: The HP investment ensures Annihilape will not OHKO Ursaluna-B with Final Gambit, and the Defense EVs stop Choice Band Tera Water Urshifu-R from OHKOing Terastallized Ursaluna-B. This spread survives Modest Choice Scarf Chi-Yu's Overheat and Tera-boosted Moonblast from Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane on all but the highest damage roll. Offensively, the Special Attack EVs ensure that Blood Moon OHKOes offensive Urshifu formes.

Other Options

  • 20 Speed EVs: 20 Speed EVs let Ursaluna-B outspeed paralyzed Adamant Urshifu formes at the cost of some bulk. This may seem to conflict with Yawn, but paralysis is often a viable secondary playstyle for teams with this set to deal with more offensive threats.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Ursaluna-B's typing is fairly good, but its weakness to common threats like Chien-Pao and Urshifu-R mean Terastallization is often needed.

  • Poison: Tera Poison has excellent synergy with Ursaluna-B's playstyle, not only granting it an important resistance to Urshifu-R's Close Combat and Flutter Mane's Moonblast but also ensuring that poison status will not wear it down.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy doesn't help against Flutter Mane, but it does transform Ursaluna-B into a very strong Urshifu-S check, in addition to avoiding Choice Specs Latios's wrath.

  • Normal: Tera Normal only helps defensively against Ice, Grass, and Water types, but the power boost to Blood Moon makes Ursaluna-B far more difficult to wall, with defensive Primarina in particular usually being put into Earth Power's KO range.

  • Water: Tera Water offers a useful Ice resistance to flip Chien-Pao matchups more easily, but it doesn't help against Raging Bolt and Grass Knot users like Landorus-T.

Smarter than the Average Bear (Calm Mind.description:
• With its immense defensive profile and access to reliable recovery, Ursaluna-B lends itself very well to a Calm Mind set.

  • Blood Moon: Even though the cool down time can be annoying for a Calm Mind set, the massive amount of power is still strongly recommended for being able to OHKO Urshifu-R without a boost using the given EV spread.

Other Options

  • Taunt: Taunt can be used to shut down utility moves and attempts to stall out Ursaluna-B from the likes of Cresselia and slow Dragonite.

Items

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus berry allows Ursaluna-B to recover a significant chunk of health, which can be useful to set up boosts against special attackers.

  • Leftovers: Leftovers improves Ursaluna-B's general longevity.

  • Kee Berry: Kee Berry boosts Ursaluna-B's physical bulk, allowing it to keep pace with physical threats such as Dragonite.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: Despite its immense bulk, Ursaluna-B’s typing leaves it vulnerable to many common attacks, so a good defensive Tera type is essential for survivability and durability.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy provides a good defensive typing that synergizes well with Ursaluna-B's natural weaknesses, allowing it to stick around.

  • Poison: Tera Poison grants an immunity to Toxic, Making Toxic Spikes less of an issue. It also grants a Fighting resistance, allowing it to better handle Urshifu.

  • Normal: Tera Normal boosts the power of Blood Moon, which improves the matchup against opposing Calm Mind Flutter Mane. It leaves only a Fighting weakness, making Ursaluna-B quite hard to KO.

  • Water: Tera Water aids against both Chien-Pao and Choice Specs Gholdengo, in addition to being a great defensive typing in general.

Ancient Defense (Physical Wall).description:
• Backed by Terastallization, Ursaluna-B can use its incredible physical bulk to wall even the mighty Koraidon!

  • Moonlight: Under Koraidon's sun, Moonlight's increased recovery makes Ursaluna-B that much harder to topple!

  • Earth Power: Earth Power is strong against Steel-types like Scizor and Archaludon that otherwise resist Blood Moon, and it's also super effective against many of Koraidon's most popular Tera types.

  • Hyper Voice: While it doesn't provide extra coverage, Hyper Voice is the best option to prevent Substitute Gliscor from completely shutting down Ursaluna-B.

  • Vacuum Wave: Vacuum Wave is a solid option for picking off weakened threats, especially Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu.

  • Calm Mind: Weaker physical attackers like Assault Vest Koraidon provide great opportunities to set up with Calm Mind.

  • EV Spread: With full defensive investment and a neutral Tera type, a five-hit Scale Shot from +2 Koraidon only has about a 25% chance to OHKO. Even without Terastallization, this Ursaluna-B is so bulky that Adamant Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash into Ice Shard only has about a 6.25% chance to knock out Ursaluna-B! The leftover EVs are usually allocated to Speed; keep in mind that Ursaluna-B often Speed creeps, so reallocating some EVs for even a few more points in Speed can be useful in the mirror matchup.

Items

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet punishes many common attacks from Koraidon and Zacian-C, though Scale Shot from Koraidon is a notable exception.

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry's burst recovery can be useful against Swords Dance Koraidon, guaranteeing that Ursaluna-B survives a +2 Scale Shot at five hits even if one of the hits is a critical hit.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: Ursaluna-B has to change its typing in order to properly take on Koraidon and other physical threats it targets.

  • Fire: Tera Fire deters Koraidon from spamming its destructive Tera Fire Flare Blitz while remaining neutral against its powerful STAB attacks. Beyond that, it helps Ursaluna-B wall a litany of other physical threats like Calyrex-I, Zacian-C that lack an appropriate Tera Blast, Ogerpon-H, and Assault Vest Rillaboom. The Fairy-type resistance is also excellent against Flutter Mane, a common Koraidon teammate.

  • Water: Compared to Tera Fire, Tera Water is an alternative for resisting Koraidon's Flare Blitz that doesn't sacrifice Ground-type matchups like Landorus-T. It also helps Ursaluna-B against Urshifu-R when used against other types of teams. But without Tera Fire's Fairy-type resistance, Flutter Mane becomes harder to withstand if Ursaluna-B is not running Calm Mind, and Grass-types such as Ogerpon and Rillaboom will be much more threatening.

Offensive.description:
• With a good offensive typing and Adaptability pushing its already high power STAB attacks past the heavens, Basculegion is a horrifyingly powerful wallbreaker that only gets stronger in the later stages of the game!

  • Last Respects: After just one teammate is KOed, Last Respects already becomes a strong STAB move. When it's the last Pokemon standing, this vengeful attack will 2HKO almost anything that doesn't resist it at minimum, with the big exceptions being defensive Dragonite if Multiscale is intact and Dondozo if not using Life Orb.

  • Endure and Custap Berry: Endure can be used to put Basculegion into Custap Berry's activation range against many powerful attacks, letting it fire off Last Respects on the top of its priority bracket. This can be a devastating surprise late-game, turning what could be a sure loss into new avenues to sweep!

  • Flip Turn: Adaptability turns Flip Turn into a powerful pivoting move, giving Basculegion more utility early-game.

Other Options

  • Psychic Fangs: While hitting Urshifu-R extra hard isn't a bad deal, the real use for Psychic Fangs is to get rid of dual screens that would otherwise stop Basculegion from sweeping.

  • Mold Breaker: Mold Breaker can be tempting for cleaving through Multiscale Dragonite, offensive Sturdy Archaludon, and the occasional Mimikyu with Last Respects, but Dragonite's habit of using Tera Normal and the big overall damage reduction makes it a rather niche option, especially since Mold Breaker announces its presence, removing any sort of surprise value.

Items

  • Life Orb: Life Orb may compromise Basculegion's decent bulk, but it turns the fish into an absolute scourge against bulky Pokemon, with Last Respects now 2HKOing Dondozo at its maximum power and Tera Ghost even potentially 2HKOing defensive Dragonite through Mulitscale if it lacks Leftovers!

  • Assault Vest: When used with specialized EV spreads, Basculegion can send common revenge killers like Flutter Mane and Gholdengo to an early grave.

  • Focus Sash: Even with Wave Crash's recoil, Focus Sash is good for winning unexpected matchups against threats like Chi-Yu and Chien-Pao, though note that this item benefits best from a more specialized set.

General EV Spreads

  • 28 HP / 252 Atk / 228 Def with Adamant: This physically bulky EV spread survives Adamant Ogerpon-H's Horn Leech on all but the highest damage roll and does the same for Ursaluna-B's Blood Moon. It also always dodges a 2HKO from Adamant Choice Band Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes, usually survives +1 Jolly Dragonite's Scale Shot at five hits, and survives Jolly Chien-Pao's Sucker Punch.

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Def with Adamant: This spread always survives Adamant Ogerpon-H's Horn Leech but now has around a 19% chance of being OHKOed by Modest Ursaluna-B's Bloodmoon.

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe with Adamant: While maximizing Speed makes Basculegion notably frail, it does outspeed some otherwise troublesome foes like Modest Raging Bolt, although it needs to watch out for Thunderclap, and the rare but deadly Adamant Breloom.

  • Brave Nature Reducing Basculegion's Speed can give it an edge in mirror matches when used on Trick Room teams with setters like Porygon2 and Mimikyu, but note that going as far as using a Speed IV of 0 can harm Basculegion's matchups against normally slower foes like Scizor, Primarina, and Corviknight, so using a Speed IV of 31 is the most flexible option.

Assault Vest EV Spreads

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 172 Def / 68 SpD / 12 Spe: This bulky spread avoids an OHKO from Jolly Ogerpon-H's Horn Leech, survives Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball, and outspeeds paralyzed Adamant Dragonite even after one Dragon Dance.

  • 212 Atk / 244 Def / 52 SpD: This spread survives all but the highest damage from Adamant Ogerpon-H's Horn Leech and Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball at the cost of some Attack.

  • 244 Atk / 68 SpD / 196 Spe: This avoids an OHKO from Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball while still outspeeding Adamant Breloom.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Terastallization is a more double-edged sword than usual due to Adaptability, which only gives its damage bonus if Basculegion's current typing matches the attack. Because of this, while Terastallizing makes sense for Basculegion, it will lower the power of at least some of its attacks!

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy trades Basculegion's wallbreaking power for a defense against Dark-types. With Tera Blast, this can even stop Urshifu-S!

  • Water: Tera Water makes Aqua Jet into a potent late-game cleaning tool and lets Basculegion survive most Choice Specs Flutter Mane attacks as a bonus, with the exception of rare variants with Thunderbolt or Tera Blast Stellar.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost transforms Last Respects into a truly outrageous wallbreaking attack when Basculegion is the last fish swimming, with even Dondozo taking over 50% from it!

  • Fighting: Tera Fighting is a more niche option against Dark-types, leaving Basculegion vulnerable to Fairy-type attacks in exchange for a stronger matchup against Archaludon and Urshifu-S via Tera Blast.

  • Don't Use Tera Stellar!: Basculegion may seem like a perfect candidate for Tera Stellar, but don't be fooled: Adaptability has no interactions with the Stellar-type, making it completely useless unless using the niche Mold Breaker!

Swift Swim Sweeper.description:
• With such powerful attacks and the game-ending Last Respects, Swift Swim Basculegion is the king of rain teams!

  • Last Respects: Last Respects is the key to sweeping late-game if common Water-resistant foes such as Urshifu-R are still around, but even after one teammate is KOed, it's a good coverage attack.

  • Setting Up Rain: Pelipper is almost required support for this Basculegion, not only providing the needed rain to gobble teams up but even providing Tailwind so Basculegion can outspeed extremely speedy foes like Booster Energy Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle.

  • Substitute: Substitute ruins Pokemon like Chien-Pao and Urshifu-S for daring to use Sucker Punch and helps against Raging Bolt's Thunderclap as well.

  • Head Smash: While not very reliable, this is Basculegion's most powerful attack against Dragonite and Roaring Moon and rips Iron Bundle to shreds too.

  • Adamant versus Jolly: Adamant is the most reliable nature for sweeping, but Jolly does outspeed +1 Jolly Roaring Moon and Choice Scarf Latios.

  • Life Orb versus Focus Sash: Life Orb is preferred for maximizing Basculegion's late-game sweeping potential. If Life Orb is needed elsewhere, Focus Sash can be a reasonable shift in focus, making Basculegion easier to use outside of rain, which makes benching Pelipper for some matchups easier to justify.

Other Options

  • Liquidation or Waterfall: Wave Crash's constant recoil wears Basculegion down quickly, so Liquidation saves Bascluegion's scales if a foe is already in its KO range. Waterfall is a tad weaker, but the 20% chance to flinch can lead to huge upsets in a battle!

  • Rain Dance: Setting up Rain Dance usually shouldn't be a job for Basculegion, but it does severely punish Torkoal's attempt to change weather.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: While Basculegion can function without Terastalliztion, its often the star sweeper of rain teams, making it a likely choice to Terastallize.

  • Water: Tera Water boosts Wave Crash to truly obscene power, with offensive Roaring Moon in particular being OHKOed 75% of the time by Adamant Wave Crash!

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy not only saves Basculegion from Sucker Punch foes like Chien-Pao and Urshifu-S, but it also shreds Roaring Moon if it doesn't Terastallize with Tera Blast Fairy.

  • Stellar: Tera Stellar is a flexible method for sweeping, with the one-time boost to Last Respects reaping Urshifu-R's soul when Basculegion is the lone teammate alive!

  • Ghost: While it doesn't have amazing synergy with rain, Tera Ghost still boosts Last Respects into a ghoulish wallbreaking tool regardless of the weather, being particularly useful against Urshifu-R, defensive Primarina, and Dondozo

Choice Scarf.description:
• With Choice Scarf and the powerful Adaptability-boosted Flip Turn under its fins, Basculegion is an effective revenge killer and offensive pivot with an important immunity to Extreme Speed.

  • Jolly Nature: While Adamant's power may be tempting, Jolly is needed for outspeeding Iron Bundle, Adamant Dragonite after Dragon Dance, and the rare Dragapult.

  • Last Respects: Last Respects transforms Basculegion into a vindictive sweeper once its allies have passed on to the afterlife!

  • Head Smash: While the accuracy can be worrisome, this is Basculegion's most powerful attack against Dragonite and Roaring Moon and does a reasonable job of revenge killing Choice Specs Iron Bundle when Last Respects is still weak.

  • Aqua Jet: Aqua Jet may seem ridiculous with a Choice Scarf, but it can pick off weakened priority users like Urshifu-S and Chien-Pao.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Terastallization is nice when a game-ending sweep is in sight, but reducing the power of at least one of Basculegion's STAB attacks can make it a bit situational.

  • Water: Wave Crash is the least risky move to lock Basculegion into, so Tera Water is a reasonable cleaning option.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost Last Respects is an excellent cleaning tool when Basculegion is the final soul remaining, but watch out for Ursaluna-B, Porygon2, and Tera Normal Dragonite.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy reducing the power of both STAB attacks is a big issue, but it saves Basculegion against Chien-Pao and Urshifu-S's Sucker Punch, and Tera Blast Fairy still deals good damage.

  • Don't Use Tera Stellar!: Because Adaptability does not take Tera Stellar into account, this Tera Type is fool's gold and should be ignored.

Agility.description:
• Agility and the terrifying Last Respects transform Basculegion into a ferocious late-game sweeper once its friends are sleeping with the fishes!

  • Last Respects and Late-game: This set is extremely focused on sweeping late-game with Agility, so while Basculegion's Water-type attacks don't make it useless earlier in the game, its best to save it as your last Pokemon to transform Last Respects into a slaughterous showstopper!

  • Wave Crash: Even if using Focus Sash, Wave Crash's power is far too good to pass up, since Basculegion isn't guaranteed to be sweeping every game.

  • Aqua Jet: A priority attack may seem pointless on a Speed boosting set, but beyond letting Basculegion revenge kill weakened Pokemon, it also ruins Sucker Punch attempts from Chien-Pao and Urshifu-S.

  • Liquidation: If using Focus Sash, Liquidation is a reasonable alternative STAB attack to let Basculegion live another day.

  • Substitute: While risky and not a great fit with Focus Sash, Substitute punishes Sucker Punch attempts from Urshifu-S and Chien-Pao and could even turn the tables on Raging Bolt's Thunderclap.

  • Adamant versus Jolly: Adamant is the easiest nature to score sweeps with, but Jolly can be worth it if outspeeding Jolly +1 Roaring Moon and Choice Scarf Latios is important.

  • Focus Sash versus Life Orb: Focus Sash is the most reliable way to set up Agility, making it the best option. Life Orb can pull off sweeps with less damage though and is a reasonable alternative if another teammate already has Focus Sash.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: Terastallization guaranteeing that at least one of Basculegion's STAB attacks gets a downgrade is a bummer, but this set focuses so heavily on late-game sweeping that it's likely to go that route regardless.

  • Ghost: Even though Tera Ghost doesn't offer much defensive benefit, boosting Last Respects is often a key ingredient for sweeping.

  • Water: Tera Water gives Basculegion more flexibility in sweeping without the lives of its teammates being over, though Last Respects can become a disappointing cleaning tool later in the match.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy provides insurance against Sucker Punch throwers like Urshifu-S and Chien-Pao, but both STAB attacks receiving a power downgrade is a big problem. If doing this, seriously consider Tera Blast to rip Dark-types to shreds.

  • Don't Use Tera Stellar!: Tera Stellar is a siren song, having no impact on Basculegion's power at all due to Adaptability's mechanics.

Sneasler.overview:
This Pokemon has been updated for the fearsome world of Regulation G!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

GottaGoFast (Unburden Sweeper).description:
• With its good Speed tier and access to Unburden, Sneasler is one of the most potent cleaners in the metagame.

  • Dire Claw: Dire Claw is Sneasler's preferred Poison STAB move due to its highly disruptive secondary effects, making it a very difficult move to switch into, even for Pokemon that wall it like Dondozo.

  • Swords Dance: While it can be difficult to fit and somewhat risky to go for, Swords Dance allows Sneasler to increase its damage output and clean through teams more reliably.

  • Shadow Claw: Shadow Claw is an option to allow Sneasler to better handle otherwise problematic foes, such as Gholdengo. It's also a guaranteed OHKO vs. Calyrex-S that have not Terastallized.

  • Acrobatics - Acrobatics is a natural pairing with Unburden, providing a massively powerful Flying-type attack once Sneasler's item is used.

  • Fake Out: With a Normal Gem, Fake Out offers both good chip damage and the ability to safely activate Unburden.

Other Options

  • Substitute: While it requires sacrificing a STAB attack or coverage move, Substitute helps Sneasler set up on threats such as Thunder Wave Porygon2 and Salt Cure Garganacl, as well as scout for surprise Terastallizations.

  • Throat Chop: A slightly more powerful alternative to Shadow Claw, especially when used with a Dark Tera Type. However, it's more vulnerable to Calyrex-S Terastallizing into a Fairy-type.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium / High: While Sneasler's offensive prowess is naturally strong, its average bulk and unique typing can cause serious matchup issues. Terastallization is excellent for patching up both.

  • Flying: Tera Flying gives Sneasler an immunity to Ground-type attacks, allowing it to set up on foes such as Landorus while also boosting the power of Acrobatics even further. If using terrain support, however, be warned that any benefit besides Seed activation will be lost.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost grants Sneasler an immunity to Extreme Speed, notably allowing it to more consistently beat Dragonite. It does make Sneasler weak to Sucker Punch, but this weakness can be counteracted if using Psychic Terrain support.

  • Ice: When used alongside Tera Blast, Tera Ice allows Sneasler to more reliably beat foes like Landorus-T and Dragonite, and deal massive damage to common Dragon-types such as Koraidon and Miraidon.

Items

  • Electric Seed: Electric Seed allows for instant Unburden activation when paired with Miraidon. Keep in mind that Dire Claw will not put grounded foes to sleep while Electric Terrain is active.

  • Psychic Seed: When running Sneasler with Indeedee-M's Psychic Surge support, Psychic Seed allows for instant Unburden activation. The Special Defense Boost also helps against heavy hitters like Flutter Mane and Ursaluna-B.

  • Normal Gem: When combined with Fake Out, Sneasler can activate Unburden efficiently and without extra support.

  • Grassy Seed: Grassy Seed allows for instant Unburden activation when paired with Rillaboom. The Defense Boost and halved damage from Earthquake especially helps against Landorus-T.

  • White Herb: While less easily activated, not relying on a specific move to activate Unburden allows Sneasler to diversify its move selection more, becoming more of a threat.

EV Spreads

  • 36 HP / 252 Atk / 4 Def / 4 SpD / 212 Spe with Adamant: This EV spread will outspeed up to Timid Choice Scarf Calyrex-S upon activating Unburden, while maximizing attack. The 36 EVs in HP maximize recovery from Grassy Terrain.

Focus Sash.description:
• With Focus Sash, Sneasler can go all-in on high-powered disruption!

  • Shadow Claw: Shadow Claw is Sneasler's most reliable coverage move into Gholdengo, as well as a way to OHKO Calyrex-S.

  • Toxic Spikes: Toxic Spikes is a great support option as a lead, allowing Sneasler to build momentum for its teammates by disrupting bulkier foes.

  • Fake Out: Not only does Fake Out help break Focus Sash and Multiscale, but the free attack gives an extra chance for Poison Touch to activate.

  • Adamant versus Jolly: Running an Adamant nature maximizes power while still outspeeding threats such as Jolly Garchomp. Running a Jolly nature will let Sneasler outspeed up to Jolly Roaring Moon.

Other Options

  • Fire Punch: Fire Punch can OHKO maximum HP Scizor, which can otherwise bypass Focus Sash with Technician Dual Wingbeat.

Abilities

  • Poison Touch: Poison Touch gives Sneasler extra chances to cripple threats, especially when paired with Fake Out.

  • Unburden: If wanting to maximize your chances of paralyzing or putting a target to sleep with Dire Claw, Unburden should be used over Poison Touch. The extra Speed can also be helpful for turning the tables on speedy foes like Calyrex-S and Miraidon, but Sneasler's Focus Sash is not always in danger of being consumed against more passive Pokemon such as Alomomola.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: While there are unique cases where Terastallization is useful, this set tends to do just fine without it.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost can surprise Extreme Speed Dragonite trying to revenge kill Sneasler, and the boost to Shadow Claw is a big help against Gholdengo.

  • Fighting: Tera Fighting takes Sneasler's strongest STAB attack in Close Combat and pushes it even farther.

  • Stellar: Tera Stellar is a great way to take advantage of Sneasler's diverse offensive options without losing its unique typing. With an Adamant nature, the one-time boost to Shadow Claw guarantees a 2HKO on maximum HP Gholdengo.

  • Poison: Tera Poison is a situational option that gives Dire Claw a much-needed boost, and maintaining Sneasler's original Poison typing will let it absorb Toxic Spikes later if needed.

Meowscarada.overview:
This Pokemon has been updated to reflect Regulation H, that lasts until January 5h, 2025. After this, Regulation G will return.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

CRITTY CAT.description:
• With its good Attack, Speed, and access to Flower Trick and Knock Off, Meowscarada is a potent cleaner that is also hard to switch into.

  • Flower Trick: With its guaranteed critical hit, Flower Trick is a dangerous cleaning move once resistances to it have been sufficiently chipped.

  • U-turn: If using Protean, Meowscarada is a pivot that does far more damage than most users of U-turn, and helps Choice Scarf Meowscarada get out of some tricky early-game situations such as Serperior leads.

  • Trick: Trick can help Choice-locked sets incapacitate an annoying wall, such as Corviknight or Dondozo, by locking them into a single move. It also has the bonus of Protean letting Meowscarada resist Fighting-type attacks after using it.

  • Triple Axel: Triple Axel may not be the most reliable move out there, but it strikes fear into the heart of Dragonite and offensive Mimikyu, who can both be big offensive issues for Meowscarda.

  • Jolly versus Adamant: Jolly is usually preferred for for the speed tie in mirror matches, but Adamant 's extra power can be justified on Choice Scarf since it still outspeeds boosted Garchomp.

  • Choice Band versus Choice Scarf: Choice Band boosted Meowscarada hits incredibly hard, and with its naturally high Speed it can serve as a cleaner and a potential wallbreaker, especially against common Defense-boosting foes such as Bulk Up Annihilape and Tera Fairy Archaludon. With the Speed offered via Choice Scarf, Meowscarada can threaten otherwise faster foes, such as Dragapult and +1 Garchomp, potentially putting more pressure on offensive teams.

  • Protean versus Overgrow: Protean’s type-shifting allows Meowscarada to make the most of its colorful movepool, particularly on Choice-locked sets, where the limitation to only changing types once is effectively nullified. If you intend to make use of a Tera type other than Grass or Stellar, Overgrow is worth considering, as it allows Meowscarada more flexibility with its moves by not changing type and removing STAB from Flower Trick or Knock Off.

Other Options

  • Play Rough: Compared to Triple Axel, Play Rough isn't nearly as good at handling Dragon-types besides Hydreigon, but it does stop Terastallized Dragonite, Garchomp, and Baxcalibur from grabbing a Speed boost with Scale Shot.

  • Sucker Punch: Sucker Punch is a strong priority attack, but it can be rather risky with a Choice item.

  • Brick Break: Low Kick's superior damage output against Ursaluna-B usually makes it the better Fighting-type coverage, but with Choice Band, Brick Break still OHKOes Kingambit and breaks Alolan Ninetales's Aurora Veil.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Terastallization overriding Protean means Meowscarada should usually only Terastallize to clean a weakened team late-game.

  • Grass: While Terastallizing does override Protean, Tera Grass Meowscarada can be used to power through teams ill-prepared for it. Dual screens teams in particular are especially vulnerable to the sheer power of Choice Band-boosted Tera Grass Flower Trick.

  • Dark: Tera Dark boosted Knock Off isn't as reliable at sweeping as Flower Trick, but it can surprise bulky Steel-types such as Scizor and Archaludon, as well as deal incredible damage to bulky Volcarona.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost is a defensive option to stop Dragonite's Extreme Speed from revenge killing Meowscarada.

  • Stellar: Tera Stellar's one-time boost per attack can give Meowscarada more flexible cleaning options. If Meowscarada Terastallizes after using Protean, the type it currently is will get the double base power boost, which can lead to unexpectedly powerful coverage moves!

  • Fire: Tera Fire gives Meowscarada a Will-O-Wisp immunity and Fire resistance to combat bulky Volcarona.

Alternate EV Spreads

  • 76 HP / 228 Atk / 108 Def / 4 SpD / 92 Speed with Jolly: This bulkier Choice Scarf spread allows Meowscarada to outspeed Jolly Garchomp while avoiding an OHKO from Breloom's Mach Punch and Choice Band Dragonite's Extreme Speed.

Minor Optimizations

  • Neutral Natures and Trick: Make sure to use a neutral nature and use a Jolly or Adamant Mint on Meowscarada, so it won't get confused by eating any Berry after Trick.

Focus Sash.description:
• With its good Speed and wide movepool, Meowscarada makes for a potent lead.

  • Triple Axel: Triple Axel prevents Meowscarada from getting set-up on by Dragonite, and ruins Garchomp and Hydreigon.

  • Sucker Punch: Sucker Punch allows Meowscarada to better handle fast foes such as Dragapult and Choice Scarf Gholdengo.

  • Toxic Spikes: Meowscarada is an excellent offensive choice to lay Toxic Spikes, since it puts immense pressure on Ursaluna-B leads.

  • Low Kick: Low Kick is Meowscarada's only way through Kingambit, with the bonus of dealing immense damage to Tera Normal Ursaluna-B.

  • Protean versus Overgrow: Protean offers the most offensive flexibility. For more supportive sets with Toxic Spikes, Overgrow lets it keep STAB on its attacks after it uses its support moves.

Other Options

  • Taunt: Thanks to its good Speed, Meowscarada makes particularly excellent use of Taunt, though two big targets, Archaludon and Annihilape, will put Meowscarada in immense danger.

  • Play Rough: While Triple Axel deals with most Dragon-types better, Play Rough can be a huge upset against Terastallized Scale Shot users like Dragonite and Garchomp!

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: This Meowscarada has very little use for Terastallization, only using it in late-game situations where it can sweep.

  • Grass: When paired with an Overgrow boost, Tera Grass lets Flower Trick deal a huge amount of damage.

  • Dark: Tera Dark makes Knock Off even more difficult to switch into, especially hitting Volcarona hard.

  • Stellar: Tera Stellar is the more flexible option for late-game sweeping. Just remember that moves only get the double BP boost if they match Meowscarada's current typing.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost saves Meowscarada from Normal-type priority, which can flip the match on unsuspecting Dragonite!

Skeledirge.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Defensive Gator.description:
• Thanks to instant recovery, Unaware, and the snowballing potential of Torch Song, Skeledirge is a viable alternative to Dondozo.

  • Will-O-Wisp versus Yawn: Will-O-Wisp vastly improves Skeledirge's match-up against fearsome physical foes such as Kingambit, while Yawn works exceptionally well with Stealth Rock support.

  • Earth Power: Earth Power hits Chi-Yu switch-ins hard and is the best option into Terastallized Ogerpon-H. This is usually the preferred coverage move if using Skeledirge on a stall team.

  • Substitute: Substitute is a good way around status, especially Garganacl's Salt Cure. It also becomes effective when used on Toxic Spikes teams.

Other Options
  • Encore: When paired with Substitute, Skeledirge can seriously punish passive Pokemon, though at a serious cost in coverage.
Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: Skeledirge's defensive typing isn't without its merits, but the wide variety of weaknesses it has often forces Skeledirge to Terastallize to check major threats like Chien-Pao and Dragonite.

  • Fairy: Terastallizing into the Fairy typing removes Skeledirges glaring weakness to Dark and provides an overall superior defensive typing, making Chien-Pao and Ting-Lu far more reasonable to deal with. It also provides a neutral typing for the inevitable Shadow Balls that will be thrown at Skeledirge, like from Flutter Mane or Gholdengo.

  • Water: A Water Tera type lets Skeledirge take on opposing Water-type attacks, providing a valuable turn to burn foes like Urshifu-R. It should be noted that Tera Water tends to be a safer option versus the common Gholdengo, as it does not often run Thunderbolt.

  • Normal: While Tera Normal isn't fantastic defensively, it lets Skeledirge severely punish attempts from special attacking Ghost-types such as Flutter Mane and Gholdengo to check it.

  • Dragon: A Dragon Tera type let's Skeledirge check Urshifu-R and Ogerpon-H simultaneously, though it will likely need help from teammates covering its newfound Fairy-type weakness.

Items

  • Leftovers versus Sitrus Berry: Residual recovery helps Skeledirge use Torch Song more freely. Leftovers is the best option since Skeledirge has instant recovery, but Sitrus Berry with an even HP stat can be used to restore some health after getting hit by Ruination.

  • Ability Shield: Ability Shield keeps Unaware active in the face of Mold Breaker users like Swords Dance Ogerpon-H, which can overwhelm Skeledirge with enough boosts.

  • Covert Cloak: Covert Cloak ignores the secondary effects of Garganacl's Salt Cure as well as stopping stat drops from Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball and Ogerpon-H's Rock Tomb.

  • Heavy-Duty Boots: This makes Skeledirge less pressured to Terastallize to rid itself of its Stealth Rock weakness.

Blunder Song.description:
• With Blunder Policy, this Skeledirge provides a unique approach to offense: it'll either put important foes to sleep or threaten to snowball into a sweep with Speed and Special Attack boosts!

  • Shadow Ball: Even with Skeledirge's wide variety of viable Tera types, Shadow Ball is still an excellent secondary STAB attack for hitting Dragapult, Flutter Mane, and opposing Skeledirge.

  • Earth Power: Earth Power is Skeledirge's best option against Garganacl and Chi-Yu, and it makes checking Iron Moth feasible.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: Beyond the many weaknesses Skeledirge's typing has, it only has one shot of having +2 Speed, so Terastallizing is preferred over switching when possible.

  • Fairy: With this Skeledirge's more offensive nature, Tera Fairy's immunity to powerful Dragon-type attacks is a big help, and it makes Tera Blast an effective tool against bulky foes such as Ting-Lu, Baxcalibur, and Garchomp.

  • Water: Besides being a fantastic defensive typing, Tera Water gives Skeledirge the chance to pick off weakened Iron Bundle as they use Hydro Pump and gives it a good attack against Chi-Yu, Garganacl, and Iron Moth.

  • Fire: In addition to removing the troublesome Ghost-type weakness, Tera Fire makes sweeping with Torch Song require less setup.

  • Normal: Tera Normal gives Skeledirge a key Ghost-type immunity, taking advantage of common Choiced Ghost-types such as Gholdengo.

  • Grass: Tera Grass vastly improves Skeledirge's matchup against Breloom, Rotom-W, and Brute Bonnet.

EV Spreads

  • All EV spreads for this set should outspeed Dragapult after missing Sing.

  • 204 HP / 4 Def / 132 SpA / 4 SpD / 164 Spe with Modest: The HP investment in this spread lets Skeledirge survive one Earthquake from Garchomp or one Throat Chop from Jolly Focus Sash Chien-Pao when staying not Terastallizing, and one Choice Specs Hydro Pump from Iron Bundle when Tera Fairy or Tera Normal.

  • 92 HP / 252 SpA / 164 Spe with Modest: This spread sacrifices bulk for being able to OHKO Iron Bundle with Torch Song after Stealth Rock damage and doing the same to Kingambit with Tera Fire.

  • 164 HP / 180 Def / 164 Spe with Bold: This defensive spread allows Tera Skeledirge to always avoid a 2HKO from Jolly Choice Band Dragonite's Extreme Speed and avoids getting 2HKOed by Baxcalibur's 4-hit Icicle Spear when Tera Normal or Fairy.

  • 4 Def / 252 SpA / 252 Spe with Modest or Timid: A huge sacrifice in bulk makes it harder for Skeledirge to set up, but the Speed investment does allow it to outspeed several major Choice Scarf threats after missing Sing. Modest variants will outspeed up to Modest Choice Scarf Chi-Yu and Jolly Choice Scarf Annihilape, while Timid sets will Speed tie with +1 Espathra.

Offensive Gator.description: This set does not have a full write-up yet. If you'd like to finish this, feel free to reserve it here!

(Regulation C) Moxie Sweeper.description:
• Aqua Step and Moxie give Quaquaval a niche as a late-game sweeper that doesn't always need a turn of setup.

  • Aqua Jet: Aqua Jet's ability to pick off weakened threats pairs very well with Moxie, giving it new potential win conditions.

  • Ice Spinner: This is Quaquaval's best way of dealing big damage to Dragonite and Garchomp.

  • Encore: Encore lets Quaquaval punish slower foes such as Corviknight by getting an easy setup opportunity or by simply forcing them to switch.

Other Options

  • Wave Crash: While Wave Crash is Quaquaval's strongest Water-type attack, the recoil can be problematic for Focus Sash sets.

  • Roost: Recovery might seem odd on such an offensive Pokemon, but it helps Quaquaval avoid getting worn down against bulkier teams.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: With Moxie and Aqua Step boosting its offensive output, Quaquaval doesn't always have to rely on Terastallization.

  • Water: Boosting Aqua Step's and Aqua Jet's power opens up new sweeping chances late-game.

  • Electric: Tera Electric lets Quaquaval deal massive damage to Azumarill and wear down Dondozo switch-ins with Tera Blast.

  • Steel: Tera Steel can let Quaquaval get the jump on Fairy- and Dragon-types such as Flutter Mane and Garchomp by resisting their attacks.

Items

  • Focus Sash: With Focus Sash, Quaquaval trades potential wallbreaking for getting surprise sweeps against more offensive teams.

  • Assault Vest: Even without defensive investment, Assault Vest can let Quaquaval take a super-effective hit against some naturally faster threats, such as Psychic Chi-Yu and Energy Ball Iron Moth.

  • Mystic Water: The power increase to Aqua Step and Aqua Jet makes sweeping easier, especially when paired with Tera Water.

(Regulation C) Bulky.description:
• While Quaquaval's bulk is only serviceable, having both Roost and a great support movepool makes it a reasonable defensive option that does particularly well against Kingambit.

  • Taunt and Bulk Up: Taunt pairs particularly well with Bulk Up, letting it set up on surprising foes such as Corviknight.

  • Substitute: Substitute lets Quaquaval stall out OHKO moves from the likes of Dondozo, and it protects it from Garganacl's Salt Cure.

  • Encore: Not only does Encore give Quaquaval new chances to set up, but it also punishes passive play from Unaware walls such as Skeledirge.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Setup Quaquaval will often have to use Terastallization to deal with the checks switching into it.

  • Steel: Tera Steel gives Quauqaval a better matchup against Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle, who can be fairly problematic otherwise.

  • Flying: While it has very little defensive synergy with Quaquaval's previous typing, Tera Flying lets Quaquaval effectively stall out Dondozo if using Taunt, or Substitute and Encore together.

  • Grass: Tera Grass makes Quaquaval's match-up against Rotom-W much smoother.

  • Fairy: With a Fairy Tera type, Quaquaval can set up against most defensive Garchomp thanks to the Dragon Tail immunity.

Items

  • Leftovers: The passive recovery from Leftovers works great with Substitute sets in particular.

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet pairs well with Taunt and Tera Flying, letting Quaquaval easily play around Dondozo and Corviknight while setting up Bulk Up.

  • Covert Cloak: If running Substitute isn't possible, Covert Cloak is Quaquaval's best shot at defeating Garganacl.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 156 SpD / 100 Spe with Jolly: This EV spread allows Quaquaval to outspeed Meowscarada after an Aqua Step while raising its special bulk. If not using Bulk Up, running Defense EVs is also viable instead.

  • 244 HP / 4 Atk / 28 Def / 164 SpD / 68 Spe with Careful: The Special Defense investment and Careful nature let Quaquaval survive Timid Flutter Mane's unboosted Moonblast at full health, and the Speed lets it outspeed Garchomp after Aqua Step.

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 Spe with Jolly: Maximizing Speed ensures that Quaquaval outspeeds Choice Scarf Gholdengo, Iron Bundle, Flutter Mane, and Dragapult after using Aqua Step.

Lokix.overview:
Welcome to the next generation of Battle Stadium Singles! In this new and exciting metagame, new ideas are constantly developing, so this analysis will constantly be updated to reflect metagame trends.

If you feel this analysis is not up to date, feel free to check out the thread for this Pokemon and post suggestions. For more resources on Series 1 in general, check out this thread.

Tinted Offense.description:
• The combination of First Impression and Tinted Lens make Lokix one of the most threatening revenge killers in the format, able to outprioritize and KO foes regardless of resistance.

  • First Impression is Lokix's most important attack, but it can only be used as the first attack after it switches in.

  • U-turn can be punishing against offensive and slow teams as the lack of resists means Lokix can keep switching in and dealing big damage with First Impression, at the cost of making it vulnerable to hazards.

  • Leech Life is the strongest Bug-type move Lokix learns outside of First Impression, with the added benefit of healing recoil damage.

  • Sucker Punch is a powerful STAB priority move, enabling Lokix to outprioritize foes even after it has used First Impression.

  • Axe Kick is the only coverage move of note in Lokix's moveset due to its high Base Power. Be wary of the low accuracy and recoil that occurs should it miss.

  • Throat Chop is the most powerful Dark-type move Lokix learns. It also has the side benefit of disabling Roar from Hippowdon and Hyper Voice from Sylveon.

  • Swords Dance is an option to make Lokix a sweeper instead of a revenge killer.

Items

Life Orb: Life Orb enables easier revenge kills at the cost of recoil.

Silver Powder: Silver Powder raises the power of First Impression without the recoil from Life Orb, and it also frees up Life Orb for a teammate to use instead.

Tera Types

Bug: A Bug Tera Type increases the damage of First Impression, allowing Lokix to OHKO foes it could not otherwise, such as Dragapult.

Pawmot.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out the format page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

Offensive Utility.description:
• Pawmot separates itself from Iron Hands by having an excellent support movepool and a good Speed tier.

  • Double Shock and Close Combat: Double Shock and Close Combat are its most important attacks, but note that it can only use Double Shock once without Terastallizing. Once Terastillized, Pawmot you can use Double Shock continuously for big damage, even on foes that resist it.

  • Mach Punch: Priority allows Pawmot to revenge kill better, hitting Meowscarada, Roaring Moon, and Iron Bundle super effectively.

  • Ice Punch: Ice Punch gives Pawmot coverage against Ground-types, most notably Great Tusk, Clodsire, and Garchomp, in addition to hitting Dragonite for lots of damage before it Terastallizes.

  • Revival Blessing: Revival Blessing's one shot of reviving a teammate gives Pawmot an extremely unique niche in turning battles around, though it doesn't fit all offensive teams.

  • Nuzzle: This is notably one of the few ways to inflict paralysis on Gholdengo. Nuzzle is best when used with a Focus Sash, as Pawmot can paralyze the foe and outspeed it the next turn, getting another move off before it faints.

  • Encore: Encore does a great job of punishing passive play, and prevents easy setup from slower defensive foes such as Garganacl.

Other Options
  • Fake Out: This can be used to get an edge against common Focus Sash leads such as Meowscarada.
Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Situational: Terastallizing is only needed if Pawmot is on the field long enough for repeated uses of Double Shock.

  • Electric: An Electric Tera Type allows Pawmot to continuously use Double Shock, making it an effective late-game cleaner.

Items

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash trades the damage boost from the other items for better opportunities to use support moves.

  • Life Orb: Life Orbs enables easier revenge kills at the cost of recoil.

  • Magnet: Magnet will power up Double Shock without the recoil from Life Orb, and it also frees up Life Orb for a teammate to use instead.

Abilities

  • Iron Fist: This boosts the power of Mach Punch and Ice Punch, giving Pawmot more powerful priority and coverage.

  • Volt Absorb: Volt Absorb's Electric immunity stops Magnezone, Rotom-W, and Rotom-H from using Volt Switch to create safe switch-ins.

  • Natural Cure: This allows Pawmot to take status moves more freely, such as Yawn from Dondozo or Will-O-Wisp from Skeledirge.

Offensive.description:
• Pawmot's good offensive stats and unique support movepool give it a good niche in the metagame.

  • Double Shock and Close Combat are its most important attacks, but note that it can only use Double Shock once without Terastallizing. Once Terastillized, Pawmot you can use Double Shock continuously for big damage, even on foes that resist it.

  • Mach Punch allows Pawmot to revenge kill better, hitting Meowscarada, Choice Scarf Hydreigon, and Tera Steel Dragapult super effectively.

  • Ice Punch gives Pawmot coverage against Ground-types, most notably Clodsire and Garchomp, in addition to hitting Dragapult for lots of damage.

  • Revival Blessing's one shot of reviving a teammate give Pawmot an extremely unique niche in turning battles around, though it doesn't fit all offensive teams.

  • Nuzzle paralyzes foes, and it's notably one of the few ways to inflict paralysis on Gholdengo. This move is best when used with a Focus Sash, as Pawmot can paralyze the foe and outspeed it the next turn, getting another move off before it faints.

  • Encore does a great job of punishing passive play, and prevents easy setup from slower defensive foes such as Garganacl.

  • Fake Out can be used to get an edge against common Focus Sash leads such as Meowscarada.

Abilities

  • Iron Fist: This boosts the power of Mach Punch and Ice Punch, giving Pawmot more powerful priority and coverage.

  • Volt Absorb: Volt Absorb's Electric immunity stops Magnezone, Rotom-W, and Rotom-H from using Volt Switch to create safe switch-ins.

  • Natural Cure: This allows Pawmot to take status moves more freely, such as Yawn from Dondozo or Will-o-Wisp from Skeledirge.

Items

  • Life Orb: Life Orbs enables easier revenge kills at the cost of recoil.

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash trades the damage boost from the other items for better opportunities to use support moves.

  • Magnet: Magnet will power up Double Shock without the recoil from Life Orb, and it also frees up Life Orb for a teammate to use instead.

Tera Types

  • Electric: An Electric Tera Type allows Pawmot to continuously use Double Shock, making it an effective late-game cleaner.

Assault Vest.description:
• With a superb special stat line, Seed Sower, and good moveset coverage, Arboliva can be a deceptively strong and long-living Assault Vest user!

  • Seed Sower: Once activated, Grassy Terrain’s passive recovery and boosting of Grass-type attacks like Giga Drain can help Arboliva survive longer than expected. Grassy Terrain also halving Earthquake’s power is greatly appreciated by bulky teammates like Skeledirge, Arcanine, and Iron Hands.

  • Dazzling Gleam: This move keeps Arboliva from becoming setup bait against foes like offensive Dragonite, and is also your best move into Wo-Chien before Tera.

  • Tera Blast: Tera Blast is a great option for hitting types that Arboliva lacks natural coverage for. Tera Fire lets Arboliva hit Steel-types like Scizor and Tera Electric punishes Tera Flying users like Gholdengo. Both Tera Fire and Tera Electric cover Corviknight as well.

  • Mirror Coat: This set’s massive special bulk can make getting one-shots with Mirror Coat awkward, but it is still a great option, particularly against boosted or super effective hits. Bear in mind though that this won’t work against Chi-Yu as long as it keeps its Dark typing.

  • Leaf Storm: Leaf Storm trades consistency for a single turn of high burst damage and can be worth it if investing in Special Attack.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Arboliva’s raw special stats make it capable of tanking super effective hits without using Tera. Nonetheless, Tera is still a strong tool to extend Arboliva’s uptime and contest matchups that would otherwise capitalize on its mediocre defensive typing.

  • Fire: Tera Fire can flip matchups against Focus Sash Chien-Pao and Choice Scarf Chi-Yu when healthy. If running Tera Blast, it also gives Arboliva the opportunity to contest Steel-types more effectively. Be aware, though, that this significantly worsens other key matchups, like Rotom-W.

  • Poison: Tera Poison is a solid defensive option, especially into Toxic abusers like Toxapex and Clodsire. Notably, it flips several weaknesses, blocks Toxic, and allows for absorbing Toxic Spikes later in the match.

  • Electric: Tera Electric is Gholdengo's worst nightmare. It gives a resistance to Make It Rain, blocks Thunder Wave from defensive sets, and punishes Tera Flying usage that is meant to get around Earth Power. On top of that, Arboliva still hits Corviknight very hard.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy is another great defensive option for neutralizing most of Arboliva's weaknesses, and the extra power behind Dazzling Gleam can make it easier to break defensive Dragonite variants.

  • Grass: Tera Grass removes Arboliva’s Fighting weakness while maintaining Spore immunity, letting it check Breloom. If both Tera and Grassy Terrain are active, Modest Giga Drain can even 2HKO Breloom!

  • Ground: While not as strong defensively, invested Tera Earth Power can OHKO uninvested Chi-Yu and Gholdengo.

EV Spreads

  • 236 HP / 4 Def / 140 SpA / 124 SpD / 4 Spe with Modest: This spread balances bulk and power, avoiding the 2HKO from Choice Specs Gholdengo's Make It Rain and almost always surviving Modest Chi-Yu’s Fire Blast before Tera! If running Tera Ground, there are enough Special Attack EV’s to turn Earth Power into an OHKO against uninvested Chi-Yu and Gholdengo. The Speed EV's Speed tie with 4 Speed Gastrodon.

  • 236 HP / 252 SpA / 20 SpD with Modest: This simple spread still provides plenty of bulk while maximizing Special Attack, working nicely with Leaf Storm and Tera Types that boost Arboliva's coverage moves. If Grassy Terrain is present, fully invested Leaf Storm has a 75% chance of OHKOing 4 Special Defense Garchomp. The bulk investment lets Arboliva always avoid the 2HKO from Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Mystical Fire after Grassy Terrain recovery.

  • 236 HP / 20 SpD / 252 Spe with Modest: While maximum Speed investment may seem a bit strange, it can be worth it when running Tera Fire Tera Blast to get the jump on Scizor, Corviknight and the rare Timid Amoonguss.

  • 236 HP / 4 Def / 148 SpA / 20 SpD / 100 Spe with Modest: This alternative Speed spread gives Arboliva a nice boost in Special Attack while still letting it outrun 4 Speed Azumarill. This is usually more than enough Speed to outrun Ting-Lu as well.

Garganacl.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Salty Stall.description:
• With some entry hazard support, this Garganacl can be very difficult to outstall, thanks to the constant passive damage from Salt Cure.

  • Protect: Not only does Protect scout for surprise Tera types, but it also goes well with the passive healing from Leftovers.

  • Stealth Rock: Since this set benefits so much from Stealth Rock support, running it on its own is a reasonable sacrifice if Garganacl needs to be more self-sufficient.

  • Substitute: This makes Garganacl even more difficult to properly switch into, providing protection against Trick, OHKO moves, and opposing Salt Cure.

  • Fissure: Garganacl's great bulk makes it a prime candidate for fishing with Fissure itself, though its low PP can be an issue in mirror matches.

Other Options

  • Fling with Light Ball, Toxic Orb, or Flame Orb: Although the loss of Leftovers can be a huge blow for Garganacl, Fling and its associated status inducing items can be a devastating surprise for some of its checks, such as Annihilape and Urshifu formes. Just note that Covert Cloak will still block these statuses.

  • Sturdy and Custap Berry: Getting rid of Garganacl's status immunity and Ghost resistance is a huge sacrifice, but it can let Garganacl lead against some surprising Pokemon effectively without needing to Terastallize, like Choice Specs Chi-Yu and Iron Bundle. Custap Berry's pseudo-priority can also lead to surprising Stealth Rock set-ups.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: While Rock may be an awful defensive typing, this Garganacl's complete focus on taking advantage of Salt Cure means that in some scenarios, it can get away without Terastallizing.

  • Poison: Tera Poison's Fighting and Fairy-type resistance vastly improves Garganacl's match-up against Flutter Mane, Ogerpon-H, and Urshifu-R, making it a prime Tera choice. As a bonus, this also lets Garganacl absorb Toxic Spikes.

  • Water: Tera Water gives Garganacl a better matchup against Chien-Pao, Urshifu-R, and Gholdengo, in addition to being an excellent defensive typing.

  • Ghost: While removing Purifying Salt's Ghost resistance is a shame, Tera Ghost does wonderfully against Archaludon and opposing Garganacl due to the Body Press immunity, and in general removes all of Garganacl's common weaknesses. Tera Ghost also can make foes paranoid of it being the Curse set.

  • Flying: Tera Flying gets rid of the Ground and Fighting weaknesses, giving it a far better chance of beating Landorus-T and Ursaluna-B. It also makes Fissure no longer an issue from Ting-Lu, Dondozo, and opposing Garganacl.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy lets Garganacl tank powerful Fighting coverage such as Chien-Pao's Scared Sword, and shrug off powerful Dragon-type attacks from Latios and Roaring Moon.

Curse.description:
• With Curse's well-known different effect for Ghost-types being brought into play by Terastallization, Garganacl makes dangerous and diverse use of the move! Boosting Salt Cure's meager power can also help against frailer Substitute users such as Flutter Mane.

  • Tera Ghost Curse: If using Tera Ghost, Curse will change its effect, which drastically changes Garganacl's playstyle. While the 50% health cut can make it a tad risky, the Curse affliction is very powerful at wearing down Pokemon, including major foes that take advantage of Salt Cure, such as Covert Cloak Pokemon, bulky Substitute users, and Blaziken Baton Pass chains. When combined with Salt Cure, it can even overwhelm bulky Pokemon with recovery, such as Dragonite.

  • Curse and Earthquake: Ghost Curse unfortunately does not work against Gholdengo, so using regular Curse alongside Earthquake makes Garganacl far less passive against against Gholdengo and frail Substitute users such as Flutter Mane. This is especially recommended if using other Tera types.

  • Protect versus Substitute: Protect is perfect for getting some extra Leftovers recovery, but Substitute comes in handy against Dragon Tail users like Archaludon and Garchomp.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: Salt Cure means Garganacl can still without Terastallization, but to truly take advantage of either facet of Curse, expect to Terastallize it often.

  • Ghost: In addition to being a great defensive typing that leaves Garganacl with only a weakness to Dark thanks to Purifying Salt, this is the Tera type that enables the unique properties of Curse.

  • Poison: Tera Poison is Garganacl's best option against Flutter Mane, ensuring it resists both STAB attacks. Absorbing Toxic Spikes is also helpful against stall teams.

  • Water: If messing with Gholdengo is the goal, Tera Water is an excellent choice, resisting the powerful Make It Rain and being a good defensive typing in general.

  • Fairy: Beyond being a great typing that offers a Fighting-type resistance, it also means Garganacl no longer has to worry about Dragon Tail from Archaludon. This doesn't improve Garganacl's match-up against Gholdengo though.

  • Flying: Tera Flying has excellent synergy with Garganacl's former typing, making it immune to Landorus-T and Ursaluna-B's Ground-type attacks, and even removing any worry about Fissure from Ting-Lu and Dondozo. However, this comes at the cost of still making it vulnerable to Iron Bundle.

Defensive.description:
• With Purifying Salt making it immune to status and Salt Cure providing useful chip damage, especially against Water- and Steel-types, Garganacl is a dangerous defensive setup Pokemon.

  • Iron Defense and Body Press: Body Press is the best option for consistency against offensive teams.

  • Fissure: Fissure severely punishes passive play against Garganacl, at the cost of forcing it to rely on Salt Cure residual damage against offensive teams.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: Rock has a huge amount of weaknesses as a defensive typing, so Garganacl will usually want to Terastallize to make sweeping more feasible.

  • Poison: Tera Poison is the prime pick to combat Flutter Mane, with it making Garganacl resist both Moonblast and Shadow Ball. The Fighting-type resistance against Urshifu formes and Toxic Spikes absorption is also quite helpful.

  • Water: Tera Water vastly improves Garganacl's chances of defeating Gholdengo, Urshifu-R, and Chien-Pao.

  • Ghost: A Ghost Tera type gives Garganacl an immunity to Body Press, giving it the edge against Archaludon and opposing Garganacl, especially when paired with Leftovers. It can also fool players into thinking Garganacl is using the Curse set.

  • Flying: A Flying typing lets Garganacl take on new foes such as Landorus-T, Ursaluna-B, and Garchomp, though it makes Garganacl fairly weak to Iron Bundle and Chien-Pao

  • Fairy: Fairy is a good defensive type for Garganacl, giving it a useful Fighting and Dark resistance to help against Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu, and no longer worrying about powerful Dragon-type attacks. However, Garganacl still remains vulnerable to powerful Steel-type attacks from foes like Gholdengo. EV Spreads ========

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Careful: Maximizing Special Defense is the best choice for easier setup.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 Spe with Impish: In addition to powering up Body Press, a focus on Defense makes setting up on powerful setup sweepers such as Dragonite an easier task.

  • 252 HP / 84 Def / 172 SpD with Careful: This EV spread allows Tera Steel Garganacl to avoid a 2HKO from Breloom's Mach Punch after Iron Defense.

Expanding Force.description:
• Armarouge's combination of powerful STAB moves, excellent coverage, Weak Armor, and Psychic Terrain makes it a strong candidate to use Focus Sash.

  • Psychic Terrain: Psychic Terrain is a powerful setup move for Armarouge thanks to Expanding Force; it also protects Armarouge from priority moves after Weak Armor triggers.

  • Expanding Force: Expanding Force under Psychic Terrain especially with Tera Psychic, is a devastatingly powerful move.

  • Armor Cannon: This helps Armarouge defeat Steel-types as well as Chien-Pao and Wo-Chien, who all resist or block Expanding Force.

  • Aura Sphere: While Armor Cannon covers several prominent Dark-types, Aura Sphere is needed if you want to threaten Chi-Yu or Roaring Moon.

  • Destiny Bond: This is a good alternative to forcefully take down threats that Armarouge can’t easily KO, and it works very well with Weak Armor.

  • Energy Ball: Energy Ball hits the specially defensive Water-types Armarouge might struggle to defeat otherwise, most notably Gastrodon.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low / Medium: Between Focus Sash and Psychic Terrain blocking priority moves, Armarouge is well-equipped to play without Tera. On the other hand, Armarouge can specialize to handle certain matchups better, at which point Tera can become more necessary.

  • Grass: This Tera typing turns Armarouge's Water- and Ground-type weaknesses into resistances, and gives a vital Spore immunity against opposing Breloom.

  • Psychic: With a boost from Tera Psychic, Expanding Force OHKOes even relatively bulky foes such as Garchomp and Flutter Mane. With Stealth Rock, Expanding Force still achieves most notable KOs without Tera Psychic, but the extra damage is still appreciated.

  • Fairy: In cases where setting up Psychic Terrain proves to be more difficult, Tera Fairy grants a resistance to Sucker Punch and makes disrupting other Dark-types like Chi-Yu easier. Its also just a solid defensive typing that neutralizes all of its other weaknesses.

  • Fighting: Tera Fighting is a more niche option for a Dark-type resistance that also powers up Aura Sphere.

Abilities

  • Weak Armor: This ability takes full advantage of Focus Sash, guaranteeing you live a single hit from a physical attacker and granting a big Speed boost thereafter.

  • Flash Fire: While more situational, Flash Fire is worth considering with certain Tera Types like Grass, keeping momentum against revenge killers who use Fire-type attacks. It can also be used with Tera Fairy or Tera Fighting to shut down many variants of Chi-Yu.

Offensive.description: • This set does not have a full write-up yet. If you'd like to finish this, feel free to reserve it here!

Ceruledge.overview:
With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Bulk Up Sweeper.description:
• Bulk Up Ceruledge makes excellent use of both its respectable bulk and Bitter Blade's high recovery. By changing its typing to a more defense oriented one, while maintaining the Fire immunity thanks to Flash Fire, Ceruledge can set up Bulk Ups on a variety of common Pokemon, ranging from Corviknight, Kingambit, Azumarill and Gholdengo.

  • Taunt: Taunt lets Ceruledge set up Bulk Up without needing to fear common phasing moves (with the exception of attacking moves such as Dragon Tail), as well as opposing setup moves such opposing Bulk Up and Iron Defense, provided you outspeed.

  • Shadow Sneak Priority of some form is always nice to have on a Pokemon, which makes Shadow Sneak an easy contender for the last move. Gaining extra added strength against Pokemon such as Flutter Mane, Dragapult and Annihilape is certainly charming.

  • Grass Tera Blast: This allows Ceruledge to eliminate Dondozo more quickly. While Taunt can shut down Dondozo's Yawn, it cannot shut down Fissure. The only way to beat Dondozo would be to eliminate it as quickly as possibly, which Grass Tera Blast aids with.

  • Flame Charge: Flame Charge provides Ceruledge an extra net of safety against potential Scarf users and Annihilape, who are capable of turning the tides against it. While normally, Ceruledge is prone to faster Taunt + Bulk Up users and Scarfed Trick, Flame Charge helps mitigate both of those weaknesses.

  • Will-O-Wisp: Ceruledge can be a status spreader in games where it can't set up as easily. It also helps Ceruledge set up more easily against threats such as Unaware Clodsire.

Tera Types

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy helps Ceruledge's matchup against prominent Dark-types such as Roaring Moon and Hydreigon.

  • Grass: An immunity to Spore and a resistance to Water makes Grass the most notable Tera type for this set. Flash Fire eliminating one of Grass's many weaknesses is also noteworthy.

  • Fire: Increasing Bitter Blade's power will always be a valuable trait. Eliminating Ghost's weaknesses to Ghost and Dark also allows Ceruledge to set up more comfortably.

  • Bug: Tera Bug is similar to Tera Grass, but in exchange for losing the Water resistance and maintaining the Rock weakness of Fire / Ghost, Ceruledge can tank Volcarona's Bug Buzz with significantly more ease.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 Def with Impish: Investing into Defense prepares Ceruledge and its mediocre physical bulk for the physical-biased metagame. Bulk Up will boost its Defense, but it can struggle to take some physical hits even after a boost, and its special bulk is naturally high.

  • 252 HP / 252 Spe with Jolly: A faster spread helps Ceruledge outspeed other Bulk Up users, like Annihilape opting to invest in bulk. Being faster, more often than not, lets Ceruledge win these matchups with ease.

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD with Careful: While most threats in the metagame at the moment are physical, a specially defensive spread is still noteworthy for its ability to surprise Hydreigon.

Focus Sash Attacker.description:
• With a stellar offensive typing, a unique set of attacks, Weak Armor allowing it to outspeed a large part of the metagame, and its immunity to Extreme Speed and Mach Punch, Ceruledge proves itself to be a very solid Focus Sash option.

  • Bitter Blade: Bitter Blade's recovery can make Focus Sash usable even if entry hazards chip it. If Ceruledge is brought down to 1 HP, a +2 Bitter Blade can heal it to the point that it can tank an extra attack.

  • Close Combat versus Shadow Claw: Close Combat hits the Normal-, Dark-, and Rock-types that resist Ceruledge's STAB combination. Still, Shadow Claw is a noteworthy choice to guarantee the KO on Mimikyu and let Ceruledge pressure Skeledirge. Note, however, that maximum Defense Skeledirge can recover more than Shadow Claw's damage, barring critical hits, and a Terastallized Skeledirge can completely wall this set.

  • Swords Dance versus Destiny Bond: As powerful as Swords Dance boosted attacks from Ceruledge are, the abundance of Unaware Pokemon, primarily Dondozo, has made some players opt to use Destiny Bond to snag surprise kills. Destiny Bond can also make the matchup against KOing common Sucker Punch Pokemon, such as Meowscarada and Kingambit, easier to win without having to rely on predictions.

  • Adamant versus Jolly: Adamant's added damage output is valuable, but Jolly allows Ceruledge to outspeed non-Scarf Gholdengo, and gives it a chance at outspeeding Modest Rotom formes and Glimmora. All of the mentioned examples are Special Attackers, meaning Ceruledge's Weak Armor often does not trigger in these matchups.

Tera Types

  • Fire: Giving Bitter Blade an extra push in damage is quite useful, giving Ceruledge more recovery.

  • Normal: Normal is an exceedingly common Tera Type on Ghost types due to the immunity it brings to the table. Ceruledge makes particularly excellent use of Normal Tera by resisting both Steel and Fairy, making it very difficult for Gholdengo and Mimikyu to click anything other than a Ghost type move when facing off against Ceruledge.

  • Fighting: Giving extra reach power to Close Combat, a powerful option against Pokemon such as Hydreigon, makes Fighting a solid choice for a Tera Type.

Bellibolt.overview:
With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Tactical Bellibolt.description:
• Bellibolt can be quite unassuming, and specially offensive Pokemon such as Hydreigon and Rotom may see it as a free opportunity to get into position. Assault Vest turns the tides against them with Electromorphosis + Parabolic Charge, which makes Bellibolt seem impossible to remove for certain Pokemon. It's also a decent check against Iron Bundle.

  • Grass- or Fairy-type Tera Blast: Tera Blast is important coverage to have; with a Fairy Tera type, Bellibolt reliably checks non-Tera Steel Dragon-types.

  • Muddy Water versus Chilling Water: Muddy Water should be used with Tera Electric for much-needed coverage. Alternatively, Chilling Water weakens common switch-ins such as Garchomp and Baxcalibur, allowing you to reposition your team more safely.

  • Acid Spray: This threatens non-Steel type switch-ins, and it also lets Bellibolt effectively use Electromorphosis without having to take damage first. It's also a powerful tool against Unaware walls such as Skeledirge.

  • Sucker Punch: While weak, Sucker Punch snipes Pokemon that activate Focus Sash and/or deals chip damage when Bellibolt is guaranteed to go down.

Tera Types

  • Fairy-type: Tera Fairy Bellibolt offensively checks big threats like Roaring Moon and Dragapult by walling their non-Terastal sets and nabbing surprise KOs.

  • Grass-type: Tera Grass Bellibolt can stay in versus common Pokemon such as Hippowdon and Breloom, sponge their attacks, and either chunk them or survive and reposition.

  • Electric-type: Maximizing Parabolic Charge damage is a viable option.

EV Spreads

  • 228 HP / 28 Def / 180 SpA / 44 SpD / 28 Spe: This spread is to avoid the 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Rotom-W and Hydreigon's Hydro Pump and Draco Meteor. 28 Speed EVs allow Bellibolt to outspeed 4 Speed EV Hippowdon. 28 Defense EVs are enough to survive Focus Sash Garchomp's Earthquake, which notably becomes a 3HKO if Bellibolt Terastallizes into a typing without a weakness to Ground.

  • 228 HP / 156 SpA / 124 SpD: This EV spread avoids a 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Iron Bundle's Hydro Pump. This spread can also use a Quiet nature and 0 Speed EVs for the slowest possible Volt Switch.

  • 228 HP / 52 Def / 180 SpA / 44 SpD / 4 Spe: This spread sacrifices outspeeding Hippowdon for surviving a +1 or Choice Band Dragonite Earthquake.

Fat Bellibolt.description:
• Bellibolt's stats allow it to be deceptively bulky, and a pure Electric typing is not terrible on a defensive Pokemon with reliable recovery and pivoting.

  • Parabolic Charge: Parabolic Charge gives Bellibolt a more constant stream of recovery, though it is much less punishing than Discharge.

  • Volt Switch: Volt Switch maintains initiative when predicting switches after bringing Bellibolt in on something that it walls, such as defensive Gholdengo or Corviknight.

  • Chilling Water: Chilling Water punishes Garchomp and Hippowdon on the switch.

  • Thunder Wave: This disrupts opponents if Bellibolt doesn't have Discharge.

  • Fairy-type Tera Blast: Tera Blast hits common Dragon-types such as Garchomp and Baxcalibur after Terastallizing into the Fairy typing.

  • Soak: Soak catches Electric-resistant foes on the switch and forces them to either switch out or Terastallize early, with major targets including Garchomp and Baxcalibur.

Tera Types

  • Grass: Terastallizing into the Grass typing flips the matchup against Ground-types like Hippowdon and Garchomp on its head, turning their super effective attacks into resisted hits that still activate Electromorphosis. Tera Grass Bellibolt also absorbs Spore versus Breloom and Amoonguss, effectively walling them as well.

  • Fairy: Fairy Tera Bellibolt comfortably walls Dragon-types, removing a lot of their offensive pressure.

  • Water: Water is just generally good to have as a defensive Tera type. It also gives Bellibolt STAB on Chilling Water for slightly more damage.

EV Spreads

  • 228 HP / 244 Def / 4 SpA / 4 SpD / 28 Spe: This EV spread allows Bellibolt to survive two Glaive Rushes from Adamant Baxcalibur if it is not in a position to Terastallize. The physical bulk lets Bellibolt always survive Life Orb Garchomp's Earthquake, and after Terastallization into a neutral type, it becomes a 3HKO. 28 Speed EVs allow it to outspeed 4 Speed EV Hippowdon.

Items

  • Leftovers: Leftovers provides long-term passive recovery alongside Slack Off, which can make Bellibolt very difficult to remove. Leftovers also removes any chance of a 2HKO from powerful physical threats such as Baxcalibur.

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry is a good backup option if Leftovers is already in use.

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet Bellibolt can switch into and passively punish physical attackers; the chip damage can also break Focus Sash and weaken foes into range of Electromorphosis-boosted attacks.

Bespectacled Bellibolt.description:
• With such good natural bulk, Bellibolt can easily survive hits from common threats and nab surprise KOs in return with a cheeky Choice Specs set.
