  • EV Spread: The special bulk guarantees that Scream Tail survives Shadow Ball from Choice Specs Flutter Mane. If using Sitrus Berry, the physical bulk guarantees that both formes of Choice Band Urshifu will fail to 2HKO Scream Tail with their signature moves.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Scream Tail's bulk and typing make it easy to set up without having to rely on Terastallization.

  • Water: Tera Water's Steel-type and Fire-type resistances can be key at surviving big attacks from Gholdengo and Chi-Yu.

  • Steel: Tera Steel can help Scream Tail set up against Tera Flying and Extreme Speed Dragonite while still providing a key Steel-type resistance.

Items

  • Mental Herb: Taunt Flutter Mane can be a big problem for Scream Tail, but Mental Herb can help guarantee that it gets to set Trick Room at least once.

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry's healing can give Scream Tail a stronger chance at getting both Stealth Rock and Trick Room down.

Stealth Rock Support.description:
• Scream Tail's incredible support movepool and bulk makes it a fine Stealth Rock supporter.

  • Thunder Wave versus Fling: Thunder Wave is the easiest form of paralysis to fit in, but with Light Ball, Fling can paralyze Ground-types such as Great Tusk and Garchomp, and Gholdengo that lack Covert Cloak, at the cost of leaving Scream Tail extremely vulnerable to Encore. Fling can also get rid of devastating Choice items from Trick users such as Rotom-W.

  • Encore: Scream Tail's great Speed tier makes it an especially effective user of Encore, letting it punish foes that attempt to set up, such as Roaring Moon.

  • Perish Song: Perish Song is another way for Scream Tail to threaten setup sweepers such as Dragonite, and it can become a win condition late in the game. It's also a fantastic response to Baton Pass foes such as Espathra and opposing Scream Tail.

  • Rock Tomb: Rock Tomb's additional Speed control is helpful against threats that boost their Speed, such as Dragonite and Baxcalibur.

  • Dazzling Gleam: While a rather weak STAB move, Dazzling Gleam threatening to 2HKO offensive Great Tusk can make it a good way to punish Rapid Spin use.

Other Options

  • Flamethrower: Flamethrower 2HKOes Scizor, though it does not 2HKO Gholdengo, making Recover sets still problematic.

  • Disable: Disable is particularly apt at ruining Choice item foes that need a specific move to 2HKO Scream Tail, such as Scizor, though compared to Encore, it's less useful against support moves.

  • Psychic Fangs: In addition to 2HKOing Iron Moth, Psychic Fangs breaking dual screens can be extremely useful, though this doesn't work against Grimmsnarl.

Tera Types

  • Normal: Tera Normal might seem like an underwhelming defensive option, but taking on Ghost-type attacks while avoiding a 2HKO from Gholdengo can be valuable.

  • Steel: Tera Steel gives a vital Steel resistance and is a great defensive typing in general.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy improves Scream Tail's matchup against Dark-types such as Hydreigon.

  • Fire: If using Flamethrower, Tera Fire Scream Taill will have a 97.3% chance to 2HKO Tera Steel Scizor, making it an effective lure.

Items

  • Mental Herb: Blocking the first use of Taunt makes Scream Tail an extremely reliable setter of Stealth Rock.

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry is the safest way to increase Scream Tail's longetivity, and it can avoid certain 2HKOs depending on the EV spread, such as that from Choice Specs Iron Bundle's Hydro Pump with specially defensive spreads.

  • Light Ball: Light Ball is a requirement when using Fling, ensuring Scream Tail can inflict paralysis once and get rid of Choice items with one move.

  • Booster Energy: Booster Energy being instantly consumed makes Scream Tail less flexible, but boosting Speed lets it outspeed key threats such as Dragapult. This item can also be used with bulkier EV spreads to make Scream Tail even bulkier, pulling off incredible stunts such as surviving Timid Choice Specs Gholdengo's Make It Rain.

EV Spreads

  • Scream Tail has an incredible number of viable EV spreads at its disposal: consider these as mere examples rather than all of its viable EV spreads!

  • 180 HP / 156 SpD / 172 Spe with Calm or Careful: This EV spread outspeeds Baxcalibur and Great Tusk and survives Timid Choice Specs Iron Moth's Sludge Wave 93.7% of the time.

  • 180 HP / 124 SpD / 204 Spe with Calm or Careful: The Speed investment outspeeds Jolly Annihilape, and Scream Tail avoids OHKOs from Timid Gholdengo and Choice Specs Flutter Mane.

  • 220 HP / 220 Def / 68 SpD with Calm or Careful: This EV spread avoids an OHKO from Timid Gholdengo's Make It Rain after Stealth Rock damage, and Scream Tail has a 93.7% chance of surviving Tera Steel Scizor's Choice Band Bullet Punch. If outspeeding Baxcalibur and Great Tusk is a must, a Speed-boosting nature and 68 Speed EVs can be used instead.

  • 252 HP / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Timid or Jolly: With maximum Speed investment, Scream Tail outspeeds not only Iron Moth, but also major Encore targets such as Garchomp and Annihilape.

Baton Pass.description:
• Scream Tail's diverse setup options and bulk make it one of the most unpredictable Baton Pass Pokemon in the metagame.

  • Encore: Encore is perfect for punishing passive play, giving Scream Tail many new setup opportunities.

  • Sing: Sing is a high-risk, high-reward option to set up in otherwise impossible situations, and it is especially effective with Blunder Policy.

  • Substitute: Not only is Substitute useful to pass with Baton Pass, but it makes weak Pokemon such as Garganacl into easy setup bait.

Other Options

  • Flamethrower: When using Calm Mind, Flamethrower can threaten Gholdengo and Scizor.

  • Psychic Fangs: Psychic Fangs 2HKOes Clodsire and, after a Bulk Up boost, can OHKO Iron Moth that don't invest in Defense. However, Grimmsnarl holds back its dual screens-breaking potential.

  • Drain Punch: Drain Punch gives Scream Tail some offensive presence against Kingambit.

  • Stored Power: When combined with Calm Mind and Blunder Policy, Stored Power can threaten Unaware walls such as Skeledirge.

Tera Types

  • Normal: Tera Normal gets rid of Scream Tail's key weakness to Steel, and it performs well against Flutter Mane and Gholdengo in particular.

  • Steel: Tera Steel gives Scream Tail a fantastic defensive typing, resisting Scizor's Bullet Punch in particular.

  • Dark: If Grimmsnarl is particularly problematic for your team, Tera Dark will block its Prankster Taunt from stopping Scream Tail.

Items

  • Mental Herb: Mental Herb is the most reliable option for getting Baton Pass off against faster Taunt users.

  • Blunder Policy: When paired with Sing, Scream Tail can pass Speed when Sing misses.

  • Sitrus Berry: A burst of recovery from Sitrus Berry eases setup in general.

  • Booster Energy: While it's impossible to pass Protosynthesis boosts via Baton Pass, either outspeeding disruptive foes such as Iron Bundle, or surviving Choice Specs holders like Iron Moth and Gholdengo, can be a deadly surprise.

General EV Spreads

  • 220 HP / 220 Def / 68 SpD with Careful or Calm: This EV spread gives Scream Tail enough bulk to survive Timid Gholdengo's Make It Rain after Stealth Rock damage, and it has a 93.7% chance of surviving Tera Steel Choice Band Scizor's Bullet Punch.

  • 180 HP / 124 SpD / 204 Spe with Calm or Careful: This spread outspeeds Jolly Annihilape, and with Blunder Policy, it can even outspeed Booster Energy Iron Bundle after missing Sing. The bulk lets Scream Tail survive a hit from Timid Gholdengo and Choice Specs Flutter Mane after Stealth Rock damage.

  • 252 HP / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Jolly or Timid: Maximizing Speed lets Scream Tail outspeed high-profile targets such as Iron Moth and Garchomp.

Blunder Policy-Specific EV Spreads

  • 220 HP / 220 Def / 4 SpA / 4 SpD / 60 Spe with Careful or Calm: This spread gives Scream Tail enough bulk to usually survive Tera Steel Choice Band Scizor's Bullet Punch, and it also outspeeds Booster Energy Iron Valiant after missing Sing. The remaining 8 EVs can only boost Special Defense and an offensive stat of your choice.

  • 180 HP / 212 SpD / 116 Spe with Jolly or Timid and 180 HP / 100 SpD / 228 Spe with Careful or Calm: These functionally identical stat spreads let Scream Tail outspeed even Choice Scarf Dragapult after missing Sing! The Special Defense investment lets Scream Tail survive a hit from Timid Gholdengo and Choice Specs Flutter Mane after Stealth Rock damage.

Dual Screens.description:
• Scream Tail's bulk and impressive Speed make it a great dual screens setter.

  • Encore: Encore punishing setup is extremely valuable considering Scream Tail's passive nature compared to other dual screens setters.

  • Perish Song: Perish Song can ruin Baton Pass attempts from the likes of Espathra or opposing Scream Tail, and it does well against most setup sweepers, except Gholdengo.

  • Light Clay versus Mental Herb: Light Clay is the preferred choice, but Mental Herb can save Scream Tail from some particularly difficult users of Taunt such as Corviknight and Annihilape.

Tera Types

  • The extreme support focus of this set means that Terastallization should only be used as a last resort, or when it can clearly lead to a win.

  • Normal: In emergencies, Tera Normal can let Scream Tail set up dual screens against Flutter Mane and Gholdengo. Note that Scream Tail is completely passive against Gholdengo, though.

  • Dark: Tera Dark is a niche answer to Prankster Taunt users such as Grimmsnarl.

Brute Bonnet.overview:
This new Paradox Pokemon is likely to be relevant in Battle Stadium Singles Series 2. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Speedy Spore.description:
• Don't be fooled by Brute Bonnet's low Speed stat; after two uses of Trailblaze, it even outspeeds Dragapult, which is a very feasible feat thanks to Spore. With the lack of Sleep Clause, this Speed turns Brute Bonnet into a terrifying sleep inducer!

  • Crunch versus Sucker Punch: Crunch is the preferred STAB move, reliably hitting the most common Spore check, Gholdengo, which makes it the ideal STAB attack to use with Substitute. However, Sucker Punch lets Brute Bonnet pick off threats when it doesn't have the chance to Spore and set up Trailblaze.

  • Close Combat versus Substitute: On one hand, Close Combat deals massive damage to Dark-type resistances, such as Roaring Moon, but it leaves Brute Bonnet fairly vulnerable to priority attacks. On the other hand, Spore gives Brute Bonnet ample opportunity to set up Substitute, easing the cost of early wake ups.

Tera Types

  • Dark: Powering up Crunch makes it easier to sweep with Crunch or Sucker Punch while still leaving it immune to Grimmsnarl's Prankster Taunt.

  • Fire: Tera Fire turns Brute Bonnet's devastating U-turn and Fairy-type weaknesses into resistances, giving it the edge against Flutter Mane and letting it fry Scizor and Tinkaton with Tera Blast.

  • Poison: Tera Poison grants Brute Bonnet important resistances to U-turn, Fighting, and Fairy without compromising itself against Water-types.

  • Fairy: With Tera Fairy, Brute Bonnet deals with Dragon-types far more reliably, and gains a valuable tool against opposing Dark- and Dragon-types with Tera Blast.

EV Spreads

  • 148 HP / 100 Atk / 4 Def / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Adamant: With Adamant, Brute Bonnet will still outspeed Great Tusk and Annihilape after Trailblaze and Dragapult after two uses of Trailblaze. Brute Bonnet's bulk lets it survive some powerful attacks, such as Iron Moth's Sludge Wave, Choice Specs Gholdengo's Make It Rain, and almost always surviving Choice Specs Iron Bundle's Freeze-Dry.

  • 252 Atk / 4 Def / 252 Spe with Jolly: At the cost of bulk, maximizing Speed lets Brute Bonnet outspeed threats such as Garchomp and Iron Treads after just one use of Trailblaze

Items

  • Booster Energy: Activating Protosynthesis takes dvantage of Brute Bonnet's power, though it means switching out will weaken Brute Bonnet.

  • Leftovers: If using Substitute, Leftovers is by far the preferred item, as Brute Bonnet has plenty of turns to recover its health against sleeping foes.

  • Life Orb: Life Orb is the most consistent way to boost Brute Bonnet's power, letting it switch out after using Spore when needed.

  • Focus Sash: Despite Brute Bonnet's good bulk, Focus Sash is a great option to stop potential sweeps, assuming entry hazards aren't set up.

Bulky Spore.description:
• With good bulk and access to strong priority, Brute Bonnet is a great offensive user of Spore.

  • Bullet Seed versus Seed Bomb: Even when not using Loaded Dice, Bullet Seed is useful for potentially KOing foes like Iron Bundle and Flutter Mane through Focus Sash and punishing Mimikyu switch ins. Nontheless, Seed Bomb is the more reliable option when not using Loaded Dice.

  • Substitute: Substitute is easy to set up thanks to Spore and eases the risk early wake-ups can pose. If using Substitute, using Crunch or Payback over Sucker Punch is preferred due to the issues Substitute Gholdengo can cause.

  • Crunch versus Payback: Having a reliable Dark-type STAB move is helpful when facing foes like Substitute Gholdengo. Payback has higher damage potential, but Crunch won't have its power dropped by foes switching in.

  • Close Combat: Close Combat crushes Roaring Moon and opposing Brute Bonnet, though the drop in bulk can be troublesome for this set.

Tera Types

  • Dark: Tera Dark works fantastically with Sucker Punch, giving Brute Bonnet good revenge killing capability.

  • Poison: Tera Poison covers Brute Bonnet's major weaknesses to U-turn, Fairy, and Fighting, giving it an easy chance to use Spore.

  • Fire: While the Stealth Rock weakness can be troublesome, Tera Fire still does well against Flutter Mane and lets Brute Bonnet melt Scizor and Tinkaton with Tera Blast.

  • Fairy: Powerful Dragon-type attacks such as Outrage and Draco Meteor can be turned into Spore bait with Tera Fairy, in addition to arming Brute Bonnet with a powerful Tera Blast against them.

  • Grass: If using Bullet Seed, Tera Grass can make sense for increasing the chance of shooting down Focus Sash leads such as Flutter Mane and still keeping the Spore immunity against Breloom and opposing Brute Bonnet.

Items

  • Leftovers: The extra recovery pairs very well with Spore and Substitute.

  • Sitrus Berry: If not using Substitute, the quick burst of recovery with Sitrus Berry is preferred.

  • Loaded Dice: Guaranteeing 4 hits with Bullet Seed means Brute Bonnet will always OHKO Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle through their Focus Sash, and the higher chance for 5 hits can even shoot down Mimikyu and offensive Great Tusk.

Offensive.description:
• Flutter Mane's blistering Speed and Special Attack along with its powerful unresisted STAB combination exerts an oppressive amount of pressure on most teams, making it one of the premier offensive Pokemon in the format.

  • Mystical Fire: Mystical Fire scorches the common Flutter Mane check, Scizor. It also heavily disrupts enemy special attackers.

  • Power Gem: Power Gem gets a bit of extra damage against Fire-types like Ogerpon-H and Incineroar, which can be relevant when using Tera Stellar.

  • Substitute: Calm Mind + Substitute is a classic duo that greatly assists Flutter Mane's setup attempts, allowing it to set up in-front of Thunder Wave Porygon2. Even without Calm Mind, it can save Flutter Mane from devastating uses of Thunder Wave from the likes of Archaludon.

  • Taunt: Taunt is hugely disruptive against a variety of support Pokemon, such as Swampert, Ting-Lu, and Porygon2.

Other Options

  • Stellar Tera Blast: With Tera Stellar, Tera Blast can be some good insurance against Pokemon with unpredictable Terastallization options, but the Special Attack drop doesn't gel well with Booster Energy.

  • Draining Kiss: When using extremely bulky Flutter Mane variants, Draining Kiss can be paired with Calm Mind to keep it around much longer. However, Tera Fairy is highly recommended when using this, as Draining Kiss is otherwise very weak.

Items

  • Booster Energy: Flutter Mane's incredible Speed is put to good use, outspeeding almost everything in the metagame with the major exceptions being Booster Energy Iron Bundle and the very rare Choice Scarf Dragapult.

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash patches up Flutter Mane's poor physical bulk, giving it new revenge kill chances.

EV Spreads

  • All of these EV spreads are designed to give Flutter Mane a Speed Boost with Protosynthesis.

  • 4 HP / 108 Defense / 140 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Timid: The Defense investment usually allows Flutter Mane to survive Sucker Punch from Adamant Chien-Pao. To require Adamant Chien-Pao to get a critical hit to OHKO Flutter Mane with Sucker Punch, an EV spread of 4 HP / 124 Def / 124 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe can also be used.

  • 116 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpA / 4 SpD / 132 Spe with Timid: This EV spread outspeeds Jolly Roaring Moon and survives an opposing Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball without Terastallization. In addition, Life Orb Mimikyu's Shadow Sneak has a fairly low chance of OHKOing, and Iron Bundle fails to KO with the combination of Hydro Pump and Freeze Dry.

  • 4 HP / 252 SpA / 252 Spe with Timid: If using Focus Sash, this simple spread is best for maximizing Speed and power. Note that this spread's vulnerability to priority makes it a poor fit for Booster Energy variants.

  • 236 HP / 252 Def / 20 Spe with Bold: This extremely defensive spread allows Flutter Mane to survive Tera Dark Life Orb Jolly Chien-Pao's Sucker Punch without needing to Terastallize itself, while still outspeeding Choice Scarf Jolly Landorus-T and Gouging Fire after Booster Energy.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: While Flutter Mane benefits from Terastallization, it's generally flexible enough to go without it.

  • Stellar: Flutter Mane boosting all of its offensive moves once gives it good offensive flexibility, especially since it retains the important immunity to Extreme Speed.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy makes Moonblast a potent sweeping move, while reducing damage against Chien-Pao's Sucker Punch and Mimikyu's Shadow Sneak.

  • Water: Tera Water is handy for giving a resistance to Steel, Ice, and Fire, giving improved matchups against Scizor, Ting-Lu, Chien-Pao, and Chi-Yu.

  • Electric: In addition to resisting Bullet Punch, Tera Electric protects Flutter Mane from the dreaded Thunder Wave and Glare!

  • Fire: Tera Fire gives Flutter Mane an offensive and defensive edge against Scizor, though the weakness to Urshifu-R's Aqua Jet is quite unwelcome.

Choice Specs.description:
• Thanks to its high Special Attack and Speed, Flutter Mane is a devastating wallbreaker, outspeeding and blowing holes in bulky metagame threats like Dragonite and Ting-Lu!

  • Power Gem: Power Gem is recommended to hit Chi-Yu and Ogerpon-H for super effective damage.

  • Mystical Fire versus Psyshock: Mystical Fire allows Flutter Mane to hit Scizor for huge damage while also nerfing the power of special attackers like Iron Bundle, although Psyshock can be used against Poison-types like Glimmora and Sneasler.

  • Perish Song: Perish Song is another alternative that can be used as an anti-setup option to counter team archetypes like Baton Pass.

Other Options

  • Tera Blast: Tera Blast in conjunction with Tera Stellar can be used to make Flutter Mane a check to surprise Terastallizations from Urshifu-R or Dragonite.

  • Thunderbolt: Thunderbolt can be used to more reliably threaten Dondozo and Suicune, especially with Tera Stellar or Tera Electric.

  • Energy Ball: Energy Ball is a very niche option that can be used to OHKO Hippowdon and Swampert.

EV Spreads

  • 4 HP / 108 Def / 140 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Timid: This EV spread allows Flutter Mane to survive Chien-Pao's Sucker Punch before Terastallization while also maximizing Flutter Mane's Speed stat.

  • 4 HP / 52 Def / 212 SpA / 4 SpD / 212 Spe with Modest: This EV spread doesn't outspeed Roaring Moon, but in exchange Flutter Mane OHKOes maximum HP Ogerpon-H with Tera Stellar Power Gem. The defensive investment survives an Aqua Jet from a +2 Adamant Urshifu-R.

  • 116 HP / 204 Def / 116 SpA / 4 SpD / 68 Spe with Modest: This EV spread only outspeeds up to the Jolly Urshifu formes but maximizes Flutter Mane's ability to take hits, such as surviving a Tera Dark Sucker Punch from an Adamant Urshifu-S after Stealth Rock damage, surviving Adamant Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash, and having a 93% chance to survive Surging Strikes from Adamant Urshifu-R.

116 HP / 204 Def / 52 SpA / 4 Def / 132 Spe with Timid: This EV spread only outspeeds up to Jolly Roaring Moon, and survives a Tera Dark Sucker Punch from an Adamant Urshifu-S after Stealth Rock damage, survives Icicle Crash from Adamant Chien-Pao, and has a 93% chance to survive Surging Strikes from Adamant Urshifu-R. This does come at a pretty serious cost of only having a 50% chance to OHKO Urshifu formes with a neutral Tera with Moonblast, forcing Flutter Mane to Tera a lot more.

  • 252 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Timid: This is an alternate spread that can be used to maximize Flutter Mane's damage output.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Flutter Mane already has a stunning type combination, which doesn't need much of a boost. However, the Tera type can be used to boost Flutter Mane's offensive capabilities even further.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy gives Flutter Mane a boost on Moonblast and helps it against Chien-Pao and Urshifu-S Sucker Punch.

  • Stellar: Tera Stellar gives Flutter Mane a one-time nuke to secure knockouts and works especially well with Tera Blast.

  • Electric: Tera Electric in conjunction with Thunderbolt can OHKO Dondozo and Primarina, as well as providing Flutter Mane with a paralysis immunity.

  • Water: Tera Water is a defensive option that patches up Flutter Mane's Steel-type weakness against foes like Archaludon and Scizor, as well as resisting Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes.

Offensive Support.description:
• Flutter Mane utilizes high Speed and Thunder Wave to become a status spreader and sweeper.

  • Hex versus Shadow Ball: Hex is normally preferred for dealing massive damage after a successful Thunder Wave. Shadow Ball can be used if consistent damage is more desirable and is almost always the stronger option against Gholdengo.

  • Taunt: Taunt is a great complement to Thunder Wave, shutting down opposing disruption and setup.

  • Pain Split: Pain Split can be used after a KO to heavily disrupt the next target and possibly stall out weaker attacks.

  • Mystical Fire: Defense-invested Flutter Mane can live unboosted Bullet Punch from Scizor and hit it back hard with Mystical Fire.

Other Options

  • Substitute: When paired with full paralysis chances and Pain Split, Flutter Mane can live for much longer than expected and snag some sneaky KOs. The main drawback is that Flutter Mane can only run one attack, usually Moonblast.

  • Calm Mind: Booster Energy sets can still make great use of Calm Mind. It is possible to get free setup turns thanks to full paralysis, but be aware that this is more of an occasional bonus than a consistent strategy to rely on.

Items

  • Booster Energy: With the Speed increase from Booster Energy, it is nearly guaranteed that Flutter Mane can cripple something.

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash can be used with more offensive spreads, and is particularly strong against already boosted opponents.

  • Jaboca Berry: Jaboca Berry's damage is a sneaky option against physical attackers. It allows Flutter Mane to cleanly beat Focus Sash Chien-Pao and Urshifu in a single turn, while making the combination of Thunder Wave into Hex much more potent into offensive Dragonite.

EV Spreads

  • 236 HP / 252 Def / 20 Spe with Bold or Timid: This spread gives great survivability, surviving unboosted Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R and unboosted Bullet Punch from Scizor. 20 Speed EVs ensures that Booster Energy boosts Speed, outrunning Choice Scarf users like Landorus-T and Gouging Fire. Bold is preferable to maximize bulk, but Timid is still viable to get the jump on other “slow” Flutter Mane and outrun Choice Scarf Urshifu.

  • 124 HP / 252 Def / 132 Spe with Timid: This spread maintains enough bulk to almost always survive unboosted Surging Strikes while also having enough Speed to outrun Roaring Moon after a single Dragon Dance.

  • 4 HP / 108 Def / 140 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Timid: This spread allows Flutter Mane to be more offensively oriented while still maintaining some bulk, almost always surviving Adamant Chien-Pao's unboosted Sucker Punch.

  • 4 Def / 252 SpA / 252 Spe with Timid: A full offensive spread can be used if opting for Focus Sash.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Flutter Mane's high Speed and support options allow it to disrupt with ease. Terastallization is therefore only needed for specific matchups where maintaining momentum is important.

  • Water: Tera Water resists Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes and Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash, and gains a Steel-type resistance for the Gholdengo and Scizor matchups.

  • Electric: Tera Electric prevents Flutter Mane from being paralyzed itself–an important consideration for the mirror–while still giving a pivotal Steel-type resistance.

Charm.description:
• The combination of Charm and Pain Split turns Flutter Mane into a devastating control option, massively crippling opposing offensive threats and healing itself with the combination of Pain Split and Draining Kiss.

  • Calm Mind versus coverage: Calm Mind allows Flutter Mane to maintain its role as a sweeper by increasing its damage output while simultaneously reinforcing its longevity. However, this leaves Flutter Mane quite vulnerable to Steel-types, so Shadow Ball and Mystical Fire are reasonable alternatives.

  • Draining Kiss versus Moonblast: Moonblast's far superior damage output is a great option versus more defensive teams, while Draining Kiss supplies superior lasting power against more offensive teams and is a great fit for Tera Fairy.

EV Spreads

  • 124 HP / 252 Def / 132 Spe with Timid: The chosen EVs ensure that Flutter Mane will always outspeed Jolly Booster Energy Roaring Moon. Maximum Defense investment gets the most out of Charm with the rest placed into HP.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Since this Flutter Mane is trying to defeat unexpected physical threats one-on-one, Terastallization is great at patching up some matchups that Charm can't on its own, even if it's not required for this set to work.

  • Water: Tera Water gives Flutter Mane a very useful resistance to Steel, Ice, and Fire, giving it improved matchups against Scizor, Ting-Lu, Chien-Pao, and Chi-Yu.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy Further boosts Moonblast's impressive damage output while removing Flutter Mane's Ghost weakness.

  • Electric: Tera Electric not only gives a useful Bullet Punch resistance against Scizor, but it also prevents common paralysis spreaders like Porygon2, opposing Flutter Mane, Archaludon, and Serperior from crippling Flutter Mane.

Slither Wing.overview:
This new Paradox Pokemon is likely to be relevant in Battle Stadium Singles Series 2. While we wait for the metagame to settle, here are some sample sets that may be viable. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Sandy Shocks.overview:
This new Paradox Pokemon might have a niche in Battle Stadium Singles Series 2, though their viability is uncertain. While we wait for the metagame to settle, here are some sample sets that may be viable. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Iron Treads.comments:
Speed EV Benchmarks

  • Quark Drive: If you want Quark Drive to boost Speed, make sure to keep Attack below Speed, especially for the lower benchmarks.

  • 76+ Spe: This ties with Adamant Urshifu formes. When Quark Drive is boosting Speed, this outspeeds Timid Calyrex-S.

  • 140+ Spe: This outspeeds Jolly Landorus-T.

  • 188+ Spe: This outspeeds Jolly Urshifu formes.

  • 212+ Spe: This outspeeds Timid Chi-Yu and uninvested Eternatus.

Choice Band.description:
• Choice Band Iron Treads is a force to be reckoned with, putting huge pressure on bulky Restricted Pokemon like Eternatus and Tera Poison Lugia!

  • Earthquake: When it's boosted by Choice Band, even checks like bulky Urshifu formes risk being 2HKOed by Earthquake if they try to switch in!

  • Iron Head: Iron Head punishes targets that use Tera Fairy for defense such as Eternatus and Lunala, and the potential flinch chance has the potential to ruin slower targets.

  • Ice Spinner: Ice Spinner is your best move against predicted switch-ins like Dragonite and Landorus-T. Keep in mind that this also removes Terrain like Electric Terrain, which can work for or against Iron Treads and its team depending on the circumstances.

  • Knock Off: Knock Off destroys Calyrex-S before Terastallization, and the item removal can make it difficult to switch into for Iron Treads's checks.

  • Volt Switch: Iron Treads can provide pivot support for teams that need it, though be wary that most teams have Ground-types that can negate it.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Iron Treads already has fantastic typing for many of its intended targets, but there are some circumstances where Terastallization can give an extra edge.

  • Ground: Tera Ground is a simple but effective option to boost Iron Treads's best move in Earthquake.

  • Normal: Tera Normal blocks Shadow Ball from Flutter Mane and Astral Barrage from Calyrex-S, potentially letting it snag a surprise KO.

EV Spreads

  • 60 HP / 196 Atk / 4 Def / 108 SpD / 140 Spe with Jolly: This EV spread favors balance, with the Speed investment allowing Iron Treads to outrun Jolly Landorus-T and guaranteeing Quark Drive grants a boost to Speed. The Special Defense investment guarantees that Iron Treads will live one unboosted Astral Barrage from Calyrex-S and survive two Moonblasts from Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane.

  • 60 HP / 252 Atk / 4 Def / 4 SpD / 188 Spe with Jolly: This EV spread maximizes attack power and invests just enough Speed to make sure Quark Drive boosts Speed when active. The rest is put into bulk, but it can be reallocated back into Speed depending on what benchmarks are needed most.

Assault Vest.description:
• With a strong defensive typing in Ground / Steel and good bulk, Iron Treads can run an effective Assault Vest set against restricted legendaries, most notably Miraidon and Calyrex-S.

  • Ice Spinner: Ice Spinner gives Iron Treads a move to hit Dragonite and Landorus-T hard.

  • Knock Off: Knock Off is Iron Treads's best move against non-Terastallized Calyrex-S, and its item removal is valuable all around, crippling both the Pokemon it's supposed to check as well as common switch-ins.

  • Rapid Spin: Iron Treads is a great user of Rapid Spin thanks to its Steel-typing, removing Stealth Rock and Toxic Spikes for teammates like Dragonite, Lugia, Lunala and Focus Sash Chien-Pao. The Speed boost can also come in handy later against threats like Calyrex-S.

  • EV Spread: The Defense investment avoids an OHKO from Jolly Landorus-T's Earthquake. The Special Defense investment combined with Assault Vest gives only a 6.3% chance for Astral Barrage from Timid Calyrex-S to 2HKO. If running Iron Treads with Electric Terrain support or Rapid Spin, the Speed EVs guarantee that +1 Iron Treads will outrun unboosted Timid Calyrex-S. If Iron Treads does not have Speed support, the Speed EVs can be distributed elsewhere.

Other Options

  • Volt Switch: Pivoting can help Iron Treads against physically bulky Pokemon like Dondozo, Alomomola, and Terastallized Garganacl.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Iron Tread's dual-typing is incredible against restricted threats like Miraidon, though Terastallization can be used in a pinch against some of its checks.

  • Normal: Tera Normal acts as a final stand immunity against Astral Barrage from Calyrex-S, usually buying Iron Tread's one more turn to attack.

  • Water: Tera Water gives Iron Treads a fighting chance against Urshifu-R, but consider that this will completely flip the Miraidon matchup.

Offensive Support.description:
• Iron Treads possesses an incredible support movepool along with a great base 106 Speed stat, making it a great support option.

  • Knock Off: Along with its item removal ability, Knock Off is Iron Treads's best move to hit Calyrex-S that isn’t Terastallized.

  • Ice Spinner: Ice Spinner allows Iron Treads to hit foes such as Dragonite and Landorus-T hard and has great type synergy with Earthquake.

  • Rapid Spin: Despite the fast-paced-nature of BSS, Rapid Spin allows Iron Treads to both boost its speed and clear entry hazards from its side of the field, supporting teammates such as Dragonite, Lugia and Lunala as well as Focus Sash users like Chien-Pao. Its Steel-typing further makes it well-suited to clearing out Toxic Spikes mid-match.

  • Endeavor: When used with defensive investment, Endeavor can be used to devastating effect against Ground-type checks that can't OHKO with Earthquake. It works well with Focus Sash too, albeit more predictable on those sets.

Other Options

  • Tera Blast: When paired with Tera Fairy, Iron Treads can OHKO Koraidons that might otherwise think they are safe against Iron Treads.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Support Iron Treads is less dependent on Terastallization thanks to its unique stat spread and good item choices.

  • Normal: Tera Normal is great against Choice Scarf Calyrex-S in particular, blocking Astral Barrage and allowing Iron Treads to get a bit hit in.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy removes all of Iron Tread's previous weaknesses while still maintaining good overall typing. On Booster Energy sets, it can help overcome Swords Dance Chien-Pao that try to set up while Iron Treads uses Stealth Rock.

  • Ghost: While situational, Tera Ghost can guarantee you get a low HP Endeavor off against Extreme Speed Dragonite.

Items

  • Booster Energy: Booster Energy increases Iron Treads's speed even further, allowing it to outspeed key targets like Flutter Mane and Chien-Pao, making it very likely to get a move off first.

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash is an option for ensuring Iron Treads can get at least one move off against faster foes that can KO it.

EV Spreads

  • 188 HP / 92 Atk / 4 Def / 12 SpD / 212 Spe with Jolly: This spread is meant for Booster Energy sets. Defense investment keeps Iron Treads from being OHKO'd by up to Jolly Landorus-T's Earthquake, and the Special Defense investment survives Timid Calyrex-S and its Astral Barrage on all but the highest damage rolls. The Speed investment outruns up to Timid Chi-Yu.

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe with Jolly: For Focus Sash sets, a simple offensive spread is often sufficient.

Santa's Slay.description:
• With nearly perfect coverage and an incredible Speed stat, Iron Bundle's ferocious brand of holiday spirit is a metagame-defining force!

  • Encore: Giving the gift of an encore lets Iron Bundle punish passive Pokemon and naughty sweepers alike.

  • Substitute: Substitute lets Iron Bundle take further advantage of encored Pokemon and is a decent way to scout for Tera types when using Booster Energy or Life Orb. It's especially effective at punishing Sucker Punch revenge killers such as Chien-Pao and Urshifu-S.

  • Ice Beam: With a power-boosting item, Ice Beam OHKOes Dragonite through Multiscale, and is a far safer way to OHKO Ursaluna-B that lack Assault Vest.

  • Flip Turn: Pivoting is a big help when Iron Bundle is facing Pokemon likely to Terastallize such as Chi-Yu or Landorus-T, though it doesn't have great synergy with Booster Energy's one-time use.

Other Options

  • Taunt: Taunt will make support Pokemon such as Alolan Ninetales and Ting-Lu want to take a holiday, though watch out for common users of Mental Herb such as Toxapex.

  • Whirlpool: Although difficult to pull off with Iron Bundle's mediocre bulk, trapping foes with Whirlpool can make Encore especially deadly.

  • Electric Terrain: Giving Iron Bundle a Speed boost via Electric Terrain isn't nearly as flexible as Booster Energy, but it does let Iron Bundle support potentially deadly Quark Drive teammates such as Iron Valiant and Iron Hands.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Iron Bundle's perfect coverage and high Speed means its fairly flexible with a team's Terastallization needs.

  • Water: Besides the power boost for Hydro Pump, Tera Water enables a reliable Water-type STAB move in Tera Blast and avoids an OHKO from Choice Scarf Urshifu-R's Close Combat.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost gives Iron Bundle an important immunity to Extreme Speed and Quick Attack, which can especially ruin Dragonite, Ogerpon-H's, and Entei's holiday with Encore.

  • Ice: With Tera Ice, Freeze-Dry will OHKO offensive Dragonite through Multiscale and Ice Beam will OHKO even bulky Dragonite and most Assault Vest Ursaluna-B.

Items

  • Booster Energy: Quark Drive's Speed boost lets Iron Bundle outpace key Choice Scarf and Booster threats such as Flutter Mane, Urshifu-R, and Landorus-T.

  • Choice Specs: Choice Specs Iron Bundle regifts support moves so it can wallbreak, with moves such as Tera Water Hydro Pump now OHKOing physically defensive Ting-Lu.

  • Focus Sash: Getting around Iron Bundle's iffy bulk makes it a fantastic lead and revenge killer.

  • Life Orb: While Life Orb compromises Iron Bundle's ability to take priority attacks, it boosts damage without passing on powerful support moves.

Bulkier EV Spreads
  • 44 HP / 12 Def / 148 SpA / 52 SpD / 252 Spe with Timid: This bulkier spread survives Jolly Chien-Pao's Sacred Sword and Timid Flutter Mane's Moonblast.

CATCH THESE HANDS (Bulky Offense).description:
• With its great Attack, its good natural bulk, and a healing move in Drain Punch, Iron Hands stands out as a premier bulky attacker.

  • Supercell Slam versus Thunder Punch: Supercell Slam is easily the most powerful Electric STAB attack available, but be mindful of Ground-type switch-ins that can trigger its recoil. Thunder Punch can be used as a safer option but at the cost of power.

  • Ice Punch: Ice Punch gives Iron Hands a good option to hit Dragonite and Landorus-T.

  • Heavy Slam: Heavy Slam is Iron Hands's best option to hit Fairy-types. If fully invested in Attack, Heavy Slam OHKOs even the bulkiest of Flutter Mane.

  • Volt Switch: Volt Switch, though incredibly weak, can scout switches and maintain offensive momentum.

  • Fake Out: Fake Out picks off weakened, normally faster threats, such as Dragonite and Chi-Yu. It can also beat Focus Sash leads, such as Chien-Pao and Urshifu-R.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium / High: Physically defensive sets are less reliant on Terastallization to function. For Assault Vest sets, however, it'll be needed to handle Choice Specs Flutter Mane, argubly the most dangerous special attacker in the metagame.

  • Water: Tera Water's Ice and Fire resistances help a lot against Chien-Pao, Urshifu-R, and Chi-Yu.

  • Flying: Tera Flying lets Iron Hands greatly improve its matchup against Ground-types like Ursaluna-B and Landorus-T and dodge Fissure attempts from the likes of Dondozo and Ting-Lu.

  • Fairy: A Fairy-type Tera allows Iron Hands to take advantage of its great bulk by giving it a better defensive typing, though previously walled Steel-types like Gholdengo and Archaludon become a lot more threatening.

  • Steel: Tera Steel grants a resistance to Fairy and boosts Heavy Slam's power, drastically improving defensive Iron Hands's matchup against Flutter Mane.

EV Spreads

  • 28 Speed EVs versus negative Speed nature: 28 Speed EVs are required to outrun 4 Speed EV Ursaluna-B. However, some sets prefer to run a negative speed nature to make Volt Turn as slow and as powerful as possible. If using a negative Speed nature, you can allocate the 28 Speed EVs elsewhere.

  • 228 HP / 252 Def / 28 Spe with Impish or Relaxed: This spread is meant to be used with Sitrus Berry, giving Iron Hands incredible survivability against physical threats such as Chien-Pao, Ogerpon-H and Urshifu-R. With Sitrus Berry recovery, not even Terastallized Jolly Ogerpon-H's Ivy Cudgel can 2HKO Iron Hands!

  • 68 HP / 168 Atk / 252 Def / 4 SpD / 28 Spe with Adamant: This balanced spread invests enough Defense to avoid the 2HKO from Jolly Tera Flying Choice Band Dragonite's Tera Blast. After outrunning 4 Speed EV Ursaluna-B, the rest is invested into improving Attack. Sitrus Berry is not required for the Dragonite caluclation above, though it is generally recommended for this spread.

  • 252 Atk / 228 SpD / 28 Spe with Adamant: This Assault Vest spread balances power and special bulk. With Drain Punch recovery, even Tera Normal Bloodmoon can struggle to 2HKO Iron Hands!

Regulation C Bulky Substitute.description:
• Iron Hands's incredible bulk gives it one of the game's strongest Substitutes, letting it set up on a unique list of threats.

  • Swords Dance: Swords Dance lets Iron Hands set up on the passive foes it blocks with Substitute. The Attack boost also pairs very well with Drain Punch, keeping Iron Hands healthy and making it much harder to break.

  • Ice Punch: Ice Punch provides more immediate damage against pure Ground-types and the ever-present Dragonite.

  • Earthquake: Earthquake hits Gholdengo, Iron Moth, and Tera Fire Chi-Yu hard. It also does well against foes that try to block Drain Punch with Tera Poison.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: Despite having a strong bulk profile, Iron Hands frequently needs to remove its common Ground- and Fairy-type weaknesses to be effective.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy removes all of Iron Hands's most troublesome weaknesses while also granting a powerful Dragon-type immunity. This does, however, make Iron Hands much easier to revenge kill with Gholdengo and Iron Moth.

  • Water: Tera Water is another solid defensive option that drastically improves the Chi-Yu matchup. Likewise, the resistance to Ice is fantastic against Chien-Pao and Baxcalibur, with the latter no longer being able to rely on Icicle Spear to effectively break through Substitute.

  • Fighting: Tera Fighting boosts Drain Punch's output while removing Iron Hands's Ground weakness.

  • Fire: Tera Fire can block Will-O-Wisp from support Dragapult and Rotom formes, which otherwise outspeed and burn Iron Hands if it doesn't already have Substitute up.

  • Grass: Tera Grass can turn the tide against faster Grass-types like Breloom and Wo-Chien, blocking their status moves and buying a free turn to start setting up.

EV Spreads
  • 92 HP / 4 Atk / 172 Def / 212 SpD / 28 Spe with Impish: The defensive investment keeps uninvested Dondozo's Wave Crash from breaking Iron Hands's Substitute, providing superior protection from Fissure spam. After Terastallizing, non-STAB Earthquake from the likes of Dragonite and Baxcalibur often fails to break Substitute as well. On the specially defensive side, a full health Iron Hands can survive a Fire Blast from Modest Tera Fire Chi-Yu.

Iron Jugulis.overview:
This new Paradox Pokemon might have some niches in Battle Stadium Singles Series 2. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Booster Energy.description:
• While not quite as powerful or versatile as its counterpart Hydreigon, Iron Jugulis fills a unique role due to its higher Speed and Flying-type STAB.

  • Hurricane vs Air Slash: Hurricane secures KOs on Pokemon like Iron Bundle that Air Slash cannot, however, Air Slash is much less likely to miss, and the flinch chance can come in handy occasionally.

  • Taunt: With Taunt, Iron Jugulis stops walls such as Clodsire from healing off its attacks, and prevents debilitating status that would otherwise cut its sweep short.

  • Earth Power: Earth Power grants Iron Jugulis valuable coverage on most Pokémon that would not mind its main attacks, like Tinkaton.

  • Flash Cannon: Flash Cannon is useful for hitting Fairy-types such as Flutter Mane for big damage.

  • Flamethrower: Flamethrower provides super effective coverage on Steel-types that might otherwise cause issues for Iron Jugulis.

Other Options

  • Knock Off: While not doing much damage to many does due to Iron Jugulis's thoroughly average Attack stat, Knock Off can still help Iron Jugulis and its teammates by softening up defensive cores via item removal.

  • Substitute: Substitute can be used to punish Spore attempts from the likes of Breloom and Brute Bonnet, as well as easing prediction by scouting switches.

  • Focus Blast: Though unreliable due to its accuracy, Focus Blast is Iron Jugulis's best option to hit Kingambit.

Tera Types

  • Flying: Terastallizing into a Flying-type boosts Iron Jugulis's damage output with Air Slash and Hurricane, making it even more difficult to switch into while removing the weaknesses that come from its secondary Dark typing.

  • Dark: A Dark-type Tera boosts Dark Pulse's damage considerably, and when coupled with its rather high flinch rate, a Tera Dark Iron Jugulis can prove quite difficult to handle for some teams.

  • Steel: A Steel-type Tera grants Iron Jugulis a resistance to Fairy and Ice, improving its matchup with Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle and giving it STAB on Flash Cannon.

  • Ground: Tera Ground gives Iron Jugulis an Electric-type immunity, allowing it to block Volt Switch from the likes of Rotom-W and Iron Hands while also giving it STAB on Earth Power.

NANO LOVE (Choice Item).description:
• With its good Speed and powerful STABs, Iron Jugulis lends itself nicely to use a Choice item set, setting itself apart from Hydreigon by virtue of its higher Speed at the cost of some power.

  • Hurricane vs Air Slash: Hurricane offers Iron Jugulis an extremely powerful Flying-type STAB attack, though Air Slash is far more consistent due to its higher accuracy.

  • Earth Power: Earth Power allows Iron Jugulis to hit otherwise irritating switch-ins like Magnezone and Tinkaton.

  • Flash Cannon: Flash Cannon allows Iron Jugulis to punish Fairy-type switch-ins such as Flutter Mane, as well as the numerous Tera Fairy users in the BSS metagame.

  • U-turn: U-turn allows Iron Jugulis to keep momentum for its team by scouting switches and pivoting out of disadvantageous matchups.

Items

  • Choice Specs: Choice Specs elevates Iron Jugulis's power, allowing it to wallbreak much more consistently.

  • Choice Scarf: Choice Scarf's Speed boost allows Iron Jugulis to outspeed otherwise faster foes like Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle, potentially surprising them with early KOs.

Tera Types

  • Flying: Tera Flying boosts Air Slash to more respectable power levels, and also makes Hurricane incredibly hard to switch into safely.

  • Dark: Tera Dark pushes Dark Pulse's damage output even further, making Iron Jugulis very hard to deal with in conjunction with the move’s ever-irritating flinch rate.

  • Steel: Tera Steel gives Iron Jugulis resistances to Fairy and Ice, improving its matchup against Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle.

Offensive.description:
• Good Speed, the useful ability to absorb Toxic Spikes, and great coverage make Iron Moth a reasonable alternative to other offensive Fire-types like Chi-Yu and Gouging Fire.

  • Meteor Beam and Power Herb: Beyond being a more flexible way to boost Iron Moth's Special Attack than other options, Meteor Beam and Power Herb let Iron Moth crush opposing Fire-types who can otherwise use their bulk to be an issue, like Entei and opposing Iron Moth.

  • Overheat: Even with the lack of extra coverage, Overheat is so strong that very few Pokemon can safely switch into it if using Choice Specs.

  • Energy Ball: Energy Ball is highly recommended to hit Urshifu-R and Ursaluna-B as hard as possible.

  • Dazzling Gleam: Dazzling Gleam makes sense with Tera Fairy, dealing huge damage to Roaring Moon and OHKOing Urshifu-S.

  • Toxic Spikes: Iron Moth stands out as a good choice for an offensive Toxic Spikes setter, though note that it fears Ting-Lu far more than Meowscarada.

Other Options
  • Flame Charge: If not using a Choice item, coverage can be sacrificed in exchange for giving Iron Moth the ability to outspeed major threats such as Iron Bundle, Flutter Mane, and Chien-Pao.
Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Iron Moth's sheer offensive power and good Speed tier means Terastallization isn't integral to it, but it can be a good tool to stop revenge kills.

  • Grass: Tera Grass massively improves Iron Moth's matchup against common foes like Urshifu-R, Landorus-T, and Primarina, and also prevents the rare Breloom lead from launching Spore successfully.

  • Water: Tera Water gives coverage against other Fire-types with Tera Blast, and is still a good option to prevent Choice Scarf Urshfu-R from revenge killing with Surging Strikes.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost pairs best with Meteor Beam or Booster Energy variants, letting Iron Moth dodge Normal-type priority that would usually revenge kill it from Dragonite, Ogerpon-H, and Entei.

  • Fire: When paired with Overheat and Choice Specs, Tera Fire means Fire-resistant foes aren't safe; with even physically defensive Incineroar taking over 60% from it!

  • Fairy: The Dark-type resistance Tera Fairy provides can be a good way to catch Chien-Pao off guard after its Focus Sash has been broken, and saves Iron Moth from Urshifu-S's Sucker Punch.

Items

  • Booster Energy: While Booster Energy does make this Iron Moth less flexible in terms of switching out, the extra power can allow Iron Moth to run bulkier EV spreads, and the lack of recoil like Life Orb can make it a good late-game cleaner too.

  • Choice Specs: Choice Specs turns Iron Moth into a full blown wallbreaker.

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash makes predicting against foes like Landorus-T less troublesome, and is a perfect fit if setting up Toxic Spikes.

  • Assault Vest: Iron Moth's good special bulk makes Assault Vest a fine choice, letting it survive new attacks such as an unboosted Hydro Pump from Iron Bundle. It can be paired with bulkier EV spreads for even more impressive feats!

  • Choice Scarf: Choice Scarf outspeeds important threats such as Iron Bundle, Flutter Mane, and Dragapult, who could otherwise outspeed and KO Iron Moth. Note that this item does compete heavily with the more powerful Chi-Yu, so make sure aspects of Iron Moth like Toxic Spikes absorption are important to the team.

Bulkier EV Spreads

  • 164 HP / 100 Def / 60 SpA / 4 SpD / 180 Spe with Modest: This EV spread survives Tera Normal Choice Band Dragonite's Extreme Speed and Life Orb Chien-Pao's Throat Chop from full health, survives two Shadow Balls from Modest Flutter Mane that lack an offensive boost, and outspeeds Modest Chi-Yu and Adamant Urshifu formes. If using Assault Vest, even Choice Specs Flutter Mane fails to 2HKO with Shadow Ball!

  • 140 HP / 28 Def / 160 SpA / 180 Spe with Modest: This Assault Vest based spread avoids a 2HKO from Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball, and OHKOes Iron Bundle with Fiery Dance.

Speedy Booster Energy.description:
• With Booster Energy in its circuits, Iron Moth can sacrifice some of its power to become a surprisingly effective late-game sweeper and emergency revenge killer. While Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle are the usual go-to for this, Iron Moth doesn't have to worry about Toxic Spikes or Scizor's Bullet Punch.

  • Energy Ball: Energy Ball is the best option for dealing damage to bulky foes like Ting-Lu and Suicune, and it also OHKOes Iron Bundle.

  • Dazzling Gleam: Dazzling Gleam is Iron Moth's ticket to overloading Dragon-types like Garchomp and Roaring Moon, who can otherwise stop a sweep.

  • Toxic Spikes versus Toxic: This Iron Moth set is arguably the fastest offensive Toxic Spikes setter that makes sense, making it a reasonable option for Toxic Spike loving teammates like Garganacl. Toxic on the other hand, directly puts a timer on common bulky switch-ins like Dragonite and Ting-Lu.

  • Psychic: While not providing great coverage overall, Psychic is Iron Moth's best move against Toxapex and opposing Iron Moth.

  • EV Spread: The given EV Spread ensures Iron Moth gets a Speed boost upon consuming Booster Energy while providing as much protection from priority attacks as possible. It also avoids a OHKO from Jolly Choice Scarf Landorus-T's Flying Tera Blast.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium If saved for late game, Iron Moth can often get itself in a position to sweep without worrying about revenge kills. Terastallization however, can reduce its vulnerability to certain priority attacks and allow it to be used earlier.

  • Grass: Tera Grass is among the best options, preventing foes Aqua Jet Urshifu-R from from easily stopping a late-game sweep, plus dealing big damage to physically defensive Ting-Lu with Energy Ball.

  • Water: Tera Water still aids against Urshifu-R, but does so while not being OHKOed by Choice Scarf Landorus-T's Flying Tera Blast, at the cost of doing less well against bulky Water and Ground Pokemon.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost blocks common Normal-type priority, from foes like Dragonite, Entei, and Ogerpon-H.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy punishes Chien-Pao and Urshifu-S from attempting to revenge kill with Sucker Punch.

Toxic Spreader.description:
• Iron Moth may seem like a strange Pokemon to use as a bulky Toxic spreader, but it sets itself apart from other Pokemon like Toxapex thanks to being far less passive and having access to phazing.

  • Fiery Dance: While Fiery Dance is not a particularly reliable away to sweep, taking the chance is worth it considering Iron Moth's Speed.

  • Toxic Spikes versus Toxic: Toxic Spikes is the preferred option for its excellent team support for bulky Pokemon like Garganacl, Charm Flutter Mane, and Latias. Toxic on the other hand, lets Iron Moth independently punish bulky responses to it like Ting-Lu and Porygon2.

  • Whirlwind: A phazing move may not seemingly gel well with Speed investment, but it has incredible utility when Toxic Spikes are set up, punishing teams that leave their Toxic Spikes absorber in on Iron Moth.

  • Sludge Wave versus Energy Ball: Giving up on Whirlwind does lose a unique selling point as a Toxic Spikes setter, but in exchange makes Iron Moth much harder to check with Chi-Yu and Primarina. Sludge Wave's damage output makes it the best choice, but Energy Ball stops Swampert from having a field day.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: When the aim is to simply set up Toxic Spikes, Terastallization is not that important. However, Iron Moth's typing gives it enough weaknesses that Terastallization can give it a far longer life span.

  • Water: Tera Water gives Iron Moth a resistance to Water-type moves without losing its resistance to Ice and Fire, which is helpful against Urshifu-R, Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu. It's also a great type to use with Tera Blast for dealing damage to Chi-Yu and Ursaluna-B.

  • Grass: Tera Grass lets Iron Moth deal with powerful Earthquakes from the likes of Ting-Lu and Landorus-T, gives it a vital resistance to Water, and nullifies Spore.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy's Dark resistance can surprise Chien-Pao looking to revenge kill Iron Moth and protects it from powerful Dragon-type attacks from the likes of Choice Band Dragonite and Gouging Fire.

Items

  • Booster Energy: Booster Energy can be paired with specialized EV spreads to either get easier KOs, gain a Speed boost, or survive surprising special attacks at the cost of the flexibility of more general EV spreads designed to switch in multiple times.

  • Sitrus Berry: The quick burst of recovery Sitrus Berry gives can be paired with specialized EV spreads, allowing Iron Moth to survive a wider range of attacks.

  • Covert Cloak: Covert Cloak protects Iron Moth from the dreaded Salt Cure, which can otherwise put a timer on phazing. It also prevents specially defensive Iron Moth from losing to Chi-Yu's flinch chance.

  • Leftovers versus Black Sludge: Leftovers's residual recovery pairs well with using Whirlwind as much as possible, but it's a fairly high-value item. Black Sludge is an acceptable alternative, but note that it will hurt Iron Moth after Terastallization if not using Tera Poison.

Booster Energy Exclusive EV Spreads

  • 188 HP / 244 Def / 36 SpA / 4 SpD / 36 Spe with Modest: This Booster Energy optimized spread OHKOes 4 Special Defense EVs Iron Bundle with a Quark Drive-boosted Fiery Dance while having good enough physical bulk to have a good chances of surviving powerful attacks from full health, like Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Psyshock.

  • 252 HP / 220 SpD / 36 Spe with Calm: This EV spread gives Iron Moth a Special Defense boost with Quark Drive, making it so bulky that even a Modest Choice Specs Chi-Yu has a low chance of 2HKOing it with Dark Pulse!

Sitrus Berry Exclusive EV Spreads

  • When using Sitrus Berry, make sure to run an even HP stat, so that one use of Ruination will activate it.

  • 180 HP / 228 Def / 100 Spe with Timid: This EV spread almost always survives two hits from Jolly Focus Sash Chien-Pao's Crunch with Sitrus Berry, and it outspeeds Jolly Annihilape.

  • 244 HP / 188 Def / 12 SpA / 12 SpD / 52 Spe with Bold: This EV spread has around a 90% chance of avoiding a 2HKO from Adamant Focus Sash Chien-Pao's Crunch. The minor Special Defense investment also avoids a 2HKO from Modest Chi-Yu's Dark Pulse and Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball.

Other EV Spread Examples

  • 236 HP / 228 Def / 4 SpA / 4 SpD / 36 Spe with Modest: This EV spread survives Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Psyshock from full health.

  • 196 HP / 132 SpD / 180 Spe with Calm: This EV spread almost always avoids the 2HKO from Modest Chi-Yu's Dark Pulse while outspeeding it alongside Adamant Urshifu-R.

  • 244 HP / 164 SpD / 100 Spe with Timid: This EV spread outspeeds Jolly Annihilape and, as a bonus, gives Leftovers Iron Moth a nearly guaranteed chance to avoid being 2HKOed by Modest Chi-Yu's Dark Pulse and Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball.

  • 244 HP / 52 Def / 4 SpA / 12 SpD / 196 Spe with Timid: This EV spread sacrifices some bulk to outspeed Garchomp while still surviving Life Orb Chien-Pao's Crunch and having a great shot of surviving two uses of Dark Pulse from Timid Chi-Yu. It also gets a Speed boost from Quark Drive.

Benchmarks for Speed EVs

Like many fast bulky Pokemon, Iron Moth has a huge variety of viable EV builds. If you'd like to make your own EV spread though, keep these Speed tiers in mind! Natures that can efficiently use these Speed tiers will be mentioned.

  • 36 Speed EVs with any Neutral Nature: This is the minimum amount of Speed to run, outspeeding Jolly Breloom.

  • 52 Speed EVs with any Neutral Nature: This outspeeds Modest Gholdengo.

  • 76 Speed EVs with Timid or 180 Speed EVs with Calm This outspeeds Modest Chi-Yu and Adamant Urshifu formes. Note that Timid will give Iron Moth a bonus point to Speed, but a Calm nature has a greater chance of surviving some special attacks with specific EV spreads.

  • 100 Speed EVs with Timid: This outspeeds Jolly Annihilape.

  • 132 Speed EVs with Timid: This is the minimum investment for Iron Moth to get a Speed boost from Quark Drive, assuming no Special Attack investment, since doing so will increase Special Attack instead.

  • 156 Speed EVs with Timid: This outspeeds Jolly Urshifu formes and Mimikyu.

  • 196 Speed EVs with Timid: This outspeeds Jolly Garchomp.

Iron Thorns.overview:
This new Paradox Pokemon might have a niche in Battle Stadium Singles Series 2, though their viability is uncertain. While we wait for the metagame to settle, here id s sample set that may be viable. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Baxcalibur.overview:
This Pokemon has been updated to reflect Regulation H, that lasts until January 5h, 2025. After this, Regulation G will return.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Sweeper.description:
• With good bulk, an immunity to burn, multiple ways to boost its Speed, Baxcalibur is a unique and dangerous sweeper.

  • Icicle Spear: Icicle Spear KOes Breloom and Mimikyu through Focus Sash and Disguise respectively, and is also more reliable than Scale Shot.

  • Dragon Dance versus Swords Dance: Dragon Dance's Speed boost is generally more effective against offensive teams, but Swords Dance is still viable for breaking through more defensive foes like Corviknight due to Scale Shot still providing a Speed boost. Swords Dance also pairs nicely with Ice Shard for late-game sweeping.

  • Ice Shard: Ice Shard means Baxcalibur will have a difficult time breaking past bulky Steel-types early-game, but it makes it an effective cleaner otherwise, especially with Swords Dance.

  • Jolly versus Adamant: Jolly ensures that Baxcalibur outspeeds Dragapult after one Speed boost, but Adamant makes plenty of sense with Ice Shard or when using Dragon Dance with Scale Shot.

Other Options

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash may seem like a waste with Baxcalibur's bulk, but it provides new set up opportunities and eases match-ups against other Dragon-types, though Icicle Spear and Scale Shot become far less reliable.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Terastallization is required for Baxcalibur to cover the most amount of threats via Tera Blast, and patches up its mediocre defensive typing, but Baxcalibur's bulk and tendency to force switches means it's still viable without it.

  • Ground: Tera Ground makes Earthquake an especially reliable sweeping tool, removes most of Baxcalibur's weaknesses, and makes it immune to Thunder Wave from the likes of Archaludon.

  • Electric: Tera Electric lets Baxcalibur set-up against Gholdengo and Scizor, and when paired with Tera Blast, is Baxcalibur's best way of wearing down Dondozo, The paralysis immunity also helps Baxcalibur set up against Serperior with less risk.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy protects Baxcalibur from faster Dragon-types like Garchomp, and lets Baxcalibur come out on top against Terastallized Scale Shot Dragonite.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost provides even better protection against Fighting-type attacks than Tera Fairy, and ensures that Dragonite doesn't revenge kill Baxcalibur with Extreme Speed.

  • Steel: With a Tera type of Steel, Baxcalibur has a much better matchup against Dragon-types and Mimikyu, and a handy resistance to Scizor's Bullet Punch.

Assault Vest.description:
• Baxcalibur's fantastic bulk, immunity to burns, and access to a priority attack make it a strong option for an Assault Vest tank, despite its iffy defensive typing.

  • Icicle Spear: Icicle Spear is recommended despite its inconsistent damage, as it deals damage through Mimikyu's disguise and potentially KOes Focus Sash users like Breloom and Meowscarada. Just be careful about hitting Stamina Archaludon, who can threaten to gain multiple Defense boosts from it.

  • **Glaive Rush versus Scale Shot **: Glaive Rush makes Baxcalibur very vulnerable to getting KOed the next turn (especially by OHKO users like Fissure Dondozo), but it is still the least risky Dragon-type STAB move. Remember that Ice Shard will remove Glaive Rush's negative effects as well. Scale Shot's Defense drop may not seem like it gels well with this set's bulky focus, but the Speed boost can lead to some late-game clean-ups that would be impossible otherwise.

Other Options

  • Icicle Crash: Icicle Crash's chance of missing and being less effective against Dragonite's Multiscale and Mimikyu's Disguise usually makes it the inferior choice to Icicle Spear, but it doesn't risk activating Archaludon's Stamina multiple times, as well as potentially flipping matches by occasionally flinching slower foes like Ursaluna-B.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: Baxcalibur is fully functional without Terastallization, but doing so makes it a far more effective tank due to its poor defensive typing.

  • Ground: A Ground Tera type gives Baxcalibur a reliable STAB move in Earthquake, resistance to Stealth Rock, and removes a ton of weaknesses, at the cost of becoming more vulnerable to Primarina, Basculegion, and Rotom-W.

  • Electric: With Tera Electric, Baxcalibur's Tera Blast deals massive damage to Corviknight that lack a set up move, and helps break through Primarina. Tera Electric also makes Baxcalibur a great Gholdengo check thanks to resisting Steel.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy helps Baxcalibur against opposing Terastallizations from Dragon-types like Garchomp and Hydreigon, though being weak to Steel is a big problem.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 Atk / 4 Spe with Adamant: This simple EV spread maximizes Baxcalibur's bulk and power.

  • 252 HP / 204 Atk / 52 Spe with Adamant: If using Scale Shot, this Speed investment outspeeds Garchomp, who will often Terastallize in front of Baxcalibur.

  • 116 HP / 156 Atk / 236 Spe with Adamant: The Speed investment here outspeeds Modest Gholdengo and Adamant Dragonite at the cost of some bulk, in addition to outspeeding Meowscarada after Scale Shot.

Gholdengo.overview:
This Pokemon has been updated to reflect Regulation H, that lasts until January 5h, 2025. After this, Regulation G will return.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.
Gholdengo.comments:
Speed EV Benchmarks

  • 4 Spe: This outspeeds maximum Speed Modest Ursaluna-B.

  • 68 Spe: This outspeeds Jolly Ursaluna and Jolly Kingambit.

  • 84 Spe: This outspeeds Timid Ursaluna-B.

  • 148 Spe: This outspeeds Adamant Breloom.

  • 164 Spe: This outspeeds Jolly Tyranitar.

  • 228 Spe: This outspeeds Adamant Dragonite.

  • 244 Spe: This outspeeds Jolly Breloom.

  • 188+ Spe: This outspeeds Adamant Baxcalibur.

  • 220+ Spe: This outspeeds Jolly Dragonite.

  • 228+ Spe: This outspeeds maximum Speed Modest Archaludon.

Paralysis EV Benchmarks

  • 20 Spe: This outspeeds paralyzed +Speed Dragapult.

  • 28 Spe: This outspeeds paralyzed Choice Scarf Basculegion.

  • 36 Spe: This outspeeds paralyzed +1 Speed Jolly Dragonite and paralyzed Choice Scarf Gallade.

  • 84 Spe: This outspeeds paralyzed +1 Speed Jolly Baxcalibur.

  • 108 Spe: This outspeeds paralyzed Choice Scarf Annihilape.

  • 140 Spe: This outspeeds paralyzed Choice Scarf Mimikyu

  • 156 Spe: This outspeeds paralyzed Choice Scarf Hydreigon.

  • 172 Spe: This outspeeds paralyzed +1 Speed Volcarona.

  • 220+ Spe: This outspeeds paralyzed Choice Scarf Meowscarada.

Choice Item.description:
• With Trick and an immunity to status moves, Gholdengo is a dangerous Choice item attacker for offensive and stall teams alike!

  • Nasty Plot: This can be used to give Gholdengo more bite against defensive, slower teams after using Trick.

  • Thunderbolt: Thunderbolt OHKOes Pelipper and matches Make It Rain for damage against Primarina. It also stops Tera Water Garganacl from walling Gholdengo. It does make Gholdengo very vulnerable to Ground-types like Ursaluna-B and Garchomp though.

  • Focus Blast: Focus Blast slices through Kingambit, who otherwise walls Gholdengo, but the accuracy can be a big issue in close matches.

Other Options

  • Power Gem: Power Gem severly punishes Volcarona switch-ins, who otherwise can be very difficult to deal with. Otherwise, most Pokemon weak to Rock-type attacks will take more damage from Make It Rain.

  • Dazzling Gleam: Dazzling Gleam can be paired with Tera Fairy to crush Hydreigon, though Make It Rain deals more damage to most other Dragon-type targets like Dragonite and Garchomp.

Items

  • Choice Scarf: With this, Gholdengo outspeeds key threats such as Garchomp, Dragapult, and Hydreigon. It also outspeeds Meowscarada, but beware of Sucker Punch.

  • Choice Specs: Choice Specs make Gholdengo much more difficult to wall, with Assault Vest Ursaluna-B in particular being much easier to break through.

EV Spreads

  • 4 HP / 252 SpA / 252 Spe with Timid or Modest: Gholdengo mirror matches are common enough that maximizing Speed is usually a wise idea. Choice Scarf Gholdengo particularly needs Timid to outspeed Dragapult. If using Choice Specs, Modest becomes easier to justify for cracking through Ursaluna-B more reliably.

  • 172 HP / 252 SpA / 84 Spe with Modest: This spread focuses on outspeeding Timid Ursaluna-B, Jolly Ursaluna, and Jolly Kingambit, all of whom are uncommon but very deadly to Gholdengo.

  • 212 HP / 236 Def / 52 SpA / 4 SpD / 4 Spe with Modest: This bulky Choice Specs spread survives Dragonite's +1 Earthquake, while outspeeding maximum Speed Modest Ursaluna-B.

  • 244 HP / 4 Def / 12 SpA / 244 SpD / 4 Spe with Modest: This extremely bulky spread allows Tera Flying Choice Speccs Gholdengo to survive Tera Normal Ursaluna-B's Blood Moon followed by Vacuum Wave.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: While Choice Gholdengo is perfectly functional without Terastallizing, it's particularly vulnerable to common Pokemon that Terastallization can solve such as Hydreigon, Garchomp, and Ursaluna-B.

  • Flying: With a Flying Tera type, Gholdengo gains an extremely useful immunity to Ground, which is especially useful on Choice Specs sets against Ursaluna-B and Garchomp.

  • Water: This Tera type gives Gholdengo a valuable resistance to Fire and Water, massively improving the matchup against Primarina and Volcarona.

  • Steel: Make It Rain becomes very powerful with a Tera boost, giving Choice Specs the chance to OHKO several Ursaluna-B variants in particular.

  • Fighting: Tera Fighting saves Gholdengo from Kingambit's Sucker Punch, and can be paired with Tera Blast for a far more reliable Fighting-type attack than Focus Blast.

  • Normal: A Normal Tera type gives Gholdengo the edge against opposing Ghost-types, potentially flipping the table against hard to check sets like Trick Mimikyu.

Minor Optimizations

  • Neutral Nature and Nature Mints: Use a neutral nature Gholdengo that has a Timid or Modest Mint used on it. This way, Gholdengo can eat any Berry without being confused after Trick.

Nasty Plot.description:
• Nasty Plot makes Gholdengo a terror against slower teams, especially with its good bulk, unpredictable coverage, and diverse Tera Types.

  • Substitute: Substitute lets Gholdengo avoid residual damage from Garganacl's Salt Cure and eases prediction in general.

  • Focus Blast: Despite its reliability issues, Focus Blast OHKOes Kingambit, who otherwise is a great check against Gholdengo, in addition to ripping through Ursaluna-B switch-ins.

Other Options

  • Psyshock: Psyshock lets Gholdengo break through Clodsire more easily as well as OHKOing Sneasler without a boost. It often isn't particularly useful outside of stall match-ups though.

Items

  • Covert Cloak: Covert Cloak prevents Salt Cure from chipping down Gholdengo, making it far easier for it to run Recover against Garganacl.

  • Leftovers: This is the most reliable option for keeping Gholdengo healthy and pairs especially well with Substitute.

  • Air Balloon: Air Balloon prevents Dragonite and Ursaluna-B from hitting Gholdengo particularly hard until its popped. It also ruins Breloom's chances of winning the lead war against Gholdengo and makes Hippowdon easy set-up bait.

EV Spreads

  • 156 HP / 124 SpA / 228 Spe with Modest: This spread outspeeds Adamant Dragonite, while having the same Special Attack stat as a fully invested Timid Gholdengo to disguise itself as the Choice Scarf set.

  • 84 HP / 252 SpA / 172 Spe with Timid: This outspeeds up to Modest Archaludon and Jolly Dragonite, two foes that otherwise can revenge kill Gholdengo.

  • 212 HP / 236 Def / 52 SpA / 4 SpD / 4 Spe with Modest: This physically bulky spread survives Dragonite's boosted Earthquake, which can be particularly helpful from stopping a Choice Band Dragonite revenge kill.

  • 4 HP / 252 SpA / 252 Spe with Timid: Maximizing Speed is useful on more offensive sets to at least speedtie with opposing Gholdengo, and outspeeding several threats close to this Speed tier, such as Dragonite.

  • 244 HP / 4 Def / 12 SpA / 244 SpD / 4 Spe with Modest: Focusing on special bulk allows Tera Flying Gholdengo to survive Tera Normal Ursaluna's Blood Moon followed by Focus Blast.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Gholdengo may have a great typing, but common Pokemon such as Garchomp, Hydreigon, and Meowscarada will usually revenge kill it without Terastallization.

  • Flying: Flying Gholdengo gets the jump on dangerous offensive Ground-types like Ursaluna-B and Garchomp, as well as Pokemon that use Ground-type coverage like Dragonite.

  • Water: With this Tera type and Tera Blast, Gholdengo can severely punish Volcarona, who otherwise is very dangerous to this set.

  • Fighting: Tera Fighting is a good stop to Dark-types such as Kingambit, as well as making Tera Blast into a far more reliable alternative to Focus Blast.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy stops defensive Archaludon from being able to phaze Gholdengo at all, in addition to saving it from Dark-type attacks. This comes at the cost of losing the mirror match up though, as well as being easily revenge killed by offensive Archaludon.

  • Normal: While it's a much worse defensive typing, Tera Normal does let Gholdengo surprise faster Ghost-types like Mimikyu and opposing Gholdengo, at the cost of being revenge killed by Annihilepe and faster Gallade.

Defensive.description:
• While Gholdengo's defensive stats aren't remarkable, it's fantastic typing and immunity to status moves like Taunt make it a great defensive Pokemon, and a horrifically effective spreader of paralysis!

  • Hex versus Shadow Ball: Hex gives this Gholdengo a good offensive kick against paralyzed foes, but Shadow Ball is worth considering for its consistency.

  • Make It Rain versus Focus Blast: Make It Rain is Gholdengo's most consistent way of dealing damage to Garganacl, but this set's defensive nature makes it difficult to win the one-on-one. Focus Blast isn't nearly as reliable, but it's Gholdengo's best shot at making it past Kingambit.

Items

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet takes advantage of Gholdengo's excellent typing against physical moves, making it a good way to punish contact moves such as Outrage from Dragonite.

  • Covert Cloak: This is Gholdengo's best shot of outstalling Garganacl, since it grants an immunity to Salt Cure's effect.

  • Leftovers: Leftovers is at its best with specially defensive Gholdengo, letting it withstand Ursaluna-B's Earth Power followed by Vacuum Wave without requiring Terastallization.

  • Weakness Policy: While this might seem strange on a defensive Pokemon, Weakness Policy lets Gholdengo beat opposing Gholdengo as long as they lack Choice Specs.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 220 Def / 20 Spe with Bold: The given EV spread will outspeed up to paralyzed Dragapult and paralyzed +1 Speed Jolly Dragonite.

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Calm: This offers Gholdengo the best shot of surviving Ursaluna-B's Earth Power followed by Vacuum Wave after Leftovers recovery.

  • 252 HP / 84 Def / 172 Spe with Bold: The Speed investment allows Gholdengo to outspeed Choice Scarf Hydreigon and Speed-boosted Volcarona with the magic of paralysis.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Despite Gholdengo's fantastic typing, foes like Garchomp and Hydreigon are easily able to break through any Gholdengo that doesn't Terastallize.

  • Flying: Avoiding Earthquake against foes like Garchomp makes Tera Flying extremely useful for Gholdengo; this also gives it protection against Fissure from the likes of Dondozo and Garganacl.

  • Water: Tera Water is the best Fire-type resistant Tera type for Gholdengo, letting it potentially survive an assault from Volcarona and Choice Specs Primarina, though its coverage moves can still seriously damage Gholdengo.

  • Fighting: Tera Fighting flips the tables on Kingambit, who otherwise only fears full paralysis, while turning Tera Blast into reliable Fighting-type coverage. It's also useful against Meowscarada, though its coverage moves can still deal serious damage to Gholdengo.

Leech Seed.description:
• With excellent bulk and a unique array of moves to support it, Wo-Chien stands out as a dangerous user of Leech Seed and a prime Pokemon to stall matches out with.

  • Foul Play versus Knock Off: Foul Play is Wo-Chien's most consistent offensive move that also happens to punish setup sweepers, while Knock Off's support is especially helpful against Trick users such as Gholdengo and Rotom-W. Note that both are viable together if you're willing to give up a support move.

  • Substitute: When paired together with Toxic Spikes, Protect and Substitute makes even foes that should beat Wo-Chien get worn down before they can KO it, such as Chi-Yu. Substitute itself protects Wo-Chien from slow users of Yawn such as Dondozo and Hippowdon, and slow OHKO moves from Ting-Lu, Dondozo, and Kingambit.

  • Ruination: Ruination gives Wo-Chien powerful chipping down potential, though it should never be used as Wo-Chien's only attack due to it being extremely difficult to KO with. When paired with Knock Off, it's especially useful against Wo-Chien mirror matches.

  • Giga Drain: With Stealth Rock support, Giga Drain OHKOes Iron Bundle and almost always 2HKOes Chien-Pao. If you allocate 60 EVs to Special Attack, Giga Drain will OHKO Iron Bundle regardless of Stealth Rock.

  • Taunt: Taunt does an excellent job of surprising other Taunt Pokemon switching in, such as Annihilape and Corviknight.

  • Toxic Spikes Partners: Wo-Chien becomes far more deadly with Toxic Spikes support, letting it quickly wear down a wide variety of foes even faster. Toxapex is one of the best options thanks to its good defensive synergy with Wo-Chien, but other options include Iron Moth, Glimmora, Clodsire, Focus Sash Meowscarada, and the niche Gengar.

Other Options

  • Snarl: Snarl makes fearsome special attackers such as Flutter Mane and Chi-Yu far easier to switch into when Wo-Chien needs to escape, though Wo-Chien will need to have the correct Tera Type to outstall these foes itself.

  • Ingrain: In addition to providing some extra recovery, Ingrain makes phazers such as Ting-Lu and Hippowdon fail to stop Wo-Chien consistently, though Wo-Chien being trapped is a serious drawback.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: Despite Wo-Chien's fantastic bulk, its vulnerability to Toxic Spikes and poor defensive typing mean it must often Terastallize to stall out teams.

  • Poison: Tera Poison provides a vital resistance to Fairy and Fighting, and it also lets Wo-Chien absorb Toxic Spikes.

  • Fairy: Besides being a great defensive type, Tera Fairy helps Wo-Chien against Fighting-types that'd normally beat it.

  • Water: Tera Water provides Ice and Fire resistances, helpful against Baxcalibur, Chien-Pao, and Chi-Yu.

  • Fire: Tera Fire gives useful resistances to Fairy, Fire, and Ice, which help against major threats like Flutter Mane, Baxcalibur, Chi-Yu, and Chien-Pao.

Items

  • Leftovers: Wo-Chien's stalling playstyle makes Leftovers the most consistent recovery item.
