  • 252 HP / 124 Atk / 68 Def / 4 SpD / 60 Spe with Adamant: This bulkier spread allows Ogerpon-C to survive Jolly Punching Glove Urshifu-R's Tera Water Surging Strikes and outspeeds Iron Bundle after Rock Tomb's Speed drop. It also naturally outspeeds Jolly Breloom, Modest Archaludon, and Modest Gholdengo, while also outspeeding Timid Iron Bundle after a Speed drop from Rock Tomb.
Other Options

  • Trailblaze: Ogerpon-C is not nearly as effective at sweeping with Trailblaze as Ogerpon-H, but it's still a potential win condition that can work well with Sturdy due to ease of setup.

  • Leech Seed: While Rock is not a good defensive typing, both Sturdy and Embody Aspect can make good use of Leech Seed's recovery.

  • Spikes: Sadly Ogerpon-C doesn't learn Stealth Rock, so this is the best alternative. While Spikes aren't bad, their failure to hit important floating Pokemon like Dragonite and Landorus-T means they aren't a perfect replacement for Stealth Rock.

Embody Aspect

Ogerpon-C is locked into a Rock Tera type, with the bonus of getting a Defense boost via Embody Aspect. While the Defense boost can be useful, note that Ogerpon-C loses Sturdy, which ironically can make it easier to OHKO! If needing the Defense boost, it's usually best to do this if Ogerpon-C is not at full health or needs a boosted Ivy Cudgel to KO a threat.

Defensive Support.description:
• Archaludon's magnificent typing, superb ability, and beautiful movepool make it a golden bridge to Stealth Rock in the Regulation F metagame!

  • Iron Head VS. Flash Cannon VS. Heavy Slam: Archaludon should always take advantage of its Steel-type STAB moves to whack Fairy-types. Iron Head has excellent synergy with Thunder Wave thanks its flinch rate and easily 2HKOes most Flutter Mane. Flash Cannon sets risk getting set up on by Calm Mind Flutter Mane but deal more damage to Tera Fairy Pokemon like Gouging Fire and opposing Archaludon. Finally, Heavy Slam crushes all but the most bulky Flutter Mane but does poorly against heavy Tera Fairy foes like Gouging Fire.

  • Body Press: Body Press works great with Stamina to make Archaludon a less passive threat.

  • Thunder Wave: Archaludon's decent Speed means it outspeeds almost anything that lacks a Choice Scarf after paralyzing them, which can be especially frightening when paired with Iron Head's flinch rate stacking with full paralysis.

  • Dragon Tail VS. Roar: Archaludon is a fantastic phazer that also happens to outspeed most other phazers. Dragon Tail is easy to recommend, being usable through Taunt and dealing extra chip damage, but Roar is required to force out Fairy-types and Pokemon behind Substitute.

Other Options

  • Mirror Coat: While it can be tricky to fit in, Mirror Coat on specially defensive Archaludon can cause huge upsets against foes like Flutter Mane and Latios.

  • Draco Meteor: Draco Meteor deals massive damage to opposing Dragon-types and Ursaluna-B that lack Assault Vest, but it's rather tricky to fit in without losing some utility or running a Speed-decreasing nature.

  • Rest and Chesto Berry: Rest and Chesto Berry give Archaludon even more time to rack up Defense boosts and also make Yawn foes like Swampert and Hippowdon less momentum-killing. Both the move and item require giving up more generally useful slots, though.

EV Spreads

  • When using Sitrus Berry, make sure Archaludon's HP is an even number at Level 50 so that one hit by Ruination activates it. This can easily be done with 244 HP EVs.

  • 244 HP / 164 Def / 100 SpD Impish or Bold: This Sitrus Berry-optimized spread avoids a 2HKO from Timid Flutter Mane's unboosted Moonblast and also survives two hits of Earthquake from Jolly Landorus-T thanks to Stamina.

  • 244 HP / 252 Def / 12 SpD Impish or Bold: Maximizing Defense means it takes Adamant Choice Band Landorus-T to have a good shot of OHKOing Archaludon, with other Landorus-T variants usually failing to OHKO it, at the cost of a worse Flutter Mane matchup.

  • 244 HP / 12 Def / 252 SpD Careful or Calm: This specially defensive spread almost always survives Choice Specs Latios's Draco Meteor after Stealth Rock damage and has around an 88% chance of avoiding a 2HKO from Modest Choice Specs Gholdengo's Shadow Ball with Sitrus Berry recovery.

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD / 4 Spe Careful or Calm: The extra bit of special bulk ensures Archaludon will survive Choice Specs Latios's Draco Meteor after Stealth Rock, even on the highest roll! Just note that Ruination will no longer immediately activate Sitrus Berry.

Items

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry has excellent synergy with Stamina, letting Archaludon take on foes it normally wouldn't dream of, such as Landorus-T and Garchomp with the correct EV spread!

  • Leftovers: Leftovers's gradual recovery rewards Archaludon that manage to get multiple Stamina boosts, making it even more difficult to take down than usual! This can usually be done by switching into a weak priority attack like Primarina's Aqua Jet

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet is an effective tool against physical attackers, being especially helpful on Tera Flying Archaludon to force Tera Normal Dragonite to use Extreme Speed.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Archaludon's fantastic typing can make Terastallization a net negative, so make sure to Terastallize only if it's needed for the matchup.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy solidifies Archaludon against Urshifu-S and Chien-Pao, making the Defense boost-ignoring moves Wicked Blow and Sacred Sword far less of a problem, and saves it from powerful Draco Meteors from foes like Latios.

  • Flying: Tera Flying fixes up its weakness to Ground- and Fighting-type attacks, which can save Archaludon from Ursaluna-B for a turn. Just note that losing its Blood Moon resistance could be detrimental in the long run without a boosted Body Press.

  • Water: Tera Water is Archaludon's best option against Urshifu-R, removing its Fighting weakness while allowing it not to worry about Surging Strikes ignoring Defense stages.

Pseudo-Sash.description:
• This Archaludon takes advantage of Sturdy to get around Item Clause for Focus Sash, making it a surprising offensive support Pokemon or revenge killer depending on the matchup!

  • Thunder Wave: Thunder Wave is especially brutal with Custap Berry, letting Archaludon fire off one last priority Thunder Wave to support an incoming teammate.

  • Electro Shot and Power Herb: Electro Shot's Special Attack boost when combined with Power Herb's recharge removal makes Archaludon far more difficult to wall, with offensive Gholdengo in particular being in KO range of Flash Cannon afterwards!

  • Heavy Slam VS. Mirror Coat: Heavy Slam OHKOes all but the bulkiest of Flutter Mane, giving Archaludon even more early-game power. Mirror Coat is the riskier option, since Archaludon must get hit, but it can lead to a shocking demise for many a special attacker!

  • Modest VS. Timid: Modest is preferred to get as much power out of Archaludon as possible, but Timid happens to outspeed Gholdengo and Adamant Urshifu formes.

Other Options

  • Steel Beam: Steel Beam is an insanely powerful kaboom to go out with, but Archaludon's reasonable bulk even when uninvested makes it a rather constraining move to slot in.

  • Dark Pulse: Dark Pulse is Archaludon's strongest attack against Gholdengo but does little else, especially if using Power Herb and Electro Shot.

  • Rock Tomb: This Archaludon is fast enough to fully take advantage of the speed control Rock Tomb provides. While not as devastating as paralysis, it is less vulnerable to Lum Berry, Taunt, and Encore, in addition to breaking Iron Bundle's Substitute. Just make sure to use a Timid nature so Iron Bundle will be outsped after the Speed drop.

  • Dragon Tail or Roar: Phazing with such an offensive set may seem odd, but it makes Archaludon less passive after using Draco Meteor.

  • Metal Burst: Metal Burst is a seemingly less risky alternative to Mirror Coat, but its lack of negative priority doesn't bode well against slower special attackers like Ursaluna-B.

  • Naive with 0 IVs in HP, Defense, and Special Defense: Going this route is the most likely way to get Custap Berry to activate on Archaludon, but the bulk loss makes it less flexible overall.

Items

  • Custap Berry: Custap Berry gives Archaludon a pseudo-priority move in the situation it gets hit hard, giving it a chance to completely ruin gameplans or even revenge kill later in the game!

  • Jaboca Berry: This Berry guarantees that the first physical attack to hit Archaludon will deal damage to its foe, potentially ruining common Focus Sash leads such as Chien-Pao and Urshifu formes.

  • Sitrus Berry: Archaludon's great physical bulk means even if Sturdy is activated, it's capable of surviving resisted priority attacks from foes like Adamant Urshifu-R, Dragonite, and Entei while at 26% of its health.

  • Red Card: Red Card makes early-game setup foes like Dragonite much less of a worry when Sturdy is intact.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency: Very Low: Since this Archaludon is usually used in the early parts of the game to support the rest of the team, Terastallization isn't usually a good idea unless a matchup absolutely requires it.

  • Flying: A Ground immunity can come in handy against Landorus-T, a common early-game Stealth Rock setter that can give Archaludon some issues.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy is a big surprise to powerful Dragon-type wallbreakers like Choice Band Dragonite and Choice Specs Latios.

  • Stellar: In the rare situation Terastallization is needed, Tera Stellar's one-time power boost for each attack could be situationally useful for cleaning up late-game.

Choice Specs.description:
• With a Choice Specs in tow, Archaludon becomes a surprising and powerful wallbreaker that can ruin the days of its usual defensive checks like Ting-Lu!

  • Thunderbolt: Thunderbolt is not only good coverage against Steel-types like Corviknight, but it also 2HKOes Assault Vest Primarina, an otherwise troublsome foe for other offensive Archaludon.

  • Dark Pulse: Dark Pulse 2HKOes bulky Gholdengo, and it even has a shot at OHKOing offensive Gholdengo. It also deals decent damage to uncommon Steel-types that are immune to Thunderbolt like in Excadrill and Iron Treads.

  • Steel Beam: Steel Beam is absurdly powerful, with even bulky Steel-resistant Pokemon like Scizor needing Assault Vest to avoid a 2HKO! This does come at the cost of ruining Sturdy by losing half of Archaludon's health, though.

  • Aura Sphere: While risky to be locked into because of Ghost-types, Aura Sphere deals plenty of damage to Chi-Yu and opposing Archaludon without committing to a Special Attack drop from Draco Meteor.

  • Dragon Pulse: Dragon Pulse is a less risky back-up to Draco Meteor, making the revenge killing of Dragon-types like Dragonite less risky.

  • Sturdy: While Stamina is potentially workable with Archaludon's good bulk, Sturdy is highly recommended for ensuing very few Pokemon can OHKO it without Stealth Rock support, making it far more difficult to check offensively!

  • Modest versus Timid: Modest's extra power is preferred if using Dark Pulse for a potential OHKO on offensive Gholdengo, but Timid is a reasonable consideration for outspeeding Adamant Urshifu formes, Timid Gholdengo, and Jolly Dragonite.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Archaludon focuses so much on offense that Terastallization is best for either dealing more damage or giving it useful immunities.

  • Stellar: Tera Stellar's one-time boost per type makes Archaludon a fearsomely flexible wallbreaker, with even support Landorus-T sets being OHKOed by Draco Meteor and Steel Beam!

  • Flying: Floating with Tera Flying is a strong way to punish attempts to revenge kill Archaludon with Ground-type attacks, with Landorus-T and and Ursaluna-B in particular being ripe targets. The Fighting resistance also comes in handy if Sturdy is broken by a weak attack.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy ruins strong special attacking Dragon-types like Choice Specs Latios, and it makes Archaludon a solid Urshifu-S check even when Sturdy isn't in play.

  • Dragon: Tera Dragon's defensive benefits aren't strong beyond resisting Ogerpon-H's STAB attacks, but a consistently powerful Draco Meteor makes it a good offensive choice.

  • Steel: Tera Steel's Fairy resistance can save Archaludon from revenge kills if a weak attack has broken Sturdy, but its main use is for firing off an extremely powerful Steel Beam twice.

Assault Vest.description:
• This set's write-up has not started yet, but here's some basic info to get you started!

  • Heavy Slam: Despite the Natures, Heavy Slam is a good idea for OHKOing all Flutter Mane except for extremely defensive variants.

  • 252 HP / 180 SpA / 76 SpD with Modest: This spread avoids a OHKO from Modest Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Tera-boosted Moonblast.

  • 252 HP / 52 SpA / 204 SpD with Calm or Modest: This spread with Calm avoids a 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast, while still letting Draco Meteor deal over 50% to most Ursaluna-B that lack Assault Vest. If surviving Ursaluna-B's Earth Power is the main concern, Archaludon can use a Modest nature instead with this spread.

Eject Pack Pivot.description:
• This set's write-up has not started yet, but here's some basic info to get you started!

  • EV Spread: This survives Horn Leech followed by Ivy Cudgel from Terastallized Adamant Ogerpon-H thanks to a jump point in Defense, and is not OHKOed by Modest Choice Specs Gholdengo's Make It Rain.

  • 0 Speed IV: This is used in conjunction with Eject Pack and a Special Attack dropping move to pivot as late as possible, underspeeding Garganacl before it uses Curse in particular.

Gouging Fire.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon is a new addition from the Indigo Disk that happens to be relevant!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Offensive Dragon Dance.description:
• With nearly unresisted coverage and reasonable bulk, Gouging Fire is a fearsome Speed boosting sweeper!

  • Heat Crash VS. Flare Blitz: Heat Crash hits plenty of targets for high power thanks to Gouging Fire's high weight without compromising its bulk like Flare Blitz. However, beware that some heavy targets that sometimes use Tera Fairy like Ting-Lu, Ursaluna-B, and opposing Gouging Fire will take very little from Heat Crash compared to Flare Blitz.

  • Scale Shot and Loaded Dice: Scale Shot with Loaded Dice not only gives Gouging Fire an alternate way to boost its Speed but also provides it with a way to bust through Focus Sash Pokemon after a boost, such as Chien-Pao.

  • Outrage VS. Dragon Claw: Outrage is preferred for maximum late-game sweeping potential, but Dragon Claw is a safer option if you don't always bring good Fairy-type checks like Scizor.

  • Earthquake: Earthquake is a good response to bulky Fire-types like Incineroar and the rare Heatran, and it is the strongest attack against Toxapex.

  • Substitute: Substitute lets Gouging Fire block Yawn from troublesome foes like Swampert and Torkoal and not worry about Thunder Wave from slow, bulky foes like Gholdengo and Porygon2.

  • Booster Energy: If not using Scale Shot, Booster Energy's power or Speed boost is the most useful for late-game sweeping without compromising Gouging Fire's good bulk like Life Orb would.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Gouging Fire's typing is fine defensively, but the high profile weaknesses to Ground and Dragon mean Terastallizing gives it far more versatile setup opportunities.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy turns the tables on fearsome Dragon-type attacks from the likes of Latios and Dragonite and is a good defensive typing in general.

  • Fire: Tera Fire gives Gouging Fire plenty of extra power and a useful Fairy resistance against Flutter Mane, even if the irritating Earthquake weakness remains.

  • Water: Tera Water is a godsend against Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes and gives a setup opportunity against Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash as well.

  • Grass: Although it's awkward against several targets like Tera Flying Landorus-T and opposing Gouging Fire, Tera Grass's Earthquake resistance and Spore immunity give it a niche.

Alternate EV Spreads
  • 84 HP / 164 Atk / 4 Def / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Jolly: With this spread, Gouging Fire gets a Speed boost with Protosynthesis, letting it become a competent revenge killer with Booster Energy or have an extra use on sun teams. The defensive investment allows Gouging Fire to survive Tera-boosted Adamant Chien-Pao's Choice Band Crunch

Choiced.description:
• Gouging Fire's deadly STAB combination makes it a great user of Choice items and gives it an especially strong role on sun teams as a cleaner and revenge killer!

  • Raging Fury VS. Heat Crash: Gouging Fire's bulk is commendable enough that in a late-game stage, locking it into Raging Fury may make it less vulnerable to revenge kills than Flare Blitz's recoil. Heat Crash fulfills a similar purpose, though heavy threats like Ting-Lu and Ursaluna-B will take very little from it.

  • Dragon Claw VS. Breaking Swipe: Dragon Claw is the most powerful option for a no-drawback Dragon-type STAB move, but Breaking Swipe's Attack drop can open up some support opportunities for Gouging Fire's teammates.

  • Earthquake: Earthquake hits Incineroar and bulky Tera Fire users like Scizor hard, though it can be a risky move to choose with the large number of Ground-immune foes in the metagame.

  • Torkoal: If using this set on a sun team, Torkoal is among the best options for setting up sun for Gouging Fire thanks to its access to Stealth Rock and Yawn, which can soften up foes for a sweep.

  • Choice Scarf Vs. Choice Band: Choice Scarf functions the best outside of sun teams and is able to outspeed major threats like Chien-Pao and Iron Bundle. Choice Band is harder to clean with outside of sun teams, and it can use a specialized EV spread to get a Speed boost in sun.

Other Options
  • Double Kick: If using Choice Scarf, Double Kick can be used to OHKO Chien-Pao through its Focus Sash in a surprise revenge kill. It's too weak to be used for much else though.
Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Since Gouging Fire is focused on cleaning and revenge killing, defensive Terastallization isn't usually an important factor for it.

  • Fire: Tera Fire makes Gouging Fire even more difficult to wall, especially in late-game scenarios. It also gives Gouging Fire a handy Fairy resistance.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy can turn the tables on other Dragon-types, making it by far the most useful defensive Tera type for this set.

Alternate EV Spreads
  • 84 HP / 164 Atk / 4 Def / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Jolly: This spread gives Gouging Fire a Speed boost with Protosynthesis, allowing potentially easier cleaning with Choice Band sets in sun. The bulk investment allows Gouging Fire to survive Choice Band Tera-boosted Crunch from Adamant Choice Band Chien-Pao.

Bulky Dragon Dance.description:
• Gouging Fire's incredible dual STAB coverage and good defensive stats make running a bulky Dragon Dance set a great choice!

  • Breaking Swipe VS. Dragon Claw: Dragon Claw is the more reliable late-game cleaning attack, but Breaking Swipe eases Gouging Fire's setup against physical threats.

  • ** Heat Crash VS. Flare Blitz**: Gouging Fire is heavy enough for Heat Crash to be just as powerful as Flare Blitz against several lightweight targets, such as Flutter Mane and Gholdengo. However, common, heavy foes like Ursaluna-B and Ting-Lu will only take 40 Base Power of damage from it, which can justify Flare Blitz's recoil for some teams. Checking our damage calculator can help decide if Heat Crash or Flare Blitz is better for your team!

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: While Gouging Fire's typing isn't bad defensively, its common weaknesses to Ground- and Dragon-type attacks mean Terastallization will greatly increase its setup opportunities.

  • Fairy Tera Fairy is a fantastic defensive choice, fending off Dragon-type attacks that can break through Gouging Fire and making it a great option against Urshifu-S.

  • Water: Tera Water vastly eases the matchup against Urshifu-R, which can bypass Breaking Swipe with Surging Strikes otherwise. It also makes dealing with Chien-Pao easier.

  • Fire: Fire isn't an impressive defensive choice beyond the useful Fairy resistance and losing the Dragon weakness, but the power boost still makes it worth considering.

  • Grass: Tera Grass is awkward against opposing Fire-types and Tera Flying Landorus-T, but the Ground resistance and Spore immunity do give it a niche.

EV Spreads
  • Minimum Speed EVs: Gouging Fire's EV spreads are fairly customizable, but usually it's best to have at least 212 Speed EVs with a neutral nature or 116 EVs with a Jolly nature. This ensures that Gouging Fire outspeeds Iron Bundle, Flutter Mane, and Chien-Pao after one use of Dragon Dance. If the rare Dragapult is a special concern, 252 Speed EVs with a neutral nature or 148 Speed EVs with Jolly can be run to outspeed that after Dragon Dance.
Physically Defensive Spreads

  • 244 HP / 4 Atk / 44 Def / 4 SpD / 212 Spe Impish: This spread avoids a 2HKO from Timid Flutter Mane's Moonblast and Choice Scarf Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes.

  • 108 HP / 188 Def / 212 Spe Impish: This spread is the second most physically defensive spread possible with the given Speed, sacrificing some special bulk to have about an 85% chance of avoiding a 2HKO from Jolly Choice Band Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash with Leftovers recovery. The HP investment is worth it over making Gouging Fire slightly more physically bulky for some extra cushioning against special attacking threats, such as surviving Choice Specs Gholdengo's Shadow Ball after Stealth Rock damage.

Specially Defensive Spreads

  • All of these spreads avoid a 2HKO from Flutter Mane that lack Choice Specs, provided Stealth Rock is off the field.

  • 188 HP / 204 SpD / 116 Spe Jolly or 188 HP / 108 SpD / 212 Spe Careful: These identical spreads usually allow Gouging Fire to survive Blood Moon followed by Vacuum Wave from Modest Ursaluna-B when taking Stealth Rock damage and Leftovers recovery into account.

  • 116 HP / 52 Atk / 4 Def / 220 SpD / 116 Jolly or 116 HP / 52 Atk / 4 Def / 124 SpD / 212 Spe Careful: These identical spreads sacrifice some overall bulk to get an Attack boost from Protosynthesis, which can be helpful against sun teams or when using Booster Energy.

  • 252 HP / 108 SpD / 148 Spe Jolly: This spread gives Gouging Fire a Speed boost with Protosynthesis, which is especially helpful for outspeeding Booster Energy Flutter Mane after a Dragon Dance.

Items

  • Leftovers: Leftovers is best for easing Gouging Fire's setup, especially when paired with Breaking Swipe.

  • Booster Energy: Booster Energy can be used with the specialized EV spreads above to boost a specific stat once.

  • Rocky Helmet: When using physically defensive spreads or Breaking Swipe, Rocky Helmet is an effective passive damage dealer against threats like Dragonite and Choice Scarf Urshifu-R.

  • Clear Amulet: Clear Amulet prevents Landorus-T and Incineroar from obstructing Gouging Fire with Intimidate cycling.

  • Heavy-Duty Boots: While not as cripplingly weak to Stealth Rock as something like Volcarona, Heavy-Duty Boots lets Gouging Fire check threats more consistently overall.

  • Covert Cloak: Covert Cloak makes losing to Garganacl far less likely and prevents dreaded flinch scenarios from Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu.

Raging Bolt.comments:
Offensive EV Benchmarks

  • 44 SpA: This lets Thunderclap OHKO offensive Urshifu-R.

  • 140 SpA: This 2HKOes Modest Ursaluna-B that have maximum HP and Special Defense investment with Tera Blast + Draco Meteor if using Booster Energy.

  • 204 SpA: This lets +2 Thunderbolt OHKO offensive Flutter Mane.

Defensive EV Benchmarks

  • 140 HP This is the minimum amount of HP needed to survive Annihilape's Final Gambit.

  • 148 HP / 20 Def: This lets Raging Bolt survive +1 Jolly Ogerpon-H's Play Rough.

  • 140 HP / 76 SpD: This avoid a 2HKO from Timid Flutter Mane after Sitrus Berry Raging Bolt has a Calm Mind boost.

  • 140 HP / 108 Def: This survives Adamant Choice Band Chien-Pao's Tera-boosted Crunch.

  • 140 HP / 180 Def: This survives Adamant Landorus-T's Earthquale and Adamant Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash.

  • 20 HP / 172 Def: This is the most EV efficient way to survive Adamant Choice Band Chien-Pao's Tera-boosted Crunch, at the cost of being OHKOed by Annihilape's Final Gambit.

Assault Vest EV Benchmarks

  • 140 HP / 92 SpD: This survives Modest Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast.

  • 140 HP / 132 SpD: This avoids a 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast after Stealth Rock damage if Raging Bolt is Terastallized.

Speed EV Benchmarks

  • 44 Spe: This outspeeds minimum Speed Dragonite.

  • 76 Spe: This outspeeds maximum Speed Modest Ursaluna-B.

  • 132 Spe: This outspeeds Jolly Ursaluna, a rare but powerful threat against Raging Bolt.

  • 156 Spe: This outspeeds Timid Ursaluna-B.

  • 220 Spe: This outspeeds Adamant Breloom, a rare threat that can stop Raging Bolt's sweeps with Spore.

  • 196+ Spe: This outspeeds Adamant Basculegion.

  • 204+ Spe: This outspeeds Adamant Dragonite.

  • 244+ Spe: This outspeeds Modest Archaludon.

Bulky Offense.description:
• Raging Bolt's decent defensive typing, hefty bulk, and booming priority in Thunderclap make it an excellent bulky offensive Pokemon.

  • Thunderbolt versus Discharge versus Volt Switch: Volt Switch makes Raging Bolt a great pivot, but it does mean that Raging Bolt lacks a reliable Electric-type STAB move or has worse coverage, making Thunderbolt a reasonable alternative. Discharge's higher paralysis chance can make the power drop worth it if using slow teammates like Ursaluna-B.

  • Heavy Slam: When used with a Quiet nature, Heavy Slam OHKOes offensive Flutter Mane! If using Modest, it'll still put most Flutter Mane into Thunderclap's KO range as well.

  • Modest versus Quiet: Quiet is mainly used for OHKOing offensive Flutter Mane with Heavy Slam, but even with that move, Modest makes sense if your team requires Speed investment.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Raging Bolt's good typing means Terastallization does have some drawbacks, such as making Urshifu-R harder to switch-into, but it has enough common weaknesses to types like Ground and Fairy that mean Terastallization will often be optimal.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy is a fantastic defensive typing, making Raging Bolt a spectacular check to most Urshifu-S and prancing around strong Dragon-type attacks.

  • Steel: Retaining the common Ground weakness is unfortunate, but Tera Steel makes up for it by tanking Fairy-type attacks and shredding Flutter Mane with Heavy Slam.

  • Ice: When used with Tera Blast, Tera Ice chills Landorus-T to the bone and deals tremendous damage to Ursaluna-B without firing off Draco Meteor.

  • Water: Tera Water gives Raging Bolt a cool resistance to Ice-type attacks from the likes of Chien-Pao while still retaining the Surging Strikes resistance against Urshifu-R. Just watch out for Tera Electric Chien-Pao.

  • Electric: Tera Electric makes sense for making Thunderclap an even more effective revenge killing tool and ridding Raging Bolt of its Fairy and Dragon weaknesses.

  • Bug: This niche Tera type grants Raging Bolt a resistance to Ground without making it weak to Ice.

EV Spread Examples

  • 148 HP / 156 Def / 204 SpA with Modest or Quiet: This survives both Adamant Landorus-T's Earthquake and Adamant Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash on all but the highest roll of damage, and it also OHKOes offensive Flutter Mane with +2 Thunderbolt.

  • 148 HP / 20 Def / 180 SpA / 4 SpD / 156 Spe with Modest: This spread outspeeds the rare but dangerous Timid Ursaluna-B while avoiding an OHKO from Timid Flutter Mane's unboosted Moonblast and +1 Ogerpon-H's Play Rough.

  • 140 HP / 236 SpA / 132 SpD with Modest or Quiet: These EVs are optimized for Assault Vest, letting Terastallized Raging Bolt to avoid a 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast after Stealth Rock damage.

Items

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet lets Raging Bolt punish Urshifu-R that lack Punching Glove for using Surging Strikes, since most Urshiu-R will switch out from Raging Bolt.

  • Booster Energy: Booster Energy gives Raging Bolt a useful increase in power, with Thunderbolt now OHKOing Primarina that lack Assault Vest. However, it doesn't work well with Volt Switch and will usually tell your opponent that you aren't carrying it.

  • Weakness Policy: Raging Bolt is bulky enough to take full advantage of Weakness Policy, turning Thunderclap into a vicious cleaning tool!

  • Assault Vest: Raging Bolt's excellent bulk and pivoting prowess make it a great user of Assault Vest.

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry's quick burst of recovery is especially helpful when Terastallized into a type that doesn't resist Water against Urshifu-R. Just make sure to use an even HP number to eat the Berry after being hit by Ruination once.

  • Choice Specs: Choice Specs transforms Raging Bolt into a fearsome wallbreaking pivot! However, it makes Thunderclap even riskier to use.

Calm Mind.description:
• Raging Bolt's incredible bulk and access to the crackling Thunderclap make it one of the most dangerous special attackers in the metagame!

  • Dragon Pulse versus Draco Meteor: Dragon Pulse is a reliable STAB attack against Ground-type foes. Draco Meteor is harder to sweep teams with, but it severely damages Assault Vest Ursaluna-B enough that it's worth considering.

  • Thunderbolt versus Discharge: A reliable Electric-type attack ensures that the risky Thunderclap isn't Raging Bolt's only option against Water-types, with Thunderbolt offering a tad more power, while Discharge's 30% paralysis rate is helpful for slow teammates like Ursaluna-B and Basculegion.

  • Volt Switch with Draco Meteor: Volt Switch may seem completely contrary to sweeping with Calm Mind boosts, but it can be combined with Draco Meteor to transform Raging Bolt into a wallbreaking pivot rather than a bulky sweeper.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Raging Bolt's common weaknesses like Ground and Fairy, combined with its awesome bulk, makes it a good candidate for Terastallization to prevent revenge kills.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy is a brilliant defensive typing, ruining Dragon-type attacks and transforming Raging Bolt into a good Urshifu-S check in a pinch.

  • Water: Tera Water is perfect for soaking up Ice-type attacks from Chien-Pao while still resisting Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes.

  • Electric: In addition to removing the annoying Fairy and Dragon weaknesses, Tera Electric makes Thunderclap an even more fearsome priority attack!

  • Ice: Tera Ice is awful defensively, but when paired with Tera Blast, Raging Bolt can freeze specially defensive Landorus-T's smug grin off with an OHKO!

  • Steel Steel unfortunately retains that annoying Ground weakness, but the resistance to Dragon and Fairy is good enough to consider it against threats like Flutter Mane and offensive Archaludon.

  • Bug: This niche Tera type gives Raging Bolt a Ground resistance without an Ice weakness that would doom it against Chien-Pao like Tera Flying would.

Items

  • Leftovers: Leftovers rewards Raging Bolt's longevity more than any item, making it the prime cut of items.

  • Rocky Helmet: With Rocky Helmet, Raging Bolt can consistently punish Choice Scarf Urshifu-R for using Surging Strikes, giving it the perfect chance to set up Calm Mind as Urshifu-R switches out.

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry can be used with specalized EV spreads to prevent some useful 2HKOs. Just make sure to use an even HP stat so it's eaten after Raging Bolt is hit by Ruination one time.

  • Booster Energy: Booster Energy is a more immediately offensive approach to Raging Bolt, letting it deal good damage without needing to set up Calm Mind.

  • Figy, Aguav, Mago, Iapapa, or Wiki Berry: These berries restore more health than Sitrus Berry, though the 25% HP activation does make them riskier.

EV Spread Examples

  • 140 HP / 180 Def / 44 SpA / 140 SpD / 4 Spe: This spread survives Annihilape's Final Gambit, Adamant Landorus-T's Earthquake, and Adamant Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash. It also OHKOes offensive Urshifu-R with Thunderclap and survives Timid Flutter Mane's Moonblast after Stealth Rock damage.

  • 148 HP / 20 Def / 180 SpA / 4 SpD / 156 Spe with Modest: This Raging Bolt is fast enough to outspeed Timid Ursaluna-B, a rare but potentially game-ending threat! The defensive investment ensures that Raging Bolt survives a +1 Play Rough from Jolly Ogerpon-H and Moonblast from Timid Flutter Mane.

  • 140 HP / 4 Def / 244 SpA / 76 SpD / 44 Spe: This lets Sitrus Berry Raging Bolt avoid a 2HKO from Timid Flutter Mane's Moonblast after Raging Bolt boosts with Calm Mind, and it also outspeeds minimum Speed Dragonite.

• This set's write-up has not started yet, but here's some basic info to get you started!

  • EV Spread: This gives Iron Crown a Speed boost with Quark Drive, and is faster than Jolly Urshifu formes.

Offensive.description:
• This set's write-up has not started yet, but here's some basic info to get you started!

  • 44 HP / 36 Def / 172 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Modest or Timid: This spread survives Jolly Punching Glove Urshifu-R's Tera Water Surging Strikes, and Modest Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball if using Assault Vest.

Terapagos.comments:
Speed EV Benchmarks

  • 60 Spe: This outspeeds Jolly Ursaluna.

  • 76 Spe: This outspeeds Timid Ursaluna-B.

  • 100 Spe: This outspeeds Jolly Choice Scarf Landorus-T after using Rock Polish.

  • 140 Spe: This outspeeds Jolly Choice Scarf Urshifu formes after using Rock Polish.

  • 196 Spe: This outspeeds Speed-boosted Iron Treads after using Rock Polish.

  • 244+ Spe: This outspeeds Calyrex-S after a Speed boost from Rapid Spin.

  • 252+ Spe: This outspeeds Adamant Urshifu formes.

Double Dance.description:
• With an incredible ability to resist any attack at full HP and the completely unresisted Tera Starstorm after Terastallization, Terapagos is one of the most terrifying bulky sweepers in the game!

  • Rock Polish: Rock Polish ensures that Terapagos outspeeds most of the metagame, with only extremely fast Speed-boosted Pokemon such as Koraidon, Miraidon, Calyrex-S, and Flutter Mane outspeeding it.

  • Protect: Protect pairs excellently with Leftovers and Toxic Spikes support to whittle down foes and give Terapagos an even longer lifespan.

  • Earth Power versus Flamethrower: Using a coverage move over Protect doesn't make Terapagos as long-lasting, but it makes Terapagos less of a liability if a different Pokemon needs to Terastallize in a given match. Earth Power ruins Glimmora and does big damage to Miraidon and Zacian-C, while Flamethrower still hits Zacian-C and roasts the irritating Knock Off Scizor.

  • Leftovers: Besides benefitting Terapagos's impressive bulk, getting any chance to gain Tera Shell's effect back is devastating enough to seriously consider Leftovers.

Other Options

  • Rest and Chesto Berry: When Rest and Chesto Berry are combined, Terapagos has an easy way to gain Tera Shell's protection back! However, this combination won't work nearly as well with Toxic Spikes as Protect does and is very vulnerable to Knock Off.

  • Dark Pulse: Dark Pulse nails Calyrex-S regardless of whether or not Terapagos is Terastallized, though the great coverage isn't all that useful after Terastallization.

  • Rapid Spin and an Attack IV of 31: Terapagos is great at removing entry hazards with Rapid Spin, especially since most foes won't expect it, plus Terapagos can still boost its Speed even if it's Taunted. As a bonus, Rapid Spin breaks Focus Sash on powerful users like Sneasler. However, Terapagos will now need 244 Speed EVs and a Timid nature to outspeed Calyrex-S after a Speed boost.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Almost Required: Terapagos is heavily dependent on Terastallization to transform into the incredibly bulky Terapagos-S. This is especially the case if Tera Starstorm is its only attack, meaning Terastallization is necessary to hit Ghost-types.

  • Terapagos-S: Tera Stellar is the only possible option for Terapagos, but thankfully Terapagos-S's incredible bulk and perfect coverage make Terastallizing worth it. However, Tera Shell is a fantastic ability for enabling setup, and Tera Starstorm actually does more damage to neutral targets when Terapagos is not Terastallized, so it shouldn't be in a rush to Terastallize either. Also, take special note of Teraform Zero; while its not the main selling point of Terapagos-S, clearing Koraidon's sun or Miraidon's Electric Terrain at the correct times can have a huge impact on the match!

EV Spreads

  • 172 HP EVs: This HP investment gives Terapagos maximum Leftovers recovery before Terastallizing and minimizes Terapagos-S's damage from entry hazards. It also ensures that +1 Psyshock from Calyrex-S will not 2HKO Terapagos-S after Leftovers recovery.

  • 100 Speed EVs versus 140 Speed EVs: 100 Speed EVs let Terapagos outspeed Jolly Choice Scarf Landorus-T, a common revenge killer. 140 Speed EVs will require losing some power, but they do enable Terapagos to outspeed Jolly Choice Scarf Urshifu formes, which can potentially revenge kill Terapagos-S with Close Combat.

Choice Specs.description:
• Terapagos's offensive power may seem underwhelming compared to most Restricted Pokemon, but Tera Starstorm hitting every Pokemon neutrally in its Stellar forme makes it a strong and easy-to-use Choice Specs threat!

  • Dark Pulse: Dark Pulse is Terapagos's best attack against Calyrex-S, making it especially important when Terapagos is not Terastallized.

  • Power Gem: Power Gem hits Ho-Oh and Tera Fire Koraidon without needing to Terastallize.

  • Dazzling Gleam versus Ice Beam: Dazzling Gleam ruins Koraidon that don't Terastallize, while Ice Beam does more damage to other Dragon-types, with Dragonite being a big target.

  • Earth Power versus Flamethrower: Earth Power deals huge damage to Tera Fire Koraidon while keeping Tera Shell in play, and it's good coverage against Steel-types like Zacian-C. Flamethrower goes all in against Steel-types, roasting Scizor and Corviknight in particular.

  • Healing Wish / Lunar Dance Support: A Healing Wish or Lunar Dance teammate lets Terapagos go on another Tera Starstorm rampage, pairing well with its superb bulk. Some good users of these include Latias, Cresselia, and Indeedee formes.

Other Options

  • Flash Cannon: Flash Cannon is Terapagos's most damaging attack against Flutter Mane, but its coverage is otherwise poor.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Very High: Terapagos needs to Terastallize into Terapagos-S in order to gain perfect coverage and bulk. However, if the flow of the match suggests a different Pokemon should Terastallize, Terapagos still has the useful Tera Shell and good coverage as backup, even if it's rather mediocre without Terastallization.

  • When to Terastallize: Before Terastallization, Tera Starstorm is actually more powerful, and the superb Tera Shell lets Terapagos revenge kill a wide variety of weakened Pokemon. Terastallizing before Terapagos has taken damage is often not advised, but it makes sense if predicting your opponent is difficult.

EV Spreads

  • 196 HP / 252 SpA / 60 Spe with Modest: This spread lets Terapagos outspeed the extremely powerful Jolly Ursaluna, which can OHKO it through Tera Shell with boosted Facade.

  • 236 HP / 68 Def / 204 SpA with Modest: This spread lets Terapagos survive Adamant Koraidon's Collision Course after it Terastallizes to get rid of the sunny weather.

  • 4 HP / 252 SpA / 252 Spe with Timid: Maximizing Speed allows Terapagos to outspeed Adamant Urshifu formes, which otherwise revenge kill Terapagos-S.
